All time favorite side dish has to be surf and terf which consist of fried steak and shrimp handed it to you still sizzling! One of the best sushi rolls is the love affair because tt has some lobster in it ;). 

Their alcohol prices are reasonable for the portions they serve you. It can be slow at times when its busy, but definitely worth the wait. Every time i go they, it seems like i'm in a club since they play house or clubbing music lol. A great place to go but not in a large group. 

Great place overall :-(D
I just love this place, best Sushi place in Las Vegas. Price, food and service are the best.
This place is the bomb!! Excellent AYCE!! I'm in love with the Catercheese roll! Great place plus they're open until 2am!!

This place used to be good with good service and atmosphere. Now, hands down the WORST thing about Oyshi is the SERVICE. We have given this place multiple chances thinking something would change, but it just keeps getting worse. Unless you speak the language there, they don't care about your service. It's so frustrating to be sitting there for 30min, with nothing but a drink, and seeing so many others (who even come in after you) get served their food. Never again is this place worth our time or money. Definitely DO NOT recommend Oyshi if you're looking for good food or even relatively descent service

The worst place ever my family and I went for sushi there and 3 out of the 5 of us got food poisoning so bad that I missed work for 2 days. It Was horrible and when I called in to let them know that something may have been wrong there food the manager told me well that's too bad and hung up on me 

I would never go here again and unfortunately prob turned off sushi for a while 

The service was horrible and then the food I have heard bad things from others as well and some swear by it that they would never go there again. I guess it's a hit and miss situation with this sushi place
One of my favorite sushi places. They have a wide variety and love the surf and turf. Atmosphere is awesome. Love, love, love it!!!!

I would give the food 5 stars but I had something strange happen to me the two times I was there and I'll never go back because of it. 

Both times I was there I was picking up take-out. The first time I was picking up my food, the total was something like $19.20 and I gave the very polite man a $20 bill. He didn't bring me any change, but asked me if I wanted something to drink while I waited. I though maybe when he brought me my food, he would give me my change but he didn't. I was going to tip him but since he never even mentioned my change, I let that be his "tip". 

The next and last time I went I got to go food again. It was the same guy and he took my order and the total was $43.50. I have him $45. So this is actual paper money now so I thought he would totally bring me my money back this time. Again, very polite, asked me if I wanted something to drink.....and never mentioned my change again! It's not the money that bothered me, it's the assumption that really irritates me. Now you may ask, why didn't I just ask for my change. Well it's kinda simple, why should i have to! He lost a customer and a word of mouth review for $1.50. 

I was almost tempted to try this theory again and pay for something with a $100 and see what the result would be. Does he only keep a certain amount of money, would something over $20, $40 $50 be pushing his luck....

So in short, the food is pretty good, the thieving man is very polite but I don't like when someone just assumes that my change is his tip.

Good service. But the last order we had put in took a long while to get. 
Lounge area was blowing cold a/c. Nice place but needs a little touches here and there.
Food is good music is terrible. RAP music is terrible making it a not kid friendly resteraunt
Fair priced sushi.  Sashimi is good, not great.  The staff was on top of things and coming around to make sure we were happy.  A good joint for a quick fish fix!
Best AYCE Sushi in town. Try their berry parfait for dessert!

My rating is bias on the food, that is why I gave 3 stars.  My friends and I originally game to that side of town for Goyemon, the wait was 1.5 hour, so we decided to head down to Oyshi to check out.  All the rolls were mediocre, nothing too special to make me crave to return to that specific location anytime soon.  A couple of stuff they could lay off the yum yum sauce, Kami-Kaze had so much yum yum it looked like pasta sheets as garnish lol.  The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri sushi was really good.

Service was another story.  We waited around 45 mins or more for our first round to come out....even the oyster apps.  Go figure why thier AYCE time limit is 2hrs, not the usually 1hr.  Our server wasn't the greatest, but she did follow up on us when she could.  I noticed she was busing several tables, which is probably why she never followed up with the food and why she was tired.  I have done that, so I know the feeling.  the facility needs to either have the host bus, or have someone to.

So we walk in and see a bunch of servers walking around and eventually one of them comes up and points to our table.  Whatever...
We sit down, order our drinks and our first order..all was fine till then.  After we order, a good 10 minutes pass by while I observed the chefs, servers, and tables.  
There were about 4 other tables and 3 of them were finished.  The one table next to us seemed to be about midway into their meal which seemed like hours between dishes.  They get one dish, finish it, then wait for another 5 minutes for the server to bring their next order. They looked irritated. And so about 20 minutes of watching 4 or 5 chefs looking busy, we get our first order.  After we finish through our first order we order maybe 4 more orders of nigiri. (Which shouldn't take more than 3 minutes) And by then all tables were gone and about 5 people at the bar. So I expected it to come quick. Nope...20 minutes later we get our last order and by then I was fed up with everything. 
There were about 6 servers(why??) and they seemed more excited about talking to each other than even looking to see if the customers were okay.  
Nigiri was like 80% rice 20% fish which you can expect from a Korean run sushi restaurant.  And of course they charge you if you leave rice.  How else would they make money? Not by quality, that's for sure.  
Overall, the worst experience at an AYCE sushi restaurant.  
If you want quality food and service, I'd recommend xtreme sushi.  Best sushi I've had in vegas by far.

This place has the best sushi! I usually go all the way to a kona grill to eat but I have this place a chance cuz it's closer to where I live now and omg... it's amazing!!! Highly recommend! I gave 3 stars because the service sucks. They don't listen. They forget half your order and when reminding them they act like it's such an inconvenience to have it fixed. Other than that, the food is great!

AYCE is awesome.  Contains more items than you would usually find.  

Order is simple and the food comes out super quick.  Can't go wrong with this place!

This place is AMAZING!!! During the week they do lunch specials, which is only $10 for my fav, the teriyaki chicken. It's amazing! Never had teriyaki chicken like this and so good!! It also comes with California rolls, fried vegetables, salad (I don't care for, I substitute it for white rice) AND miso soup. Way more than I can eat but I try!
They also have jalapeo poppers, which are not your ordinary jalapeo poppers. They are my FAV. I could eat them everyday, all day.
Also, fav sushi rolls-- spicy tuna crunch, love affair, full moon. They are all spectacular.
Their ice cream parfait dessert is also fantastic. All you can eat is great but doesn't include jalapeo poppers so I don't usually get it unless I'm in the mood for a big variety. I also love their egg rolls. Before I came here I HATED sushi! And seafood. Now I LOVE sushi, mainly only there's. basically everything is amazing here. I don't like how loud the music is, but if you ask they'll turn it down. Waiters are nice & atmosphere is very japanese (which I LOVE, love Japan & their culture!)
Lousy service up front. Each and every time I come to this place, the front service person is rude and unprofessional. The sushi is great, but not worth getting snarky remarks and attitude over.
Seriously is the best sushi place! And so affordable...and all the time fresh. My fav pace to go eat..i come here like once a month.

It was an unfortunate experience.  We wanted to order the kampachi and the chef advised that he wasn't comfortable serving it - although it was listed on their "specials"  board.  Guess what it really means is this is the fish we really wanted to get rid of.

Rest was just ok at best.

Too bad - so many other places near here so we won't be back.
Excellent service. There's nothing special with the food. Fish is not fresh. Not enough varieties with the AYCE menu.

BOMB food for all you can eat.  You don't have to lower your standards because it's  AYCE.  It takes some time for them to bring out your food, so do yourself a favor and put in a couple choices so there's a steady flow of sushi coming.  There's so many good ones, I can't pick a favorite.  Be patient, cause they do tend to get backed up.

Good & decent lunch specials! However, I had to knock a couple stars because waitress came to our table at least 3 times & did not bother to fill water glasses. And we had to remind her for our roll that comes with lunch entre! Fish was ok, not that fresh!

I used to live in Green Valley and there was a great AYCE place on GVP and Pebble. It's closed now. I found that out the hard way many many moons ago. We used that place as a crutch and were afraid to try a new place (for fear it would not live up to the old place standards). 

I had passed Oyshi many times running errands and after driving back to the Southwest area of town, broken hearted about the closure of our "comfort zone" sushi venue, we decided to go to Oyshi and give it a try. 

I am happy to report that we were very satisfied and have been back MANY times. 

Recommendations 
1. Do the AYCE. We've calculated MANY times what our meal would have cost with out AYCE and we always come up winners. 
2. Don't go on Friday or Saturday nights if you are starving and just can't wait. It's busy, and that should say quite a bit about the quality. I don't mind the crowd or the wait, but sometimes my stomach wishes we had gotten there a little earlier. 

Likes 
1. House music in the background 
2. TVs behind the sushi bar for the sports fans. 
3. Ample bar seating - we ALWAYS sit at the bar
4. Extensive menu
5. Chef willing to let you make up your own rolls :)

We try to hit up Oyshi once a month or more if the Sushi cravings are just to hard to resist. I highly recommend. Yum (salivating as I write this)
Always busy but awesome food. My hubby is a yelper, so read his detailed review(s) (Dan N.) . Must get the Atomic Bomb!

The all-you-can-eat is to die for!!! Be prepared to spend $40 for drinks and all you can eat but it's totally worth it. They have a wonderful selection ranging from mild to WAY spicy. It's definitely worth your time, I'm going back soon!

First time here, I am a visitor from southern California! I enjoyed the sushi very much! It was so fresh and delicious. I will definetly return when I come back to visit my best friend. All the staff was welcoming and courteous. Our waiter (can't recall his name) was very helpful and offered good choices for our party to try!

I eat sushi probably two times a week and I love trying new places around my area. I have tried this place three times and each time I have gone there the service was so HORRIBLE that I will NEVER go back. It took me 15 minutes for me to even have someone come greet my table and another 15 min to order. Now I would understand the long wait if it was around lunch or dinner time but this was at 2 in the afternoon on a weekday. When I finally ordered it took about another 45 minutes to even get my salad and sushi. They forgot some of my order and at this point I was done. The second time I went I was there for dinner and the same thing happend but a longer wait! The manager came over and took off our salad which only cost us 4.00, I would assume for such bad service that they would have tried to make us a little more happy but comp'ing off one salad was no acceptable. I will never go back there and I advise you all not to either!

Really best sushi in Vegas! Sometimes when I didn't have time to wait cause the wait line  was very long , i tried other sushi bars but honestly i always regret i didn't wait for Oyshi ... Everything is just yummy!

It's true...I have fallen hard for yet another sushi place. AYCE, super unique rolls and here's the kicker...a very cool vibe! If you've ever been eating sushi and thought to yourself, this would be so much better with some Tiesto playing, this is your spot!

First off, don't be discouraged by the wait. They're busy and you should be happy for them. It's usually no more than 15 minutes and you can occupy yourself by practicing new dance moves. We always sit at the sushi bar and the service is friendly and fast. I once saw no less than 6 sushi chefs hustling in that narrow space so you'll be well taken care of. 

On to the tasty stuff. What I like most about this joint is if you like deep fried, baked, raw, hot, mild, funky they've got you covered. I hate places that are all cooked or all raw, you've gotta people please!  From the freshness of the fish, to the sauces they're paired with it's all a win. Their all you can eat knows almost no bounds so if you're not busting at the end you've done something wrong. To top it all off the strawberry ice cream they serve is surprisingly top notch, little strawberry swirl through it and everything. 

They also have 2 private rooms for large parties and I know this because I spied on them when I was there like a creeper. Try this place out next time you're in the southwest. We were happy to find it on our side of town and not have to venture to Sushi Blvd aka Eastern.

I went to return movies at Blockbuster with my younger son and had the urge for some sushi. Since Oyshi was just across the street from Blockbuster, we stopped in for a quick sushi fix. I've been to Oyshi many times in the past, but this visit will be my last. Service at Oyshi in the past sucked, but tonight's service was just plain unacceptable. 
Being a server myself, I strive to be polite, easy, PATIENT, understanding, and tip well. When my son and I walked in, we waited a good 5 mins as the manager and servers walked passed us and no one even cared to seat us. I finally flagged down a server to seat us. If the establishment was busy, that's a different story, but this was at 10pm on a Thursday with only three other tables.
The girl that sat us gave us menus and asked if we were doing AYCE and I responded, "No"(I didn't want to stuff myself this late at night). I ordered water and told her I was ready to order, but she said she's not my server. 5 mins passed and our server came to take our drink order, and I told her I was ready to order. I ordered two waters, a miso soup, and 2 simple rolls. The waters and soup came in a timely manner, but I had to flag down a server for a spoon, straws, settings, and soy sauce. 
We waited, waited, and waited(@ least 30 mins), saw other customers get their food-while thinking...did they forget our rolls??? I lost patience and called the server over & told her if they haven't yet made our rolls, I wanted to cancel. She glared at me then went over to tell the sushi chef, and he miraculously & immediately passed her a plate with our rolls! What the heck?? While we were waiting forever for our rolls, the sushi chef had them.
We never even got an apology for the delay. Not once were we asked if we were ok or needed anything or even got a refill. As soon as we got our rolls, we gulped them down, asked for the check, paid, and bounced!! The rolls were mediocre. Being a good tipper, I left absolutely nothing for such horrible service(from the beginning to the end) :-/.

This place is amazing the sushi is amazing rolls are Incredible the service is fantastic!! Loving the atmosphere and the music. We live in Los Angeles and we come here everytime were in town..I'd recommend this place and    ED THE BEST SUSHI CHEF EVER all day long!

Had a Great time here and had nice service, we got a  private room for our friends Birthday and the service was really friendly and quick ... And I know my group could be a lot to handle at times too ... They did make the stipulation that we could have the private room for 15 ppl if MOst of the group did all u can eat !!

I used to live right down the street from this restaurant and still wouldn't go there because of the slow service. The only time the service was good was when it was slow. Knowing this, I would just get to go orders and never had any problems with that. 

Fast forward about 1 year... I was excited to eat here because I was sure they would have their sh*t together by now. Boy was I wrong... Our first round took FOREVER AND A DAY and our server forgot a couple things I had ordered so I ordered once again. I swear saw her scribbling on her notepad while I was telling her what I would like to eat next.  It is quite possible that she was just jotting things down for the grocery store after her shift. We decided to order dessert from the waitress at the next table so that we could have it right after the rest of the sushi came. So, dessert came and we decided to let the creme brle sit there on our table until the rest of our sushi came. To our surprise the sushi and our waitress was nowhere to be found!!! A long while later I asked another waitress if she could check on our other sushi orders and she informed is that there were none and she could take our order if we wanted more. THIS IS THE SECOND TIME THIS HAPPENED IN ONE VISIT!!! I tried to give this place another chance and I just feel silly for expecting something better from a place that can't offer anything better than horribly slow service. They deserve NO stars but the sushi that actually made it to the table was okay.  Don't waste your time going here... Drive to Goyemon, SushiMon, or Sushi Twister. I promise, even though the drive is further it'll take even longer to wait around for sushi here.

I've been here multiple times with my family because of it's convenience in location and the wait time is pretty minimal. The food is decent if you're not a fish snob. I don't even think sashimi is served. All the rolls are heavily seasoned/ sauced-up and majority of them are stuffed with imitation crab (basically different variations of the california roll). I tried a spicy tuna handroll and the fish was not fresh so I had to return it (since you're charged for not eating everything that's ordered from the "all you can eat").

I stick with non-sushi items such as the udon or this teriyaki beef rice bowl. I do like the ninja meal (veggie and shrimp tempura, California roll, and teriyaki chicken) but I can only order it if my nephew comes along (for kids only-and they're really strict about it).  In fact they're so strict that my nephew ordered it and he drank a bottle of milk so he was too full to eat. They wouldn't even let us bring the kids meal home. We had to pay for it but we couldn't pack to go!

My boyfriend and I strolled into Oyshi on a weekend afternoon for some AYCE. From the moment we walked in the door the staff was rude and acted like we were bothering them from coming in. There were a few people helping us and not one of them were attentive. It took forever to refill waters and order more food. The staff was very standoffish and everyone from the management to servers to the sushi chefs looked miserable to be working there. I didn't like the atmosphere for an afternoon they were playing party music. Their quality of fish was low and didn't seem fresh. I was very disappointed with this place considering all of the reviews. I have to drive a little bit father for an AYCE sushi place now but it is well worth it, so everyone go to Sushi Koma instead!! Their staff is so friendly and the food is 100 times better!

Favorite sushi place 
They have the best sushi in vegas 
The staff are very friendly and accommodating

The downfall of our favorite AYCE place???

Since it's opening, my wife and I have patronized Oyshi on S. Rainbow.  For most of this time, the service levels have been at a minimum adequate and mostly 4-5 star.

No longer.  Last night, one of our boys asked to go to Oyshi as he has basically been going since his birth.  Over the past few visits, we noticed a decline in customer service, less knowledgeable staff, and simply less training.  The service culture gives one the sense of barely organized chaos.  The staff is no longer efficient and organized.  It almost felt that we should feel lucky that they were there to bring our food.

Service is now merely "dump and run" with no real follow-up.  Dirty dishes left on table and servers were handing us new plates of food instead of removing the old to make space for the new.

The manager on duty was obviously in over his head.  We were always accustomed to the manager coming over, checking on our food as he did with everyone, and visibly managing and directing the staff.  Unfortunately, that is no longer the case.

As the owners branch out into new concepts (our understanding is they also own Soyu - Korean Barstaurant in the same strip center as well as some other concepts), the better managers (and possibly staff) are going as well.  Problem is, they are not leaving competent (or at least not well-trained) folks behind.

Sad to see.  Oyshi had a great run for a few years.  However unless they get their act together this particular location is headed down a steep slope with no brakes.

The service is horrible ! 
I've been here before and the sushi wasnt so good but I decided to give it another shot. Bad idea! I was on lunch break ordered two rolls and there. Were five sushi chefs. It wasn't even busy! Took thirty minutes to get my order right and the sushi was just plain messy.  I should've gone to Kobe down the street.

We moved into the neighborhood a few months ago and have been to Oyshi several times. The miso soup and the tempura veggies are delicious. overall this is some of the best sushi we've had. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star review is because the shrimp aren't fried to order for the rolls. The tiger roll is usually one of my favs but not when the shrimp are soggy.

I come here for sushi when I'm craving a solid AYCE menu with a lot of raw fish options. I find if you sit at the sushi bar and just ask the chefs for your order the menu is not very stringent and they are happy to really make you anything you ask for. I found the service of our waitress to be pretty bad. My drink was only refilled once and she was very inattentive. Quality of fish is always good and have never had a problem besides how full I leave. The other options are also very good, I always order the seaweed salad and seared ribeye steak which comes on a sizzling hot pan with cabbage and onions and is a great option on the AYCE menu for those that love a surf and turf. I say the food is great for the price, and the place is only getting 4 for the value I got which is something I look for. But the service was lacking. Still worth a trip!

I have been a regular at this location for over 5 years.  The quality of service has declined steadily over the years - especially the hostess position.  The people they hire are the absolute laziest, who seem more interested in networking than providing actual service.  After checking-in with the host and being told "about a 20 minute wait," I watched people who arrived after me be seated.  After 30 minutes, I asked how is it possible that everyone was seated before me?  The hosted blamed the manager who took my name, but never added me to the wait list.  It seems like whenever you go there, it is a '20 minute wait' even though there are plenty of empty tables.  The food is AWESOME - once you get it - and that's the ONLY reason I keep going back.

The best AYCE sushi place. Never disappoints. The nuclear bomb is amazing. The fish is so fresh. Even if you don't like sushi, you can have their ribeye steak, skirt steak, so many choices. The staff is always friendly. If you still have room, try the parfait or the cream brle.

My husband and I have a new favorite place in town. We live in Summerlin and still drive to the Southwest side of town for sushi.

Portions for AYCE would fool you. Sushi pieces are generous and balls of rice are not enormous. The appetizers are good, you have to try Grilled beef asparagus!

Staff is friendly and do their best on busy nights. Make sure you call for reservations on weekend nights. 

Also, you can order half rolls from the sushi bar, not tables. So if we go, just the 2 of us, we will sit at the bar.

I love this place beyond love. We eat here every time we are in Vegas. I wish I could box them up and take them back with us to NC. I love all the rolls but my all time favorite roll is the Love Affair. The crunchy topping with the sauce is absolutely amazing. When we lived here we ate here almost every single week. I highly recommend everyone eat here. The all you can eat is the best deal in town by far. It's off the strip always but TRUST ME it's worth it!!!
ayce is the best. great flavor. less one star though because 3 times we did ayce, food was really sloooow to come out from the kitchen.

I usually go to oyshi often but the last time i went the service i had was extremely horrible... so ever since my last visit i never went back... dont get me wrong but the sushi there is really good but they just gotta work on the service... i could of seriously just walked out and they would not notice...

Love this place..
Decor.Nice.Clean. Great vibes from everyone
Have been here three time. Great dining experience. Food is excellent.
There is a charge if you dont finish your order. The hostess was nice enough to charge us one time.. We had three orders of Rolls that we didnt finish. Left a 25% because the hostess was fantastic!
Will be returning.
I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars. I am an avid sushi eater and this place is awesome! Really great rolls, good atmosphere!

Been going to this place since it first opened.  David always takes care of us.  This place is always fresh & has high quality AYCE sushi, that rivals non-AYCE places!  Huge assortment and great appetizers too!  Awesome & friendly staff.  It can get super busy, so we usually just slip in and take a seat at the bar rather than waiting for a table.

Ate here 2x with the fam while visiting Vegas. 2nd time we decided to go with the All You Can Eat, and it was well worth it. If you're hungry, go for this one. They have a large menu, portion is good, price maybe $1-$2 more than what you may be used to. Service starts off slow, but once your first order comes out, everything else will follow. I know we'll be coming here whenever when in town.

I would say Oyshi is the 2nd best AYCE Sushi so far in my books! 

Pros: The quality of the food is fresh and delicious. Good customer service. They can accommodate large groups if you plan to throw a get together. Some menu highlights - they have AWESOME selections of sizzling iron plates of Steak Teriyaki, Chicken Teriyaki, and Grilled Salmon. (Unlimited too!) Annnd there Calamari and Popcorn Scallops are so yummy!

Cons: NO HALF-ROLLS available except if you eat at the sushi bar. Getting your sushi orders takes a long time! We waited for over a half an hour after putting our order for sushi, so I recommend that you know what you want and putting in a large order.
This place is awesome everything is good ask the chef for special made hand rolls they're off the hook

Geez - the service has really gone to shit ! 
4 of us for dinner last night.  2 had AYCE, 2 didn't .  Server had attitude from the beginning - my sense is a combination of being annoyed by the questions, that we all didn't get AYCE and I was the only one drinking .

We were told the problem was the kitchen was backed up .... Really ?  More like the kitchen was fucked up and the server was backed up and someone needed to stick their foot up her ass to cleanse her of the crappy attitude.

The food ?  Gotta admit the sushi was good - sweet shrimp, garlic tuna and Cajun tuna as well as the yellowtail were the stars.  Unagi also worked for me.

The hot dishes ?  The ones we actually got ? Calamari, popcorn scallops, asparagus beef ... Very average.  There were at least 5 dishes they never brought us.

This was a very rare occasion I didn't tip much - $95 bill, $2 tip.

Get it together OYSHI !

I've been going to this place for a few years now and finally getting around to reviewing it. I have only had the all-you-can-eat here, so my 4-star rating is based on quality for an AYCE setting. 

Of all the AYCE places I've been to, Oyshi is definitely the best. Their variety of rolls, sushi, and appetizers is the largest. The fish is fresh and the appetizers are quite creative. I highly recommend the Red Rock Roll and Screaming Roll. For appetizers, the Ahi Poke and Agedashi Tofu is always very good. A welcomed difference from many other AYCE sushi places is that Oyshi is a very nice restaurant. It was built to be a sushi restaurant and has the ambiance of one. 

Ever since I found Oyshi a few years ago, I have not gone anywhere else in town for AYCE sushi. However, it has really caught on and their business seems to be booming, especially during the peak hours. Because of that, the last couple of time I've gone there, the service has been very, very slow. I actually tried a new place recently, because I didn't want to be there for 2+hours. Outside of that, it's definitely the best AYCE place in town.
Terrific all-you-can-eat sushi. If you're going huge, it's definitely worth the money. Service was slow when we sat at a table but very good at the bar.

Scale of 1 - 10 I give it a 5 at best. The service is adequate but food takes a very long time to get. Yes, it was a busy Friday night but you know what, Friday is busy, staff up already. 
The portions of food and presentation are both sub par. The flavors were good but honestly I am not impressed. 
It almost feels like they just want you to eat and get out. 
The atmosphere is okay. The booth that we sat in had its upholstery all torn up. 
Will I go again, NO. Not with all of the sushi joints in town.
Food is overall good but every roll has imitation crabmeat. I'm pretty sure this is their way of getting you full when you choose all you can eat.

This is one of our go to sushi places because it's close to our house, but also because their AYCE sushi is excellent.  The fish is very fresh and flavorful, except the oysters, which I thought were a little bland.  Lately we've had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated, so this place is definitely gaining in popularity.  The menu has changed somewhat in the past year and now they have more appetizers and dessert, which is definitely a plus!  However you can only order one of the special desserts but you can have all the ice cream you want.  The rolls are solid and the uni has been fresh every time we've visited.

Great selection of sushi rolls, appetizers, nigiri, and other misc. items. The service and atmosphere is the reason why we come back every time when we are craving sushi. We always ask for stefan as our server cause he always provides the best customer service.

I did the AYCE (all you can eat) dinner for $27 and I thought it was worth it. The menu is pretty big but there are a lot of items on the menu that is not included in their AYCE meal. On top of that, you are only allowed to get one dessert. One thing that I like about this place is the fact that they don't make their rolls as if it was for 3 people. This gives you room in your tummy to try more items. Service was above average. They never fail to give you the wrong order at least once while you are dining with them. If you're looking to try a new AYCE sushi spot, try this place.

this is one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in vegas! i always have oyshi cravings every time i crave sushi... i love there oyster shooters in the all you can eat. Most sushi places don't offer that.  The ambiance is pretty bumpin... they play good house music that keeps you going. The rolls are phenomenal and satisfies my cravings till I'm about till I'm about to fall over. Dessert is great i always order the green tea ice cream parfait *drools* Price is $26 for dinner and lunch is about $21 before 3:30pm...

One of my favorite sushi joints, great fish every time and a great menu. Service can be iffy, as they can be very busy. Knocked off one star for that. Both nigiri and rolls were delicious, the fish is very fresh and salmon is delicious. Would keep going back.

Slow service, limit of one dessert per person, subpar rolls and nigiri fish to rice ratio is ALL rice, no actual Japanese people anywhere to be seen (customers nor staff). Should've gone to Sushimon or Sushi on Rainbow.  This place sucks!

For $26, get the all-you-can-eat menu.  The sushi is only ok and not authentic Japanese food.  The fresh oysters, ika with massago, uni, beef terriyaki, and salad are not bad.  The service and chefs are really friendly.

My family has been coming to oyshi for as long as I can remember. At least twice a month. But in the last year the service, staff and food has gone down hill drastically. 
The food now takes a lot longer to come out and a lot of the rolls taste like they've been sitting and they started putting lemon juice type sauce on the sushi which makes everything taste horrible. They seem to have changed some rolls and not a change for the better. 
Luckily our server tonight has been wonderful, but I she will not make up for the past year. 

We now go to the one on Sahara and it seems to be a lot better. This location is so much closer to our house though...
In my eyes the best sushi in town! I recommend getting all you can eat and try the lobster rolls. They are simply amazing

First time going here and thought it was very good, sushi was fresh and the service was excellent if I'm ever on this side of town again I will definitely go back. Also there spicy mayo is really good!

My first time here , we were seated right away,  it's very noisy, so good for groups but not for romantic dinners,  it did tend to be less noisy as the night went on, the sushi was delicious and totally worth the price, in fact it was a steal , all u can eat off the menu, with exception of sashimi , I will definetly be back.
It's perfect for a large group, and especially for those with big appetites and those who want to try everything off the menu..
They do offer teriyaki which is tasty for those who do not like sushi...
Took us 10 minutes to be seated and there was nobody else ahead of us in line. Not at all a traditional sushi place at all with terrible costumer service

Recently I placed a to go order and was quite disappointed when I got home. My food had been made incorrectly and I was frustrated usually the food is excellent and delicious. However despite the mistake, I have to give rave reviews to how the manager Wong (I think that was her name) handled the situation. When I called back to ask to be refunded because I did not want to drive back to have my order fixed she without waiting a beat jumped in to refund me and even offered to give me two complimentary rolls on my next visit. The food has always been great and mistakes happen but it is how those moments are handled that decides whether a person returns or not, and I will be for sure. Definitely recommend the Spicy Maniac roll and the Chung Hua if you like really really spicy. They are fantastic.

Great sushi! So far the best I've had in Vegas! 
Fresh and good quality ! 
The restaurant is also very clean !

My boyfriend and I live right across the street from Oyshi, and we go once a week or once every two weeks. It is soooo delicious and we crave it basically on a daily basis. Lol. I have tried other sushi places, but Oyshi is by far my favorite. I love their baked rolls and appetizers. My favorites are the hot tamale roll, the Japanese lasagna, spicy tuna crunch, potato croquette, egg rolls, Yellowstone, and quite a few others. The sushi chefs behind the bar are very nice. I rave about this place to basically everyone I know. Lol. It gets really busy during the normal dinner hours...which we typically try to avoid because it takes longer for each order to come out. The only reason I rated 4 stars instead of 5 is because the service is a hit or miss. Sometimes we get a really great server who is very attentive to us, but other times we sit there forever before a server finally notices us. Or they take forever to refill your drinks...or they take your first order and forget you're there. It is a little pricey, but so worth it! If you want to eat or try a lot of stuff, definitely go for the all you can eat!

OUR FAVORITE SUSHI SPOT SINCE 2009. We've been here a few dozen times, and are never disappointed with the food or the service! The downfall is that wait times can be extensive at times depending on when you go, but average wait is 10-20 minutes... and it's oh-so worth the wait! Lunch is 22$, dinner is $27. (For children 12 and under, lunch is 16 and dinner is $19.) They use fresh ingredients, the food presentation is beautiful, the service is always great and we always leave so full & so happy! ^___^

We like to order:
APPETIZERS:
- Ahi poke
- Calamari 
- Fresh oysters (two pieces per order, one order per person only)
- Dynamite (scallop, shrimp, crab mix, mushroom & onion baked w/ yum yum sauce)
- Baked mussels (5 piece limit per person) 
- Asian skirt steak
- Yakitori shrimp & asparagus 
- Rib eye steak 
SUSHI ROLLS
- Love affair
- Vegas roll 
- Premium spider
- Japanese Garlic Lasagna 
- Lobster Affair 
- Oyshi roll 
- Salmon nigiri
- Unagi nigiri 
DESSERT:
- Green tea berry parfait
- Vanilla creme brulee 
- Green tea ice cream (desserts are one order per customer except for ice cream)

PRO TIP: If you have peanut allergies, you'll be happy to know they do not use ANYTHING with peanuts, none of their dressings contain it and they do not use peanut oil.

PRO TIP II: Also, For parties of 8 or more, 18% gratuity is added to the bill (this includes children and any patrons who are seated at the table, whether eating or not).

Everything in the menu is delish!!!!!   Staff are all very nice and courteous, prompt and smile all the time.  I will recommend this restaurant anytime to everyone.
Love their weekly lunch special can't beat that too.  

Clean utensils and clean all around this place.  Real Japanese place.

I live right down the street from this place so I try to come in whenever I can. I usually sit at the sushi bar to interact w/ the chef's and it's quicker to get your food. I've been here numerous times, but my review stems from the last few times I have come to visit. Most recently my gf & I came in for dinner and the host was not at her station so we proceeded to head to the sushi bar where I typically sit. We sat down and the hostess came to us and asked if someone sat us. We said no due to no one being at the host stand. She said I need to seat you. I informed her, we are already seated and we would like to sit here. She told us the server who worked in that area wasn't accepting tables. We asked if the server working the whole bar? She went back to the stand to look and I followed. She went to go speak w/ another employee to ask if it was okay. I'm guessing the hostess was new since she didn't know what to do. When she came back, she took us back exactly to where we originally went to sit. Pretty frustrating to say the least. So now we are under the impression we have a server. Not really though. A woman came to our seats and provided us w/ a setup and took a drink order. After that, nothing. About 8 minutes went by and the server, our server, comes up and asks us what we wanted to eat. No apology, just took our order. Once we ordered our food, everything was business as usual.

I've had spotty service here since coming here. I come for the food and that's why I sit at the sushi bar because it cuts out the time the server has to take to grab the food and deliver it. The chef just hands it to you. The best option here is the AYCE because just about everything is up for grabs. Oh and if you don't know, which most don't since it's not on the menu, you can order pork belly. It comes in a serving of 4. Even regulars that come in don't know. You're welcome :)

No more sushi-mon for me -  ever.  This place has only decent service but very good food. 
No sushi place can be great unless it is by the sea.  We are in the middle of the desert in America, so let's be real; this isn't Japan or Korea.  However, that being said: for Vegas it is pretty good. Not a lot of rool options, but the ones they have are tasty.

Got picked up from the airport and came straight to a late night dinner. It wasn't too busy and the customer service was decent. I used to come here a long time ago and loved it. The quality of food decreased slightly and there were so many other sushi places that were better that I stopped coming.  Well my husband and I decided to come back since they are open later than other good sushi places close by. We were surprisingly satisfied. The quality seems to have gotten better. I'm definitely coming back! Sucks we couldn't order half rolls though. You can only do half rolls if you are seated at the bar. What's the difference?  I vote to have that changed!

Now I don't know how many check-in's I have on Yelp, but I've been here a fair amount of times to know what is good and what is bad about this place. This was the first AYCE sushi place I've been to here in the valley and it's not in my top 3 places. To sum it up, Oyshi is so hit or miss that it's almost a risk to come here. Yes, you'll come here see that there's a long wait and expect it to be great but the last few times I've been here and given chance after chance, I've left disappointed. 

First of all, I used to work in a restaurant. Server's know when it's busy, trust me, and as a customer I expect you to acknowledge that. The times that I've waited for a decent amount of time, I've never been apologized to about the wait or been given an explanation when the rolls I've ordered don't come out when it seems like people who just sat down are getting there's before me. 

I'm not that selfish, but I just feel like the service here is poorly conducted. I've felt that it takes a group of us to look around constantly before someone comes and asks if we need anything. The rolls are always very good, but the amount of time that it takes most times I'm there is not average to the sushi places I've been to. 

I will admit I do love their Salmon Nigiri and the Love Affair roll but a lot of the other rolls often feel like there is just too much going on. I don't like to complain, but the service isn't up to my standards and my standards aren't extremely high. I just expect my water to be refilled within a decent time and asked if I'd like to order more without having to ask to order more. 

I am very forgiving and I will come here, I just don't have the expectations that I once did. The sushi is usually very fresh and the options aside from the sushi are great. I always order the calamari and the surf-n-turf appetizers when I come here. I would recommend this place to a friend, I think I would just advise them to be go-getters with their servers and make it known when they want something. All in all, if someone said they were coming here tomorrow, I'd probably join them. Cheers!

Always a crowd pleaser . Excellent service and foods.  Always having the Rib Eye Teriyaki appetizer and the Double Salmon.  Everyone I bring here never complain,  in fact sometimes we might eat here twice in one day !

Damn, where do I start... this place has one of the best AYCE sushi bar for a price under $30. I love Japanese food, so I'm quite critical when it comes to quality. The quality here is equal to the quality in Japan.

For starters, I'd begin with the Ahi Poke, Shrimp & Asparagus, Dynamite and Ribeye Steak Teriyaki. 

When you're ready for battle, I'd suggest the Yellowtail Trio, Atomic Bomb, Red Dragon, and Bonzai Rolls!

To complete the food madness, grab some mochi green tea ice cream!

So who's down for a Vegas run?

Horrible service. Went 20mins before getting our drinks, half of the food we ordered NEVER came out! Most of the food served for one of my guests either tasted like freezer burned sashimi & tasteless ribeye! This is the 2nd Sushi place I've tried here in Vegas & lets just say that I am far from impressed. 

Kudos to our waitress Toni for picking up the slack of her coworkers & handling what could be an irate situation with patience.

Best sushi in town!!!  Great prices too.  Waitstaff is very accommodating. My wife is vegetarian and the chefs make her special rolls. We have been to many all you can eat sushi restaurants and this place is by far the best!!

I just want to say Oyshi is one of the best All-you-can-eat sushi places around Las Vegas. In fact, a year ago I would have given it a 5 star rating. The reason I only gave a 4 star is because the quality of service has dropped. Largely due to the fact that it has gotten so much busier. There are more waiters but they do not tend to the customers fast enough. The food is great, but for an all-you-can-eat spot, you will enjoy the large menu they offer. The food is always fresh because of the amount of traffic they had. You can find your favorite server and request them to serve you.. Usually requesting anyone to serve you in particular will encourage them to serve you better. I am sure everyone was expecting my 4 star rating to be all positive but I've gone to Oyshi since it opened and I understand the restaurant has grown from what it originally was. The service has dropped a little but they still offer you great food for a great price.

I love this place. The price is reasonable. Everyone pretty much summed it up. Their Oyshi rolls are the BOMB. I love their Surf and Turf too... Another thing that is awesome about this place is that they sometimes get the UFC fights and you get to eat all you can eat sushi for $26 and watch the fights for free... Like tomorrow night. Make sure you make reservations cause its pretty small and seats get filled fast!

I have been here a few times and have always loved it. This place is so clean you could eat off the floors. No but really. I would come here more often if it werent so far away from me. Love the surf and tuf.

By far the best sushi place in Las Vegas! Ej the server is great and always there for your needs AND I know they don't like to admit this, but I know they have one of the cooks on the aux or DJing cause he's cooking the restaurant up with bangers !!

Has been a looong time since I went to Oyshi, as my first experience here was less than memorable, and pre-Yelp.  

Some colleagues talked me into another visit recently, and I have to say, I was pleased with the AYCE lunch special.  I found a couple rolls that were interesting and spicy.  Enjoyed them both thoroughly.  My colleagues raved about their selections also.  The sushi chefs were very courteous, and the waitress was quick to assist with questions and recommendations.  

I will definitely keep this on my lunch list, and may have to make an evening visit, when you really decide on that last star at a local sushi spot!  "Kanpai!"
So delicious !! Best place in Las vegas. I love "all can you eat" !! :)

Love the Halloween spirit, food & excellent service by Game & Sabas.  Remarkable!  The sushi bar & whole restaurant was packed so I was surprised that they sat us so quickly on a Sunday night, 10.22.17, 6:30pm.  My first time, guess we got lucky!  We ordered many items & not one was left behind.  

Sizzling Ribeye plate over cabbage, side of rice, miso soup & the salad had a tasty ginger dressing & was larger than a usual side dish.  Cooked perfectly & well seasoned  ribeye, sliced.  They offer Teriyaki Chicken, Surf & Turf, Asian Skirt Steak & Sweet & Spicy Pork also.

Salmon Lover Roll, Game's recommendation was fabulous!  Lite lemony mustard cream drizzle over tempura salmon, avocado, cream cheese rolled in rice & topped w/ fresh salmon!  Delish & I will start w/ it again!

I'm not a Spicy Tuna Roll fan, but we also ordered the Spicy Tuna Crunch which was fantastic.  Jalapeo, cream cheese deep fried & topped w/ spicy mayo & eel sauce so you can't go wrong.  Many rolls have cream cheese btw.  I usually look for the ones that are more fresh so next time will sit at the sushi bar & experiment.  I did love our servers recommendations tho!  

Our Vegan friend got the Cucumber & Avocado roll which was also delish.  Overall, the menu is very appetizing w/ numerous items that I must come back for & I was happily surprised by everything at Oyshi.  Cheers!

We were just there on Sunday night and was very pleased with everything.  This was our first time there and we sat at the bar and had a blast of a time.  The guys behind the counter making the sushi were attentive to our needs and made us laugh.

When we go back to Vegas, we will make sure to go back to Oyshi Sushi again and bring friends.

Hip and trendy. Probably the most attentive service I had in a long time! 
The server constantly asked us if we needed anything and made sure our glasses were filled with water. 
The place is clean, aesthetically pleasing. 
They have an all you can eat deal for 20 bucks for lunch..but I decided to go with a la carte. I ordered the Chirashi bowl hoping to fill my craving of when I get the Korean version called Hweh do bap. 
The rice had too much vinegar flavoring, the sashimi wasn't cut thin enough and didn't taste too fresh at that. 
My search is still on for THE BEST SUSHI in town.

4.30.11 I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere, it was cute for a huge restaurant. It was dim, but not to the point where you can't see anything. I really like their sushi bar it's really big. The tables in the restaurants are nicely spaced so you're not rubbing elbows with your neighbors. I'm not used to Japanese Restaurants that can accommodate several large parties. They had two private rooms and we were in another area that was semi-private. There were 9 of us and we sat comfortably. I really like the painting they had against the wall in our semi private area. It was actually the only painting I saw throughout the restaurant. 

I have never eaten at an AYCE sushi in Las Vegas away from the strip so I was super excited. I ordered their Agedashi tofu and it was so Salty! Stay away, ha ha. I was disappointed but quickly got over it when I tasted their poke salad. I remember ordering the Kimono Roll, Yellow Trio and dessert. I had more than that, but I was so amazed how refreshing everything tasted I was too excited to remember to write it down. When I ordered I stayed away from tempura or anything baked. I was not going to get full off that, I wanted fish. Their sushi was fresh and I especially remember the salmon handroll, it was perfect. I really enjoyed their food, although the oyster was okay and their uni really looked like it needed a makeover. 

Their Service was super duper good, although for some reason I was the last one to receive my order. That made me the last one to eat the desserts everyone was done while I was still waiting. Ha ha. Do not pass up on ordering their Mochi Ice Cream. Doesn't matter if you're full and your fly is about to pop, still order their dessert.

So overall, next time I will definitely come here for their AYCE! Their selection of rolls for their AYCE is plenty, not like other places its mainly filled with baked and tempura stuff. This one had plenty of raw fish in their rolls. Just the way I like it! 

Don't be a fool and miss out on this wonderful meal..
CHEF ED! ahhhhhh thank you for the absolutely amazing hand roll sushi  to die for ! Always good service at the sushi bar !

1 star?  Why?  2 Words - FOOD POISONING on the night of 11/05/2011

Totally ruined my last date night with my wife before I deploy for the military when you are praying to the porcelain gods hurling with nori blowing out of your nose...graphic I know...


To top it off, the rolls were mediocre compared to Sushi Twister and Sushi Xtreme and the service was slow for the amount of people in the restaurant.  

What are my credentials to be badmouthing this "highly" rated yelp institution?  5 years living on Honolulu and knowing what sushi restaurants are supposed to taste like, but what do I know...uggh worst night ever afterwards SMH
Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent

Average sushi at best but considering that for $27 you can get all you can eat lunch, I'm a fan.

Pros:
1. decent selection of rolls, sashimi, appetizers for the buffet option
2. friendly service

Cons:
1. No sweet shrimp or uni (sea urchin) for lunch buffet (dinner only)
2. Dynamite roll had wayyyy too much mayo which was gross
3. No all you can eat dessert!? Wanted some more of that strawberry mochi!

Recommendations: I'd choose the skirt steak over the other steaks. Yellow halibut is awesome (don't get the baby halibut as it is bland). Any of their rolls is decent but nothing really stood out to me in particular.

Definitely worth coming back for the lunch special

Best sushi buffet! So good! We definitely ate our money's worth of food! The service was super slow, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. They have a huge parking lot right outside. there was no wait when we went in for dinner on Thursday night. Too bad this place isn't on the strip, or it'll be packed! Should definitely drive out from the strip to try this place!
Excellent service (Anthony & Curtis) & great food. Loved it. $21.00 FROM 4-5:30, happy hour!
This place is outstanding! The sushi I fresh and they serve it to fast. 2 for 1 beer?.. doesn't get Any better!..staff is incredibly friendly and attentive

Love the food and service! Great spot for AYCE. Been going to this location for years and has always been great! Only complaint would be the hours. They say they're open until 2 am, but I have gone multiple times around 12 and they've been closing super early! 

I work in the restaurant industry and get it that on slower nights you might close early. But when there's a line out the door of people you are turning away, doesn't seem smart for business or for customer satisfaction. I would NEVER go to a restaurant 5 minutes or even an hour before close, but closing 2 hours early? Really?? 

Food is great tho. Just go in 4+ hours before close to ensure you can be seated.

More than half of the time I visit Vegas, I spend the whole time off of the strip. Lately, I've really been trying to find local "Off strip" eateries and establishments. The last few times I've been to town, I've gone to Oyshi Sushi. It's conveniently close to my folks' house. Oyshi has two different set-ups. One is AYCE (All you can eat) and the other is A la carte. I've done both. The service and staff are good, the place is clean, and the prices are average. The sushi is good but not spectacular and the portions aren't as meaty as I'd prefer. Now, this isn't a reason for me not to eat at Oyshi, but yeah, it's nothing to write home about.
for all you can eat, you can't beat this place... service is great and the ambiance is pretty trendy, especially if they play trance during your dinner... can't beat that...

This is one of the best AYCE sushi joints out there. Their fish is fresh and the portions are right. The sushi is big enough for you to actually taste it, but at a size where you don't get full quickly. My staples at any AYCE sushi joints are eel and avocado handrolls and nigiri. I'm not a big fan of rolls and this place does it for me. They also have additional appetizers that you won't find at typical sushi restaurants. I really like their seaweed salad, which is quite the generous portion. Seaweed salad is expensive and this place does not skimp out. The albacore is especially good at this restaurant. They have these sizzling plates which comes out on fajita wooden plates. I have tried the surf and turf which is really delicious. I would recommend getting one to share with a few friends. The appetizer portions are small, but they do fill you up. Try sharing the appetizers so you can save room for the real stuff. With this said, the best part truly is the dessert. This place by far has the best tasting Creme Brulee I have ever had. The only bad thing is that dessert is not all you can eat, it's only one per person. Make sure you leave room for dessert because you do not want to miss out. I have been here twice and will definitely come back the next time I'm in town. The service has been great during both of my visits. The food is usually out at the right time and you never have to wait too long for your orders. The waiters are also really sweet. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

whenever im in vegas i always go out of my way from my mainstay on the strip to go here because its worth the side trip.

prior to XS, i brought my group of 8 here and it definitely started the night off correctly...the staff was friendly and seated us in the private room which provided a more intimate atmosphere given out attire.

in the main room, there is the usual sushi bar and a few flat screens to get a lil more rowdy. in essence, it caters to all types of occasions which i liked.

as far as the food goes- amazing. nuff' said
Awesome all-you-can-eat sushi buffet that includes dessert and hot plates. Can get busy at times but we'll worth the quality sushi rolls!

Gonna base this review with overall experience. Honesty I didn't enjoy myself besides the company I was with. The service there is horrible... Horrible!! I would've possibly given this review a 3 based on the fresh sushi.. Wasn't so bad.. But it slightly tastes fresh even if sitting at the bar not having been served ASAP to the customer.. So sushi pretty delish. 

But honestly the service there is beyond poopy because.. Sure went on a Sunday, did not wait for a seat but I did wait just to order a glass of water just about 15 minutes.. Just to order that damn water.. And behind me was a wife and kid and the server finally asked are you waiting for something? And she responded. "yes my sushi, I've been waiting for 20 minutes"

Yeah... Keep that in mind and enjoy!

By far the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever been to.
My cousin, who lives in the area, claimed that this place has really good sushi and an even better all-you-can-eat deal. As I'm from San Francisco, I was a bit cautious and not too optimistic about the quality and freshness of the fish, however I was quickly impressed with the large variety of rolls, fish as well as other main entres and appetizers on the menu.
I started with the simple seaweed salad and edamame, both which were well seasoned and served at the perfect temperature.
Typically I am a fancy, combo roll fan but I will have to say that the quality of fish made the simple rolls one of my favorites of the night. The spicy yellowtail roll was very good as was the salmon avocado.
To finish off, the all-you-can-eat menu there is a choice of dessert. I'm always a fan of the green tea ice cream and in this instant the ice cream was superb. 
Will def go back the next time I am in Vegas.

Very bad service !!! Food was good but u wait a long time for ur food.... The only thing the servers can do so quick is when they give you ur check....not very nice is like there doing it in purpose....i dnt ussually do this review but we were there 3x & still same .....

This place was actually really great. I have not heard of it and came here on a whim thanks to Yelp. I was pleasantly surprised by what I found. This place is a nice size restaurant with a large sushi bar-, which is a super plus. The wait staff was nice and the sushi chefs were super friendly. They were super helpful as well (not to mention one that was super cute lol.) I ordered two rolls, both spicy. One had a spicy chili such and was deep friend. The other had Cajun albacore on the top - SO AMAZING. I would go there and order everything with that on top of it. The flavor was nice with a subtle kick in the back. I also had the crme brulee trio- also called the trilogy (by the cite sushi chef) The green tea wasn't good at all- way too strong but the other two, vanilla and chocolate were excellent. The chocolate was absolutely fantastic and I'm not a huge fan of chocolate crme brulee. Also the fact that they're all you can eat was only 26.95 is a super plus. They have a variety of specialty salads and appetizers you can ad onto that that looked amazing. Unfortunately I didn't have enough room for that but Ill be back! Probably next week with a friend.

I was coming through vegas on my move across country, and great friend said he wanted to take me out for sushi.  This was a special occasion for several occasions:  we were meeting after knowing each other online for ten years, it was a few days before my birthday and most importantly, I'd never eaten sushi before. I told him to pick somewhere really special and where I could try several different things because I wasn't sure what I'd like.  He said that Oyshi was all you can eat, which meant I could sample just about anything I wanted.

We ordered everything. This little guy put away about 18 pieces of yellowtail.  I tried it and it was ok, though the rolls were definitely the star.  The fried calimari was amazing.  We ordered fantasy roll, sexy roll, love affair, and dragon roll.  It was all amazing! if I had to pick my favorite, it was the love affair.  We also got seaweed salad, sweet shrimp, and fried scallops. The only thing I didn't care for was octopus, but it was a personal preference.  it was amazingly good, all of it, and they were so nice! Service was excellent and since 2 people in our party were almost an hour and a half late, they even let us stay longer than the two hours allowed.  It was the best first experience having sushi that I could've had!

Oyshi has been my favorite all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant for a long time.  Great food, great service.  This visit was no exception.  Went after work in a group of 7 around 10 pm.  No problems!!  We ordered a LOT of food...different rolls, sushi, appetizers, all of which were delivered quickly to our table.  Our server, Thomas, was great.  He and his staff kept our drinks filled and our table cleared of empty plates.  I've tried other places for AYCE sushi....and they've been good as well.  Oyshi always hits the mark, though, and they are open late allowing for late night dining.  Except on Sunday when they close a little earlier.  Me and my co-workers will definitely be returning!!!

It was just OK. We went based upon raves from our friends who went for the AYCE deal. We are not AYCE fans but decided to try the ala-carte option.

It's a very large place and was bustling on a Saturday night. Lots of families. Very loud booming music (not for us) When we go out we look for a relaxing experience - this isn't it.

We were greeted warmly by the hostess and our server. When we said we didn't want AYCE we were given an additional menu. So we had a large menu with the rolls and AYCE info and another with "dinner" options. They have lots of rolls with the "dynamite" mix which seems to be Krab mixed with other seafood and mayo.

The sushi is a B-. Certainly the quality isn't up to our other favs like Sen and Soho but not bad. They have a lot of rolls and cooked menu options. I had the "steak" on rice. In parens because it seemed more like chopped beef. It didn't resemble a quality steak but for $12 who could expect otherwise. The sauce was high in sugar and salt. Very tasty but we were thirsty all night.

The tempura was very greasy. Not a redo.

Service was great!

Prices are very reasonable and you get a lot with the dinner orders. If you like a lot of ok food at cheap prices this is definitely the place for you.
Went with a large party this past week, more than half of us became VERY ill with food poisoning Beware!!!!!!  Never again !!!!

After years of going to crowded sushi bars with minimal arm room between me and others, I found a location with comfort as well as a great selection of sushi creations. The restaurant is an upscale environment with room for large parties. 

 - The restaurant offers a huge menu of both sushi and hot kitchen items (e.g., sushi, koma, Hamachi, sizzling hot plates of steak and seafood, tempura, oysters, soups/salads, and desserts). 

-  There is usually a wait to be seated. The wait is sometimes as long as an hour during peek dinner times. You can drop in to be put on the list, and they will text you when they are ready to seat you. They take reservations. 

- They offer an all you can eat sushi menu for about $25 that includes one desert (e.g., green tea ice cream, creme brle, Moche ice cream).

- My favorites are the yellowtail koma, double salmon roll, surf and turf sizzling hot plate, spicy tuna hand roll, fresh sashimi red snapper and halibut, Red Rock sushi roll, and the vanilla creme brle with green tea ice-cream. 

I've been to this location over a dozen times in just the last four months - my most frequent visit being last week for lunch. I generally ask for my favorite sushi chef and server, and I am willing to wait for them. Vincent is the best server!  This restaurant generally wants the server to tell the sushi chef your order even as you sit at the bar. At first I wasn't fond of this process, but it works well and there isn't a lag in service. The sushi chef still hands you your order -it just prevents you from yelling out at a busy chef. Vincent offers exceptional service that includes getting your beverages, kitchen items, and sushi bar order. He is exceptional. 

The sushi chefs are all awesome, but my favorite is Ivan. When the restaurant isn't too busy, he will inquiry if you want anything. If you request, he will also make creations for you based on what he notices you like. He is efficient, creative, and humorous.

Always love coming here... They always go light on the rice, a quality you can't find in too many all you can eat spots. Some of the rolls are a little saucy for me but once you have it once just ask for easy sauce next time. Great service, good food... What else can you ask for?

I really wish that we had an Oyshi near my house. Their all you can eat sushi is the best. Make sure you also ask for stuff that's not on the menu, such as white tuna.

Conclusion: high quality food that makes you satisfied

AYCE sushi!! Apparently there quite a few of these places in Las Vegas, but Oyshi cannot be beat! 

My cousins ordered for us since my BF and I were first timers. Some of the rolls they ordered included the Sunset, Spider, Philadelphia. And of course - lots of nigiri! The ahi belly and salmon nigiri were my faves. 

Finally, dessert! we had the green tea creme brle, the vanilla creme brle and the green tea tiramisu. All were winners!!

Lunch for us was $22 per person. We went around 1pm on a weekday, which was great because it wasn't that busy. Be warned that the appetizers are not included in the AYCE, so be sure to ask your server what's included. Our server was helpful and gave us suggestions for various rolls and nigiri. However she got busy and would disappear for long periods of time... oh and the hot water machine was broken, so no miso soup or hot green tea :(

Cheers to AYCE sushi!! We'll be back!
Love it! Big menu and fresh sushi!!! Staff is always pleasant. It can get busy on the weekends but they have call ahead seating!

Great food! So fresh. The table management is god awful. People stacked on top on each other in the lobby with open tables and at least 6 seats at the sushi bar. We literally watched money walk out of the door as customers got frustrated with waiting. Lots of choices for food in our area and more restaurants opening every month. Get it together please!

5 MF stars

ALL YOU CAN EAT for $22 my dude

Great music

Friendly staff

I cannot stress how freaking delicious this place is. My radio co-host from Cake And Sausage brought me here because she knows my heart.

We EASILY ate OVER $100 in sushi, surf n turf, tempura and poke for $22 my guy. Twenty two dollars total!!! It included dessert 

Lobster rolls, BSCR iCant. Just come here
Food was good and fresh! but not really happy for the service... It's all you can eat, sometimes missing some orders and the food come out quite slow!

The AYCE sushi is great! The sushi rolls taste amazing, my personal favorite is the Nuclear Bomb and the Love Affair! Small appetizers and spicy sushi bowls are included as well as a specialty dessert. Get the green tea tiramisu, you can make all the other stuff in your kitchen and it tastes amazing. 

Although the food is great, service is baddd. I'm pretty sure our server forgot the entire entree for my friend, as his food didn't come out until we were very much done with ours, and the rolls were not very difficult to make. Some servers took their sweet time just walking around the place with an FML look on their face. Overall, the food was great which keeps me coming back, but I definitely have to tolerate the service.

This place is amazing. we will never go to another all you can eat sushi restaurant .we've been there over 20 times always had consistency with the food experience . The fish is always fresh, Green mussel are amazing.The all you can eat menu is very large... Yummy yummy.

This is my favorite AYCE!  Service is good, nice environment, and good food!

Just be patient if you're going with a big group.  ;)

Good clean fresh fish lots of specialized Rolls that are very good. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is there tables setup and timeliness. Been going here for years definitely needs a remodel or revamp on the setting.

The food was great. Too bad the service was horrible. We sat waiting at the sushi bar for 20 minutes before our waitress even came to check in, we'd been done eating and just wanted the check. We even asked the sushi chef when he asked if we were doing ok. He didn't do anything about it. Bummer. We won't be rushing back here, Sumos has great food and great service.

Update: I visited the Rainbow location last night at 12:50am with some friends. (They close at 2am) We were told they were closing early because they were slow and they took last call at 12:45am. I questioned the guy and mentioned that their hours say 2am. My friends drove 45 minutes specifically to go to Oyshi! He said they decided to close early and we couldn't eat. I even mentioned that we knew exactly what we wanted, since their "last call" was 5 minutes earlier. He was not very friendly! 

During the time we were standing outside deciding where to go, more people came and got very upset. That's at least 9 people they turned away! If your hours are until 2am, you should be open until 2am. From what I saw, they lost enough business to make it worth being open until the normal time. Next time we are going to eat, Oyshi will not even be an option unless it's early in the evening. When businesses aren't reliable, you're not gonna go out of your way to visit! Or tell others to visit at all! My review went from 5 stars down to 2. This isn't the first issue I've had at this location! Customer service is everything. 

As far as the food...

My friend told me about this place and their All You Can Eat sushi but I wasn't too sure about going because I only like one kind of roll. When we decided to go, I asked her if they had a regular menu because I wouldn't be able to eat that much sushi to justify All You Can Eat. When we arrived I was shocked that their all you can eat menu included appetizers, sushi, and dessert! This was perfect!

My friend and I both ordered the Love Affair roll which is shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. (no eel sauce for me) It was delicious!!! We also ordered....

Gyoza- nothing special but yummy!

Surf & Turf Platter- all the platters are small, so you can easily order two. The steak is pretty good and the shrimp was amazing. (I am very picky when it comes to shrimp)

Ebi- the best I've ever had. 

Teriyaki chicken- yummy

I absolutely love this place! I love variety without spending a fortune AND they are open late. (Well they are when they DECIDE to stay open) 

Price: 
$22 for lunch
$27 for dinner

Had dinner here the other night and it was good ! The sushi came out super fast and was delicious. Took a little longer on the apps but overall good experience ! Biggest concern was the cleanliness ! Lots of dust in the ceiling area and food on the floor ! The ceilings are black and you could see layers of dust plus the curtain at the front is super dirty and looks horrible ! I would recommend cleaning and looking at brightening the place up a little,  especially because they are busy !!

Last few times I've went to oyshi the experience has gotten worse with each visit. Randomly I came here to read the reviews and I noticed something interesting, the favorable reviews were rarely from people in Las Vegas. Come to your own conclusion but this bugs me.

Oyshi, ditch the millenial staff, organize your kitchen and turn the stripper music off. Start acting like you used to when you were good.

After many attempts at eating sushi, I have accepted the fact I will never like it. Ever. BUT my friends still like it and I can't say no to food. I usually go for a chicken dish of some sort and was thrilled when I saw Oyshi has chicken teriyaki. My entree came with soup & salad. The salad was enormous and SO good - probably the best ginger dressing I have ever had. The chicken teriyaki came out on a skillet and a bowl of rice. It seemed to be more darker meat. The teriyaki sauce was sweet & good. My only complaint was the abundance of onions... I love onions but it was too much for me. The onion scent stayed with me the rest of the day! The amount of food I got for ~$9 was mind blowing. Would recommend this place for sure!

I absolutely love this sushi place. It's not always the cleanest and it could use a professional touch to improve the atmosphere but the food is remarkable. Since I moved I had to find a new sushi place and I like this one more than my last favorite place.

You must try the mango wasabi!

Service was good. Clean inside. Went in for AYCE sushi it was very disappointing. The rice tasted at least two days old. The fish itself was somewhat ok. Complete waste of my time and money. Will never return...

On our search for another epic place for sushi happens to fall onto this place as it drew us in for AYCE. I think a few of our friends had heard or were recommended to try this joint since they knew our group and how we can grub. The last place we went to before left a bad taste in my mouth and another a little ill from the meal, we were happy to try a completely different place. 

The atmosphere, ambience, are very inviting yet dark for those intimate encounters due to the dark wood finish everywhere. TVs around for those ackward silent moments if you're on a date or deep conversation in a larger group. I do like the mural on the back wall which was really impressive.

Now, down to the food, you can order anything on the menu but just watch for any restrictions such as only 1 order of uni for example. I do like the sound of appetizers you can order such as rib-eye steak which is really less than tapas on a sizzling plate and a bed of cabbage and onions. Another beef plate was the same which tasted good but I feel like I would have to order 5 of these to really make a good size order to be called an appetizer. 

The rolls are inventive and decorative which is a refreshing change from the other sushi places. My recommendation is to stick to the "designer" rolls rather than the sushi. I must strongly advise against ordering the uni which it could be me and an off night. I always try to be brave and order it knowing it could be really good or it could be really really bad. In fact, I didn't eat the second piece because the first one I ate tasted like iodine for some reason. Definitely may explain for my stomach pains on the way back to our place. Nausea may be another descriptive word for this feeling as well. The rolls taste great and presentation looks great but I may have to say no to sushi so far away from the coastline especially in the middle of the dessert. If you have reviewed or about to review this place and give it 5 stars, you may have to check yourself as your taste buds are a bit off for what great sushi really should be in quality.

I often used to come to Oyshi because it's close to my house and it was very delicious. Fish was always fresh and service was always good, but ever since they got popular, everything has down-graded. 

I tried to give them second chances because I used to love this place so much! But lately, their customer service has been way too slow. I get that they're busy, which IMO they need to hire more staffs. My last visit, it took them at least 10 mins to realize that we were standing there waiting to be seated. Then, it took 30 mins for the server to bring us water and miso soup. The owner walks by and doesn't acknowledge us at all. You've got to be fast and efficient, especially a busy place like this, you've got to have more staffs. I will never come back again, even if it's a block away from my house. 

Despite my horrible experience, I still love their Love Affair roll, it's the only roll that doesn't fail to satisfy me.

This is my favorite all your can eat sushi place in Vegas! You can always find a seat right off the bat (Which is a far cry from somewhere else Yama Sushi where I have waited up to 2 hours with a group of 6). The menu is much longer, and more unique than somewhere like Sushi Mon. The decor is pretty hip, staff very friendly. We go back at least once a month!
Great food, amazing service. Judy was so helpful with recommendations. Very friendly staff. Timely turn around on the r

Horrible service extremely long wait for our food all the drinks sat on the table empty with a nuclear roll burning through the skin in my mouth I'll never be back be sure to take my business down the street to Kobe or ohjah.

Ever since I can remember, Sushi-Mon (the one on silverado ranch/maryland pkwy) has been my favorite go-to spot. Words couldn't describe how good it is. But I decided to try something new. This place had 270 reviews with an average of four stars. So they must be doing something right.

After one minute of walking the wrong way..we finally got into the entrance..by Following THE ARROWS...

Decor was really nice, bigger than the usual sushi bars. Great Location too. The VIP room and Lounge room was a nice touch. It was slow mind you, during lunch when I walked in with my "friend" Karlee. We started off with, my favorite Ahi Poke and Miso Soup. Karlee had the soup as well and Gyoza. Ahi Poke was ok, but not better than sushi mon, the flavor wasn't just there. Miso was good, not fantastic. Karlee loved the Gyoza, she said it was better than the other Sushi place she goes that serves it.
