I had the J&b roll, baked, with salmon and cream cheese. It was good, juicy, hand a hint of soy sauce. hats off to the sushi chef because it was awesome. I had a cucumber roll, asian strip steak and this deep fried california roll, with hot mustard and albacore tuna. All was great but the J&b roll was the highlight. karlee had 2 orders of the shrimp tempura roll, apparently it was good, I couldn't have any because I am allergic to shrimp. She tried to Force Feed it to me, knowing I was allergic, I think she tried to kill me, because I tried to make fun of her Sirarcha/Hot mayo sauce that she custom made..oh and She had chicken teriyaki and I think another order of Gyoza, apparently she loves that stuff.

 The service was a little slow, especially when they weren't busy. This was all you can eat, and what I was shocked about how they did not serve Half rolls!! I was like WTF? how could I possibly try more than 3 types. Other than that The waitress seemed puzzled and brought us the wrong dishes a couple of times. No big deal. The Food was great, service was so-so, and It is a place I would come back to again. I also ate too much, because I regret not getting desert (no one really gets more than one desert, but why would they limit you to JUST one, its all you can eat!!!), being that it was one of the reasons I came here for, Green Tea Tiramisu, I'm Coming back for you!

We had so bad experience here today. As my friends and I  have lunch here, servers were not nice.. At the moment, there were no many parties of customers, that means it wasn't busy at all. At the sushi bar, there were about four sushi chefs, and there were about at least 3 servers. Yet, our orders were delayed unnecessarily, and didn't receive any customer service. They didn't come to check if foods are ok. We got foods long after we ordered, and some of foods we ordered wasn't even put in and made. But we rather got foods we didn't order, or ones we canceled. I told a server that that's what we canceled, and the foods  we ordered earlier didn't came out. We were not ok with all of them at all today. A chef just came out and asked if we are chinese or korean. And asked if we canceled orders of spicy tuna and some other order. I said we did, and he answered us to enjoy our meal, but his attitude and tone of voice seemed like he had something to complain. The head chef, looked at us and laughed at us while he's passing by our table. Obviously it wasn't smile he may normally treat to customers. We felt so uncomfortable that we asked if we can talk to manager about many things since we had not only bad customer service ,but also foods were so bad. A server said that manager is not here. We paid for our check, and left. But we were definitely not ok with all of them, so we got in the restaurant again and if we can get manager's contact. The chef, who came to our table and told if we canceled food, seemed worried with us, so asked if there were anything went wrong. We told him about things we wanted to complain. He looked like he's pretending to listen to us. Looking uncomfortable with what we said, he asked what he can compensate with(but obviously his attitude was to get out of the situation). He took out his wallet and said "I will refund for the price you paid." No one of us wanted to get refund, but his unnecessary action wasn't appropriate with the situation. He could have apologized about his and employees' faults sincerely, but he just tried to solve situation with his money. If he really wanted to compensate for bad service and was going to give us money back, he should have asked cashier to give us money back instead of taking out his wallet. There were even more things to say about foods, but I will reserve my opinion about food since it can reflect my bad feelings from bad experience. 

Oh, I forgot to tell you guys. In korean culture, it's common that older people treat younger people poorly. But chef Ed, who asked our age, He didn't have to ask and talk about our age in spite of our young looking-appearence. Was that really necessary to ask our age? His attitude definitely made it worse. The attitude you have shown was not professional at all.

I would of loved to give this 5 stars but after my second visit this week my waiter was a complete idiot.
He didn't have basic knowledge of sushi or the menu items available.
When i asked for plum wine ice cream he stated naming off the different types of sake they offer.
My sushi order NEVER came out. After we had eaten all our appetizers and put in a second AYCE order... we realized something was up because everyone around us was eating. When we ask where our food was the server accused us of getting our food and said we didnt order those things and... it was just bogus to say the least.
Was excited to have a good place near by, but will seriously reconsider coming here, especially with all the AYCE in the area.

Got a Chirashi opposed to AYCE and the fish was super fresh, the rice is delicious, and best of all, the servers were extremely friendly. I was sitting at the bar area and Chef Ed was very nice. He showed professionalism and love for his job. We talked and he was always smiling. Very great sushi chef. He made the experience 6/5 if anything.

Dude, seriously. All you can eat everything. Anything on the menu except sashimi is fair game. 

If you go here and don't think it's the bomb, we can't be friends anymore.

My Dad, Uncle and I came here at the recommendation of my brother-in-law. It did not disappoint. We had to wait a while to get a seat at the bar. There's also rooms around the main dining area that look like they're available to reserve. 

The decor is pretty Neo-Far East trendy. Between that and the music, it comes across as a pretty hip, young place. This is not the place to go if you're looking for a quiet, traditional Japanese style sushi experience.

Extremely disappointed. I was told by a friend to try this place and it sounded like some great sushi. Wrong. Walked in and half the tables were reserved. But there was space along the sushi bar. Took them 15 minutes to seat us, then we had a horribly slow server. Took 20 minutes to order sushi, and the sushi wasn't anything amazing. I suggest trying somewhere else.

I'm a customer there for years. Love their appetizers. They are bomb, my favorites are shrimp on skewers, scallop popcorn, and baked mussels but don't forget tiramisu at the end of your meal. Any way, the last time I went there the tiramisu kinda changed it doesn't testy like usual.

A few weeks ago, this is the first time I visited this place after a coworker recommended this place. Friends and I got AYCE. Disappointed that we couldn't order half rolls, only full rolls. So we couldn't try a variety of sushi because we got full fast. It's ok, the sushi all seemed the same. The creme brle was good, most memorable part of the experience. The green tea tiramisu someone got was ok. Didn't like how you can only order one dessert but unlimited ice cream. Got too full to try the ice cream. Their rules are weak compared to sushi mon or Yama sushi. Would not come back. I didn't think it was worth it.
Cool local sushi joint, shows paper view for free.  Must try the all you can eat, well worth it.

This place is GREAT! Food is awesome, I'd recommend sitting at the bar if the offer is available because this place gets pretty busy on a Saturday night. 

The nice thing about the Sushi bar is the counter space is a lot wider than most sushi spots, this gives you a lot of space for all your AYCE plates ;)

My favorites, Yellowtail Trio and Love Affair roll. The Love Affair roll is full of so much flavor thanks to the mixture of the scallops and crab mix, the crispies add the texture that makes each bite easier to chew.

Pretty good sushi at a reasonable price. Better than average sushi. 

The servers kept brining me food I did not order though . It was pretty funny.
My favorite sushi place in southwest. Employees are always nice and food is always consistent which is important to me. Good music and def good drinks:)

Would have given a 5 star but the service was a bit lacking. However, the food made up for it. Went to lunch there with our staff and the menu was wonderful. I ordered the lunch special sizzling plate with chicken teriyaki and it came with miso soup, salad, tempura shrimp and vegetables, and California roll with the entre. It was a boat load of food for $10. I had to take a portion home. BTW: the green tea ice cream is also a screaming deal for two scoops $2.50. Great food but I should caution you to go early for lunch because you will wait for a good fair amount of time. I will definitely be back to give the service another chance.

Place is pretty delicious.  Food is tasty, only thing that leaves to be desired is the speed at which the food actually comes out.  Servers were awesome and very attentive.  All you can eat is quite the deal so it is much recommended.  Just prepare to wait some time for food to come out as the kitchen sure likes to take their time.

Me and my boyfriend went here for dinner. Everything was ok except for one thing, I order miso soup twice and I didnt get it. Even the chicken yakitori we didn't get it. We asked the server about it and she said she gonna check about it and still nothing happened.

I've been to this place well over 20 times and while sometimes the service is slow or sometimes there is a roll that isn't my favorite, it really is consistently great. I always do the all you can eat, and get a number of appetizers like seaweed salad and spicy sashimi salad, a couple hand rolls, and nigiri. I used to get a number of rolls, and find them great, but don't usually want that much rice and they're very filling.

Highly recommend this as a local sushi joint!

Service was good, food was good, music was terrible. Just not what I enjoy listening to over dinner...sounds like a night club. I would also like to see more rolls that do not have cream cheese and also upside down shrimp.

Our go-to place for ayce sushi!!! Best place ever...

Picture says it all so you've got to try it out. Almost all special family occasion is an oyshi ayce night for us!

Great food !!! Good service. Probably the best sushi in Vegas. I've tried quite a few spots too. Oyshi's wait list can be long but typically no longer than 30 min. I recommend making a reservation the morning of or day before. Try the sizzling skirt steak.... Yummmm

I am so shocked that this place only has 3.5 stars! I am normally not a fan of "all you can eat" anything...but Oyshi is an exception. 

AYCE sushi includes their ENTIRE menu- including sushi, sashimi, dessert, hot foods, and all rolls. The real kicker...it's only $28. I live in CA but each time we go out to Vegas we stop at Oyshi before hitting The Strip.

Quick tip: If you sit at the bar they permit you to order half rolls.

Not too bad. But not my first stop if I have a craving for Japanese. The rolls aren't that great. Or it could just be ones that we ordered. The service is great though. So that's a plus. Very polite and always askin if we needed anything. I would come bavk again but order something diferrent everytime until I find the right one.
So good!! Lunch specials are amazing! So much food for such a cheap price. Love it. Will definitely be back.

SBC VEGAS SERIES:9 of many reviews
I want some sushi NOW!!!!

Its hard to find sushi during lunch hours on the strip. Mind you that I didn't have any fancy jeezus phone or other interwebz navigating phone on me so I had to depend on my simple, yet reliable and dependable intuition... and lifelines. ;D  As I walked the strip during lunch hour sunshine I was rudely awakened to the fact after epic fail after epic fail that sushi apparently only open during dinner hours. FML!!!! 

I end up calling my cousin to yelp it... bare in mind he doesn't know how to use the ever HOLY YELP but does what he can for me off his interwebz capable cell. He forwards me a list and after several returned calls of being open hours later one of them responds that they are currently open. I tell the cabbie who then proceeds to drive my ass half an hour into the desert. Who knew????

WTF??

Well, I get there to this strip mall in the middle of no where and proceed to order and drink, drink and eat, and eat and drink some more. I dock them one star for the uni.. it wasn't as good as I would have expected but then again we are in the desert and I suppose should be grateful for anything shell fish. After ordering countless orders of sashimi and sushi I realize that they offer a all-you-can-eat sushi. 

Oh well!

It appears that a lot of people come here for this. I had no idea what to order so I flagged the closest waiter for assistance. The helpful and over zealous staff suggested a number of oddly named rolls which we humored them by ordering. Well, I can at least tell you that their menu offerings were pretty damned good. I wish I could remember the named of the lobster covered roll that I ordered because it was indulgent. So other than the uni I had no complaints about traveling the better part of an hour to get here. 

now how do i get back to the strip?
o_0

Used to be my favorite AYCE sushi place. They have really good rolls here. My favorites include Tiger roll and Lobster Fair roll. So delicious!

I would say...better than Kaya (Spring Mtn & Arville) worse than Goyemon (Hacienda and Decatur?)

Very fresh sushi- came here with a girlfriend, and on a diet!
She ordered AYCE for $21...her food looked amazing.
I opted for a lot of low-calorie things, so I got fresh albacore (6 pc), house salad w/ dressing on the side, and miso soup.My food was amazing and I tried one of her lobster roll,that was also amazing!
They had served us edamame as an appetizer beforehand I guess...awesome i love those little perks places like this offer. Sometimes its cucumber salad. Love.
She ended up getting a pink ball of ice cream after,but I didn't try it.
We will definitely be back, as they have a ladies night and AYCE for $21 quite often!

We went there on last Saturday nite expecting full house, but the place was only 3/4 full.  We sat at the wide open bar for all-you-can-eat so it's easier to order sushi from the chef. Our first impression was good atmosphere and hip music.

We found the service excellent, contrary to some reviews. Maybe because it was not busy or from over staffing, we were asked "How is everything?" every 5 minutes, even thought we were sitting at the bar.

The food was just OK. We liked the ahi poke, spider hand roll, white tuna, and especially the green tiramisu. On the other hand, we were not excited about the miso soup, bland tasting sushi, water-down soy sauce, light wasabi, and $2.50 xtra for hot tea.

Over all, we thought $67 for two AYCE including 15% tip is just a little higher than most places in town especially for average food.

We might or might not go back.

I am so utterly disappointed we usually eat here all the time and we even made reservations to get to come and enjoy for Valentine's Day dinner and we figured everything would be great we even had little reserved signs! As soon as we sat down a gentleman took our drink order and first round of food since we decided to all you can eat, we started receiving our food from the bar but with no server in sight, with at least 10-12 servers/bussers walking around, about 20 minutes go by and my husband still hasn't gotten a refill and we still had a stack of used plates in front of us, finally I went up and talked to the host because we still haven't received refills or even taken any more orders, so we decided we just wanted the check even though we were still hungry

The host was extremely nice and I told her what had happened and she explained our first server was leaving and a lady was supposed to come help but she never did and she apologized and went and got the manager, she as well was very nice and asked if she could do anything but at this point we were so frustrated we just asked for the check and she kindly said no, and so we left... honestly this was one of my favorite places to go but after ruining our Valentine's Day like this we won't be back and that saddens me because of one person who neglected to even check on us or even introduce herself but then again we never even saw the first server again either or was told he was leaving so bad on the service area, but I do appreciate both the host and managers concern

We randomly tried Oyshi on whim and I'm glad we did. The reviews are so harsh so I decided to write one. Our servers name was Jane, and she was great! The food is so good, you need to try the dynamite appetizer probably the best one in Vegas that I've found thus far from living here for about a little over a year. The atmosphere is great. They have private rooms for party's and they play some really good music. If I had to choose between sumo sushi 2 and Oyshi, for some AYCE sushi on this side of town, it would be Oyshi!! Lol anyway we will be coming back for sure!
We love eating at Oishi - be sure to ask for Stefan for great service.  He listens to what you like & then makes awesome recommendations.  We eat here at least once a week

I have eaten AYCE at Oyshi literally about 30 times. 29 out of 30 of those times the food and service was impeccable (the only minor issue  I had once was a new waiter that mixed up a few of my rolls). The waiter/waitress are fast and attentive, the place does no smell super fishy when you walk in (because the fish is fresh), the actual sushi tastes a notch above most in Vegas,it is super affordable, and they are open late. Everybody I know that has gone there loved it. Oyshi is a must try. It is across town from me now, but it is worth the drive.

I'm writhing in pain as I write this review because my stomach hurts so flipping bad after eating from here.  Prepare yourself for my meanest review yet.

First, NO.  Just no.  I want to shout this at the top of my lungs to the owner/manager/whatever of this place.  The sushi here was the WORST ever that Ive tasted.  They boast an impressive menu but too bad they do not know how to properly make each roll.  The fish was SLIMY and gross.  Sushi rolls should not slide down your throat, you should be able to chew them and relish in all the amazing flavors.  I couldn't distinguish any of the rolls apart and the WORST one was the Hawaiian roll.  It completely ruined my entire appetite and I couldnt eat any more sushi.  Like literally too disgusted.

Secondly, NO.  The service needed some help.  They were friendly but when they got busy they couldn't keep up.  There were 4 sushi chefs and 3 waitresses with the restaurant being full.  It took forever to get us seated (the hostess has to waitress just to keep up), forever to get our sushi rolls, and forever to get a refill and we went there when it was NOT busy.  

Lastly, my boyfriend and I both immediately felt sick to our stomachs when we left.  Like nauseous, clutch your stomach, take tiny sips of water and moan sick.

So why one star?  Why bother to give one?  Because the staff WAS friendly whenever they did talk to us.  

Also there were several flies in the restaurant.  DEE-SGUSTING

Harumph!

Horrible service. Just came in for the all you can eat, and in one hour wet were served one tiny rainbow roll... The guy didn't take the time to come and check on us. People next to use were served right away after coming in 20 minutes after us. Should have known it was going to be bad when I asked if they were open and was ignored.

Will never come here again.  Next time will check yelp as I see the yelp reviews are similar to mine. 

Just sad.

This place is always packed which makes for a good atmosphere. Sushi is edible but not the best in the area. You can find better all you can eat on the southwest side for the same price. They can accommodate large parties which is a huge plus.

We had a rental car so we decided to venture out of the strip and check this place out.   I'm sorry to write that Yelpers disappointed me this time.  AYCE sushi deal is a great value, no doubt.  However, if you like quality than quantity, then you will be disappointed too.  I get better sushi at mediocre places in east coast.   Yes, you would have to pay a bit more, however, I would rather  pay a bit more than be unhappy after spending almost $30 pp. I also wasn't keen on the house music being blasted like we are at some club.   
I do have to say that the service was pretty decent.  I don't think I would ever return.

I was visiting for work and one of my colleagues lives in the area and suggested Oyshi. It was such a great experience. 

ATMOSPHERE 
Decor is modern and zen feel. There was a range in ages, families etc. 

FOOD 
It is all you can eat. I'm usually not a fan, always think that's it's pre made rolls etc. NOT HERE. It is made to order. The quality of the sushi was just fine. Again it's not Nobu, but it really is a good value and just tasty. I had mostly nigiri (sushi). 
- albacore (regular, seared and Cajun)
- yellowtail - peppered with yuzu sauce
- roll forget the name, had tuna on the inside and albacore on top. 
- dynamite appetizer 
I enjoyed everything I ordered. 

PARKING 
Lots of free parking in the lot. 

Anytime I'm in town now, I will make an effort to come have a meal here. Totally worth the drive from the strip.
Definitely one of the best sushi spots in town! Really good rolls and not very expensive! I go here all the time!

This place is probably one of my favorite sushi restaurants.  It has a spectacular AYCE menu with tons of appetizers and rolls to choose from.  My favorite appetizer is the surf and turf.  My favorite rolls consist of the Red Rock, Volcano, and Rainbow.  You can order half portions here, so that way you can choose to sample several rolls, or just stick to a couple full rolls.  There is almost always a wait, but it's well worth it.  The staff is super friendly and I have never dealt with poor customer service any of the times I have dined there.  The couple times I have sat at the bar have been great experiences too - the chefs are all nice.

It's in a great location, but I have driven past it a couple times without realizing it. Really, I have nothing but positive things to say!

It's a great all you can eat spot with a large dining area. The servers are nice & the food is great. I enjoy getting all you can eat because I always try new things. 
I highly recommend the super white & they also have green tea creme brle for dessert! It's amazing. 
If you're into all you can eat, this place won't disappoint. It's a regular spot for me & I keep going back for more.

The all you can eat sushi menu is pretty extensive. At $26 for dinner it is right on par with other sushi places I have been to. The sushi is fresh, the steaks and meats are tender and juicy, and the appetizers like the gyoza and seaweed salad are tasty. The calamari could use some work in the flavor department however. The service there is second to none. You are greeted when you walk in by nearly all of the staff, the waiters/waitresses are friendly and attentive, and the bus staff makes sure your table isn't cluttered with plates and your drinks are never empty. The wait for the sushi can get a little long, so order up some appetizers and sides while you're waiting. Just remember that there are other tables waiting for sushi, and only a few sushi chefs to make all the sushi so patience is a virtue here.

We love it , we go few times every month , it's clean and have fun environment. The food is good and come very fast .
Everyone there is very nice and friendly .

Their prices for lunch and dinner are on par with other places in the area, and the food is delicious. All you can eat is great, but I've only had one extremely nice and prompt waitress. Others have been begrudging in their obligation to help the customer even if their tip depends on it, and I usually tip at least 20 percent. Even the host who sat us kind of seemed to not want to be there in the slightest. I totally understand working in food and bev industry, have done it for years, but for gods sake at least pretend to want to be there. Anyway, other than the shifty service, everything there is fabulous.

Must do AYCE! Definitely worth the price. Not only is the sushi AYCE, but the full menu as well. So you can get appetizers with your sushi. Fish is always fresh, and VERY tasty rolls. good, quick, friendly service, lots of seating, can be busy and a lil loud at times, so call for big groups. But i cannot say anything bad about this place. I'm very surprised it only has 3.5 stars.

$21 all you can eat sushi for lunch/$26 for dinner. 

I love how their specialty rolls are included...and the rolls are made fresh (compared to most sushi buffets).  My favorite rolls were the love affair roll and the monster roll.
Don't forget to get a dessert too! Their creme brulee is delicious! :)

I have gone to this place for a couple of years. And every time I come in I can see their popularity is rising. They have add more seating area which is great. I don't think I've ever waited for 20mins for a table. The food is always good. Everything I've ever had their is yummy! They added a sizzling plate which I really enjoyed. They have a couple ppl that walk around just to clear your table which is awesome. Your table is never cluttered.

I tried this restaurant with a meetup group.  I suppose we had 12 who met for AYCE lunch.  We all ordered so many different types of rolls and shared them.  I would have to say my favorite was the Pink Lady Roll.  That roll had several types of fish and wrapped in a pink soy wrapper.  Very nice.  We also tried the RockN' Roll, the Atomic Bomb, Salmon Lover, Yellowtail Trio, Hawaiian  and other specialty rolls.  

After eating at a different AYCE near Summerlin I had a fresh comparison.  I found what we had was all very fresh and tasty, prepared to order.  We also had seaweed salsa, rib eye appetizer, ahi poke,  and desert was included, too.  I had strawberry mochi ice cream and tasted the green tiramisu.

Thomas was our waiter and was very attentive in locating each of us with our orders.  He was very good.  Yes, it did take a little while to wait for some of the rolls, but we were ordering a lot of food and the quality and taste made it worth the wait.  

I will definitely be back with my friends and I'll bring a bigger appetite!

This was my second visit to Oyshi, my first to the main dining room.  It was fairly busy, but we had a reservation and were seated immediately.  Our server was friendly and extremely prompt without being pushy at all!  She never let our drinks get completely empty and always made sure our plates were full!  My friend and I shared the Spicy Tuna Crunch and I devoured the Japanese Lasagna and the lobster/crab roll alone as he isn't a big fan of any warm sushi.  We also shared some Gyoza and the popcorn scallops (my favorite appetizer!) As always, everything was fresh and extremely tasty.  I can't wait for my next visit!!

My coworkers and I went here after shift .. we arrived 12:30am, we were told that last call is at 1am. They were going to close early that day. (Last call is usually 1:30am).. anyways, the reason why my friends and I went there is because one of us had a birthday. But the birthday boy was running late. He arrived after 1am, (past the 1am last call for that day) but they still took his order which I thought was kind of them to do. We didn't finish our food, but we only had to pay for two rolls extra. Again, that was a nice surprise. I was expecting to pay WAY more for the leftovers. I was highly expecting them to be mad or to show sings of irritation because they ended up not closing early and instead closed at the regular time of 2am. We were one of the last two groups there.. They were very accommodating throughout the whole time. Our server, Tony/Toni, was very friendly. She was very nice and always smiled throughout the whole dining experience. I think she was the one that recommended the 'love affair' which was really good!!! Anyways, during dessert, one of my friends joked around saying they were going to bring the birthday boy cake, but said it only as a joke. He said 'just kidding' and mentioned it was our friends bday which is why he said that. Tony/Toni asked if it really was our friends bday and later she came out with a green tea looking cake. I was very happy with the service !! The food was really good, but for me, service is important.. If a restaurant has good food, but really bad service, I would most likely not go back. Well Oyshi had good food AND great service! I am sold. I will be going back here soon! :)

I decided to update this review because my recent visit was much better compared to three years ago. Came here with my family and we enjoyed the sushi. Everything was brought out on time and made well. Our waitress was nice and took our orders as quickly as possible and made sure each person got their orders right. My husband and I decided to try this place in the near future just the three of us when we can.

former review from 3 years ago:
2 Stars
How this place ever got a vote for best sushi place in Las Vegas is beyond stupid. I know going there on father's day might have been a bad idea for AYCE. So 6 of us went in at 2pm. It was pretty full but people were starting to leave.
 Yes we were seated immediately ( Which explains 1 star) and our first order of rolls and appetizers came out quick enough ( 1 more star) but they didn't even bring out ALL the first orders. I ordered a pink lady and it didn't even come out until 40 minutes  and it was my 1/2 of my FIRST ROLL. Then when it came out it looked like a 6 yr. old just grabbed mayonnaise and some seafood and loosely rolled it in soy paper. It was so big it fell apart. They might as well have just jammed the thing in a rice bowl and given me a spoon.It also tasted like the seafood part was sitting out.
  At least the waitress that helped us was apologetic. I'm not returning here ever and if I was invited to come here I would just decline. I still rather go to Sushi Bay off warm springs for their faster service and better variety of sushi

January 11, 2017 @ 10:30pm 

Let me begin by saying that this was the worst possible service ever! The food was okay and I have had much better, but this review is strictly based off of service. I've worked in the restaurant industry so I know that when an incomplete party of 8 show up at 10pm, it could be annoying, however, you don't let the customer know. Well, thats what the male busser with spiked black hair and glasses made clear last night. Every question I asked him about our table he would give a short answer and then turn his back on me immediately (Keep in mind, I worked as a hostess in Vegas for 6+ years, I know how to passive aggressively tell a customer F* you and this kid did it.) Next my friend and I asked if we could wait at the bar and grab a drink and wait for the rest of the party to show, then the hostess says,"If you don't plan on buying anything." I get it, they don't want to transfer the bill or whatever, so fine, we wait. Our party arrives and then we are seated and our server, a lady, I don't know her name because she never introduced herself and made it clear we were annoying her. We ordered a lot of food and tons of sushi and when the sushi came out, the staff didn't even know the names of the rolls, so when we would send it back because we did recognize the names, she would immediately come back and act as if it was our fault and stated the correct names (wow). Towards dessert she lightened up a bit. We aren't a difficult crowd, we all work(ed) in the industry and understand the difficulties of customer service (I'm not saying we're saints because we work in the industry, but we are more courteous than most that don't).
 I don't recommend this place for service, the sushi was alright. We ordered gyoza, rib eye (which they didn't ask which temperature and we were lucky to get beef jerky), miso soup, calamari, shrimp tempura, creme brle, mochi, and different flavor ice cream. It was all O.K. All you can eat was the best part of our experience.

This review is well overdue. 

AYCE here is great - we were so impressed by everything we ordered. 
We sat at the bar.
 Thick cuts that melt in your mouth. 
Fish or meat.. execution was perfect. You can't go wrong with any dish you order here, I really can't say that one was my favorite. I love them all equally. 
Service was friendly but not overwhelming. We will most definitely be back to try other items on the menu when we are in Vegas..  I can't wait!

As a person who eats at many different sushi places I was disappointed when it came to the rolls here. Although we enjoyed our appetizers and desserts we lacked in fulfillment in our sushi. 

For a 5 order the size was well, but when it came to 6-8 piece orders the sizes were to larger as if they were buffing it with rice and lacking any taste. When eating sushi I want to enjoy it not have a mouthful of rice and if was a good size it felt as if the sushi chefs were using the crab as a crutch to fill most of the sushi. One of my most enjoyed rolls the rainbow roll consisted of no avocado, loads of crab, and poorly sliced pieces. 

This is my third time here and I'll say that every experience here has been a gradual decrease of pleasure. The nigiri was enjoyable but that was all. The servers and bussers were pleasant but the sushi chefs were acting as if it was a middle school sleepover, gossiping with each other about customers instead of actually communicating with them.

I love the food here but the hostess staff is terrible. They literally don't even acknowledge you. I called the restaurant and was pput on an 8 minute hold before I eventually just hung up. If they restrained their front staff...this place would be awesome.

The wait here wasn't bad she said about ten min and I think it was less. The food is good however, they brought out my appetizers with my sushi. Typically the appetizers should come out first. I understand the kitchen can be backed up sometimes though. I like that they had a variety of baked rolls and the music was good as well. The policy on all you can eat is that you cannot take any food home but that's OK I guess some places let you and some don't. All in all I would come back not far from me and the price is right.

This was our favorite place for years.  3 strikes make it a no go.  Came it late one night and was rewarded with terrible customer service even though there were very few people left in the place .  We left without being served btw .  Tried it again another night.  Same result.  Tried it a third times.  Got sick beyond comprehension .  And sorry Oyshi but never coming back and we were very loyal vegas locals and brought a ton of people in .

I've came here too many times for an auditor to keep track. I've came here for a dinner date with my BF, to enjoy company of good friends, to celebrate birthdays and even left family stories here. What I mean to say is that.. This place is good for any occasion and anyone.

Of course they have ALLYOUCANEAT at 20sum dollars. Just ordering more than two dishes is already worth that 20sum. Different rice bowls (suchas unagi), surf&turf, baked mussles, desserts and so much more are included in your 20sum dollars. If there's anything specific I'm looking for in a sushi spot.. It would be Cajun Albacore & Tempura fried ice cream. This place doesn't have temp. ice cream, but they do have the best Cajun Albacore. The flavor is mouth watering! And you can't even see the rice with this huge savory slice over it. I eat these like chips!

The service here is pretty friendly, especially if you sit at the bar. I mean what's better than interacting with the chef making your food?! This place has three private rooms for group parties. One of them is a lounge with individual sofa chairs and a big LCD TV.

I love this sushi place. It has one if the biggest all you can eat menu I've ever seen. The service was a little slow at first but I'm a pretty easy going person. These rolls were amazing Love affair, Cater cheese, Full moon,Spider,& Rock and roll.

My husband and I make this our date night stop every couple of months. We have never been disappointed, The servers all help each other out which means my drink is never empty. Our food always arrives just in time before I get hangry ;) Make sure you go before dinner hour and you'll get in pretty quickly if you wait until after 6:30 then you'll have a 30-45 minute wait which to me is worth it to have delicious all you can eat sushi!! I wish their were more alcohol options but I'll deal with it:)
Absolutely LOVE this place and my favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas.  The fish is always high quality and the appetizers and desserts are awesome and included in the price!

Tried ayce sushi for the first time here. It did not disappoint!

The servers are attentive, but the food sometimes took a ridiculous amount of time to come out. I also think they forgot some of the rolls we ordered which was somewhat irritating but we just ordered again.

Get the rolls! The fish to rice ratio is awesome. The rolls are smaller than you'd expect though so don't be afraid to order lots. The gyoza and poke bowls are delicious.

Fish was fresher than I would have expected which was a pleasant surprise. They have oysters on a half shell as well. And uni!!! One per customer but still great.

The green tea creme brle was awesome. Tons of matcha flavor. Don't bother with the  green tea ice cream though - worst green tea ice cream I've ever had. Also don't bother with the yakitori it was disappointing.

Overall it was a successful first time for ayce sushi. I'd come back here again when I'm in Vegas.

Oyshi Sushi is one of my all time favorite sushi bars in Las Vegas. I rate restaurants based on food, service, and atmosphere, making the highest possible score a 30. Oyshi gets a 25/30 thus the 4 star rating. If I could rate the food higher, I would, because it's truly what I love Oyshi for! 

If you'd like to see my full review, and get a better idea of what Oyshi and its food is like, click below! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p24_mwKZvIg

Driving down Rainbow with my dad and sister after some very exhausting furniture shopping, we decided to pick up sushi for dinner. There are several sushi restaurants along the way, so we pulled over to the first one we saw: Oyshi Sushi. 

The restaurant is very cute, decked out in the typical Japanese style (fountains, folding screens) with a modern feel. It could serve well as a date spot or a family dinner outing, based on the groups of people I spotted. While we waited for our take-out order, the host offered us beverages, which was a very nice touch.

I tend to judge restaurants based on how vegetarian- and vegan-friendly they are, and this place definitely passed. There are at least 10 or 12 vegetarian rolls to choose from. I ordered the asparagus and avocado roll, vegetable tempura and miso soup. All of them were very good. The sushi in particular was well-made and tasty, which was surprising considering that this restaurant advertises its All You Can Eat special. 

The prices are good, the food is better. We'll be back!

Came here for lunch while I waited for my nail appointment next door. Amazing! Such a great serving size for a lunch special. I wasn't aware of this, as I ordered an extra roll. 

Chicken teriyaki lunch
Sizzling chicken teriyaki
California roll
Tempura
Soup
Salad 

And my extra 
Eel avocado roll. 

Yes, I boxed it up to go! 

Tempura is great.... Very lightly breaded. 

Staff is obviously skilled in teamwork and costumer service. It wasn't just one person tending to me, they worked as a team. 
I will definitely be back!!!!

Always great food. The dining area can get a little noisy when they are busy. They have private areas for big groups. The waiting area up front is limited and uncomfortable little stumps are all you have options to sit on. The bathrooms are routinely unkept and slightly dirty. Great all you can eat deals.
Great variety, great price, atmosphere. Best Screaming O I've tried at an AYCE place. Way better service and fish than the Sahara location

I ordered take out so I can't talk much about the actual restaurant.  

The food was ready on time and was pretty good.  They gave me everything I needed for my meal which is always a bonus for take out.  

I live nearby so I will probably be back.  

Food was good, prices were average.

Got finish our meal... Sushi was superb, service was good but not great... The sushi was good and rice to sushi ratio was good, not too much rice to fill you up.. A lot of baked rolls... Good for kids...lots of options... Overall was one of the better AYCE sushi places in Vegas

This WAS my favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas. The size of the AYCE menu was great for the sushi lover (me) and the non-sushi lover (my wife). The service was always good and the creativity and execution of the rolls was awesome. Went last night with two of my guy friends. I owed one sushi for losing a bet and the other was tagging along. We ordered a few appetizers, some nigiri (12 pieces total between the three of us), and 4 rolls. It took about 20 minutes to get our food. When it came out it was not as good. I got a piece of salmon that had what I assume was cartilage that was like chewing on leather. I've never had that happen with sushi before. Obviously, sushi by nature is somewhat chewy, but this was inedible. We ordered a few more rolls and it took forvever for it to come out. The avocados on the caterpillar roll were browning. The waitress rarely came to check on us. Not what I had come to expect from this place, but from what I hear this is the status quo now. Will no longer make the drive out and instead go to I Love Sushi or Sushi Mon.

This is some seriously good sushi! And they are super quick!!! 
The heart attack roll is a favorite! 
The AYCE is soooo worth it!

Good sushi, greater service, perfect for groups. 

Walked in with a group of 11 friends and we were seated in a private room. It was perfect for our group and very relaxing. We all had AYCE.

Food came out faster than I expected, and not all at once. Service here gets an A+. 

For  AYCE, sushi is very much up to par. It's not the best, but you definitely appreciate the taste. The best rolls were: Lobster flare, tiger roll, spider roll, and monster roll. Uni is good but you can only get 1 order.  Also, we saw that they ran out of ingredients or particular sushi (it's never fun to pay for AYCE only to find out the items you want had run out). 

Still - great place. 

Clean bathroom, so clean kitchen!

This place is a disappointment it used to be good but the service has gone way down. Got there at 3:30pm with my other half was gonna go sit at the bar since it wasnt that packed maybe like 3-4 people sitting then one of the servers stopped us this short asian server and said it will be a few minutes because they only had 3 servers. There was 7 tables occupied and 3 people at the bar and 1 large party in the back, i mean i guess they are rookies and couldn't handle a party of 2. so we waited. 3:44 rolls around and decided to ask again then he said that he's waiting for the 4pm servers to show up! Wtf? U coulda told us that in the beginning or at least got us sat with glasses of water. So we left and NEVER GOING BACK THERE AGAIN. HORRIBLE SERVICE!

The pro's fun ambiance, friendly staff, and quick service.

That being said the sushi here was lacking. We ordered the tuna poki, garlic albacore, salmon sashimi, and the screaming orgasm. The poki was mediocre but not bad. The salmon was also okay but once again not the best. The screaming orgasm was way over sauced in a creamy mayo sauce. I couldn't even taste the fish, although I do have to say they cut the tuna well. The worst was the albacore. It was bright red and tasted mushy and off. Needless to say we didn't finish it. I have a feeling if I want to find good sushi in this city I'm going to have to head to China Town.

Being from hawaii we have ALOT of great sushi restaurants, but i must say after living here for a little over a month and eating at a few different sushi places this by far is at the top of my list. I get the all you can eat because i can put down some sushi haha. The sushi here is sooooo good! The high roller, the different types of spicey tuna rolls, beef wrapped asparagus. So much variety and the service and staff is super quick and super friendly.  Then comes the desert, the deserts are awesome from green tea ice cream, to the mochi ice cream and some kind of berry ice cream cup, totally delicious.

The restaurant is easy to find and theres alot of free parking. You can also order individual rolls but i do suggest just doing the all you can eat buffet if you want to try a variety of the tasty items on the menu. They do serve alcohol as well and what better way to enjoy sushi then with some sake bombs and great friends! Definitely a place im bringing my friends from hawaii when they come to visit.

yum.

it's gooood here. hubby likes this place..

cool setting.. it's very chill..
they could put a halt on the continuous rave music. lol..

but it's cool.. whatever.

it's a good place.  

all you can eat sushi for 21 bucks! 
definitely keep the rolls on a minimum because it's easy to lose control in this setting. haha..
they have a lot of other things besides sushi..
must haves:
ahi poke
seaweed salad
surf & turf
garlic tuna
calamari
veggie & shrimp tempura..
??? miso. haha

all the rolls start to look the same eventually.. 
just put together differently!

I used to love this place but the customer service sucks! We waited forever for our food and it wasn't even busy. I tried to give them a chance... Four chances infact and the service sucked every time. I will never recommend this place to anyone. I'm never coming back here.

I used to come here all the time with friends .. The last two times I was in they tried to charge me AYCE for my TWO YEAR OLD! Seriously?! She eats a few pieces of edemame and maybe a piece or two of sushi.. The sushi has always been ok.. Not bad for the price..

Just came here tonight. Our server, Odi, is awesome. We got AYCE, and she recommended a lot of great stuff to us. She also comes back to explain the dishes to us after somebody else serves it; we liked that. Just me and my boyfriend. With green tea and AYCE, bill came up to $58, without the tip. 

We had:
POKE SALAD - 3/5 - Maybe I should've eaten the fish with the rest of the salad because I ate all the fish first. My bad! Fish was so fresh. 
SEAWEED SALAD - 4/5 - Pretty good. 
OYSTERS - 3.5/5 - Pretty good. 
TIGER ROLL - 4/5 - I liked this one, but my boyfriend said it's just alright. 
MONSTER ROLL - 4.5/5 - We both liked this one. 
SHRIMP SKEWERS - 5/5 - Great. I like the sauce, and the shrimp is delish!
ASPARAGUS - 2.75/5 - My boyfriend said he didn't like meat wrapped around it. Ironically, that's the only thing I liked about it. 
SURF AND TURF SIZZLING PLATE - 3.75/5 - I like the shrimp, but the beef was just alright. 
UNI - 4.5/5 - First time having Uni. It was delicious! We would've ordered more if we weren't getting full already. 
LOVE AFFAIR ROLL - 4.75/5 - We both loved this one. But my boyfriend later complained it was sweet, which I completely didn't understand because I didn't think it was sweet. 
GREEN TIRAMISU - 5/5 - I like that it's not too sweet. It's perfect ending to your meal. It melts in your mouth. We love this one. 
CREME BRLE - 5/5 - We also love this one. The server said they got reviewed as having the best creme brle in the city. It was really good. The glaze is delish, but it's also delish without the glaze. 

We'll be back!!!!

My husband and I ate here for lunch and got their all you can eat option. There is a nice variety of sushi rolls, and various appetizers and side dish options to choose from. The atmosphere is upscale and pleasant. Our server was nice and brought our food out quickly. Everything we ordered was delicious. Would definitely recommend this restaurant for all you can eat sushi.

It saddens me to write this review because I really used to like Oyshi. We were so excited when they first opened, as there weren't any sushi restaurants nearby. We came here often and really enjoyed it. As time went on, we noticed changes in staff and service suffered. They also got busier, thus orders were taking way too long. 

The food has always remained pretty good (in my opinion). But good food doesn't make up for bad service or a bad experience.

The good news is, they have another location on Sahara, which is farther away from me, but less busy and usually has better service.

Oyshi definitely has one of the most expansive AYCE selections in Vegas. Lots of appetizers are also included, my favorite being the Surf and Turf. The fish is always very fresh, and their special rolls are inventive and delicious! There are a few reviews that specifically mention the Monster Roll. I like it, but I find it very difficult to eat due to the size. My favorites are the Sunrise Roll and the Hawaiian Roll. 

I would avoid coming here during the lunch or dinner rush unless you're sitting at the counter, though...service tends to get really, really slow when they're busy and sometimes items from my order are forgotten. They do get very busy, so just keep that in mind. 

Oyshi is by far the best sushi restaurant on the southwest side, and despite some slow table service during their busiest hours and some sloppy sushi-making when they are extremely busy during weekend dinners, I will definitely continue to frequent it when I'm in the mood for sushi.

Oh, and make sure to save room for dessert: the Green Tea Tiramisu is amazing!

Variety versus Service - this is my headliner for this place.

The menu is excellent, and by that I mean I have many choices, in fact too many that on my second visit here, I think i have only tried an eight of their items. Quality and freshness of their seafood are outstanding, and I've had them on roll, sushi, and sashimi.

The stand-outs are: Miso soup, Ahi Poke, Shrimp tempura, Calamari, Surf and Turf, Eel and Avocado, Creme Brulee.... food is four stars hands down.

Now, the service is not the most accommodating, I'm afraid to say. Some cons on my last visit: our waiter forgot our three orders of Calamari and had to be reminded, as we waited for a good twenty minutes, grave sin on customer service definitely. For the pros, we were greeted and seated very quickly and our drinks were refilled readily and I appreciated the fact that our waiter apologized for making us wait on our calamaris. In the end, I would give them three stars and believe that they could do better by following up with an order.

I'm going to preface this by saying I'm not a fan of sushi, but I went with a group of friends who are. Luckily, Oyshi has a lot of options that aren't sushi, with large selections of sizzling plates and teriyaki and the like. I don't even know what I got; some kind of chicken skewer and beef-wrapped asparagus from the entree menu. Both were pretty tasty, though I wish there was more beef on the asparagus. Most everyone else I was with got the AYCE sushi and seemed to love every dish that came out. The place had a trendy vibe, with an eclectic mix of top 40 music playing and everything was plated beautifully. The service was amazing, the prices were really good, and it wound up feeling like a really special occasion, when all was said and done. I definitely recommend Oyshi!

If it was possible to give no stars, Oyshi would be the one. I thought I would give this place a second try being it has a few years since I first went. The host quoted a 30 minute wait, but we got sat at a table pretty quickly. I had asked our server, Ploi, if they do half rolls and she did say that I would either have be at the bar or eating AYCE, which I did mention my girlfriend and myself were both doing AYCE and I also let her know my girlfriend is allergic to avocado. Our first order consisted of a few appetizers but the wait was ridiculous, 15 minutes had passed and nothing came by while this was happening a party of 4 was just sat next to us and they got their food in less than 5 minutes. Ploi walked by and asked if we wanted to order any more I was getting impatient so I decided to order some rolls and asked if I can get half rolls, she mentioned that I would have be sat at the bar and have AYCE which disregarded the statement she made when I first asked about half rolls. Which is stupid why only have half rolls at the bar. Anyways I put in my orders and those came out pretty quick they messed up a couple of the salmon nigiri I had ordered 3 orders but they only gave us 2. After about 40 minutes our appetizers finally came but we ordered 3 orders of shrimp tempura and they only gave us 1 order and we noticed that the kitchen was coming out with plate fulls of shrimp tempura to every other table besides ours, we had to keep reminding our food runners that we ordered more than what we received. Another thing noted was a food runner gave us a rainbow roll that we did not order which had avocado, and my girlfriend is highly allergic to avocado so I dont know why they didn't make sure it was going to the right table. More time passed we made a few more orders of rolls and appetizers but those took another 30 minutes and the tables next to us keep getting their food right away. I'm sorry but perception wise that's not okay. I was still hungry but I did not want to wait another 30 minutes for my orders to come. I will not be returning to Oyshi. I've been to sushi places with very how volume in chinatown; they were more efficient running food and their servers have a better sense of urgency. I will not be returning to Oyshi.

A friend, and LV resident, brought a group of us here.  We were blown away the 1st time--$25 AYCE Sushi?!?!  (everything on the menu except sashimi).  Food and service was great that time.

But on the 2nd visit, there was a longer wait, prices had gone up and quality went down.  We all got horrible stomach aches and dehydration for hours after.  It's a great deal, but you'll pay the price.

We were very disappointed with our first visit to this restaurant. We waited nearly 25 minutes to be seated when there were open tables scattered throughout the place. Wine was served in tiny glasses, and beer served with warm ones. Half of or orders were executed improperly. The temperature in the restaurant was too warm and our table too small for our party. Our server checked his watch several times while taking our various orders. An awful experience.
Great "all-you-can-eat" deal! Food is very good with friendly staff. Highly recommend!

For $21 (lunch) or $26 (dinner) you can indulge in all you can eat sushi and sides. The difference between lunch and dinner is that lunch excludes oysters and something else they list on the front of the menu. Aside from that, you can indulge in any roll or hot item. Sashimi's off limits. 

Keep in mind that the rolls, regular priced, run for about $13 each so you might as well pay the $26 the ayce option and sample as much as you feel like... unless you're one of those freaks that can eat ONE roll and be satisfied... 

The catch to the rolls was as I suspected- tons of rice. One roll was so loaded that I felt my body refusing to chew any more of it. The sushi was another story- the amount of rice was fair. Oh, and sidenote, you're charged regular price for anything you remove or fail to consume the rice from. 

It seems that the best way to fill up without tapping out too early is to focus on the hot items and sushi- fill up on surf and turf, calamari, and ahi poke salad and pick maybe one or two rolls that sound too good to deny yourself of them. Or, you could be me and go roll crazy and have to fight yourself to chew. 

There are very tempting dessert options, of which you're limited to one (sad!) Bring friends and share all four. The mochi (mango or raspberry) was tiny, but I can imagine it was a refreshing treat. I had the creme brulee and my friend had the green tiramisu. Both were absolutely wonderful. The green tiramisu was a first for me and it was so exciting to eat. Creamy, yet subtle, yet sweet. 

The only qualm I have with my experience was that we were there on a day when the sushi kitchen was hopelessly backed up. All of our hot food came out quickly, but the sushi took what felt like forever to appear. It became an issue for friends who didn't order hot food and waited well over an hour to eat anything. 

Luckily the two-hour ordering limit was not applied to us or else this would be a fishy deal!

If it wasn't for a stubborn friend, we would have gotten here earlier and avoided a "long" wait.  This friend said take the 95, take the 95, blah blah blah.  Even after the waiter said take the 215, my friend INSISTED on taking the 95.  The waiter probably said: "whatever, dude, get lost and then wait longer and have your friends kick your ass before you eat our delicious buffet".  After another friend looked Oyshi Sushi himself, we found out that we should take the 215 and did so after I got all frustrated driving in the 15 fwy traffic.

In any case, after waiting and getting seated at our table, we went straight to ordering our all-you-can-eat, which includes 2 uni (sea urchin) pieces, 2 amaebi (raw, sweet shrimp) pieces & 4 raw oysters.  Yep, there's a limit on those but you must understand that there aren't that many other places that would even give you these premium sushi pieces.  Just a note on the uni - slightly less fresh than I've had before.  In any case, you get these in addition to their fresh & delicious sushi.  Their salmon, yellowtail, albacore, halibut sushis are great, plus they don't give you as much rice in their sushi as other places.  Their rib-eye teriyaki is also an excellent dish to have.  Their tempura is also very good.  As for the dessert, we all had the strawberry mochi ice cream, which was very good.  All for $25 per person.  Not bad at all.

I only have to mention a couple of cons: there is a 1 dessert limit for each person.  However, you can have all the ice cream you want since this is not considered one of the dessert items.  Plus, I find it just strange that the place is so huge and yet they waste so much space & put tiny little tables in the center when you can get bigger tables there to accommodate more people.  Last con... service.  A bit slow.  It was a really busy night, but I'm still surprised that they took more than 15 mins to take out raw food.  There was a 2-hr limit, but I don't think they pushed this limit all too much.

There's no other food out there that I can say that I could every single day.  With as much sushi choices as there are, who can ever get tired of eating it?! Seriously. When I first discovered this place, I was so enamored by their flavor and service, that I told every single person looking for a good place to eat, local or tourist, that they HAVE to go to Oyshi Sushi and get AYCE!

I'm a big fan of nigiri and I highly recommend their nigiri because the ratio of fish to rice is 80-20. The fish they use is very fresh and they use a huge slice! OMG! My top list of nigiri: Cajun albacore, salmon, and eel! Have to have it every time.  Also highly recommended: Love Affair, Salmon Lover, Sunrise, and Red Dragon.  Their appetizers are awesome as well, but the ones that stick out the most that some sushi bars don't have are: Surf & Turf, Potato Croquette, grilled beef asparagus, and the Unagi (eel) bowl! Mmmmm!

They also do dinner reservations if you have a large party coming. They have VIP rooms that can accommodate large parties if you call ahead.  I've sat in their VIP rooms and their chairs are extra comfortable. The dining area near the entrance has a huge mural that gives this place it's feel and vibe. If you speak to the sushi chefs, they're pretty funny too! And if you're cool with waiting a little bit to be seated, get your Oyshi on!

I have been here about a dozen times and I will probably return. I really like the quality of their sushi and the extensive selection of appetizers. The quality of service, however, leaves MUCH to be desired. It takes, on average, about 30 minutes for the sushi to get to your table from the time you order it. It totally ruins the flow of the dinner. Take today, for example. The server came to our table 30 minutes after taking our order with two dishes in her hands and asked, "Did you order the Dynamite Roll and the Lobster Fair?" To which I replied, "I don't remember. It was so long ago, but I'll take whatever you're willing to give me." Good sushi. Nice staff. Inefficient business.

This place never lets us down in quality, the sushi always tastes amazing, even the baked dishes are worth the trip. This last time we went we tried the AYCE, it's worth the money if you are hungry enough!

Dislike!!!! I don't even know why I even bother coming to oyshi's anymore. I gave them so many chances & I swear this is the last straw. I think I have given it so many chances because it's so close by my house. 

Oyshi problem is waiting too damn Long for  our order.  we get there at 1:45pm, didn't order til about 2pm. our food order came at 2:40pm. talk about annoying & getting super impatient. I feel like the waiters talk so much more with co workers that they don't even care that there are so many hungry people there. & to top it off they never ask for drink refills. never once I got my cup of coke refilled. ridiculous I tell you. I usually can stuff myself with a good amount of sushi, but buy waiting & waiting, my hunger just went away. 

sushi wise, it's alright!! it's not the greatest fish I've tasted. it could be better . only thing good I have to say about oyshi is there ice cream parfait & creme brle for dessert. 

I will never go back again. unless my dinner gets paid for!!! otherwise it's just another disappointment.

So disappointed! 
Went to this place for lunch nd felt so uncomfortable. I asked to be seated at the bar bc I was alone nd pregnant, so I thought it was good to see how they handle the food beside I expected it to be fun nd fast. I did all u can eat. Waited 30min for my app: gyoza. The chefs never said hi or even looked at my direction with care or happiness. "I have been always greeted at a bar/sushi bar", it is the least they can do. One of the chef made a silly comment as soon as I arrived at the bar, after that I knew I was at the wrong place. From 4 different kind of rolls I would only came back for 1 (maniac roll) it was the only one spice with no sweet sauce or fake crabmeat. Everything else was just blah blah blah. The service was polite but slow nd confused. I never had a refill on my water. Their (management/sushi chef) seems like to kiss the good looking/well dressed ppl ass. Everyone else were mistreated including myself. This was the worse place I have ever been. I would never come back here once I won't put my best clothes just to someone treat me with respect. Besides for 1 single good roll??? Forget it. I would prefer to drive to 808 sushi that' is not fancy but better quality sushi and a way better service. . The first roll I had was the monster (every single piece of it fell apart when trying to eat it. every single roll were ugly and tasteless except for the super sweet sauce and super sweet crabmeat combination they put on everything.
My experience at this place lasted around 1 1/2hour bc it would take between 25-35 min for every order. Plus 20min for the check. In the end I can say: The only good thing about this place is that you can do half order... That's all.

This place is good if u want an easy all you can eat sushi restaurant. The quality of fish is of the all you can eat kind (not the best) but it's a nice layout and the have a big room in the back for large parties

After reading all the great reviews, I came here with high expectations. We got the "all you can eat" sushi. It took us about 30 minutes to receive each order. The waiter didn't bother to check on us unless he had food to deliver. And the Sushi was warm. I've had way better sushi at other places then what we we're served at Oyshi. And the oysters we're only 2 per customer. So don't expect all you can eat oysters. We stayed about an hour and 45 minutes at Oyshi. Half of the time we just sat there looking around for our waiter to come by and refill our drinks. The best thing on the menu we're the baked mussels.

This place is amazing whenever you go here and order all you can eat tell the waitress to order you her favorite they do amazing job and if you seat on the bar chef ED does amazing rolls that are not in the menu thank you chef ED for the mucho spicy roll !!

We went for a late lunch.  The place wasn't crowded yet the service was a bit slow.  We were seated at the sushi bar but the sushi chefs seem to engrossed with their work that we had to wait to catch their eye so we can put more orders in.  Good thing there was some kind of shift change and the newer chef at least asked us once if we wanted to order more.  

As for the food, we started off with nigiri sushi, then moved on with the specialty rolls.  I quickly realized that their fish wasn't 100% fresh when it was laying simple and bare as nigiri sushi.  However, they do concoct good sauces and compose interesting rolls (maybe to compensate for the lesser quality of the fish).

The weird thing I noticed when we ordered unagi... In all other sushi bars I've been to, unagi is broiled for a few minutes before making it into sushi to give it nice caramelization.  Here, they skip it, and while the unagi seems slightly warm, it was not crispy and the flavor was a bit muted (I think broiling intensifies the flavor).  I guess next time I will ask them to make it "extra crispy".

It seems the quality has dropped in service and sushi. One theory my friend has is that it just gets bad at peak times. Lunch and dinner time on the weekends and holidays. 
Understaffed maybe? 

Our ahi poke seemed less than Fresh. Our shrimp tempura seemed rushed and not fully fried. Sushi rolls took forrreevvver to come out. And it seems like the creme brle serving gets smaller each time we visit.

While I was visiting my cousin in Las Vegas, we decided to try Oyshi Sushi.  The atmosphere was nice, the presentations were creative, and  great variety of rolls as well as decent prices. They have an all you can eat sushi menu that is perfection!  The only downside for me is that they only used imitation crab meat instead of real crab meat.

I went there with my girlfriend and her brother for my girlfriends birthday last year. The place was pretty neat if you ask me. The restaurant was nice, plenty of open space with good music playing.

We went there for the "all you can eat" menu and we were not disappointed. There are only a few sections on the menu that were not included in the all you can eat price, but other than that the majority of the menu was free range. From appetizers to desserts, countless rolls and entrees this place really was a feast for the eyes and stomach.

But the only downside, there's only so much sushi you can eat before it just gets gross. After a few appetizers and 3 or 4 different rolls, we were ready to call it a night. From experiences at other sushi restaurants, this place was mediocre. The fish could have been fresher, but I'm guessing with the "All You Can Eat" staple on their menu, they get whatever fish they can and throw it in a roll.

This place was cool, but the long drive and mediocre cuisine left me wanting more from a sushi restaurant than just looks. I'd go back, I just wouldn't get the all you can eat offering again.

Well worth the price and delicious. We have been to this location several times. Never disappointed. We always go for AYCE. More than fairly priced. $23 for lunch $28 for dinner. EJ, our server was attentive and helpful along with the assisting staff. Great timing. 
My typical order: mussels, potato croquettes, vegetable tempura, oysters, sea urchin (uni), masago, the heart attack roll & creme brle. 
Yes, I come to eat! My boyfriend usually gets down on at least 4 rolls plus AYCE appetizers which tally up to far more than $28.
Usually hear hip-hop playing, which I like, so if you don't like the combo of AYCE & hip-hop, stay home.  [no one wants to hear you whine about the music selection] Just know you're missing out. They're open late for the night owls too. Check out their hours. We will continue to enjoy this place.

My boyfriend absolutely loves this place. He's not really into AYCE sushi places, but he LOVES this one. Me? Yup, I thought it was pretty good too. Love that they give you small portions, so that you can try more things, and you don't get stuck trying to finish something you don't like. ~$26 per person for AYCE dinner. This includes everything on the menu except sashimi. Some of our favs were the Hawaiian Ahi Poke, Nigiri, Tiger Roll, and for dessert, Green Tea Ice Cream. It's about a 10 minute drive off the strip. Great for large parties, but make reservations. We went on a Monday night, and though we were able to get seats right away at 5:45pm, the place was pretty busy by the time we left.  We'll definitely be back.

I've been a long time fan of Sushi Mon for quite some time now. Wanted to give another AYCE sushi spot a try. Pulled up Yelp and this was one of the places with good reviews. First time coming here, it felt weird, like i was 'cheating' on Sushi Mon. It's a completely different restaurant. Different atmosphere with the trance music playing in a dimly lit restaurant.

To my surprise, the sushi was excellent! The cuts were amazingly generous and good quality too. I had to try the rolls, which I normally don't and it was great too! Didn't have any complaints at all. 

We had the green tea tiramisu and it was really good, and I was already stuffed. So that says something about it. Only bad part is, you only get one order of dessert... dunno if that's a good thing or bad thing.

Some of my friends advised me to try this place! I came at 11:30 and by 12p.m. the place was packed!!! Service is great and fast, good is good and very affodable! I took lunch special for 13$(plate of sushi+ miso+salad) + egg rolls, all came out 18$. I liked not overslted miso soup and not greasy eggrolls, sushi rolls were perfect. Not fancy place, but cute, with Circus Du Solei posters :)

Compared to Oyshi Sushi in Sahara, this place is loser in taste.

We could not find any fresh fish and the appetizers are salty or poor looking. 

Only one that pleased us is ice cream as a dessert. 

I and my friend agreed not to come back again and not to recommend this place.

If you want to go AYCI sushi, rely on yelp review.

One hour wait. Okay this place has to be somewhat of a decent AYCE sushi. No. Just honestly go next door to Soyo and save your $27 bucks. 

We finally sat down and didn't see the waitress again for another 15 minutes. We ordered a couple random rolls, a bunch of sushi, and appetizers. 

So the rolls we're just rolls. I'm not really a fan for rolls. The food runner finally gave us sushi and didn't even know what was what. 

Food runner: Heres your octopus...
Me: Thats not octopus. 
Food runner: oh sorry, red snapper. 
Me: That's not red snapper. 
Food runner: Ohh.... *walks away... 

It was actually surf clam. Learn your sea creatures if your going to work at a sushi place! 

The sushi was not fresh. All of them were small and slightly fishy. The uni was literally orange brown and tasted so weird I couldn't eat it. 

I think then only thing I enjoyed was the miso soup. 

Service needs to be a lot better too. I know now the only reason why we waited a hour was because they took forever to clean the tables around us!

The all you can eat meal is by far my favorite in town, and there are a plethora of non seafood items included that appease many different tastes. Service is almost always swift and affable. 
They should consider improving their wait time estimates for accuracy so guests can make informed decisions, expand for surplus business, or allow small parties to makes reservations. I waited over 1.5 hours after being quoted 45 min on a Friday evening, as I watched many parties that arrived after me get seated first.
This only happened twice out of many visits, so it is a forgivable offense.

Thanks Yelpers!  This place is great.  Nice clean interior (they actually have a VIP room, guess that's a normal thing in Vegas to have everywhere though, eh?), friendly staff and an amazing deal for all-you-can-eat (AYCE) sushi.  

They do AYCE where you actually just order whatever you want off the regular menu and they make and deliver it to you.  My friends Andrea, Annie and James all chowed and put away an impressive amount of sushi.  Since Annie and Andrea are bodybuilders they usually can't get full but we were all about to burst as we waddled out of Oyshi.

The nigiri are pretty decently sized and the fish is quite good.  As far as AYCE, it's the best fish I've had.  They have a ton of crazy rolls and while I am not usually a roll guy for AYCE it's fun to try out so many options.

We went for lunch and it was $21 which we definitely got our money's worth.  It's also nice to get away from the Strip as we are here covering a bodybuilding show and the pace is less flashy and frenetic which is great.

Definitely make it out to Oyshi!

Originally this place could not figure out a system to seat guests in the correct order of arrival and it would drive me crazy. As of lately, this problem seems to be fixed. 

Their appetizer menu is extensive and the main reason why we have AYCE. Their rolls are nothing special and their is limitation on dessert, but still not a bad deal. The restaurant is spacious and even when full, still feels fine.

Probably my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant on the face of this planet,

and I don't even live in Las Vegas.

It's a really fun place to take your friends.. I introduced a group of my gal pals to Oyshi last December when we all came to town for my 21st birthday, and now they won't stop asking me when we'll be coming back!

(+ For sure, you'll need to try to Love Fair or Lobster Fair, those are our favorite rolls.)

Went here yesterday and it was pretty good. The quality of the sushi was good but not the best. The only complain is that they put a lot of rice in their sushi pieces. I think they do that so you fill up more and not over order on their all you can eat. The restaurant is nice and clean.  Good vibes.
I've had sushi from Japan and this is by far no where near the real deal. Blue fin is some what closer to what you could expect in a sushi restaurant in Japan.
You get a lot but that isn't always a good thing.

5 stars for the interior decorations.  This place is very upscale and the ambiance is nice, great vibe for a date night.

2 stars for fish quality.  I ordered a few different nigiri: salmon, halibut, red snapper, yellowtail, and scallops.

First of all, the fish to rice ratio was 1:1.5.  I am not sure how most people like their sushi, but I tend to I like my sushi a little more meaty and less rice-y.  Everyone has their own opinion on this, which I understand.  The salmon was alright, but I didn't get the "melt-in-your-mouth" sensation.  I'm not sure if I came on an "off" night, or if the fish just wasn't fresh this time.

I guess I expected more for a nice-looking restaurant, but I will definitely try it again next time I am in the area.

I really enjoyed this place.  Honestly, this is either my new favorite sushi place or close to it.  I ate so much and still wanted more!  The rolls were tasty and never before have I seen so many appetizers that were included with the AYCE option!  The restaurant is inviting, the food is delicious, the options are almost endless, the service is quality, and as an added bonus, there were a ton of good looking women who dined here while I was present (nothing to do with the restaurant but definitely a plus).  As soon as I left I wanted to go back.  I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it wasn't perfect.  Some of the food was just ok and not amazing like the rest.  Items such as the egg rolls, surf and turf plate, and shrimp and asparagus skewers were just alright, nothing to write home about.  That being said, I would instantly come back here.
Amazing food, amazing service, all you can eat for about $30, clean and awesome restaurant aesthetics, and private rooms. Will definitely be going back regularly.

Got EXTREMELY HORRIBLE food poisoning here as well did my bf. The service was nothing great especially seeings how when we told our waitress about the roll tasting funny she didn't even notify a manager. I will NEVER eat here again as long as I live!! After my experience I had multiple friends tell me the same thing had happened to them as well as the people in their parties!!! Obviously food is being kept wrong at this place for multiple people to have food poisoning!! I never have written a yelp review but this experience has pushed me beyond belief with the way It was handled. When I called to tell them something was wrong they might want to not serve that roll and its ingredients I was told a manager would call me back I then called the next night and said I wanted my money back I was heated from no manager contacting me which by the way the money was taken out of my account and not refunded. The girl on the phone went back and forth with the manager it pisses me off you're a manager GET ON THE PHONE AND HANDLE THE SITUATION!!!!! I shouldn't have to demand to speak to a manger!! Food poisoning isn't to be taken lightly and I absolutely feel like they don't care. Please be careful eating here it's not worth getting sick! I only put ONE star because you clearly can't post a review unless you give at least one star.

This place has definitely won it's spot as a routinely vegas visit along with earl sandwiches! 

definitely one of the best ayce sushi spots i've ever encountered! Its a bit off the vegas strip about 15 mins but it's well worth it! The fish are so fresh and melts in your mouth like buttttttttter! Rice to fish ratio is 1:2...very minimal rice which is pretty rare and unheard of from any ayce sushi joints.

cant wait for my next vegas trip =)

I'm obsessed with this place. So many good options to pick from. I can eat edamame all day. You also get dessert afterwards. Parking is good. Price is decent for all the sushi you can get. I always look forward to coming here. I anticipate it all day. My favorite is the spider hand rolls without crab meat. The staff has always been friendly. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

I would've given this place 5 stars, had I reviewed it the first time I ate there. I don't quite remember what I had the first time coming into this restaurant, but I do remember having their blueberry parfait, and that alone deserved 5 stars! My second visit to Oyshi was for dinner, and I ordered the Ahi poki salad, the Love Affair sushi roll, and a parfait of course! The salad and the sushi roll were excellent, the best part was probably the Love Affair sushi roll.. probably the best roll I had in a while, from what I remember, it had lobster and crab meat, it was awesome! So here it goes, if so excellent, why the 4 stars you ask.. 

Well.. the parfait. It was so much bigger and tastier the first time around.. from what I recall, it was served in a taller glass the last time, more ice cream and more toppings..
