This time, it was skimped down to a smaller glass, and yes, smaller glass means smaller parfait. It also lacked the toppings I once remembered it had. Therefore, I conclude this review by saying Oyshi is an awesome restaurant, but they need to overcome this economic slump by serving MORE not less! =)

Came here last week with a friend and came to the bar wed night. Chef Ed was the one serving us food. He was entertianing us and gave a bunch of his specials. It was soo good, you have to try the salmon belly he prepares, its the BOMB!! Every time we come here he always surprises me and my friends. Recommend Chef Ed!!!

Food is good. Service is the reason I probably won't return. I'll admit the food is awesome and the selection is extensive when you order ayce. I gave this place three strikes before I decided I won't come here again. The first time I came with a group of 4 friends. Waitresses were always slow to come to our table to order more sushi leaving us with nothing to eat multiple times. At the end of the day two of us got food poisoning the next day. Second time I came with my girlfriend. Again, waitresses don't check up on our table enough. Third time I came with a group of 8 friends. We waited over 30 minutes for our server to take our second order for ayce. We complained to the manager about our server and it seemed like he didn't care or address our concern. When our server did come we already lost our appetite and just wanted to leave. The food is amazing but the service needs an overhaul.

I'll be return every once in awhile but, previous experiences has kept Oyshi from being my #1 AYCE sushi.
Best sushi in all of Las Vegas. I highly recommend sitting at the bar for AYCE because the service is better. We come come every other week

For the past several trips to Vegas, Oyshi has been our first stop we make before heading in to strip to check in to our hotel. We always order the all you can eat sushi. Our usual dishes are the raw Oysters, Ikura, Uni, Ono, Scallop, Yellowtail, Salmon, Softshell Crab... But they ran out if uni the last time we were there, so if you want uni, go there early if you can.

Everything is always fresh and service is great, even on a busy night! There could be a wait on the weekends, but it's totally worth the wait! Some say that the AYCE price is a little high, but if you could see how much we eat, you can say that we definitely ate more than our money's worth!!!

This is by far my favorite sushi spot in Vegas! I've been coming here for over 9 years and it never disappoints. Tonight we had an awesome server (EJ) and I thought he deserved a special Yelp shout out. If you want quality sushi and great service Oyshi is your spot!

Horrible server messing up our orders.. its AYCE lunch and good thing we were not in a hurry.  It took 25 mins to get one order of roll. We were the first ones there and the last one to get our order. It took 46 mins to get an order of sashimi. Some of our orders didnt come out. I dont think I will go back again. There's a lot more places to go for Sushi. The food wasnt that good anyway.
All I gotta say CHI is the shiz net when it comes to his creations and sushi.  AYCE sushi is so bomb there.  Best appetizers in town, went to plenty of sushi joints, by far oyishi our #1 spot.
Love the surf and turf her. Call ahead for a table cause its always packed.

More like three and a half, but I'll be nice.
Got here on a Friday night, no reservation. It was super busy, we waited about 25 minutes. We didn't mind the wait, we were pretty excited to try somewhere new. Our waiter immediately took our drink orders, and then asked if we'd like to order. All three of us got all you can eat, so we could try a bunch of stuff together. We got edemame, chicken yakitori, muscles, raw oysters, gyoza, yellowtail nigiri, miso soup, and a few rolls. The raw oysters were outstanding. Soooo fresh and good! The chicken was tasty, the muscles were fresh and not too much sauce,  the edemame was steamed perfectly. The nigiri was a little different, but tasted okay. The tiger roll and the screaming roll were only okay. An OVERLOAD of rice, it was almost astonishing. Like holy shit, that's a lot of rice, bro. The hawiaan and whatever rolls my friend got were pretty tasty. Overall, it's worth it just for the appetizers. I'll come back to try different rolls

By the way, when my friend got a refill on her sprite, he came back and she said that the syrup was all out, it just tasted like soda water. He was confused. Did she want another one? Uhm. Yeah. So he went into the kitchen, literally stood there for a few seconds, and came back and gave her the SAME glass. Oh boy. 
Other than that weird mishap, service was pretty good.
The All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi and appetizers is a great deal, if you're hungry and you don't want sashimi (which isn't included).  Food is good.

Eh... that's how I feel about this place.

I will defo give this place a 4.5 star on the decor, the styling of their menu and placemats. BUT a 2 star on their food. 

When I get sushi, I rarely get anything baked. Which makes sense if you're doing AYCE. You don't want to get filled up quick. I had the AYCE but I was craving for nigiris. Got my usual salmon, tuna, albacore, yellow tail and cajun albacore. OMG, I tried picking up the nigiri, and rice literally just fell out. and the fish was too thick and kinda rubbery. Yuck.

Service was alright, the waiter checked on us couple times like how they should. I was told that their service was the worst, but in this case, it's the fish. 

I would come back, actually I wouldn't. Wait, I would if I got appetizers only not nigiris.

Food is not fresh.....my family and I got food poisoning after our 11/20/11,visited. We went in around 9:45pm  not many customer besides few people sitting at the sushi bar. employees were talking and hanging out by the enterance. Took them 20 mins to bring water and coke, by the way, never get the refill within 1 1/2 hour stayed. The worst dishes was the one I ordered "gyo don" it supposed to come with really thin and tender beef with stir fried onion and half cooked sukiyaki soup based eggs. But disapointedly I recieved a mexivan style beef bawl. lots of green paper and sunny side up egg. Nothing like gyo don. 
Sushi was okay, until we got home, all 4 of us start feeling the stomach pain.went into quick care the next following day. 
One last thing to mntion is the lady waitress, she was really not professional. We asked her to clean up our dishes before the cakes come, she picked up 2 dishes then never come back. We have to ask anoyher waiter to clean up the rest of empty dishes. 
We live across st from thos restaurant, but we will nevrer come back again.

Ted, many of the girls in our group are in love with you. From your sweet smile to your jovial manner in serving a party of 15.

My friend had her birthday dinner here and we could not have asked for a better waiter than Ted. He was so attentive, happy, and energetic, especially with a mess of us indecisive girls and boys.

All you can eat sushi for $26! I ordered a la carte, but a majority of everyone did the AYCE. It is a great deal and usually, when you get such a good deal, you tend to sacrifice quality, but everything was really good. Fresh, amazing, whatever adjective you would like to use.

I really wish I could bring this place back home.

OYSHI ME!

P.S. My friend thought this place was near the strip, it was HELLA far away, so in case you plan to go, grab a lot of people and hop in a limo. It's the best way to do it.
I don't understand how busy this place is. We ordered 7 rolls and they all taste the same. Baked and fried ones taste really bad. I'm sorry

What a great meal!  You can opt for all you can eat for $26 or order a la carte.  $26 for all you can eat sushi is an amazing price!  The only thing you can't order is from the sashimi menu and your limited to 1 dessert item.  The menu is abundant and creative.  
We ordered... 
Appetizers
Oysters - so fresh and delicious!
Tuna Poke - mixed with seaweed salad and oh so good.
Sirloin steak teryaki - sizzling right off the hot plate, very tender.
Sushi rolls
Losbter Fair - scrumptious!
My Favorite - scallops, variety of fish, topped in eel sauce.
Yellowtail trio - fresh hamachi mixed with a ginger sauce.
Dessert
Green tea terimisu - to die for!  It's made with marscapone cheese, it's smooth consistency just melts in your mouth!

Food is good! Servers are slow and rode 
Looking at the table but never ask if everything is ok.

This place is amazing! The fish is fresh and the service is great. I came for lunch and ordered all you can eat. Normally when I go out to eat sushi the all you can eat has a very limited menu. At Oyshi, the entire menu is all you can eat with the exception of sashimi. All you can eat is only 21$ for lunch and I left with a very full belly. I will deffinetly come back with friends!

FOOD: 2/5
I wouldn't call myself a sushi extraordinaire, but I do think that I have been to quite a few sushi spots and have a holistic view of what I do and do not like. I think that this location's sushi just didn't hit the target. The baked sushi came out cold (will elaborate on this in the section below), and they were nearly always DRENCHED (not an over-exaggeration) in sauce. I did, however, rather enjoy the sashimi, but that is because it came out plain and simple. 

I ordered the following on my last visit: Kimono roll, Japanese Lasagna, Shrimp Tempura, Baked Tuna, and Tuna Sashimi. We didn't do AYCE because my stomach can't handle that much food. Anyway, the Kimono roll was pretty good--instead of nori, it was wrapped in soy rice paper, so I was digging the difference. However, when I picked it up a piece with my chopsticks, the whole thing fell apart. For $12 for five or six pieces, I was not impressed. I think this happened with nearly all of the rolls I ordered EXCEPT for the Shrimp Tempura roll. The Japanese Lasagna was drenched in sauce and topped with creamed cheese. It was cold and the flavor was too rich and too heavy. I couldn't even taste any of the other elements of it because it was overpowered by unagi sauce and cream cheese. The Baked Tuna came with poor presentation--already coming apart before any of us even attempted to grab a piece. It was cold and had too much unagi sauce. Like I said, the tuna sashimi was pretty good. Not as fresh as other places that I have been to, but it did the job. 

SERVICE: 2.5/5
I am not sure why it took so long to get my food. Each roll came out one at a time with nearly five minutes between each. By the time our last roll came, we didn't want to eat anymore. Additionally, people around us who ordered similar rolls (baked, fried, etc.) got their food very quickly. When the food came out it was room temperature or cold when it was supposed to be baked. Our whole dining experience lasted nearly 2 hours because of the delay. We were never apologized to; it nearly seemed like a norm for food to come out to the tables that slowly. I had to check on each (again--not an over-exaggeration) roll to see when and if they were coming out. I would like to say, though, the server did refill my water quite a few times. 

AMBIANCE: 3/5
The music was pretty loud in this place, which didn't really appeal to me. It kind of made me have an aversion to my meal and a bit of a headache. I think that is what they were going for though: a modern feel for younger folk. I appreciated the attempt. The decor was pretty nice though. I also enjoyed the wall designs. 

PRICE: 2.5/5
I have to say that I am not very happy to have spent $55 for sushi that I didn't quite enjoy. The food was rather high-priced for the quality of service and food offered. I would say that compared to their competition, Oyshi is priced rather high. I am all for paying a pretty penny for pretty sushi, but I wouldn't categorize this place's sushi as such.

LOCATION: 4/5
The location is easy to find. There is ample parking here, too.

Great sushi for the money!
Will recommend to a friend.
I am a fan, as the stars say ;)

Yay!

hands down. this is by far the best sushi place in all of vegas. i havent been to all, but  ive been to many sushi spots. ive explored what every sushi place i've been to has to offer as their signature rolls. but ive gotta say, Oyshi's all you can eat, is worthy of my twenty something dollars. reborn and raised on the turfs of this restaurant. speaking of,  surf & turf on a sizzling platter!? part of the all you can eat menu. come on. get real. they are. their "love affair" is part of my oyshi diet. its busy at night, you may have to wait. worth the wait. they even have 3 private rooms available to reserve if you're having a big group or a special occassion. good times every single visit. i have no complaints. if i had any complaints. its far from my house. but really worth the drive. it makes me appreciate them even more.

Celebrated a birthday here the other night.  The AYCE is a definite plus especially since we are all sushi lovers. We visit this place a lot since its close to our house. We had made a reservation since we were a large party, so we were sat right away even though there were people waiting outside.

Sushi was pretty good, no complaints. Definitely love the yellowtail with ponzi, garlic tuna and uni. Tried the tiger roll this trip and loved it. 

The service was the only pitfall. Like I said we have been here quite a few times and the service was never amongst the best but this night was especially unfortunate. The service was extremly slow, it took about 30 minutes to get our second round of sushi and we had to keep asking our runner/busser to find our server.  The server was super nice and polite but i think they were just understaffed and not prepared for how busy the restaurant was that night.

I absolutely love this place! Its delicious and the staff are not only sweet and kind they are very very attentive to anything you need!

I already went twice in a row last week and i cant wait for more! do the all you can eat sushi!

My favorite roll ever is the DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL with cucumber squeeze some lemons on top of it and it tastes even better~!! YUUM

You also MUST TRY my second favorite its a tad spicy but is so good...Lava Flow &
 as for plates the sizzling steak plate is delicious.

Came for lunch on a Saturday- they open AT 11:30, not one second before- we were shoo'ed back when we tried to have a seat at the bar 3 minutes beforehand. AYCE, but sitting at the sushi bar we were not allowed to order from the sushi chef, the waitress would take the order, then reach in front of us and hand the slip to the chef.  Sushi was okay, but I won't be back.  The waitress was condescending in attitude, not sure what they were going for-

So happy to write a review about this place. The All You Can Eat sushi is well worth it! A group of five ate 11 rolls and plenty of appetizers! We all had a great time trying new rolls. Our waiter Kevin was a great help when choosing from the extensive menu. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We'll definitely be back!
Great place to bring family or friends from out of town .. All you can eat appetizers as well as sushi ..!!

If you want to receive any of your rolls in under 20 minutes don't go here. Went on a Tuesday night and it took forever to get even some soup (13 minutes). I didn't know one of the rolls had mushrooms in it which I'm allergic to, and instead of being more considerate the waitress argued with me and said I should have read a different part of the menu where it have the description. I didn't know the roll was In the menu in two different places so I was a little upset. She ended up charging us for two all you can eats even though I only got miso soup because when I got the roll and took a bite I got sick. So I really paid 27$ for miso soup. She could have had the courtesy to charge him for his all you can eat and me for just my soup. 

Won't be coming here again. Rude server and roll took 20 minutes to get to me anyways.

I am a big fan of sushi.  We were apartment hunting and one of the leasing agents told us about Oyshi Sushi.  We were glad we did.  It was a very refreshing change from our normal haunting place here in Silverado Ranch.  Oyshi is very nice.  Most of their patrons are young adults and they have pop music in the background.  We really liked the ambiance of the restaurant.  The best part was the food, for an AYCE dinner, it is somewhat on the pricey side but we wanted to try their extensive sushis.  They have hand rolls, cut sushi, baked, deep fried, fusion, vegetarian, specialty, and sashimi (this isn't included in the AYCE price though).  You can also have some appetizers and various salads, rice bowls, and dessert with the AYCE price.  For the two of us with regular drinks, we spent $61 ($71 with tip), so as you can see, it can get pricey.  

Now, for the review of the food.  We ordered AYCE and we ate our fill of sushi.

My order:
1) Deep fried Philly - loved it!  It was cooked well and not dried up.  The sauce on it is enough that it doesn't require soy sauce to enjoy.
2) Rainbow Roll - so fresh and tasty.
3) Tiger Roll - it was so beautiful and enjoyed it immensely.
4)  Double Salmon - I enjoy salmon so this was a no brainer.

My partner:
1)  Supreme Vegetarian -  he liked it but it was wrapped in soy paper.  He liked the veggies that were rolled in the "sushi."
2)  Hawaiian Roll - this is a definite thing to order!
3)  California Roll - they were done well as they should be.  It is a staple in any sushi place.
4)  Japanese Lasagna - this one is baked.  He wasn't a fan of cooked sushi.

Then, the heavenly bites of dessert came.  My partner had the Strawberry Mochi and I had the Creme Brule.  I have to say, the Creme Brule was a taste of heaven.  I was so glad we got this for sure.

To end my LONGEST review(so far), this sushi place is definitely a go to place for us.  The ambiance was awesome, the food were tasty, and over all, its a definite place to try out.  Just be sure your wallet can afford the bill.

This place is amazing whenever you go here and order all you can eat tell the waitress to order you her favorite they do amazing job and if you seat on the bar chef ED does amazing rolls that are not in the menu thank you chef ED for the mucho spicy roll !!

Everything is so fresh here. One of our favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. The service is pretty good, sometimes you'll wait a bit to see your server during times. I would have done 5 stars but they don't offer any military discounts, so 4 stars is still good!

Say what?! AYCE for $26?! Yes sir it's worth your whole $26, or if you're going for lunch, it's only $21 but you don't get oysters and who doesn't love oysters?! They have a vast selection of sushi rolls, some of my favorites are the Oyshi Roll which is a baked roll with dynamite topping, spicy tuna crunch, and the atomic roll. But the one thing that is worth every penny is their super white tuna. Have you had super white tuna?! No?! Well, get your butt over here and try it! It melts in your mouth like butter, it's the champagne of fish.. Yes, ahh thinking about it just makes my mouth drool, they top it off with ponzu sauce and it couldn't get any better than that.

Their appetizer list is ongoing and you have so many choices, that's what I like about their AYCE, you have many options to choose from. The calamari is nice and crispy on the outside and a little chewy when you bite into it. The surf and turf is awesome and they just have new meats to pick from that come in a griddle plate (is that what it's called?) it comes steaming hot and on a bed of cabbage and onions YUMMMM! They have a good ahi poke bowl that comes with cucumber slices and seaweed salad underneath, amazing. I could go on, but you really just have to get your butt over there and try it for yourself! Oh yeah, did I mention the desserts? Oh, I haven't.. Well I love their vanilla parfait! They also have creme brle, green tea tiramisu, and green tea and vanilla ice cream. Oh goodness, I'm hungry.

OYSHI - I LOOOOOVEEEEE YOU.  HAHAHA.  No joke, the Love Affair roll = Delicious, Tiger Roll = super delicious..... nice selection of rolls and such ...   everytime I go there my server has been awesome...  all you can eat Sushi... sad that you cant have the Sashimi all you can eat... but still for the $26 all you can eat price point... I am by no means disappointed by it... if they wanted to throw some in though, I would welcome it with open arms....

Very nice place and nicely decorated.  Service is fantastic. They are on point and very accommodating.  I wish I could say the same about the sushi. We had the AYCE, and the rolls were just mediocre.  They need to improve on the rice and the quality of the fish on the nigiri was lets just say doesn't look fresh.  I would go here again, but for their lunch special.

Not as good as it used to be. But it's still so busy..! They always seem to run out of uni which is my favorite thing.

Limit one dessert with the AYCE. And my dessert of choice is the green tea tiramisu. Yum! Though the parfait is a close second.

The AYCE price is the same as most places. The items were good, but nothing too special. Service is kinda poor. Maybe because I am usually here with a larger party so we are usually in one of the private rooms. I must say though, the room on the left with the couches is nice, but not ideal for a dining area...

Not a bad sushi place food wise, but service could use improvement. But really nothing special about this place, I don't get why so many people love it here... And I AM a sushi LOVER... well.. a food lover in general. :)

This restaurant is always busy, so calling ahead will help with the long waits. They have a very large selection of sushi on the menu ranging from shashimi to baked rolls.  They have a wide variety of appetizers that come with the "All you can eat" menu.  If you like spicy rolls, go with the Nuclear Roll. It was by far my favorite of the night.  The staff was surprisingly on point with being attentive to as well, especially since it was a full house.

Las Vegas 
Robbie's place
High roller ! 
Dynamite appetizer
Rock and roll (tiff would love this)
No oyster appetizer- gross
Oysha roll is good but a 2nd dynamite would be better
Love affair is good but not amazing
Surf and turf appetizer is pretty good.
Asparagus and beef is good

Enormous amount of various combinations of every kind of roll. 

Lively atmosphere.

Friendly staff.

Fair prices with an AYCE choice.

Bar, lounge, and restaurant seating available.

What more could you ask for?

Oyshi used to be my favorite AYCE sushi spot.  They had a wide variety of quality rolls, great tasting food, consistent service, and a really nice atmosphere that made for a great spot to have pre-game Friday night dinner. 

Although the sushi is still pretty good, the service and management has gone off the deep end and because of this, I don't think I'll ever eat at Oyshi again.  There are too many quality sushi restaurants in Las Vegas to justify returning to Oyshi where the last few visits, all I seem to get are orders that never show up, drinks that never get filled, waiters that refuse to come to our table or our spot at the bar (even though it's obvious that you've seen me flag you down), and servers/staff that are increasingly bitter and unfriendly.  

This stuff matters. Oddly enough, it's also the stuff that is easiest to fix. When you've already got quality menu items, quality sushi chefs, and quality sushi rolls that people rave about - why are you letting your terrible servers and management ruin your restaurant?

If I'm sitting at the sushi bar and I'm trying to order more beer and sake, why are people refusing to help me out? If I want to give you my money in exchange for some-what overpriced alcohol, why does it take more than 20 minutes for someone to take my drink order and then another 20 to bring me a couple of beers and sake? This should never be an issue with a sushi restaurant.  Never. Sure, AYCE places get really busy and I totally understand that. But, if you can't handle the heat - hire more servers. 

I shouldn't have to wait more than 45 minutes for my order. And when my order does come out, half of it shouldn't be missing. It also shouldn't take you another 30 minutes to bring out the pieces missing from my order. And you shouldn't have an attitude with customers just because they are asking for the items they originally ordered that are missing because you either forgot to put the orders in or there was a mix up in the kitchen. I am never rude to waiters or management and this last experience at Oyshi was no exception. I was pleasant and more than patient and if I still can't get someone to so much as offer an apology for missing orders/missing drinks and for treating me like I was more of a burden than a customer bringing a lot of business to the establishment, then I will happily take my business elsewhere. 

Sorry, Oyshi, it was good while it lasted!

Oyshi Sushi place that I pass by few times and believe might have gone long time ago. Unfortunately nothing really stood out for me or remember wow factor so took longer time too come back. Nowadays in Vegas AYCE sushi is so competitive and dime dozen that it really hard too stand out unless really good. My opinion the sushi is good but not great or definitely no Wow factor for me. The menu has a nice diversity too it between the appetizers (oyster on the half shell by far my favorite), nigiri, and speciality rolls (i had some kind of spicy tuna roll; sorry forget the name but was really good)  too choose from sure find something like. Whenever I go AYCE more all about the nigiri style because feel that the true barometer of quality of the fish. I felt like compare too other places especially my top spot sushi house goyemon not in the same class. The irony was originally went too sushi hour goyemon but the wait was ridiculous. Me and Roy was hunger so decided too check out something new. Thankfully on this night Oyshi Sushi not packed went right in and sat down went sushi crazy!! 

The restaurant is lot more open then most AYCE so usually not lot of waiting too sit down. They do have private rooms for big parties. Not sure if charge extra but nice option too know if party of eight or more. The sushi bar is decent size with two too three sushi chefs going at time. Most part even on say that night half packed we were getting our sushi in timely manner. The server was great keep up on everything and even nice enough towards the end we ordered one too many speciality rolls (thanks Roy) she like no worries no forcing not going too charge us for waste! Think that was really cool! 

I like that the restaurant is open because you can have conversations without screaming with other person sitting next or across from you. Oyshi Sushi is place that come back too again but with so many other ones and not that high on my list. Not sure when next time will be but if in the area and out of options good choice.
Love their AYCE (All you can eat) menu. The wait may be long but well worth the wait!

Definitely one of the best sushi joints in Vegas. It's really far from my house, but when I happen to be in the mood to make the drive over the only thing I ever dislike is the bill. Not crazy expensive, just not the cheapest place in town. You get what you pay for in this town, it's worth what they charge on the occasions that I do go.
Used to be okay, not anymore. the amount of rice got so big, so I can't even order a lot of sushi anymore. The rice makes me full :(

This place is right next door to my house.  We came here when they first opened up and fell in love with it ever since.  Every dining experience has been excellent - the service is always friendly and attentive and food perfectly cooked/prepared.   We did a few ala cartes but most of the time it's always AYCE, both lunch and dinner.  Heck if they had breakfast I would do that too.  

Most sushi places have a few items that are exceptional and a few not so great, but everything here range from good to phenomenal.  

Let me talk a bit about their sashimi items.  I love sashimis and this place has some of the best sashimis i've ever eaten.  Their Seared Albacore with crispy onion in ginger sauce is oh so heavenly.  The only  problem is their sashimis are not included with the AYCE menu and that's understandable because the sashimis are pricier.  Another one is the Yellowtail sashimi with jalapeno and ponzu sauce.  OMG this melts in your mouth and it should be called screaming orgasm for your mouth!  amazing stuff!  How about this "Tuna sashimi with shaved daikon in a chef special sauce"? Everytime i finish this plate I want to lick the sauce off the plate but there's always people around me.  

Now for their rolls.  They make the typical rolls like Rainbow, Dragon, Spider, Dynamite and Catepillar taste amazing.  Flavor explosion with every bite.  They have a few rolls that are wrapped in thin soy paper sheet that are not as filling as the ones with rice.  Some days I do low carb and i would order a bunch of these.  Pink Lady and Oh My Heart are my favorites.  If you like scallop make sure you order the Volcano, baked scallop with yum yum sauce.  

Side dishes and appetizers are very small when you order with AYCE and that's a good thing cuz you just want to taste the variety of stuff.  Finish off with some mochi's and you can die happy.

4.5 stars

Oh sheet, it's oyshi sushi. Definitely my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. This is my go to place for sushi with my husband and his co workers

The wait can be long, so get here early. The longest we've ever waited is max 20 mins

AYCE for lunch is 21 and dinner is 26 bucks, not bad. Which includes a large amount of appetizers and desserts

Favorite rolls: spicy tuna crunch, tiger roll, snow mountains. 

The desserts are delicious. The biggest hits being green tea mochi ice cream and the green tea tiramisu.  

The service is excellent, the rolls take a while to come out but it's worth the wait because you can taste the freshness. 

Like all sushi places, they charge you if you waste food. One bite or two isn't a big deal but don't waste an entire roll.

The restaurant looks like a high ended sushi house, that's well decorated. Very clean and open. 

Can't wait to take my out of town friends here.

This place has something for everyone good seating great ambience The food is really good away from the sushi menu this is a great place to take the first time Sushi Eater to experience different flavors and if they still don't like  Sushi there appetizers and side dishes are amazing I recommend the surf and turf and all the desserts are excellent

I've been to many sushi places in Vegas and Oyshi by far was the worst.  The all you can eat is for 2 hours which is fine but it took over 20 minutes to get my one simple roll and it wasn't even busy. It also took me getting up and taking my glass to a waitress to refill my glass of water and the sushi was very average, for $27 you can find much better sushi with good service.

Pros: $27 AYCE, fresh fish, dynamite app, big pieces of nigiri, multiple sake options, calamari, extra large selection of appetizers, short wait for food once ordered
Cons: Only 5 baked mussels per person, oysters tasted bad, seared tuna was closer to fully cooked than just seared, surf and turf was over cooked, tables who walked in after us were seated before us
Overall: The majority of food that we ordered was excellent with a few misses but the large pieces of fish that were fresh and tasty made up for the few bombs. Service was decent, not the quickest or most personable plus I had to ask for the check and plates stayed around longer than I would have preferred. One thing is for sure for me, great food outweighs decent service so we will be back soon, especially since it's 2 miles from my house.
Literally, THE BEST all you can eat sushi. Really nice workers and food is amazing. Highly recommend.
We had the green yea cream brle, which was very nice! Everything came out at a very nice pace and timing was excellent! Great all you can eat sushi!

Besides this place being full of snobby ass people who have a stick up their....... u kno where .....the food and service is amaze!!! they had a roll with jalapeno ( what big help huh) but it had cream cheese and something else it was so good!!!...and their frid calamari is the BUSINEESS!!! great servive, amazing food, keep it up yall!!!

My boyfriend & all his buddies introduced me to this place, and all I can say is amazing!

I love, love, LOVE sushi and this is hands down one of the best places I have ever eaten sushi at. The employees are always super duper nice and accommodating, the food is delicious, and it's in a nice area. We always get the all you can eat, duh!! ;]

I'm from NY so whenever I visit my bf in Vegas, I always come here at least once. Don't forget to order the parfait for dessert!!

I only went once and I didn't have a great experience.  The food was fine and I enjoyed it, but it was the service that really turned me off.  They never came around, we would wait and wait til someone helped us and even when we got an order in, it took a while.  I'd visit again but it doesn't seem worth it.  Ehh.

Come here for their green tea creme brulee. That is all. No I'm only joking.

In a city where AYCE sushi is plenty of Oyshi does OK. It's in my rotation for when I'm craving AYCE sushi but not in my top favorites I do prefer others a lot more. It's All You Can Eat sushi and you can really eat all you can eat that's at least until they cut you off. It's your typical AYCE sushi, they all are sushi grade and they make your typical sushi dishes everyone is doing. Not many items wowing me but still many items satisfying.

The bad about Oyshi is their spicy tuna, imitation crab usage, and kind of little nigiri and sushi rolls which is fine if you did AYCE cause you can just order more but not cool if you weren't. They have a lot of items you want to order but aren't available with AYCE. They seem to have a lot of rules.

The good about Oyshi is just about everything else. It's a place to go people watch late nights. Did I already mention their green tea crme brulee. I've been there just for it without ordering anything else and when I do AYCE, I'll make sure there's always room for it at the end. They serve some of their entrees on a sizzling hotplate, I do like the steaks and chicken. 

They have a lunch special which includes a soup, salad, and your item of choice from various plates, there's a sushi plate, tempera plate, sashimi plate, and sizzle plate. It's not bad if your not wanting AYCE during lunch.

They offer all my favorites that I must have. They have oysters and uni but they're limited. They have shrimp tempera. They have poke, which like everyone else stretched out with other items. They have a good variety of specialty, tempera, baked, and fried rolls.

Don't mine the clubbing music that's usually playing, even during lunch.

one of my favorite sushi places! The all you can eat is at a great price. they have a huge selection and always have great specials! The rolls are unique! The staff is always kind. Thought I do have to agree with previous reviews that the service can be slow - my advice is know what you want and order a lot at once! They will bring it over as its ready. Plus we always sit at the sushi bar so you don't have to wait for a waitress to bring it to you :) There is usually a short wait but I've never waited more than 15minutes even on a Saturday night. ... For the price point, you cannot beat it!! delicious! and the atmosphere is very upbeat!

My girlfriend and I have been to Oyshi Sushi a couple of times and have thought that the food was good. Nothing spectacular. We have always gone if we are craving sushi and they have an AYCE option. We've never had the problem of getting seated right away which other people have mentioned, but I don't blame them because their staff and customer service is plain out horrible.

The first time my girlfriend took my to Oyshi she had an issue with the customer service that the waitress was giving her. She did not clarify the oysters which was a part of the AYCE and after she was very rude. After taking our order we saw her twice and then thereafter other waitresses had to take our order and deliver our food.

Our second time going to Oyshi it was fine. We were seated in a timely manner and received our orders of AYCE sushi without any issues.

The third time we went to Oyshi is WHY IM WRITING THIS REVIEW and have joined YELP and is also why I'm NOT GOING BACK THERE. We were seated in a timely manner and our order was taken in a timely manner as well, but after the waitress (Pinky) took our order of AYCE we never saw her again. That's when everything fell apart. Our food took at least 20 mins to come out and it wasn't even busy. Not only that, we always order baked mussels with our order  and that never came out to the point where we order a second round. We had to call over the host or the manager or whoever the guy that was dressed up with a tie was. When Pinky never came back a young waiter started to follow up on us. This waiter was "AWESOME!" NOT!!! The guy would only look at my girlfriend and never acknowledged me at all. I had to flag the guy down to get a refill on my drink because he would just ask my GF and leave. After waiting and losing our appetites we didn't even ask for dessert which is a part of the AYCE. We were so disgusted with the service that we just asked for the bill.

Lastly, THIS IS WHY I GAVE THEM A ONE STAR...

My bill came out to be $61.62 and because of the wait and the horrible customer service I DID NOT TIP THEM. SO TELL ME WHY AFTER A COUPLE OF DAYS MY ACCOUNT WAS CHARGED $72?!?!?!? 

Those ******** CHARGED MY CARD AN EXTRA $10.38 meaning they tipped themselves and FRAUDULENTLY CHARGED my card EXTRA!!!!

At what point do they think they deserve my $10.38?!?!

Never go to OYSHI SUSHI!!!! EVER!!!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this new sushi restaurant on Sunday for dinner since it was just opened right by our apartment. The sign "All You Can Eat" really lured us in. As we walked in, we immediately noticed the decor and thought it was so modern and clean. The place looked very inviting and the hip "ultra lounge" type music was cool, too. We sat at the sushi bar and opted for the all you can eat for $26 each. The menu had several good choices and all the food items, excluding sashimi, was included on the all you can eat. The quality and portions were pretty good too. We made sure we got our money's worth..and we did!  And they serve redbean ice cream as one of the dessert options. I would totally recommend this place if you want to try a new sushi restaurant in the Southwest part of Las Vegas. Great date night place, hint..hint to all you guys wanting to impress a girl.

I used to go to Oishi Sushi frequently when I lived nearby. It's a very nice, cozy, somewhat upscale place with class and ambiance. Low noise  & dim lights make it great for dates. Best Red Dragon rolls in town (my personal favorite.)

This is the second time I've been here and I have yet to be impressed. 
The Oysters were UNEDIBLE, not fresh at all.
And the Sushi in general just didn't seem very fresh either AND they put quite a bit of rice with the nigiri to fill your ass up with THIN ass slices of fish!
Second time not impressed, not wasting anymore time, money or calories here. 
Sorry!

The sushi was good and for the all u can eat price and what they include its definetly worth it.  We sat at the sushi bar and interacted with the guys rolling our sushi and had a great experience. We got there before the dinner rush and would definetly recommend getting there before the rush because they fill up quick.  I will definetly be back.

I've been here once since moving to Vegas so far and I LOVED it.  Service was great, menu is HUGE especially for all you can eat (AYCE), and the sushi chefs were very nice and welcoming.

I cannot wait to return here again and eat as much as possible.
I love the food here no doubt but I wish they learned how to make the sushi faster D; I guess they do that on purpose so we don't eat as much or something but I'll still go back [:

Wow...I didn't realize that I haven't done a review for one of my favorite AYCE sushi joints.  Anyway...here it is:

Located on the southwest side of town at the corner of Rainbow and Robindale.  Plenty of parking.  Customer service is a bit lacking compared to when they first opened but I'm sure it's cause they always have a full house.

Reasonable price for AYCE at $21.00 for lunch and $26.00 for dinner.  They have a wide range of menu options which includes appetizers, sashimi/sushi, signature rolls, entrees, kids menu, and my favorite...desserts.  They also have food options for vegetarians.  

There are private dining areas for a more intimate experience with seating from 5-20+ people.  The smaller private room seats about 5+ people and has couches for seating and a tv, so while you are dining you can chillax, enjoy your food, and be entertained by the tv.  The larger room can seat about 20+ so it's ideal for larger parties but there are no couches, just regular seats, however, there is a tv.

More like 2.5 stars...

I heard good things about this place so I checked it out finally, but the food was mediocre... Not a fan of the rolls - they were overly flavored and rolled messy.  I wanted to like this place, but there wasn't anything that cried great to me.  The seaweed salad was probably my favorite appetizer... 

The place is a quite overpriced for the food.  I didn't feel the fish was fresh and they used a lot of flavoring to cover-up the meh quality of its food.

My boyfriend and I got food poisoning from this place. They took forever to bring out my roll (45 min) and my boyfriend was already done when mine came. Keep in mind I'm vegetarian and I still got food poisoning. I'm pretty sure they let our rolls sit there forever. The service was also awful! The lady didn't even ask us for refill on drinks until we got a check. DO NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE NOT EVEN MY WORST ENEMY. Avoid hospital visits and costs.

Great place! While visiting my best friend who lives here, she highly recommended doing something off the strip and different. I had never heard of an all you can eat sushi place that wasn't at a disgusting buffet. This place is great because you can order sushi and small apps, including small plates and salads with the all you can eat special. Not only was the food delicious, but the music was just as good! I could have stayed in there all night. Loved it.

I don't eat rolls with that fancy mayonnaise on, just nigiri for me and the sides. I don't usually do all you can eat but this place is almost always fresh. Almost. They get deliveries every other day so that's why I dropped a star, just for the off day here and there.

The food is great! There isn't anything on the menu that I don't like. Great food and great pricing equals an awesome night. I only rated it 4 stars because of the service. I've been there about ten times and only once did I get good service. I'm sure once their staff is a little more experienced I'll change my ratings to a 5.

We've been here multiple times, probably 5+ times with good results. My husband and I went yesterday and things just tasted off. I ordered the teriyaki beef roll and wow it was really disgusting but you know if you don't finish it you have to pay for it. I choked down two pieces, it was horribly nasty. Also at the same time I had a baked roll with shrimp w/crab and lobster on top. The crab was super fishy smelling and just didn't taste right. I should have sent it back but our waitress was never at our table. Twice we had to have one of the guys who brings out the food go get her. 
I've been in and out of the bathroom since we got back last night and needless to say I think I got food poisoning. After this experience I'll never go back!

Best sushi for the best price! My recommendation is to get the all you can eat Buffett. My favorite roll are the rattlesnake and my husband's is the hot tamale. Hands down, rattlesnake is the best! 

I took off one star because the service is a hit or miss.

Definitely one of the best sushi places I have ever been. You get a great deal when for the all you can eat. Great service and excellent food. About a 15 minute drive from the strip, but sooooo worth it

Where do I begin? It was a Tuesday night and the restaurant looked busy. My group of 12 had one of their private rooms. The biggest stink about this experience is the service. They took my drink order 3 times and all I asked was for some water. I asked them to bring out a birthday cake after we were finished eating. One server came in and told me that he would clear out the dirty dishes before coming out with the cake which he didn't do. I had to get up and ask for extra dishes and forks from the hostess desk. They brought out the cake without lighting the candles that were provided and the cake still in the box. The food quality was not very good. The steak teriyaki meat crumbled in my mouth which basically meant that the meat wasn't fresh but frozen. I won't be coming back since there is so many better japanese spots in town.
Sushi is always fresh always good service. Love the vibe this spot has. I love how they're open late.

I used to love this place but after coming here last night I've lost all hope in this place! 

I came with a party of 6 all hungry and ready to eat.  I ordered the lobster fair and love affair .. Which I got about 25 mins after I ordered.. Once I got that me and my friend both ordered the surf and turf (which after 40 mins we never got so we just said f**ck it) our waitress was pretty much non existent the only person we saw was Stephen the server who was a complete douche every time we asked him if we could order he gave us the biggest attitude and said what do u want? One of my friends said to him" well if u don't wanna take our order can u send our waitress" who came to our table 20 mins later at this point we all order the ayce and only got 2 rolls each after 2 hours of not eating we were fed up ordered dessert that took another 20 mins to come out so after that we asked to talk to manager... Andy came out listened to our spiel and look uninterested and walked away ..not really say shit to us.. So we got out bill they took off ONE ayce and ONE sake without an apology or even an explanation...  Management and staffing need a total re-training you guys are all unfriendly and obviously don't want anyone's business .. We won't be coming back

All you can eat sushi in Vegas for $27?  

Skeptical at first, but definitely hit the spot with all the rolls with jalapenos. Average sushi, but even the Professional Fat Kid has been hit hard by the economy.  

I'm just glad it wasn't Todai.

Oh...and saw Chandella Powell, UFC ring girl.  Didn't want to pull a tourist moment, so I didn't ask for a picture.

We've been coming to this place for 3 years now. We order about the same thing most of the time. We are big AYCE sushi fanatics. When we first ordered, we already gave them what we usually order all at once. Then, we were questioned if we can finish it. Of course we said yes. Then we gave them our second order which is about less than half of what we first ordered. When they came back with the albacore we ordered, they gave us a regular tuna. We asked a couple times if it was really albacore and they insisted it is. We know how an albacore looks and taste like. It's one of our favorite fish and it's a must have for us. It seems like they are trying to trick customers with a different but similar looking fish or low grade items. We've tried another sushi place that did this kind of deception before but this is a first from this place. We have plenty of good sushi places in our area but we go out of our way to go to this place. We will not be coming back here anymore and so will the rest of our  family. I'm giving it 2 stars because of the promptness of the food.

Good all you can eat sushi. We had a very nice variety of sushi and apps. The nigiri was nice and fresh and oysters were tasty. The rolls were also good, we tried my favorite, monster and yellow tail trio. We also ordered the miso soup, beef roll teriyaki and shrimp tempura. For dessert we tried the green tea cake tiramisu, berry parfait, mango mochi and some green tea and vanilla ice cream. Worth the wait and filling.

I've been here multiple times and consistently had a great experience.. up until the past few months. The service and food was always up to par, even during busy times which is most of the time. The All You Can Eat lunch and dinner specials are a nice deal and include appetizers, plenty of sushi options, and absolutely delicious desserts! The only problem I've had is with pretty bad service... or rather disappointingly horrible service. Where you're sitting wondering if your server is intentionally ignoring your empty table. Especially my last visit when I invited my family that was visiting from out of state, our server seemed incredibly distracted and had to be asked multiple times where our food was after waiting 30+ minutes in between rolls and seemingly every roll we ordered mysteriously never made it to the chefs. We ended up being in the restaurant for almost THREE HOURS. Not where I want to spend so much of my night.. I hope management can reinforce the importance of prompt/positive customer service and maybe we'll make this our regular sushi spot again. Maybe.

I just realized that I have not yet written a review for my favorite sushi spot on earth! Here it goes!! Although I have not been here in months because I moved on the opposite end of Vegas, now turning into a 30 minute drive, compared to a 5 minute drive =(

WHERE: Located on Rainbow & Robindale

WHAT:  Everything about this local sushi joint is outstanding! From the uniqueness of the special rolls to the to the great customer service, this is the place to try!

If you do get the chance to come here for your first, second, or millionth time, I suggest AYCE all the way!! Lunch is 24.95 and dinner is 27.95- so worth the time and money spent!

One of my favorite appetizers is the ahi poke! There's something about the mixture that makes you want to order 5 of them and make your own dish!

ROLLS:
-Oyshi roll: The first thing you should try! It is their special roll, and the absolute best!!
-Vegas & Sibuya rolls: If I can recall, these are the 2 rolls without rice! & are both full of flavor!
-Japanese Lasagna roll: I always have to have my baked roll!!

There are other great rolls, but I can't remember what the names were! So, until next time! I will update soon!

*NOTE: You also get a free dessert with AYCE!! There are the fruit&yogurt parfait, creme brulee, ice cream, or mochi!
This is the 3rd time here and it still is a 2.5 star, 3 star at best. Service is terrible, food is either sweet or salty. I was hoping it would improve. Its consistently bad.

I have been here several times hands down best sushi joint in Las Vegas. Always clean & efficient with great food and service not to mention amazing happy hour specials. Don't forget dessert because the green tea ice cream is the perfect way to end the night. Also all you can eat
One of our favorite sushi places in town. Reasonable priced all you can eat and sushi chefs are always super friendly! We love the upbeat atmosphere and music! We will keep going back for more!

This place has excellent sushi and the ayce menu is very extensive. It's priced about what all other sushi restaurants charge so that is fine. It's also pretty big and open which is nice because you don't feel too packed in. 

I really enjoy all their different rolls but my favorites are the Rock n Roll and the crunchy scallop roll. The scallop roll has these little popcorn scallop pieces that are just so tasty. 

For dessert I always get the creme brle. If you get ayce, you only get one, but if you order a la carte the creme brle is served with three flavors (vanilla, green tea, and chocolate) but the vanilla is the best. 

The downside to this restaurant is the wait to get seated which can sometimes be a good hour or more because it's popular. The second downside is the service. Sometimes they are pretty unattentive due to the fact that they are so busy.

We arrived before the crowd and had a wonderful experience.  As we were leaving, the place was filling up and service was starting to slow down so i would suggest that the ideal time for eating at Oyshi is not during the rush.

The sushi was good, the price was good and at the time we went, service was very good!

Update:
We've returned several more times and the food is consistently good but the service has been hit or miss...more miss than hit.  Downgraded to 3 out of 5 for this reason.

The food has gotten a little better since the last two years or so. The service has ranged from mediocre to excellent; it seems to be hit or miss. The people who have worked there longer seem to be comfortable, whereas those who are newer work a little harder to ensure better service. Sometimes it takes a while for a waiter or waitress to come back and check on you, and sometimes they're always there. Sometimes the food comes timely, and sometimes not so quickly, even on the slower days. Again, hit or miss. 

This is a great place to bring company, as it is decently and comparably priced, clean, and modern. But we've also had better food at more hole-in-the wall places; the only thing is that it is not as presentable as Oyshi. I guess it depends on what you're looking for -- pretty decent food with a modern feel, or excellent food with a less presentable atmosphere.

Went here on a suggestion and WOW is all I can say. The sushi was fresh and delicious and the variety is awesome. The fact that it is so close to where I live helps a lot also. The Green Tea ice cream is a perfect way to cap off a great dinner. Will definitely be back

Sunday night here is pretty packed but people here are very accommodating and friendly. Their AYCE is the bomb!! So my mom and I ordered their Monster, (a little sweet for me), Lobster Fair (omg this is one is freaking good!), Japanese Garlic Lasagna, and many more! However, their Salmon Lover was a little bit so so for us cause the salmon wasn't fresh at all, they used frozen ones. For appetizers, their Seaweed Salad, Ahi Poke, Baked mussels were pretty good. And of course, for dessert, I got some green tea ice cream and their tiramisu too! So yummy! We're definitely looking forward to eat here again besides we just live near here!

By far this is the WORST service I have ever had in ANY restaurant. To begin with I went in with my boyfriend for a nice sushi dinner date which I was super excited for. The host said that the wait would be 30 minutes for two which was okay. We were then seated and I was fine because it seemed to be under the said time. After 5  minutes of sitting our server, Ploi, comes and takes our order : 3 orders of shrimp tempura, 1 agedashi tofu, baked muscles, and poki. 5 minutes pass, 10 minutes pass, a table next to us is seated and they place their order. Our server than returns and we place our sushi order because why not? We're already waiting. Another 5 minutes pass and the table next to us gets their food. WHAT? Then we get our sushi order and finish all of that. Then after a grand total of 35 minutes we get our appetizers. They gave us one order of shrimp tempura but it was fine we just ordered me. After that we get a roll on our table that we didn't order. A rainbow roll. I am very allergic to avocado and if a roll came to our table with avocado inside instead of outside and I ate it I would've gotten extremely sick. Food was good. Service was terrible. Compared to busier places in chinatown the service here was a joke. I will not be returning.

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants. The service here is exceptionally great. All you can eat is the normal choice. Great roll selection, lobster fair, simply shrimp, pink lady, steak plates, tempura, seaweed salad, poke, etc. The music here is always current and up to date. Toni my waitress was delightful. Her sense of urgency and service is what kept me coming back.

All you can sushi spot. A ways away from the Vegas strip. Came here for a group lunch. The set up of this AYCE sushi is cool. You can order individually and instead of placing multiple rolls and other orders in one big plate they served em to you personally so you could easily identify which roll is which. 

One of my personal favorite rolls was the "treasure roll". I'd recommend trying that especially during the AYCE menu. Also for the appetizers, get the surf and turf it's shrimp and beef. Staff was really friendly and accommodating. Thank you!
Fire!! Chef Ed killing the game...again! -Ahi Tuna wasabi and special sauce on tempura seaweed

My friend suggested that we check this place out.  I was pleasantly surprised that the venue was much bigger than I thought it was.  Also the All You Can Eat Menu had a lot of different things that I haven't seen on other menus around town.  The sushi was great.  The one roll I compare restaurants with is the salmon skin roll and I liked it here.

I've been here so many times and yet I forgot to do a review. Me & the husband love this place. Andy the manager is always friendly and helpful. The fish is always fresh. I do like the variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.. Strangely enough, I've never really had any of their dessert because we seem to pig out of the AYCE and never have room for it at the end. The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get.  They have a large parking lot so, no worries about a parking space.

I live on this side of town and for an AYCE and high volume restaurant the service and quality is great! There is often a wait at prime dinner times but that a good sign if you ask me :-) We often do our girls nights here and I don't see that changing any time soon!
Simply amazing is all I can say!  I am a Sushi rookie but this place makes me want to eat it all the time!

When eating AYCE here, stuff your faces with everything from the appetizers, nigiri to the dessert... everything was good.  Especially the dessert.  The maki rolls are packed with a lot of rice and are portioned so large, they do not fit the mouth, and they will fill you up after 1 order.  

We would go back if the service was a little warmer.  I was "reprimanded" by the host for letting my toddler walk around the dining area.  Says he's getting in the way.  Seriously?  I'm already not fully enjoying my meal coz my kid is acting up.  You're supposed to make me feel better, not worse.  I curse you host with tantrum toddlers, many of them!  Hehe.

I've been here too many times to not write a review.

Service has always been great. Every waiter/waitress that have waited on my party and I have been attentive and polite.  We usually come here for dinner/late night. Our orders were always correct and it comes out pretty quick...I'd say within 10-15 minutes.

We ALWAYS order the ATOMIC BOMB ($11). And yes...it's bomb dot com. We also order the usual spicy tuna roll. Here at Oyshi they make one of the best spicy tuna rolls. Some spicy tuna rolls are not even spicy...but here, there's a great kick to it. 
We've also tried other rolls like Love Affair, Heart Attack ($9-13) and a few others. Didn't really leave a lasting impression. 
A few days ago, we tried the JAPANESE GARLIC LASAGNA and it was yummy!!!! Soooo now I got a new roll added to my usual two.

Can't wait to be back! Never disappoints! =)

I come to this location a lot, usually i come earlier, but tonight I got off work at 11, and really wanted sushi, I called and googled to see if Oyshi is still open, it says it closes at 2am and they told me they were still open, by the time I get there it's 12am, ask I'm walking in, all the chairs were already stacked up and they told me they are completely closed, At 12am!  it's very annoying when you googled and called to make sure, and when you get all the way there, they drop the bomb on you saying that they are closed, when clearly on the window it says open until 2am, on the website it says open until 2am, and on the phone they say they are open!  So I feel very manipulated!! And very upset by this!

Very good service and selections. Steak, pork belly and oysters ( dinner only ) are available with AYCE.
Nice ambiance and not much noise. 



I'll continue to visit.

If you're gonna do all-you-can-eat sushi you might as well come here. The sushi is decent, the service is good and the vibe is great! It's great that you can order hot plates, appetizers and desserts in addition to sushi.

We've come in with our two young children a few times and the staff has always tried to get us comfortable (read: secluded) table which we appreciated.

Not sure if it is poor ventilation or what but I always walk out smelling a bit greasy. Keep this in mind if you plan on going out afterwards.

This place sucks and I never even ate a thing here. I drove past a few of my faves on Saturday evening 5/14/11 only to find myself being ignored while standing in the doorway for over 5 minutes. Four different people who are employed there including the manager behind the sushi bar saw us and 2 other groups of people behind us and still no acknowledgment. No one wanted to even tell us that they did not have tables and what the expected wait would be. Ill wait if its worth it. I bailed and will never darken their entry again. They have to learn that there are so many options that are good out there. I drove out to Summerlin and ate at a Sushi bar on Lake Mead and Rampart called" It's Sushi". It does not have AYCE available. However the superior quality of the fish makes eating anything there great. The prices are fair. They do have a Happy Hour.
Great service, Casual atmosphere and amazing food. Best sushi in town! I recommend this place to everyone I know.

Okay but not the best. 

Ate here today for the first time. The waiters were nice and they were very attentive, but the food took longer than expected, especially appetizers. All we ordered we poke bowls but it took about 15 mins to actually get it. Then we ordered 3 rolls and the restaurant wasn't even busy but it took them at least 20 mins... 

Also I wouldn't drink their water. Had a very metallic and off putting taste to it. No bueno. And their nigiri is very small! I was surprised at the amount of rice they had with each piece of nigiri! The rolls did taste good, they were just smaller compared to other rolls at other sushi restaurants.

Love it love it love it!!! It's a regular sushi bar with an 'all you can eat' option. (Does not include sashimi). So delicious. You can even get 1/2 size sushi rolls to dance around the menu. The crunchy tuna was my favorite. I also loved that you can get soup, salad, tempura, poke, and all other appetizers included. Loved it so much I went 2 nights in a row.

Have had mixed experiences with service. Sushi is good but really only rolls with rice , no quality rolls without rice or other healthy options. The rolls we had were good, the spicy tuna is good no matter which roll choose

The service and food is okay. Although there sushi is always gonna be same amount of fish and rice ratio. The only bad thing about this place is the sushi takes 30 to 40 minutes to come out. I ended up staying here for 2 and half hours because the food took so long to come out. I would rather go to other location which gives better service and food. 

They had already did auto gratuity which I don't mind but they could at least did a better job on taking care of us.

Sushi-great ; service- great music- wtf?? Electronic dance music during dinner?? Ugh this is not Sushi Samba! Totally out of place. Annoying atmosphere to say the least. Unfortunately my wonderful dinner was accompanied by aweful club style trap music.. Very disappointing.

I've eaten here twice but I doubt there will be a third visit. As for the food, it's pretty good. Nothing extraordinary, but pretty average. I got the all you can eat, and I got my $21 worth. No complaint there. But the sushi isn't very authentic in that it's nothing a Japanese person would readily recognize. Seems to be part of this "fusion" sushi movement. I told the sushi chef it wanted an omekase selection, and he had no idea what I was talking about. BAD SIGN! I probably should have just given up and gone to Osaka, but alas I stayed. Most of the rolls were average, but the yellowtail trio had a terrible ginger sauce. I couldn't finish it. 

Aside from the food, the service was non-existent. I moved to a quiet corner to avoid a very loud group and I was completely forgotten. I had to get up and ask for my check after 15 minutes of waiting.

My biggest complaint is with the music. There is rap music blaring, even on a Sunday afternoon. I guess they're trying to attact a young, hip crowd, but they're really only driving away customers. I asked them to turn down the music to no avail, and left with a pounding headache and resolved not to come here again.

Food quality and taste 5/5

Service 2/5
If you do the AYCE (all you can eat) they take years to bring anything and forget some of your order because they take so long which forces you to constantly repeat and ask about the food you ordered. 

Price 3/5 
Kinda expensive

Overall experience 3/5

This was our first time coming to Oyshi and we will definitely come again! The food was delivered in a timely manner and tasted delicious! My boyfriend is allergic to avocado and cucumber (unfortunately) so finding good sushi can be a bit hard for him. Our waitress, Odi, was very cooperative and made sure that whatever he ordered was completely free of his allergies! I also noticed that she was really busy, every table in the place packed, however she remained very calm and checked on us frequently to make sure we had the food we needed and that we were doing okay. Thank you Odi for making our first experience a great one! We will be returning soon!
Great food! All the sushi is nice and fresh. Great service. Only negative is how loud it can be with everyone talking. Must be the sake kicking in. LOL

Used to be great but quality and service so bad now. This neighborhood is ripe for an all you can eat sushi place.  If you sit at the bar it's the best  bet.  But maybe just drive ten more minutes out to a better place.

We had the all-you-can-eat sushi and went a little crazy. The surf-and-turf is a delicious appetizer, and will come out to your table steaming on a cast iron plate. The peppered yellow tail was another one of my favorite appetizers, with a smokey flavor. The "Lava Flow", "Japanese Lasagna" and "Heart Attack" were three of my favorite rolls. Dessert is included in the AYCE deal, and I enjoyed the creme brle.

I thought most tasted fresh n good, though I was not a fan of the dynamite n I thought the popcorn shrimp was a bit too much for 2 ppl (I can't eat that much fried). My favs that I do recommend was the oysters, the mussels, salmon belly(off the specials board), the ahi Pok, agedashi tofu, the uni, the salmon roe with quail egg. The rest of the nigri tasted dry, the ebi ebi roll was alright, n tho I did like the taste of the nyi roll, that don't taste or look like soft shell crab like it says lol
Great as usual, can never get enough of this place!! Love the all you can eat sushi and appetizers.
Came in for lunch and the all-you-can-eat was great. They got super busy, but kept up with all their orders in a timely mannner.  The chefs were great!  Super friendly, fun to talk to at the bar.

The quality of fish was not great. Another ayce sushi failure :/ fish to rice ratio was not good either. I asked not to put too much rice but they still did. Rice was too dense, felt like they really squeezed rice hard. Nothing was impressive here, I felt like it was waste of $26. 

On top of that, fish was really not fresh! I started feeling sick as returning to hotel and as soon as I got there I threw up everything. It was a bad experience. Won't return.

My wife (who surprisingly doesn't eat seafood) was introduced to this place and she's addicted.  She gets all the egg rolls and teriyaki chicken and beef she can eat, and even some rolls without fish.  The all you can eat deal it great.  I leave feeling like I will never need to eat again.  The food is great, the service is good, and the Mochi desert is interesting.  Even the kids meal is quite large for being only $6.  If you want good sushi, this is your place.  They make the rolls after you order them so be sure to be patient and order several rolls at a time so you don't have to wait for a long time between orders.

This used to be our AYCE spot but not anymore!

The food is great however the service is not so appealing! This actually caused us to venture elsewhere and now there's no turning back. You shouldn't be questioned whether you can eat all you order! I am there to eat for goodness sakes don't tell me not to order too much. I do understand there's time when people do order excessively and cannot finish their food. But that's not everyone so please stop asking us if we can finish what we order, I'll pay for extra if that day comes! 

My new spots, Yama sushi, Sushi Koma, and Umiya!

1) Ambiance: Modern, busy, high energy with techno/dance music playing.

2) Price: Comparable to most AYCE Sushi Joints $21 Lunch/ $26 Dinner

3) Service: Slow as far as food preparation. Spent nearly 2 hours on AYCE for 2 people. The servers & management were very nice though. Drinks were always refilled and they came around to check up on us often.

4) Food: Some of the things we ordered.

Appetizers-
Baked Green Mussels were good. I could eat 100.
Asian Style Skirt Steak - Came out on a sizzilin' platter & smelled terrific but I wasn't diggin' the taste. Nothing special.

Sushi-
Fish was eh... just ok. Not as fresh.

Favorite Rolls-
Amigo - jalapeno, combination of fish and cream cheese w/ flaming hot chili sauce. Jalepeno-licious!
Love Affair - shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes. Scrumptious!

5) Overall: Satisfactory. There were a lot of things we wanted to try but were too full. I would give this place another shot.

The sushi here is so good! Ever since I left there I've been craving their sushi. I'll definitely be coming back here ASAP. 
My only complaint is we had to wait a while to be seated when the waiters were just standing around, but they were pretty friendly and patient for a newcomer to sushi like myself

This restaurant used to be okay both food wise and service wise. I'm not sure what's going on these days but the service isn't as good as it used to be. The half of restaurant is empty and they are making us wait 10 min. Why? I always tell myself it s my last time here when I come here. This time, I am 100% positive, WILL be my last time here. There are SO MANY other GOOD aye sushi places. I suggest try them not here
Just superb. Vince, our waiter, did an excellent job attending us and explaining how the AYCE menu works. This will be our go to place for sushi.

Compared to other sushi joints in the Las Vegas area I would rather go somewhere else. The vibe here is ok, good spacious restaurant with loud music. But if you're into that kind of thing go ahead. 

Food wise they could cut back on the rice. The rice they put is a little much. I like to judge a sushi joint by their Unagi (eel) i was not impress with the unagi here. It was a little cold. 

Overall it was ok.just okay

My daughter and I make this our first stop when coming to Las Vegas.  Never disappoints.  Staff, chef's, food dynamite.

Making a reservation is suggested, because it fills up fast, but sitting at the bar you can watch chef's prepare your rolls, and sped is quality.

The all you can eat is the key.  Thanks once again; see you next year.

All you can eat sushi is what they are known for. The sushi is good, some of the best I have had in Vegas. This location seems much quicker and cleaner then the others. A bit over priced, overall good value.

Went in with my girl for lunch and had a HORRIBLE dining experience.  I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 7 years and it has been awhile since I had such horrible service/food.  

When we walked in, there was no host/hostess to greet/seat us.  After waiting for 2 minutes, we decided to seat ourselves at the sushi bar.  The restaurant was not packed but had a decent lunch crowd for a sunday.  Numerous servers passed by us and pretty much ignored us.  On top of that, there were 4 sushi chefs behind the counter who did not acknowledge us at all.  Probably after 5 minutes, the manager came by and asked us if we would like something to drink.  It took him probably at least another 5 minutes to grab us our waters.  After placing our order with him, it took another 15-20 minutes to get any of the sushi we ordered.  Talking from a server perspective, how hard is it to make sushi??? There is no cooking involved!  When we finally got our order, I was very disappointed.  The quality of the fish is very subpar and the portions are very small for the price. 

All in all, the restaurant itself is nice and has a nice ambiance, but the customer service quality of the servers and sushi chefs are waaaaayy below average.  I would not recommend going here!!

WOW!!! Love this place! My favorite is their salmon skin salad and they all so have all you can eat option. More bang for your buck! The staff are polite and very attentive. This place is pretty much pack so come in early.

The sushi was great!  It was fresh and had great preserntation.  If you like both the traditional and contemporary sushi, this is the place to go.   I recommend getting the "all you can eat" selection.  You can order appetizers, rolls, hot food, and a dessert.  For $26.00 plus tip & tax, it's a grea value.  They also have a private room for small parties.

Omg...after all these time that passed by and I am back here again ..same problem exists, the long wait to be seated even if we came after dinner time already. It's taking sooooo long for us to be seated and it's only 2 of us...frustrating and disappointing. So if you guys are thinking of coming over here make sure you bring a lot of patience! I tell you the food is nothing extra ordinary eithet. The only reason I am back is because I thought their service has changed. Double thumbs down again so sad :((

Used to eat there a few years ago
And I must to be honest them much do used to be much better
Now they're okay
Food is okay
Service Soso

I guess it depends on what kind of Japanese food you want.

Their rolls?  Fantastic.  Their heart rolls and volcano rolls were strong in flavor with soft textures.

However... their nigiri is only so-so.  I'd come here if you just want to go wild on ROLLS.

That being said, the service here was excellent.  They really try hard to satisfy your needs here.  The atmosphere/decor was nice too.
Great service and great food. First time at Oyshi's tonight! All you can eat ice cream! Hell yeah

Hmmm...I was planning to lose my AYCE sushi virginity to Ms. Goyemon but there was a two hour wait so instead I opted for the next girl available named Ms. Oyshi....I'd rather like to think we didn't go all the way and I'm still saving myself for the former.  

For 26 bucks, I think it's definitely in line with Sushi Goyemon, but I happened to be in the company of some friends who had been there as well, so I was able to get some perspective as I proceeded with my first time navigating this a la carte ordering feeding frenzy.  The first few speed bumps which caught my eye were some ground rules listed in the menu:

1. No sashimi, only one order of oysters (4 pieces), uni, and sweet shrimp allowed...fair enough

2. No excess rice shall be allowed to remain uneaten on the plate, otherwise that order will be counted as extra on the final bill....have people been discarding their rice into a large pile assembling a massive sculptured mountain of rice?  The rice that was used to prepare the sushi was highly variable in quality  (too soft, too firm, or mixed) throughout the various rounds of ordering so it only motivated us to concoct creative methods for disposing the rice (hiding it in the tea jar, breaking it into tiny grains and scattering it across the plate so as to create the illusion of a clean plate, and to borrow a technique from a friend who disliked rice during her early childhood, placing said rice into mouth and going to bathroom to dispose in toilet/trash).  Of course none of this was done, but it was tempting nonetheless.

3.  Any orders which are unfinished in general will be counted as extra orders on the final bill...this was adhered yet strangely enough after receiving our final round of food (a modest 2-3 rolls) the server waited when we were rubbing our bellies and chimes in "you have two more rolls coming!" and none of us had any idea where these phantom rolls were coming from and she then replies with a snarky shrug  "I'll take them off your order" as if she was doing us a favor....pure shenanigans

4. The jalapeno poppers on the appetizer menu were not allowed to be included amongst the AYCE orders....what kind of crazy logic is this?  Wouldn't it be good strategy to fill your customers with heartburn due to fatty spicy cream cheese richness to slow down their intake of much much more expensive items?  Either these are the greatest jalapeno poppers in the history of appetizers or a missed business opportunity.   I don't even like jalapeno poppers but I almost was willing  to eat one just because this condition existed.

THE MEAL

The appetizers  (ahi poke, spicy sashimi salad, and miso soup)  The poke might as well have been unseasoned sashimi, whereas the sashimi salad was overdressed nearly drowning in the chili vinaigrette, and the miso soup was surprisingly not overly salty as I anticipated but ended up being the surprise highlight of the meal.

The "big three" (uni, raw oysters, and sweet shrimp)...not exceedingly fresh but no risk of possible food poisoning either, although the oysters had a watered down quality to them....only tasted good since they were not specifically paid for.

The nigiri:  I sampled the surfer clam, spanish mackerel, japanese yellowtail, and a few other standards....there was definitely something I couldn't put my finger on but the level of freshness just seemed 1 level below what you would expect if you ordered these same items at a regular reputable sushi bar.  I'm thinking perhaps they were precut in mass production and by the time they arrived they were partially dried out from the external surface area of each piece of fish being exposed for a prolonged period of time.

The rolls:  Perhaps I've had enough sushi experiences to have progressed beyond rolls since they are drenched in so much sauce (seriously, what is the obsession with orgasm sauce in this town?), crispy shavings of empty calories, or packed with so many types of fish that I couldn't really differentiate any of them out of a sushi roll lineup much like the Seinfeld episode where George tries to catch the Twix bar candy thief ("It's a SETUP! They're all Caterpillar rolls!!")  I would try to limit your roll intake and focus on the other items to keep your palate from being overwhelmed(and to avoid the server from pulling that phantom roll maneuver as previously discussed)
