Last but not least, we figured we had successfully navigated through the labyrinth of extra charges until we received the final bill which charged us for the hot tea...are you serious???  So you're telling me I could have drank an entire gallon of miso soup instead of one measly cup of hot green tea which cost you pennies to brew?  Perhaps these were some tea leaves taken from the Emperor's garden, but I would appreciate a warning next time.  

3 stars only because we definitely still got our money's worth, but I'm leaving a few more stars to be earned since my friends reassured me Goyemon is better.

I'm giving this place 4 stars. The rolls are really good and they have a variety of different ones to choose from. I think I'm a third done with trying all the different rolls.

Last time I went they were very pleasant and attentive to our drinks and our rolls came out in a timely fashion. (Which I love cause nothing sucks more than having to wait for AYCE. You get full faster.) This experience varied extremely different over my first visit where it felt like they couldn't wait for us to leave!

I can happily say that Oyshi has taken up my favorite spot on this side of town. It beat Nagoya hands down.
My husband and I have been going since opening week! I looove their sushi and you cant beat the price! The love affair and the tuna! Always fresh! Also try that green tea ice cream.
We always come in for sushi and food is always good and fresh.  Just want to say that our server Bess was super sweet, attentive and just awesome.

Finally went to Oyshi yesterday (as it was recommended by my friend).  The atmosphere was pretty awesome.  They had a spacious seating arrangement, colorful decor, Xgames and the Laker's Game on TV, and Techno music playing in the background (not really what I had expected in a Sushi joint).  We came for the AYCE @ about $22.00 for dinner.  It's decently priced for AYCE.  The price does not include a drink.  The selection of food on the menu was pretty good.  They had a good assortment of appetizers, specialty rolls, and traditional Nigiri (not to mention hand cut Maki rolls).  I am a big fan of Sashimi, but like 99% of the time, the Sashimi is not included in the AYCE.  I did however stock up on the Sake (raw Salmon) Nigiri.  Being my favorite Nigiri, I found their Sake Nigiri to be very very fresh.  It was super bright orange and tasted incredible!  For dessert, they have a few different flavors of Mochi, but you can only get one.  If I remember correctly, the flavors are as follows: Green Tea, Mango, and Red Bean.  I opted for the Mango and wish I could have had a second since they were pretty small in size.  Anyhow, the Sake Nigiri alone would have gotten Oyshi 4 stars, but unfortunately the service was extremely slow.  On top of that, the only soup available was the Miso Soup.  How do you not have Udon on the AYCE menu?  Seriously?? They also did not have low-sodium soy sauce (I know it still has like 800mg per tbsp , but that's better than 1000mg).  Overall, I'd come here again... I just hope my server can keep my water cup filled.

Oyshi Sushi is one of the best sushi place in town! The service was fast thanks to EJ for providing us the best service every time I come here. I would definitely come back here not just because of the food quality but also for the wonderful service that is provided. The place is clean and very welcoming thanks Oyshi Sushi you served me well

I'm disappointed with the service I got tonight during my "AYCE" experience here. I understand that it can get busy here and there, but it would be nice to have your server check up on how things are going. NOT once did our server check on our table and we waited about 15 minutes per order.. Horrible! -_- 
2 stars for the bus boys!
Oyshi, always a pleasure to eat at your establishment. Great service and awesome sushi.
We at the all you can eat AYCE and it was awesome!! Food was yummy and fresh and it kept coming.  We had a party of 11 so we got our money's worth ...yummy food
Very fresh sushi. All you can eat for $26 which is a steal for the quality of the sushi here. Green tea tiramasui is equally creative and delicious. A sure winner for any dinner.

Great sushi. Great service. Great atmosphere . 

We've been coming here for years and won't go to any other sushi spot. The servers know us and remember our orders. We usually come on a weekday lunch and it's not too busy.  If you come before 3:30pm it's a little cheaper for lunch pricing. 
With all-you-can-eat you have the freedom of ordering all appetizers, all sushi (excluding sashimi) and dessert to finish.  Their fish is extremely fresh and the sushi chef's will make special requested rolls if you ask.
They have a great selection on their menu of specialty rolls and descriptions. If you sit at the sushi bar you have the option to order 1/2 rolls if you want to try something new but aren't sure if you'll like it. 
Make sure you eat what you order. Don't be that person! If you are completely stuffed they won't nickel and dime you if you don't eat one or two pieces but don't put your server in that awkward spot to charge you.
The restaurant is a big open venue and they have private dining rooms too for special events. They play great music all day and it's  not too loud during lunch. Dinner however is more trendy, music is louder, the crowds are bigger and the lights are turned low. Expect to wait on Friday and Saturday nights! I've been quoted up to a 90 minute wait!

I still love this place. When we want sushi we want Oyshi!

With that said, here's my rant....no matter what night you go here it's ALWAYS packed. That's not my gripe. Upon our recent visit I noticed that they took out some of the tables to put in a rather large hostess stand. This place is already small and crowded, why would you take away seating???

Ok end rant.....

I've been to Oyshi several times now and I absolutely love the sizzling rib eye, beef yakitori and vegetable tempura appetizers. My favorite rolls are the oh my heart, to die for! And the Philly roll 

The food is great, the reason I'm only rating 3 stars is because the last 2 times I went the service was awful. Our server was super busy with a large private party and forgot to submit our order, of course it felt like forever to get food. I truly hope the service improves, if not there are plenty of other great restaurants to choose from.

Oyshi Sushi- My go to! I love this place, and im there at least three times a month. I go for the AYCE option. It is like $23 for lunch and $27 for dinner. Try to go for lunch, there isn't a lot different in dinner except for a higher price. Service could be improved! 8/10 times I visit, I get wonderful servers! But then theres a few times I get a server who never refills drinks, slow on taking orders, not being very attentive. Other than that I love this place! The rolls are delicious! I reccomend the Love Affair (crab and crunchy flakes) or the Crunchy Roll (popcorn shrimp and yum yum sauce) or basically everything else on the menu. You get delicious food for a reasonable price, only wish servers were a little more welcoming but other than that, this is the place!!
Everything here is GREAT, love all the AYCE, love all the rolls. Service is good but when it gets busy  (and it does)  it  can take awhile for the food but very worth it.
Was here on a Tuesday it was kinda busy but nothing crazy. Service seems like it went downhill. I have been here before but never checked in.

When I visit Las Vegas, I usually come to Oyshi Sushi for sushi. There is plenty of parking around the center. I did not have to wait long for a party of three (15 minutes wait time). The restaurant is a good size and is able to accommodate large parties. I was quite hungry and decided to do the all you can eat sushi! The price for the all you can eat sushi was definitely a good price! For the all you can eat, you can order anything from the menu! The sweet shrimp and dynamite were my favorites. Also, don't forget to order dessert! There are some limitations on the menu for the quantity of sushi that can be ordered for certain items. Also, the restaurant limits only one dessert per person.  

I'll definitely be coming back here when I visit Vegas again!

I've been coming here since the place opened back years ago. Never have I ever had a bad experience until today. Staff was lacking in actually paying attention to the few people that were in the place. With all these new AYCE sushi spots opening up I'd figure they would've changed the menu just a little but it's been the same ever since ever since. Maybe a few changes, and different rules. I'm all about loyalty and I'll continue to keep coming to this place. Get John and Kevin back in there before this place continues their downward spiral.

The sushi was okay. The service was very slow, it took 40 minutes to receive 2 rolls despite the 6 sushi chefs behind the bar & the dining area not being full. The servers were unfriendly and we always needed to wave them down to order food. Seemed like they didn't want to serve us. I gave it 3 stars instead of 1 or 2 because of the All You Can Eat option for dinner at $28. Fairly priced and would recommend coming on an empty stomach. I probably wouldn't return though because the service was junk.

Plenty of sauce and plenty of rice.  You're better off going to a real buffet that doesn't add tons of sauce to everything you order so that it makes you gag.  Gagging will prevent you from eating more food.  In this case, the "quality" is not even up to par with Todai or any other buffet that serves mediocre sushi.  For $5 you can get a jar of mayonnaise or thousand island dressing to eat with your rice so that you can meet your 3000 calorie intake of carbs.

Avoid this place if you are a true sushi connoisseur, or simply like to eat good quality food.

We go here when their competitor gets crowded. When we got there we were seated  promptly. The food here have alway been fresh and consistent but this time it wasn't so. Most buffets start out strong then lose its luster over time. This place is getting there.  I noticed my sushi was packed with a lot of rice. I was kinda full upon ordering the second round but that didn't stop me.  Also the sweet shrimp was a little fishy but it didn't cause any havoc to my tummy.  I hope the owner reads this because we really like this place.

Great food!

Yes there is a wait, but that is because the food is cooked FRESH!

My wife was not a Sushi fan...but she is now because if Oyshi. 

Grew up eating Japanese food in San Francisco & this tops the list!!

The sushi was good and fresh....the service was not great at all! They forgot about 4 rolls that we ordered and never brought it to our table. It took about 20 mins to receive our rolls every time we ordered. Definitely not the best experience.

Regardless of what the others have been rating this place, I can honestly rate it a good 5 stars! Our first time going because the other place we usually go to; Sumo Sushi 2, which now closes earlier than usual. Tonight, we have ordered the Spicy Tuna, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, and the Vegas Lasagna, let me tell you it was AWESOME ... Absolutely enjoyed ourselves, great customer service, just real nice. It is more of a social sushi spot rather than the one we are used to; which is a more private one, but it was good! It is small, but very comfortable! Highly recommended and enjoyable ..

This is probably one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in town. We have been going here for years and its nice that it is by us. They have a variety of rolls and as well as appetizers on their menu. The only thing I am disappoint about is that they did not carry white tuna anymore the last time they went.

This place is one of the best ayce sushi places in vegas. In the past I would go to Yama, but I recently moved to south vegas and wanted something closer. My friend and I tried Oyshi and I think this place gives Yama a run for the money. Things that stood out is the raw oysters and surf n turf.  All the sushi was good for ayce style, and the rice was in the nigiri wasn't hard and didn't fall apart like other ayce places. The negative aspects was that the service was a little slow for me, and they brought me one piece of yellow tail that looked like it had been sun bathing out back for the afternoon. Otherwise this place is great, and I'll be returning soon.

AYCE sushi for the win! This is a must go to spot when I hit Vegas. The customer service is straight and the rolls are delicious! The price is reasonable and a it's a great way to enjoy sushi and apps amongst friends!

The rolls were delicious. Their appetizers such as ribeye steak, chicken teriyaki, shrimp and vegetable tempura, oysters, and green mussels are a must try especially when you're doing all you can eat. The service was superb. The ambiance ok.

On a Friday night passing by the area... we found this place.. wow.. the AYCE is excellent!! Boy was I stuffed.  Told the waitress keep bringing the rolls to me.  Haha.. One Word:  "Your unbelievable... "  I keep laughing and eating.. The special rolls are tasty, the sushi are fresh, and the chefs are awesome.

Service - 5 Stars
Food - 5 Stars
Cleanliness - 5 Stars

Overall, if your in the area and dig the AYCE got to try it out!!

$26 (Dinner) can't go wrong..

Love this place! Been here over a dozen times. Staff is wonderful & attentive. Sushi is fresh. GREAT AYCE !!!! Great atmosphere with private rooms for party's. Expect to wait for a table during peak times. I'm not the only person who will go out of my way to eat here. The Mochi Ice Cream & the nuclear bomb roll are my FAVS... Num num.

Usually, when I walk into a Japanese restaurant, I get the boisterous greeting from the sushi chefs and wait staff. None here. No biggie. Nice, clean-looking restaurant.

The fish tasted fresh. Ordered the tuna and super white tuna. Both were tasty. The rolls, however, I found a little disappointing. The atomic bomb was the only roll I thought was pretty good, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. The Sunrise roll I did not care for at all. It tasted like it was soaked in a garlic soy sauce. The Iris Special roll was very difficult to eat. The sauce tasted very similar to the sauce in the Sunrise roll, but it was a completely different sauce. There was a pasty, yet grainy texture to it and the flavor was pretty gross. 

All in all, I don't think i'd go there again.

I remember why I choose other places over this one because their service is inconsistent sometimes fast sometimes slow n it doesn't matter how busy their are and the biggest one for me is I never feel gratitude from the employees there. Sushi is good I do have to say

Best sushi that I ate so far since I moved here from Maui. Cool atmosphere and service are excellent. I give this place a 10... I will be back soon with wifey when she get here..Mahalo Oyshi!! You make me feel that I'm home in Maui :)

I love this place. 2 blocks from my house. I would give 5 stars, but the waitress must have been new cause I have to keep asking for stuff.  Can I get a lunch menu? Can I get wasabi with my sushi? Lol. How u forget that?  I still love the food. This was the first time the severs was ok, not great.

The best All You Can Eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to by far. 

At first when I came here, I wasn't expecting any thing to be that great since it's all you can eat, the food will be soso.

Was I wrong or what.

Plenty to choose from the menu! From sushi rolls to chef specialties to chocolate mochi, each dish brought out a different and wonderful flavor that automatically send me to the roof. Every single dish that was brought out were delicious and off the hooooooook. Especially the raw oysters, mmmmmm! (That's my favorite!)

One thing to keep in mind: Each time you order, be sure to order alot since the dishes come out fairly slow. Otherwise you'll finish a dish before the next one comes out.
Went back in October, still outstanding food and service, and  you can not beat the all you can eat price or wide variety of ordering options.

Great AYCE. More of a sushi fusion restaurant. Great place to take friends new to sushi. Their rolls are unique and the menu is very easy to read. The atmosphere is modern. Service is great 75% of the time. We have had a few servers that are slow and inattentive, but if you let management know they are very nice. I love the green tea tiramisu! Delicious.

I highly recommend this place!  I did not think that an AYCE Sushi buffet would be that great since it's buffet food but they proved me wrong.  The sushi is very fresh and delicious.  The all you can eat menu has tons of food to pick from including sushi rolls, appetizers, salad, soup, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters and dessert.  You have 2 hours to eat your food which is plenty of time to enjoy and savor your meal.  The service is great and the restaurant is pretty spacious.  This is a must-visit restaurant almost every time I go to Vegas.

Oyshi has all you can eat. A bit pricey compared to the other places I've been and not as big of a selection in terms of food outside of sushi. The creme brle desert was delicious, but the tiramisu did not come across as tiramisu; instead more like cheesecake.

Best all you can eat sushi I've had! I was SO surprised at their huge selection for all you can eat! Not only are their rolls all you can eat... so are their appetizers :D Although they limit desserts to 1 per customer, I left completely satisfied! 

The restaurant is very clean, and the environment was enjoyable. When I went, we came in a large group so they put us in the side room, so it was a little more difficult to get a hold of the waiter, but they came by often enough to keep taking our orders. 

DEFINITELY will be going back when I'm in vegas!
very clean.  Good food.  too bad it's so crowded now.  Worth the wait though.

This was my second visit. After reading those frightening November reviews of food poisoning I was very leery about returning. I think Alice W was more angry about the service and used the F.P. card. I've never heard of a whole family getting food poisoning so take that review with a grain of salt. 

 My first time was good, I just did not write about it. Today I went for lunch and had a great experience. They have a few new rolls and I tried 3 of them. They were all beautifully executed and tasted great. 

I'm usually not a fan of ponzu sauce but the Iris roll**** off the new menu was so good I had 2 of them. It had  Spicy albacore with cucumber, wrapped with avocado, and seared tuna. My eating partner in crime loved it. 

Screaming Roll****shrimp tempura roll wrapped with yum-yum cajun albacore and avocado with garlic ponzu sauce. Flavor of cajun albacore was awesome. 

Love Affair roll ***shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. This was good, but came in last of all the other rolls. 

Asian skirt steak*** is served teriaki style on a sizzling mini skillet. It was a nice addition to sushi.

Service was better than average. I always sit at the sushi bar. Here you order from a waiter instead of directly from sushi chefs. My waiter was attentive, I had enough H2O to drink and never had to wait on food or ordering more of it. 

The AYCE is $21.00 per person and well worth it. I wish they offered fried rice but there are lots of items offered on their menu.

I will return to Oyshi as it is the best sushi that is close to my house.
My favorite sushi place in Vegas so far. Love the Yellow Tail Trio roll, the poke appetizer, and the creme brle.

This place gets five stars simply from being a non-buffet all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant! I tend to have slow moments so it wasn't until the end of the meal that realized that, with the exception of a few items, the whole darn menu (appetizers, soups, rolls, nigiri, tapas, and dessert) was included in one price! Lunch was less than $20 per adult, which I felt was a steal. The restaurant isn't on the strip but it's worth it for anyone visiting to venture off the beaten path for this great dining experience. Plus, it gives you the opportunity to see the residential side of things. This is now, without a doubt, one of my "must-visit" places when I come to Vegas.

I was in Vegas on vacation recently and went to this restaurant based on it's Yelp ratings.  BIG MISTAKE!!! The service was slow and the sushi was awful.  It seemed like a good deal.. $21 for all you can eat sushi.  The trick, however, is that all their rolls have some sort of cream cheese or mayonnaise in it and make them so heavy and sweet tasting that you can't eat more than a few rolls.  If you like an extra helping of creamy toppings on your sushi than this place is for you.  If you prefer fresh sushi rolls the way they are supposed to be made than stay away!

AMAZING
I have been going here for close to six years and it is still my favorite place in Las Vegas

Never thought sushi could be so good in Vegas, and it's even better with all-you-can eat!!  for $21 all-you-can eat at lunch (sashimi excluded), it's like winning the jackpot!  This place about 15 mins from the strip but worth the drive if you are craving sushi and can eat endless amts of it within 2 hours of ordering time.  The service can be a bit slow and the waiter was forgetful in some of our orders so keep ordering lots each time you see the waiter - just as long as you can eat it all.

favorites: Rattle Snakeroll, Tiger Roll, Rainbow Roll, Eel/avocado Sushi, Salmon Sushi

This place is truly a hidden gem.  The AYCE is not skimpy and reasonably priced.  Hawaiian rolls are my thing and theirs requires a re-order.
Very nice atmosphere and decent service.
I'm looking forward to going back soon!

So sad Sushi Factory closed down!! My group of 6 was looking for a buffet to eat after a fun, but exhausting day at Daylight and with it being July 4th weekend, we knew all the good buffets on the strip would have crazy waits. So, after finding out that Sushi Factory was closed, we got a recommendation from a friend to go here -- around $20 for AYCE sushi dinner, which included appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert (only thing excluded was sashimi). Pretty good deal, especially for how extensive their menu is.

I wasn't really feeling like rolls, so I ordered and ate mostly nigiri -- so my 3 stars is based mostly on that. The pieces of fish were on the smaller side, and (obviously) the fish isn't the freshest you're going to find at a sushi joint (some of the uni looked a tad bit iffy, but I'm also on the paranoid side when eating raw stuff). But, if you're there more for the rolls and other items, I would probably give this place 4 stars.

Service was good, and it was easy to flag down our server whenever we wanted to order more food (which was often!).

Asked if they could use a clean knife to make my wife's veggie rolls so it wouldn't be contaminated with fish. She is pregnant and her doctor said we should ask for this. Talked to two hosts and they were both rude as possible. Said they had no idea if they could use clean knifes and didn't know if they ever cleaned the knifes. Manager couldnt be bothered to help. How dumb do you have to be!! Never going here again.

I am very disappointed with the ayce we had last night . I've been coming to oyshi since 08 and then ventured out since there was always a wait. 
We decided to go last night and the fish was NOT fresh at all . The Uni being the worst - was very brown and I had to send it back . The waitress even made a comment about it....
The tuna and salmon on our rolls were off colored - not the normal vibrant red and orange fresh versions should be. 

The nigiri pieces came out better - super white tuna was the best, salmon belly, and garlic tuna. 
Yellowtail was off perhaps I should've asked for a different cut . Oh and they put double rice to fish ratio which is annoying and takes away from the enjoyment of the fish 

All in all I was very disappointed in Oyshi's decline in quality and I won't be returning . The server was very attentive and quick . She's the reason for extra star . 

LESSON: walk up to the bar and check fish quality/freshness before committing to ayce or even eating there at all !

Hands down. One of my favorite sushi spots in town. This is mine and my best friend's go-to sushi spots. Sushi quality is amazing. We usually do All You Can Eat. Service is great. Sushi comes out quickly. Hands down, no complaints.

1 suggestion would be better discounts on alcohol for AYCE guests.

We use to come here all the time, but I will never go back. The place use to be a packed house, and now there's no wait on a Friday night and I can see why. The waiters are snobbish and rude and the manager has no backbone to stand up to them. On top of that, they super pack the rolls and sushi with rice and if you can't eat it all, they'll charge you for it. Our waiter was a fat dick (not the good kind, fat and an a$$hole) from the start of the night. He barely acknowledged us the whole night. Anytime we signaled him to order, he looked annoyed and wouldn't come over until ten minutes later. Again with the rice, the douche bag wanted to charge us $14 for not eating all the rice. WTF man, all the rice we didn't eat didn't even equal a bowl of rice they normally charge you $1 for. When we asked the manager about it, he was useless and just said, "You don't have to tip the waiter. He doesn't expect a tip." After arguing about fairness and how the establishment has gone to crap, we walked out of there paying $4 extra for rice... You can have your $4 worth of rice along with the out of business sign Oyshi. Rude, snobby employees coupled with declining quality of food ain't keeping you in business much longer.

By far the best all you can eat sushi in town. The staff is amazing and the food is even better definitely worth the 15 minute wait. When they say it's going to be a half hour it's always sooner. We come here at least once a week.
Best place for all you can eat sushi! The service was great and our food was delicious. The best roll I had was the dynamite roll. Ask for Ed, he's an awesome sushi chef!
Came in yesterday evening .. tried something new and it was a blast in my mouth ! Super nice servers as well

Simply spectacular. First time here and I was very happy when I left. The white tuna was perfect. Vince was our server and he was so pleasant. We was so friendly and not overly present, but there before we even knew we needed him. Plates were constantly cleared from the table and the orders were brought out in a timely manner. I am definitely recommending this place to people I know. Especilally for their AYCE sushi. Two thumbs up, Oyshi!

I'm sorry but it bothers me that this restaurant is highly reviewed. Everyone has different idea about sushi but this place disappointed me, who is not so picky about sushi. 

Wish I had the picture of the sushi that I ordered but it's been a while and unfotunately it's hard to find from thousands of pictuers I have. 

This restaurant is great for people who loves "rolls". I enjoy rolls too but I enjoy regular nigiri sushi, which, I think, is the best way to enjoy the quality of fish. When I order Tuna nigiri, the sushi came out WET & SOGGY like the fish was just microwaved and defrosted. I do not know what caused it to be wet & soggy but I've never seen such thing in my life. Sea Urchin is not edible if they are not decent quality and this restaurant's sea urchin was not good at all.

Again, rolls are enjoyable but I don't know if  I can call this restaurant a "good sushi restaurant".
Always good! Friendly staff and outstanding food. Go hungry & get the "all you can eat" special. Parking is a premium so be prepared to look for a spot.

Oyshi's AYCE sushi experience is kind of, well, meh.  It is neither exciting nor disappointing.  I felt that the fish to rice ratio on the nigiri was a little rice-happy.  The rolls were not too exciting.  I would go back, but only if someone else insisted.

I was in Vegas on March 3 and 4th and the friend I was visiting recommended this place for AYCE Sushi. I'm from Los Angeles and we have AYCE here so I couldn't imagine what the big deal was.

Well first off the price was incredible, it's a steal for what you get. There were 3 of us and we let my friend do all the ordering because she frequents here all the time. Of my memory serves me correctly we started with a Poke salad followed by 9 different sushi choices and ended with dessert. I couldn't tell you everything we ordered but the Japanese Lasagna sticks out, never had anything like it and it was so good. I don't know any place in Los Angeles that has anything close to it. 
My friend is very outgoing and the waiter was great. He definitely earned his tip as often as she was calling him back for more about every 10-15 minutes. 
The food here is fresh and packed full of flavor. I can't wait to come back to Vegas JUST for the sushi here. I wish your establishment much success and I will definitely be back

I was regular here but, probably won't be back again :( my waiter kept forgetting to bring things and i didn't have anything in order for me to eat sushi like chop sticks and wasabi and little stuff...food wasn't that great this time either I've had fresher sushi here before and it's right next to my house so it sucks but, service was bad & food was bad so, good-bye Oyshi!

If I lived in Vegas I'd eat here at least 3 times a week! Big portions! The food is so good! Service was super fast! It's  cheap!! $23 all you can eat lunch! I left here full and happy! Highly recommend! Don't over order like we did' we were stuffing our face!

Here is my review:

HMMMMMMM HMM HMMM HMM WHEEEE

My new favorite sushi bar.

The fish has always been good so far and the variety of what is included for all you can eat can't be beat.

Find me another place that includes green tea tiramisu and chocolate creme brule in their all you can eat menu and I'll think about changing my alliegence.

I'm so lucky to have such an amazing sushi place so close to home. They have an all you can eat that is very reasonable and I always over do it. I just can't help myself, the food is so good!! Nice casual atmosphere.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and ever since then we love coming here. The staff is friendly and fast service! I love how it looks inside very modern. We can't find a place that's better then this place. They have quality fish for a great price!

From someone that hated sushi, I've learned that's it's all in how it's prepared....Oyshi Sushi converted me into someone that can't get enough now!  The place is always busy, and the crowd is very diverse.  

Waiters are good at suggesting items if you're not too sure, and the menu offerings are plentiful.  Only once did I attempt AYCE....but my stomach wouldn't allow any more after the 3rd dish. But if you can, go for it...very affordable.

I come for lunch special. 12 bucks gets you soup,salad,cal roll, tempura plate, and stir fried meat dish (chicken,beef,or shrimp ) with veggies. All freshly prepared. Nicely decorated.  A good deal!  American pop music too loud, would like something a bit more ethnic and softer.  The food and service is 5 star though, so that's what I'll give them.

came in last night with my boyfriend and one of our friends they had all you can eat and I just had some of the tapas. The food was amazing as usual but the server was extremely rude she took so long to come back for our orders and rarely checked up on us. I've always had very good experiences here but last night was not one of them. we shouldn't have had to wait so long for our server to come back and check on us. Several times other servers were the ones to take the orders.

servers should know what their guests order. my table only had 5 people. it's not like I'm asking you to remember what belongs to who because it's reasonable to not be able to remember that. I ordered the most simple order out of all my friends, which was 3 orders of masago and 1 order of uni with quail egg. My friends ordered actual rolls(such as volcano roll) that take forever to make and they finished all their food they ordered which was more than 15 different full sushi rolls. I had to tell the server to check on my food twice to actually get acknowledged. I then asked do you even know what we are missing ? and he was about to walk off not even knowing what order he's going to go check on. I will never come back or recommend this place again. I used to be a regular here and now it's ridiculously bad customer service. I already didn't want to come here but I was content with the service last time. it was neither good or too bad. you need to hire new servers.

The sushi is awesome but this update is mostly for the service:

unfortunately, i did not catch our servers names but.... everytime I go, he's usually there.

Both servers were incredibly nice and despite it being close to closing time, they were very upbeat! We didn't finish all the sushi for all you can eat but they allowed us to take it home. We just had to pay for another roll. Not a bad deal!

Wow this place was definitely the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. First of all, the selection is AMAZING and overwhelming. It is a great deal for 21 dollars. Trust me and order the following items and you will be one satisfied customer with your belly about to explode. 

I will start off with the non-rolls food: Must get the surf and turf, ahi poke, sashimi salad, skirt steak, grilled asparagus and beef. There were a few other items that I would like to try next time. There were simpy so freaking many.
For rolls, try the Nuclear Bomb Roll, Lobster Fair, Paradise Roll, and oh what the heck, just try everything!
For desert, you definitely have to try the green tea tiramisu. 

The service was also great and very attentive. They will make great recommendations based off of your tastes. So trust me, if you're in Vegas, give this place a try.

I am still in love with this place!! Since it was just me and a friend, we opted for first available seating Nd that ended up being at the bar. It's a while new environment when you sit at the bar! If it's just you and a friend, I recommend sitting at the bar. If it's you and your family or a large group, stick to a table. But I do recommend experiencing the bar when you can. 

By sitting at the bar, you are face to face with the sushi chefs. You may order your rolls directly from them and if you are daring, you can just have them make rolls for you without necessarily going off the menu (AYCE guests only, I'm guessing). Since it was the first time sitting at the bar for both of us, we didn't know that was possible until we had already ordered the world and we were just about bursting at the seams. We did try a fatty tuna sushi though which was basically made with tuna belly. It was sooooooo good!! 

We also had a bottle of lychee sake. It came in a wine sized bottle, but we decided to take shots of it. It was so yum and it basically tasted like juice. Which is dangerous because it had the same alc vol as wine, and my friend and I finished the bottle like it was nothing! 

Here are a few things that I think would be great to keep in mind while you're here: 
-if you and a friend are looking to hang out, enjoy great food, and be social, definitely sit at the bar and have the chefs make you whatever your heart desires 
-it's all you can eat, so definitely come here with an empty stomach and be prepared to eat the world! BUT...on busy nights, the wait can be awhile and if you come here super hungry, once you're seated, you'll want to order everything at once! This may not be a good thing, cuz if you're anything like us, you'll stuff your face and be done within 30 minutes. 
-if you're paying with multiple cards, make sure the person taking your payment knows what exactly is going on what card. Although  we thought that we were clear in our instructions, she still managed to charge the wrong amount! (I'm not sure if this girl just wasn't paying attention or just wasn't having it because it was so busy, but I remember she was also being a bit rude when she was calling people for their tables)
Slow service. I'll also call up to 10 times literally and no answer for to go orders. Not the first time they don't answer their phone.

One of my fave sushi restaurants! I love the service, quality food and its very fresh. The menu is on point. I really have nothing bad to say. I've been a few times, and both times were on point. Its worth the trip.

I went to oyshi for lunch on a Friday and was immediately seated. The ambiance was beautiful.

The food was really good with a wide selection of rolls . I love how the customize what goes on the rolls if you ask . The nigiri was really fresh but I've had better. What really stood out for me was the desserts 

Our server Julia was the bomb ! She was really friendly and answered all of the questions I had . Although she was quite busy , she still kept tabs on us and made sure our drinks were always full and our tables were cleared . 

Oyshi is definately a place you want to check out , from the food to the amazing service.

Oyshi has AYCE appetizers you can't find at any other AYCE sushi place. The beef asparagus, skirt steak, rib eye, and a few other things are unique to oyshi. Beef asparagus is especially tasty. The rolls are similar to what to get anywhere else. So is are the nigiri. I think the bonsai roll is very good. Spicy tuna inside with Cajun albacore outside. Probably the best roll we had. The biggest thing is the green tea creme brle. No other AYCE sushi place has this. It is so good!!!! Without it I'd probably give 3 stars. But the green tea creme brle alone is worth 1 stat!!!

Food is good.. but the staff seems not so happy on their job.. the whole time that we were eating we didn't see a single smile.. place is good a little pricey but it fine.. i don't think we'll come back here..

Awesome! Great all you can eat price. Tons of fresh fish with as fast as they are going through it.  Amazing selection of rolls. I had to take a picture of the menu to give to my sushi chef back home so he can recreate them.  The Japanese Lasagna with Garlic if fantastic! Definitely come back here on my next trip through Vegas!

Honestly if this review was based solely on the taste of the food it would probably get 5 starts but the service was sooooooo bad both times I was there. First of all they sat us at a dirty table and said they would have someone come clean it. Took 5 mins for someone to get there. Another 5 minutes for someone to take our drink orders. Now this is beyond me 5 minutes went by before my friends sprite hit the table and another 5 minutes for my coke. Why on earth they didnt come at the same time is beyond me and why it would 10 ten minutes pisses me off even more. We ordered a couple roles and some salads. The salads came and we ate them and then sat there and sat there for about 15 minutes before we could even get someones attention to say hey whats happened??  They must have known how shitty they were with out me even complaining becase when the rolls finally did come they told us the salads would be complimentary due to the lack of service. That is only reason they get 2 stars instead of one. Regardless after two shitty service experiences I have no interest in returning.

I've been here three times now because of how close it is to the house. Food is definitely decent here but the service is so slow that Oyshi is almost painful for me to dine at. One time it took almost 15 minutes for me just to get the check and it wasn't even that busy. Service is important to me, but if you have 2 hours to kill on a 1 hour dinner, by all means.

I love Oyshi Sushi! Some All You Can Eat sushi places have a separate menu for what you can and cannot order- not here. you can order right off the menu (with the exception of sashimi, that is not included). They have a large variety of rolls and sushi. I have tried many of them and they are all delish! There is usually a wait, but its never outrageous and the staff is always super friendly whenever I go.

This place's not bad. I just feel like their food taste like any other place. The price is good for the amount you eat. I'd ordered the spider roll, crunchy scallop, seaweed salad and green tea. Those aren't good cooked dishes.

Ok here come the Vegas reviews...yes, it's down the street from my house. Yes, it gets crowded. If you bring more than 4 friends, go off-time, meaning AFTER THE LUNCH CROWD or BEFORE THE DINNER CROWD, especially on weekends. 

Or split your party up but sit near each other. Trust me this is how you won't have to wait and salivate while others are dining and taking their time. (Just kidding) But seriously, like every other Yelper, it is a good deal. 

Highly popular with everybody. Highly.

The best AYCE sushi in Vegas at an affordable cost! They have every roll you can possibly think of and their selection of sushi is pretty good. They always provide quick and friendly service. Beware: if you go on the weekends, expect a wait. Rest assure, they work hard on turning tables quickly so your wait is not painfully long.

Ordered take out. Restaurant never got my order from the app apparently. Even when shown the receipt for the exact order with the order number on it and still being charged, they wouldn't give me my food. They then tried telling me that it might have been ordered to a different restaurant when it was be exact same address.

I can assure you there's a lot better sushi spots in town if you're not restricted to the more SW side of town. Be cautious of Oyshi.
My first time in this sushi place. It was great atmosphere. We ordered all of the spacial sushi, it was good except there salmon that I feel it was't sweet. Service was good.

This place has ALL-U-CAN-EAT sushi!!!!
And the menu for that option is pretty sweet!
It's been awhile since I've been here, but every roll i tasted was delish!  The portions are good and two rolls filled me up fast (so no I did not do the all-u-can-eat option! LoL)
I think here and Kaizen have the best rolls in Vegas....for now atleast!
And the decor is pretty modern and stylish so I especially enjoyed eating here!
;)

When I arrived to this place, I noticed how awesome it looked! It was pretty and spacious. I ordered the baked salmon, baked tuna, and sexy roll. The egg rolls were so delicious! Our server really liked to hustle- she asked if we wanted anything else multiple times, haha! There were 5 of us and we ended up paying $30 each not too bad for sushi!

Use to be my favorite spot in town for sushi but over the last two years I had twice food poisonining from the raw sushi.3 stars because I am sure they can bring it back to what it was a very nice clean place to get your sushi.
Horrible dining experience.  Service was extremely slow. Ayce sushi but I got full with hot tea waiting for the slow food. Never coming back.

This place is always top notch! Typical to have a short wait.

Have had multiple rolls and all are delicious. Hardest debate is whether to order by the roll or go all you can eat. In the end, best deal is the all you can eat just prepare to leave stuffed.

My wife isn't a big fan of sushi and she always orders the ribeye. She loves it (I've tried it and it is glorious as well)!!!

Recently saw they have other locations in town which is always a plus! Try here...you won't be disappointed!

I love love love Oyishi! 

The atmosphere is modern, clean, and always plays the best Pandora Stations! I have been going here for years and have seen it change over time physically, however the food is consistent - and that's why I go back! 

It's located on Rainbow and Windmill which is literally less than a two minute drive from where I live. It's super convenient - the southwest area is developing like crazy so make sure to call ahead and make sure there's a table for you if you have a big group. Sometimes you have a wait a bit to get seated even for 2 people on a high volume day, but if call ahead it shouldn't be a problem. They've been improving seating people right away I have noticed the past few times. Prices are affordable and they also offer all you can eat. They have a private parking lot too. 

Also, during the weekdays they have an awesome lunch special. I ordered their chicken teriyaki which was a generous serving with a California roll, miso soup, vegetable/shrimp tempura, and a house salad all for $12!!!! Who wouldn't be stoked about that? 

Overall, this place is great. I recommend to anyon

Keep coming back and this last time was back to the Oyshi we knew before. The food was great and staff was outstanding. My only concern is their choice of music if you're bringing family or children. That's minor.

LATE NIGHT SUSHI AT ITS BEST (At least, from what I've tried so far)

I usually don't get off until 11:15 at night, and by that time, most sushi bars in Vegas have already packed it in and called it a night, or are shortly about to. Not Oyshi!
Thankfully, this place stays open until 2AM (last call at 1:30 AM) and is perfect for folks working in the entertainment industry in Vegas.

The All-You-Can-Eat option is $27 at this place, and it is worth it! Though not as great as other AYCE places I have dined in, it still boasts a wide selection of rolls and hot food. 

I think my favorite roll was the Yellowstone Roll, which was an interesting Spicy Tune and Whitefish concoction that was topped with yum-yum sauce, jalapeno and CHEDDAR CHEESE. I haven't ever been to a place with cheddar cheese as a sushi topping.

I do wish that the dessert was all you can eat as well, because I would have like two mochi balls instead of 1, but that's a small gripe.

The alcohol did seem relatively expensive. My buddy had a Sapporo and it was $7 or $8. That almost seems obscene.

On a positive note, Dad is not a huge sushi fan, so he opted for the Teriyaki Chicken Dinner. For $11, hhe had a Miso Soup, a Salad, a bowl of white rice and a HUGE steaming hot plate FULL of chicken teriyaki with hardly any vegetables. It was a fantastic deal!

The food was fine, but I just don't get all the hype.  The food is far from complain-worthy, but, why would I eat here when i can go to Kobe Bistro and pay half as much for the exact same fish!?

Kobe is great and is almost always 50% off (they also have ayce).   

Oyshi is good, but quite expensive.

Best Sushi in Las Vegas.
Best Service in Las Vegas.
Best Atmosphere in Las Vegas.
Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas.
Best friendly staff in Las Vegas.
Best Sake in Las Vegas.
Best beer in Las Vegas.
Best Salmon in Las Vegas - my favorite dish.
Best appetizers in Las Vegas.
Best music while eating Sushi.
Will I go anywhere else for Sushi in Las Vegas? No. I drive to Oyshi from all corners of Vegas because why? It's simply the best.
Best of Las Vegas.
Best of Las Vegas.
Best of Las Vegas.

Oyshi is right around the corner from where I reside so of course I'm gonna try it! Well this place rocks! Great service and and an always friendly staff. We always ask for Stacy if she is working and she has never let us down! I recommend the J&B roll as well as any of the tempura rolls...the baked mussels are amazing too! I highly recommend AYCE...worth every penny ;)

I gave this place 5 stars, because i honestly believe this is the best buffet/Ayce for the price in Vegas. I have gone to this place for almost 3 years now. The best part about this place are the appetizers. I love the Shrimp on skewers, Rib Eye, Asian Skirt Steak, Ahi Poke, Gyoza, and many more....Over the years their portions have gotten smaller, but i understand because it prevents from wasting food..BTW you can always get more....Their fresh sushi is amazing as well, big pieces of fish with small rice, and their Baked Rolls are very tasty. my favorites is the Lobster Fair and the Paradise rolls. Word of advice try to get there early around 5 for dinner, or you can expect a long wait. Service is really good, and ambiance is great with a younger japanese themed feel....Oyshi is the only reason my wife wants to go to Vegas...

I'm laying down in my bed right now and moaning. I'm alone, laying here, moaning. Get that visual out of your head.

As good as it gets for AYCE. Really good quality, really good price, incredible service, good ambiance. Basically just like The Ka over in Henderson, but closer to the area I'm in.

Excellent white tuna sashimi, really really good eel. 

Unghhhhhhhhhh.

If you are a sushi snob, hit back on your browser and get a plane ticket to LA at least if not Tokyo. Las Vegas as far as I have seen as two sushi options... Buffet and the type of place you are subsidizing comped high rollers. 

Oyshi is the buffet type. $21 for lunch. $26 for dinner. I did not notice anything different between the two menus. The $5 vig is likely pure the night vig. 

Your options include sushi, rolls and hot dishes. Each is worth a paragraph. 

Sushi. Most AYCE places save $$$ by not offering albacore, ikura, scallops, uni and other such high end items. This is not the case for Oyshi, which makes me wonder where they cut corners. That being said, I believe the sushi is the highlight of the menu. Though the rice is not prepared to sushi standards, the rice portion is fairly small compared to the fish, so this does not take away too much from the bite. The actual fish itself is pretty good considering it is AYCE. Note that each order is a fairly small two pieces, so don't be shy about ordering a lot. Do eat the rice as well, though, as you will be penalized for going no-carbs. 

Rolls. Of the spider, bonsai, ebi ebi and volcano, I only liked the last two. I think the issue here is the sauces are pretty hit and miss. I think that AYCE places try to make their rolls filling, salty and sweet to induce satiation or in the case of bonsai nausea. That roll actually made me heave a little. Don't order too many rolls. It is sort of like how most of the menu is rolls like casinos mostly place slot machines on the casino floor. It's the most profitable. 

Last and definitely least is the appetizer menu. All the meat items suck. The beefs are stringy and sweet sauced up to disguise their cheapness and the chicken is dry. Don't waste gut space. If you wanted a nice surf and turf combo, you should be at a fine steakhouse. I was disappointed, but having a good appetizer menu at an AYCE sushi place would just be a bonus. I think some of the non-meat stuff is fairly safe, such as the miso soup (though don't expect the world). 

Drinks. Didn't sample the alcohol, but you have your usual assortment of sake and beer. Since I was there for lunch and was still tired from the previous night's drive, I passed. Tea is $2.50 in case you wanted to know and is pretty good to share since it is a flat fee for one pot with free hot water refills. 

Though Oyshi is in a strip mall on a nondescript corner of the Vegas suburbs, it wants you to think that you are in Caesar's Palace. Not necessarily a bad thing. 

There are two back rooms to accommodate large groups. Lunch is fairly quiet. I would expect dinner to be loud with the drinking and the karaoke. 

Services is good during lunch. Attentive and even proactive about making sure you order a lot. Nice. 

Overall, it is a good value at $21. This continually justifies my urge to stay away from the Strip for dining. Just don't expect tsukiji quality or anything and enjoy the relatively cheap eats.

Great atmosphere and place for AYCE. I've been to both locations many times and was never disappointed. I'm reviewing the one on Rainbow. Parking is pretty full most of the time because Oyshi shares it's location with other restaurants. If you plan on going on peak hours, good luck finding parking! There's a big selection of rolls to pick from and you get a lot, so come hungry!  I ordered the sukiyaki once and it was super good. Hit the spot. :)

Sashimi is not included in the AYCE. Honestly I'd rather pay $8 more somewhere else that includes it. Not very many options for AYCE in my opinion. No smoke salmon :(. Service was pretty good around lunch time!

We have been here many times and each time has been more epic and delicious then the last but on this visit Stefan was the man anticipation, suggestions, The small convo breakers to comment and joke were just amazing he suggest certan items we never knew about like the takisoba and pork belly both good suggestion. Keep working Stefan up he would be amazing and Suggestion add a long sliver of lemon across the squid with shiso leaf it makes that little peace over the top. Stefan your experience and charisma have shown this 10+ year waiter that te trade isnt dead

Been coming to Oyshi for years... food is great and as usual with sushi places- if you don't eat at the bar, service can be slow during busy times. This place has one of the best ranges of foods to eat on their AYCE menu, so it's a good place to go if you have someone in your part who doesn't prefer raw fish.

This is a must place to dine when in Vegas. I've been coming here for years and it's never let me down. Bring your appetite because everything is delicious. 
My favorites include; sizzling plates-rib eye, poke salad, salmon skin roll (handroll), baked mussels and the Monster roll. 
The staff are always great and attentive.
The wait can be long but it's well worth it. 
Did I mention that dessert is included in the All You Can Eat (AYCE)? Also delicious. I recommend the Creme Brle.
My wife and i have eaten at several sushi places around vegas and we keep coming back here. There is a reason. Creative chefs, great atmosphere, and we have never had bad service.. It's awesome

Highly recommended from a fellow Yelper and also a dear friend who is a Vegas resident and an expert on ayce sushi bars who even made rotd on such, what can go wrong.  He was right.  This place is awesome.  

The locals know where to eat.  And its not on the strip with over priced and under flavored eats.  Its far away from it HA!

The place is well decorated.  Very modern.  Very clean.  However, you don't get the true, authentic feel of a real japanese sushi bar.  But their ways was cool too :)

Anyway,  their fish was above average as far as freshness.  Their rice was tastey but couldve been a little bit more warmer.    I love the fact that they didn't make their nigiri with so much rice like other places would.  That was a plus:)

I'm not a fan of rolls.  However, my company tonight ordered a few rolls.  I prefer strictly nigiri.  But the ones my friend chose was actually ok.

My friend always takes us out to his spots.  He is totally my go to guy for good eats here in sin city.  He hasn't disappoint:)

This place is a really nice spot to go for a nice  lunch with friends or  for a dinner for two. They are usually playing the top 50 charts over the radio and their staff has the young, hip, friendly vibe

They have an all you can eat menu that's $22 for lunch and $27 for dinner (I think that's for weekends). I usually stick with that because 2 specialty rolls alone would equal to the price of AYCE. 

I went for a friend's birthday and we shared all kinds of yummy appetizers, this really tasty sake and of course all of our rolls.

Everything was fresh and tasted pretty good. I would suggest the atomic bomb, pretty spicy but really good. I couldn't take a picture fast enough because it was devoured in seconds. 

My only wish is that they had more options with spicy mayo or ponzu sauce. They had a lot of rolls topped with eel sauce which  is not my go to but it's doable.
My go to spot for AYCE sushi. Staff is friendly and really good at making rounds to see if there's anything else you'd like to order. Drinks are never empty. Food comes out quick and always on point.
Flavorless Gyoza, overcooked beef wrapped asparagus, and slow service. That about sums up my visit here.

"I'm STARVING! waited 34 mins AFTER gettin seated just to flag a different waiter to take our All You Can Eat sushi order. This place used to be my favorite sushi spot but the service sticks out the most (above the food) and this place really went to the gutter."

For the $2X price of lunch or dinner AYCE sushi this place is really not too shabby!  Basically everything on the menu minus the sashimi's on the menu are obtainable for the AYCE deal just make sure you can finish everything you order, or pay the price.
I liked the fact that the fish was actually cold to the touch when I was eating the rolls and what not...it gives me the false sense that it's fresher.
Like most AYCE if you have a big appetite it becomes a better deal for you but if you can only stomach two rolls max, might be better off ordering off the menu and skipping on the deal.

Generally, I wouldn't recommend a place if I wanted to keep it a secret. I would say something like, the place sucks and not to go there. I thought about it, but then then it might backfire and the place closes down. Therefore...

Yes, I am a big fan. I'm not the biggest sushi lover as some people are, but when it's good, it's good. I do believe I've had a wide enough sample of restaurants to know the difference. This place is definitely a place I would recommend. 

The place is cool, kind of a drive from the strip, middle of nowhere strip mall with tumble weed crossings, inside is not TOO fancy, and not TOO much the other kind. But really you don't need to care much, as long as it's clean.

The place is all you can eat, not all you can pay for. More like... You can eat all, for one set price (within two hours). Three of the four pages of the menu are all included for that price. And let me tell you, they had every roll I've ever seen or heard of along with many many more that I haven't. But there are also all the wonderful appetizers like the Rib Eye and Shrimp called "Surf and Turf" tucked all the way on the last page at the very end. Ya we ordered about 8 of those. That alone, would probably be worth the price. 

Between the seven of us we ordered more sushi than I could ever imagine. But it wasn't so much about the quantity but the quality was just as impressive. Of the different rolls I did try. I had, not one complaint. They were as good as I've had at any other Sushi restaurant. I'd go into the names and ingredients of the rolls but if you love sushi, and even if you don't just imagine the ones you like and it's probably on the menu.

Service was pretty good considering how many people were eating all you can eat sushi in the restaurant. I really did expect the sushi to come out one every half hour. But I didn't even notice any wait between drinks, appetizers, sushi, more sushi, more appetizers and finally dessert. In fact, upon ordering an extra Miso soup, It seemed like it got to the table before I finished ordering it. They were that fast.

Eating good food releases endorphins in your brain. A good sign that you just had a good meal with good friends is how much everyone is laughing at the end. And there was plenty of that to be had for everyone. The only reason Its not 5 stars, is because I've had some really good Sushi, but I can't order it here because it's usually a Chef Special at the other places.

By the way, this place sucks.

I can't believe I've never written a review for this..I've been going to Oyshi for years!

Oyshi is the best place to go for AYCE mainly because of their appetizer and dessert selections.  

What I love to get are baked mussels and sizzling plates: asian skirt steak and surf and turf.  If you're hungry, these plates aren't shareable, but most of the time they are.  The asian skirt steak has a hint of sweetness to it.  It comes on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plate cooks.  

The surf and turf is just a few pieces of tenderloin steak with 2 pieces of shrimp also on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plates cooks.  Very tender steak, and the shrimp was grilled to perfection.  

I like to get nigiris: salmon, garlic tuna, and yellowtail.  All the fish tastes fresh.  The salmon was orange and marbleized as it should be.  You can get your tuna 3 different ways, but garlic is my favorite.  Yellowtail I got plain.  Always a good tasting fish.  

Rolls:  Had a few and they were good, but none of them really caught my attention to be honest.   

Dessert: Vanilla creme brulee.  I had a bite of the green tea creme brulee, and that was good as well.  

Appetizers, soups, nigiris, and desserts are well worth the AYCE.

A couple of dollars more expensive than some other ayce sushi places, but it's worth it! They're busy a lot so be prepared to wait a little but. Again, it's worth it though! Really great tasting sushi and good customer service.

I am a huge fan of sushi and usually always go for the AYCE option if one is available so I can try many different option. This is the first place I have gone where I was really disappointed. There were flies everywhere and the food just did not have that fresh flavor I am used to. All the items I tried were pretty bland and almost tasted stale. There are better sushi places around so I don't think I will be returning :(

My oh my what can I say. It was definitely Oishi, even if they did spell it wrong.
I came to vegas to quell the beckoning of the seven deadly sins. And I can safely say I left knowing full well that Gluttony is very satisfied (there's got to be some sort of ironic word play here, but goodness I can never figure it out). Oyshi Sushi has definitely raised the bar for the SoCal AYCE sushi restaurants. I might even say it is comparable to the delicious and the very-missed Kami (RIP)

The SKINNY:
I came with a group of 12. I was one of the last to show up, and I was very surprised at the fact that it could seat 12 people. The usual AYCE sushi ordering paradigm (...i barreled through 4 seasons of The Big Bang Theory) is a check list that is given to the waitress, which will be dropped off at the chef, and eventually you'll be nom-noming your way through delectable bite size raw fish goodness. But here, there is no checklist, you order directly to the waitress. But amazingly almost all orders made by the 12 people were satisfied! This place has amazing service with a very patient staff, and a variety of Nigiri and Rolls that i so deeply yearn for here in california. It's 26 dollars well spent my friends. 

The Food:
Okay so originally we were suppose to go to Sushi Mon, but one thing led to another and we ended up at Oyshi. "they have a better variety of rolls, and most of our group prefers rolls...." Hearing it breaks my heart, but the need of the many outweighs the need of the few, so I had to comply. But! hot dam, this place got some unique selections for just the simple nigiri. Spanish Mackerel? Garlic Tuna? Halibut? Seriously, the Koreans owning our local southern california ayce sushi joints needs to take a page of the koreans owning Nevada's ayce sushi joints. I have to say, they were all amazing (with the exception of the cajun albacore. that was just good. But it's still better than bad)
I have to point out the fact that they offer a free order of Amaebi and Uni, AND 4 pcs of raw oysters per customer. Being that most of the people I went with was apprehensive to raw food, I ate more than enough free orders. My goodness, my raw oyster cravings won't start up for at least another month (seriously, it's like a menstrual cycle. I know, i'm disgusting). 
Everybody speaks of how great their rolls are, and sure they are pretty good. But honestly, I can't remember them for the life of me. So maybe they were more forgettable than spectacular. But who cares, give me another 4 pieces of raw oysters dammit! That's what's important here.

The Service: 
Oh poor poor waitress. She had to go through so much...good thing we tipped her generously (and this is coming from a Chiense man). The service is actually spot on, given that there were some dead times where our food arrived a bit slow, but its a minor issue. Afterall, there were probably 5 sushi chefs taking care of a whole restaurant, INCLUDING a party of 12. 

This place is a bit off the Vegas Strip, but who cares, it's all you can eat SUSHI. and It's good! The only reason why you wouldnt come out here is if you said "Oh i ate too much at the Wynn Buffet already." And that's barely an excuse.
Nasty, smushy abacore, not my favorite place. Just had it for lunch today and now im in the toilet w diarrhea every hour. My mouth is so dry now.

I cant believe its taken me this long to find this place! stumbled upon this sushi restaurant while out doing some errands today and what a hidden treasure! Usually sushi bars have a very boring decor and bland music but this place was playing Trance music.. that is awesome! with beautiful decor to the wall art and the exposed pipes it has a very stylish/modern feel to it. I almost felt like I was in San Francisco. 
I ordered the seaweed salad. It was a very generous portion but my only gripe was it was completely covered in sesame seeds which i am not a fan but know next time to request them to be left out. The seaweed itself was very fresh and the right amount of dressing was used.
Then i ordered the Hawaiian roll with soy paper. It had albacore, shrimp, and cucumber inside wrapped in a Cajun albacore and avocado tossed with some ponzu sauce... heaven. Seriously one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had and I consider myself a sushi connoisseur. 
The popcorn scallops are amazing as well. they're little scallops deep fried and served with a wasabi ranch and honey mustard sauce. 
I had the all you can eat which was only $25 and that even included 2 oysters! Amazing deal especially for the quality. Ive already been 3 times in the past 3 days and Ill probably end up here at least 3-4 times a week. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Oh! and the sushi chefs are awesome. :)

Came in with a smile .. Left with a disappointment ...  I don't really know where to start ... It's that bAd .. We felt like our server failed  in customer service. She took our order and we dint get some of it .. She was blaming the kitchen about it .. Second we got left out in-between 1st and second order for ayce sushi  ... So we're waiting for her to come back .. I have to call the hostess to place my second order while she went to look for the server .... Argh what a waste of time and we pretty much lost our appetite I told the Busser or food runner name osmar  bout the issue .. He was very nice and tried to deliver a good service to make up for the bad service from our server.He told the manager about the issue & he kept coming back to our table to check on us .. The manager gave us 1 comp for lunch but it definitely didn't change the fact the we had a bad experience and we are Never coming back :(

We've had lunch here for the second time in the last few weeks and it's true the place is rock solid as far as I can tell by our last two visits. I waited to post a review after our second visit because often the first time may not be enough of an experience to grade a restaurant properly. Excellent quality all around, good atmosphere and most importantly the food is prepared consistently which is the main flaw with most restaurants, not just sushi places. Service is very good and everyone seems to help each other deliver orders to the tables. We really like the fact that the fish inside the rolls are actually cool in temperature and not warm like most places we've tried. The sauces are light in flavor and not over powering, which can overwhelm and kill the fish flavor of good quality sushi rolls. My only negative remark would be that for some reason, after our initial order the second order (often our final order) which is probably 1 or 2 rolls it seems to take a while to come out. Also today my wife wore white pants and it seems there was some soy sauce spilled on the seat of the booth and it stained her pants which I noticed when we went shopping afterwards, but no big deal since it would be hard to see that soy sauce was spilled on a black booth cushion. "We ain't mad at ya", we will be back for more. We hardly tried the extensive offerings this menu features. The best All You Can Eat sushi in town!

Still one of my favorite place to grab sushi!! Never been to this location and hoping quality is just as good as their sahara location. 

Ordered my usual favorites, Oyshi and tiger roll! Glad the flavors were consistent just like their other location. Plus I get my money worth here because they don't over load their sushi with rice. 

Good food and a great waiter, Stefan makes my first experience at this location great!!
Friends took me here while visiting. Came hungry and left over stuffed, this AYCE did not disappoint. All my favorites, nothing fancy just good sushi. Service was quick and friendly.

So, after doing much research, hoping to find a great alternative to my usual spot for AYCE sushi, I decided on Oyshi, solely because of the great reviews I saw here on Yelp. 

I looked up the website, called and asked about prices, and finally my boyfriend and I decided to make the trip out. 

We arrived at about 8:30pm, and it was a Friday night, so I expected it to be bustling. During our wait to be seated,  I scoped out the crowd, and noticed the usual. Mostly those under the age of 30, large groups of them in fact, and figured this must be their spot before they hit the clubs, considering their attire. Well, it was either that or the fact that the music in the restaurant sounded as if you were already in a night club. It must be set on Pandora or something. Anyway, it was only about a 15 minute wait, which wasn't bad at all. 

So, besides my observations of the restaurant ambiance and demographic, we finally were able to look at the menu. My boyfriend usually orders the nigiri, so we got the usual garlic tuna, albacore, cajun albacore, and decided to try the Oyshi scallops. As for the rolls, I decided on the Sibuya No Rice, Coco, and a Bonsai. I also decided to get the agedashi tofu, grilled beef asparagus, baked mussels and seaweed salad. This was only the first round after all.

We were excited to eat until the food arrived on our table. First the nigiri, the presentation was obviously not of any importance, but you can't judge a book by its cover, so we took a few bites anyway. 

Verdict, 

the garlic tuna was DISGUSTING. It smelled and tasted like spoiled blood. I've had garlic tuna many times at many other restaurants, and this one had to be the worst. It even looked slimy, not because of the sauce, just itself.

the albacore was seared, and also tasted old. It had the same garlic sauce poured over it as the garlic tuna, and it was mushy.

the Oyshi scallops I thought were going to be "OISHI" but, definitely not. They mixed it with crab meat, and very light mayo, and it fell apart immediately as I tried to pick it up. 

the cajun albacore had TOO MUCH cajun seasoning! I usually love cajun albacore, and this was too much for my palate, on top of that it was DRY.

my boyfriend got his usual spicy tuna hand rolls as well, and the spicy tuna looked a little spoiled. 

on to the rolls,

the Bonsai, had the cajun albacore on it as well, but I had to bear it to see if the spicy tuna in the center was at least average. The roll as a whole was not to my liking.

the Coco, was probably the most decent roll on table, probably because each of the ingredients in it were fully cooked.

the Sibuya No Rice, again with the spicy tuna... eh.

the appetizers,

the agedashi tofu is usually my favorite appetizer!!! It came out looking as if it were just fried up, and I commend the presentation on this one, but the center was cold, the sauce was not tasty, and I hate that it is not "bite-size" as most Japanese cuisine is known to be. 

the seaweed salad was not a bright green and although it was crispy, it had an ugly after taste, I've had better, let's just leave it at that.

the grilled beef asparagus was drizzled in teriyaki sauce. The asparagus was perfect, but the beef wrapped around it was dry somehow.

the baked mussels were not baked enough, and the yumyum sauce was pretty tasteless. 

I was disappointed already, but decided to take another round of appetizers, since I knew the sushi wasn't going to be very enjoyable. I settled for calamari, shrimp/veg tempura, edamame, asian style skirt steak, and some other things that were just not memorable enough.

I knew it was bad when I was scarfing down edamame and tempura. The calamari looked good, but the dipping sauces  (ranch and a mayo/mustard mix) could have been more "asian" I guess? My boyfriend ate the skirt steak (aka Korean bulgogi, in my opinion). He even commented "I'm eating beef, which is probably the last thing I would expect to eat at a Sushi restaurant."

With that said, it smelled as if something was burning the entire night we were there! 

Hm, it was overall a disappointing experience.  We have both gone to many sushi restaurants, with my list including restaurants in Hawaii and San Francisco, California, and I wanted to seriously give this place a chance. Unfortunately, Oyshi just did not live up to the hype!

On a side note though, my waitress was very helpful, and service was mediocre, but that's about it.

Frequent patron of this establishment .. It is one of the few sushi restaurants I highly recommend. The wait to get seated can be gruesome depending on the time of arrival and time of the day. Once seated though service has always been great. Their rolls are fully stuffed so be careful, you can easily get stuffed with just a few. Start out light with a few Appetizers then go in on a roll or two. They do half orders also so that's always the best way to gonif you just want to taste a new roll. Sushi has always been fresh here and I hope it remains that way. I've been coming to this place for about 7yrs now. My first sushi restaurant experience and I'm glad its still around! Try this place out, you won't leave unsatisfied

Chef Ivan is our favorite! Always a great time when we come for dinner. The food is always delicious and he is always attentive no matter how busy it is. Tried the quail with ikura and it was pretty good. I didn't even have to order it because he heard me asking the waiter about it. 

Mono is always great too! Best waiter! He is always giving excellent service and even recommend the quail with ikura. 

I gave a 4 because there is always a waiting time when we come. Usually the waiting estimates around 30 min or more but it is understandable as the food makes up for it!

Hangry!!! I only give it one star because the one roll I had was good and because the waiter was some what attentive. After waiting almost a full hour and receiving only one roll, I was basically was ignored at the bar. Hello right in front of you!!!! Not one person asking me if I received my rolls. The look on the sushi chefs faces was " I thought you made them," "no I thought you made it." "Where did they go?" No real apologies or even a "sorry next time we'll be better, so the roll you did receive is free." Nope I waited while I paid for the only roll I had. Next time it's busy, do yourself a favor and get the lunch special at a table and avoid leaving hungry and angry!!'

Where do I start with this place? First of all, we have been visiting Oyshi for 3-4 years now and have had ours ups and downs. When the owner is not around, the place goes haywire. I will say the quality of food is usually pretty good and when the heavier gentleman is behind the sushi bar, we are treated phenomenally. This is where it ends. There is zero consistency. This evening we arrived around 11:30 PM. There were 6-8 tables seated as well as about 6 people at the sushi bar. We opted to sit at the bar. There were 2 sushi chefs for the entire restaurant so we already assumed the wait time on food would be a bit slow but being that it was so late at night this wasn't a problem. What was a problem was the HORRIBLE service we received. There was a group of what seemed to be off duty employees sitting in the back portion of the bar drinking. The chefs were going over to that side at least every 5 minutes, taking shots and conversing, as tickets sat in front of them. At one point one of the servers had to go through the kitchen and behind the bar to ask a chef for extra sauce. The woman who took our order came back once after 10 minutes and once more after about 25. We placed our order with another server who did not write anything down and alas, forgot 3 of the 4 items we ordered. At this point, visibly bothered, one of the chefs told us to order any sushi through him, which we did. That too was forgotten. We could not even enjoy the $60 dinner we paid for and rushed out of there as to flee a very uncomfortable situation. Unfortunately I think it is time to find a new neighborhood sushi spot as this place clearly allows their employees to run the show which shows in their service.
We are very disappointed with Love affairs.It's a little cold.Told the server but nothing she can do.She said she will tell the chef!That's it.

Went here the other day and was the only patron on the right side of the sushi bar. Had already ordered and asked if they could switch the TV from ESPN to World Cup and was told they wouldn't switch it because they don't like soccer. Thought he was joking and asked again and he confirmed they wouldn't change TV due to not liking soccer. Spoke to the "manager" and told her that was the worst customer service I've ever heard and barely got an apology. Got a 10% discount lol. Never going there again.

Oyshi Sushi Bar Restaurant is definitely a must go! I've been here three times since it has been introduced to me on July 5th of 2014. It obviously hasn't been that long ago and it has already taken my interest and satisfies my cravings! I love their Ayce pricing ($21 lunch/$26 dinner) and of course the all-you-can-eat selections! I highly suggest their yellowtail with pico de gallo, seaweed salad, fresh oysters, and shrimp tempura as starters to prepare you for this sushi selection like Kami Kaze, Dragon, Rock N' Roll, Catepillar, Treasure and etc. Seriously though, this place is amazingly delicious. My only complaint as to why I gave this place a four star instead of a five because customer service can take you a long way and two out of the three times I've been here was a little below fair. It took them almost 20 mins in order to finally give us some attention and take our second order, they didn't refill our drinks unless asked and our wait for our entree was quite some time. Asides that, the food is heavenly mouth-watering and the AYCE pricing is good!

This place is close to my parents' place in Vegas.  I came here with my mom around dinner on a Monday.  Not very crowded.  We ordered the AYCE.  The quality of fish is decent, they don't give you a lot of rice on the sushi which is good because that is a total filler when it comes to AYCE sushi.  The price is pretty good, its under $30/person for dinner.

The service here was good, they check-in on us often, but were not overbearing.  The only thing that sucked was at the tables, they don't offer the half rolls.  It's only available at the sushi bar.  So, if you want half rolls, request to sit at the sushi bar.

There wasn't anything that really stood out.  They have specials written on the chalk board in the front.  When we were there, they had a pork belly appetizer, which tasty good.  Nice and fatty, but it was a little chewy for my taste.

This is good for the local area.  You don't have to wait as long as one that is closer to the Strip, but if I'm in this area and crave sushi, this is a good spot to go to.

This is not made up...
