I am a patient man. My girlfriend and I work in the service industry. My girl even works at a sushi place. This is literally the worst service I have ever encountered. 

Sat down for Ayce lunch at 1:30.. Our first order of Nigiri hadn't came out, it was now 1:55. We didn't order anything special, just slice the fish and send it out. We ask the server about our order. She abruptly leaves, and I can see the sushi chef and the server arguing with each other.

She then advised us that she forgot to put the order in. I thought, ok.. Cool. The world isn't a perfect place, and we all make mistakes... But when we make a mistake, a good server should hurry to correct it and make it right. 

Waited 20 min... low and behold, she forgot to put the order in a second time. It has now been 45 min since I ordered the Nigiri.. No exaggeration. By this time I've lost my appetite. The restaurant isn't even busy, the place was half full.

I felt disgusted paying the $47 plus $10 tip.. I tipped 20 percent just because I'm in the tipping industry, and don't have the heart to stiff this chick. She also told me they don't do half rolls. I could have sworn they did before.

I will never come back to this establishment.
Thanks server with the black sketcher shoes.

This sushi place located in a strip mall off the strip is a good find.  We went here for dinner after house hunting around the area and decided to go with the all you can eat option for about $25.  The all you can eat feature allows you to order anything off the menu (rolls, hot japanese items, soup, tofu, nigiri sushi, and a selection of a few desserts including mochi).  The only exception is sashimi.  Each of the rolls off the menu ranges from $12-15/per roll so I think the all you can eat is worth it if you've worked up an appetite.  The rolls are pretty good and made to order which is different from a typical Japanese buffet in which the rolls are sitting out there for who knows how long.  Service is pretty good and the decor of the restaurant is modern and clean.  

I enjoyed coming to this sushi place and for $25, the food and service can't be beat.  Thanks Oyshi for a great meal.
this is a great place to eat. always ask for their specials. you can't just have enough of their salmon belly.
Another great AYCE experience today at Oyshi for Mother's Day!!! I made reservations for noon and was seated where we requested immediately.

This place is pretty busy during the evening, the menu has a really nice selection with variety. The service was truly excellent and our server Ploi was great. The only thing I was not a fan of was the rice, I felt like the rice was too crunchy and not what you expect for sushi. Overall recommend this place but don't expect top tier fish cuts and amazing rice. Just my two cents.

Now that the idea of all you can eat sushi doesn't creep me out I had the best experience and a new loyalty to Oyshi Sushi. The ambiance is hip and cool the demographic is everything from older couples to young Hipsters. 
 You don't feel like you are in the suburbs but you don't feel like you are in a Las Vegas suburb either. The service is friendly and fast. The Rolls & Appetizers are made to order. If you throw down @ the Sushi Bar you will no doubt get your money's worth. They have an all you can eat lunch & dinner special. The icing on the cake (har-har) is the desert. Yes, it's true the green tea tiramisu is as good as it sounds. 
 I have to thank fellow yelper Cameron G for the info on this one

Great service, fresh food. Our party ordered all you can eat. The atmosphere is great here and the restaurant is very clean. The food was better than other sushi restaurants in town. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. Will definitely be coming back soon

Oyshi is awesome. The food is amazing. Love the fact that the menu includes steaks. The waiters are fun and easy to talk to and I always have a good experience with them. They made my birthday really fun.

I just wanted to update from my last review and say that ever since Andrew came back, the place has completely turned around for the better! I love Oyshi again and the service is waaay better!! They no longer mess up or forget my orders.

Loove Oyshi! Now I can say they have one of the best AYCE sushi dinners in Las Vegas. Everyone should try it!
Hawaii friends and fam one the best sushi spots that all you can eat here . Sit at the bar and Chef Ed treats ya like family . The staff here is on point and the food is bomb .

Wow, our food took 25 minutes in between each dish.  Don't know if this is a gimmick they use for all u can eat so people can get mad n leave n don't eat lots of their food.  I'm not coming again.  Good or not, it was a waste of my time sitting and waiting for food.
AMAZING FOOD! Horrible service. The manager didn't seem to care about his poor server we complained about either.

I love Oyshi, but they need to change their lighting ASAP. Every time I go there I get so dizzy, and feel so sick I always need to leave right away. I asked the waiter if other people have the same problem and he even said people have complained to him about feeling dizzy and sick. Other than that issue, try the lobster fair its amazing!

Over the top service and very cool atmosphere!  

I had a Volcano Roll and Love Affair roll.  Both my wife and I absolutely loved!  Best Sushi we have ever had in Vegas.  And we live here.

One of my favorite sushi places! Went for late night happy hour and did all you can eat which is the way to go! They bring the food out as it is made and I really couldn't find anything to complain about.

The sushi is really good but it is the Hotategai sushi (raw scallop) is what keeps me coming back as a regular and I didn't give this spot five stars only because the waiters can be hit or miss for good service

Literally sitting in the restaurant writing this review because I'm so upset with how slow the service is here. We ordered our food at 3:00 and all we asked for was 6 pieces of salmon, 2 pieces of Cajun albacore, and 2 pieces of escolar. It's 3:45 and we still haven't received our food. How hard is it to put some fish on top of rice? They aren't even busy right now.

Oyshi means "delicious" in Japanese and this restaurant doesn't disappoint. For local Las Vegans, this is the spot to go for delicious sushi!  Locals drive from the North (about 30-40 minutes away) just to eat here.

Sushi is fresh and tasty. Get the Nuclear Bomb and the Heart Attack! Even the dessert is good. Get the creme brulee!

If you go for dinner, make sure to choose all you can eat, otherwise you'll be paying buckos! All You Eat menu is anything except sashimi. As of this writing, $26 for All you can eat dinner, $21 for lunch. It will be worth your money.

Waitstaff is casual and easygoing. They play EDM music in the background which keeps the atmosphere upbeat and fun. 

Only reason not a 5 star is because there usually is a wait. Everytime we've gone, we have had to wait 20-30 minutes for a table. 

But it's always been worth the wait!  4 stars for us!

Oh boy I wish I could give negative stars!!!!!!!!!!!! This place let me down because of lazy front girls!!! I was one of two groups that left after being told there would be a 10 to 15 minute wait...all the while watching people leave and observing two empty tables. The waiting area starts to get packed in and this girl is flipping her pen with a dumbfounded look on her face just staring at the crowd of 17 in the waiting area. Yes I counted lol...that is when I talked to the manager, told her what was going on...told her I love this place, I come here all the time...BUT I WILL NO LONGER BE RETURNING. At which point I took my family and left. Good bye OYSHI!!! I do realize there is a rotation to be fair to the servers but that should not matter when the place is busy. But I am pretty sure I may get an excuse as a rsponse. All my family and friends come here because of my recommendation...I will be sure to have them avoid OYSHI.

I've been here a total of 3 times for the dinner AYCE.
1st time:  pretty decent, will come again
2nd time:  hmmm...not as good as I had remembered it
3rd time:  nah, won't be coming back for AYCE, but for a la carte item.

There were a few items that my friend and I ordered that did not taste right.  The raw oysters were strangely bitter.  We let the kind manager/owner know about this and he apologized and took the plate away immediately.  The uni that came out had an off yellowish-brownish color.  I've had plenty of uni to know how it supposed to look, but this was slightly different. 

The star of the night was the agedashi tofu.  Yum yum yum.  Was quite tasty.  Another highlight of this AYCE meal is the fact that you can still chose a scoop of icecream along with whatever dessert you want.  I chose the green tea icecream and the creme brulee.  Was yummy.

The chefs, staff, manager/owner are all super friendly and the service is quick.  Food however...aight.

This place has easily become my favorite AYCE sushi joint after Luisa P. invited me to come for her brother's birthday dinner here. I had a bad experience here in 2011 so this was their second chance. Boy have they been delivering! We had one of the VIP rooms all to ourselves for his birthday because we were part of such a huge party. They did a great job of accommodating our big group and even brought in more tables as well as chairs so that we could all be included.

Be prepared to wait! If you plan on bringing a large group, have someone.. or a few someones come early so that you can put your name on the list. Just make sure the majority of your party is there to be seated. I want to say that all 3x I have came (during dinner time), the wait has been about 20 mins - 35 mins.

I love doing AYCE because as long as you eat about 3 rolls, you're getting your money's worth. Plus, it is fun to share delicious food! Make sure you're only sharing with those in your group that are getting AYCE or else they will get charged the AYCE price as well. They have an extensive rules/information outline on their menu.

I think that the service here is really great for them being busy ALL of the time. They were always coming back to check up on us and asked if we wanted to put in more orders. Our tables were never cluttered because different people would swing by and grab our empty plates, plus everyone was more than helpful when we needed anything.

My go-to rolls: MONSTER ROLL: ORDER IT, JUST ORDER IT! Pink Lady Roll. Spider Roll. Dragon Roll. Japanese Lasagna Roll. I need to try even more of their specialty rolls, I am guilt of sticking to my favorites! For appetizers, order the baked green mussels, they're amazing here. Only a few sushi joints can get it right, trust me.

If you know me, then you know that I LOVE white tuna nigiri/sushi. The first time I had it here, it was amazing. The second time was decent. Haha, hopefully it just keeps getting better because I order a lot of those wherever I go for sushi. 

For dessert, order the Green Tea Tiramisu with vanilla ice cream on the side. Your mouth will thank me, lol.

I will definitely be back!

The best all you can eat Sushi! Customer service is excellent and the food just kept coming! Their Salmon and Ahi were fresh, and all of the rolls we ordered were just delicious! We had a 20 minute wait because it was a Saturday night (expected), but well worth the wait!

I went in recently for a birthday party for a work friend and loved all of the food! We were in a small room so it was hard to accommodate all of the birthday party guests. There were a lot of orders forgotten but with one server on our large party it was to be expected. The food was amazing though! If you are going in with a small party I highly recommend it, but there really isn't much space to have a big party. Other than the space issue everything was wonderful.
AYCE dinner for $26, best price! Fresh fish, which is rare in a desert environment; good portions, lots to go around the table. Smooth sake. Friendly, quick service. All around good eats!

FLY IN SOY 

What is the first thing you do before the sushi gets to your table? You pour soy on that little plate, but the last thing you expect is a dead fly to come out of there! 

Now the fly is not the big problem, the problem was the waitress, instead of apologizing for the mishap she immediately started making excuses of how the fly's get into the restaurant ... I had to interrupt her by telling her to just change the set up. 

When the bill came, no attempt to apologize for that nasty surprise was made nether verbally or physically on the bill. 

Their food is decent but not great, I will never go there again nor tell others to go... too bad because its in my neighborhood .
This place was amazing. The service was great - super fast. And the Sushi! So good. The All You Can Eat is totally worth it.

I love Oyshi! It's the best AYCE sushi spot I've ever been to! Love the food, love the service, love everything! I came with a party of 9, and our server was so attentive and accommodating that he came by our table a number of times to make sure if everything was ok or if we needed more food; even the host came by to check up on us, now that's good service. 

Not only that but the food came out extra fast, usually at the AYCE sushi spots that I go to in the LA/OC area the food kinda lags, maybe because they want you to get full and not order more? Just an assumption :P

All the items that came out were good quality food: 

- Oysters (limit one order (4 pieces) per person during dinner only)
- Appetizers
- Sushi
- Hand Rolls
- Speciality Rolls
- Dessert (limit one per person)

And the selection is pretty extensive! And if you're a roll person, then you're in luck because the rolls are pretty small so that means you get to have more variety by ordering other different rolls.

Great place to go for AYCE sushi. Friendly sushi chefs and pretty nice ambiance. Luckily as I went to the wrong door first a gentleman who happened to be a regular helped me out and sure enough ended up sitting next to my date and I at the bar so I instantly became friends with the manager and staff. I suppose I could credit all the special attention and custom rolls to his presence but then again maybe that's just how they do things here. 

Had a great experience and would come back again. Decent price, delicious rolls, friendly service.

Alright, I'm not an expert on AYCE sushi joints but I do feel like I can hold my own when it comes to sushi. The problem with AYCE spots is I often feel the cut and quality of the fish is usually subpar and or drenched in sauces. Or just beefed up versions of shrimp tempura rolls. 

Unfortunately this place was just that. Two stars for subpar sushi. I do think they deserve an additional star for the amount of appetites they offer as part of the AYCE deal. It's fair pricing if you can house some sushi but if you're not someone with a hug appetite I think the cost is a bit overpriced for the quality of fish.
great ayce, they offer teriyaki steaks and dessert. Lunch is about 5 dollars cheaper

Typically pick up food here! Good menu options! Being from the east coast, I'm not very used to the chopped California rolls but theirs is pretty good! They are quick and accommodating! Definitely recommend it! The inside is very nice!
The food maybe good but the servers are rude. I wanted to sit at the end of bar and they had seats open, but Vince the server had a problem with me sitting there. Place stinks.

Oyshi has great food and I would highly recommend it if you are in the area and want AYCE sushi. The prices aren't bad and the menu has a variety of rolls and appetizers.

If you come on a Saturday like I did I would say expect a wait. This place gets busy  quick which is no surprise as it probably is one of the best AYCE places on that side of town.

After getting some delicious rolls you should try the green tea crme brle to end your meal!

This is my favorite sushi place and the only place I go.  We went in for lunch right when they opened at 1130.  We have never had a bad experience.  The sushi is delicious but this visit the counter was filthy.  They soy sauce was stuck to the counter and messy and you could see the glass rings and food from people who had eaten previously.  The restrooms were so gross.  They looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a few weeks.  It's the first time I've ever been nervous eating my meal.  Cleanliness and sanitation is the utmost importance in restaurants especially sushi ones.  I hope if we come back that these issues are rectified.

Shoutout to Chef Ed! 

The sushi rolls and sashimi were delicious and Chef Ed had a really cool vibe

Oyshi is a block from my house so I eat here twice a week minimum .  It's an above average all you can eat sushi spot . Like all ayce sushi places in town they load on the sauces and mayo etc... I like most of the appetizers including the grilled ribeye and seaweed salad which is hard to mess up . At times they are very busy which leads to extended waits for ordered items . Not too much to complain about though . Green tea tornados is really good !

first time here & loved it!!
probably one of the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever ate!
the only down side is its a bit pricey!! 21 for lunch & 26 for dinner.
but you get what you pay for! everything is made & comes out fresh once you order it!

-miso soup
delicious! wasnt salty at all! :)

-eel/avocado roll
not a big fish person...but i have to admit was good! the eel overpowered the avocado for sure.

-salmon with rice 
i dont eat raw fish or anything..but i had half of one piece and it wasnt bad at all!! it looked and tasted fresh! im sure all you salmon lovers would enjoy this very much.

-love affair
shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster with crunch flakes & masago!! this was my favorite roll of the night! I finished the majority of the plate!! 

-crunch scallop
yummy!! taste had a sweetness to it and this was my second fav of the night.

-beef asparagus
delicious!! loved this and i would have eaten more if i wasnt so stuffed!! one of my favorites. simple but great!

-rib eye steak teriyaki
steak was tender!

-asian skirt steak
steak was tender and could taste the ginger like crazy in this dish! in fact, you can taste all the ingredients they used to make this dish, but the ginger enhances a bit.

-agedashi tofu
lightly fried soft tofu in green onion soy sauce! really light and it was phenomenol. I dont think you can ever ruin this dish.

-green tiramisu
sucked!!! never order this.

my auntie & uncle said their creme brulee, parfait is great! their rattlesnake roll is highly recommended!

I cannot believe the amount of selection that you get from this place. 78 rolls and tons of choices for sushi, plus its not like other all you can eat places where the rolls are California Roll based; I counted only 4 that are out of the 78. They also have daily specials that's included in the all you can eat menu adding in oyster and sweet shrimp to the dinner menu.

The quality is higher than some places I know in California and this place is located in the middle of a desert. I always make it a priority to visit this place at least once when I'm in Vegas.

Pretty good atmosphere...but, service kinda sucked cuz they were SUPER busy.

Even though we did AYCE it was hard to order anything because the waitresses were never available. Like we had to flag them down for everything: water, more sake, more sushi.

Other than the service the 4 stars is for the sushi. Always heard bout this spot from other Vegas locals and it didn't fail one bit.

Oysters were yum. Hamachi was on point. And everything we ordered was pretty much scarfed down like we never ate in days.
Passable sushi and AYCE experience...a bit too pricy though.  Do Sakana or Hikari if you want better price.  Food was mediocre at best.

This place is absolutely phenomenal! When I say that I am a regular....I mean a regular! I try to go at least 1 time a week, if not twice! Its impeccable! The service from right when you walk in to when you leave is one of a kind. I've lived in Vegas for 2 years now and its still my number 1! They have AMAZING Cajun albacore! I always suggest to order that! Another thing, they are open LATE! That's pretty convenient when you are talking sushi----most times you crave it and its around 9pm, no sweat, this place is open till 1am! 

I laugh when I see the dang music review on here....this place is HITTING and slapping with great music! I promise you all that!

Shame! Shame! Shame on me! 

I have been here at least 4 times & have not given them some love!

Well, let me say... Oyshi is my new fav sushi place! Grrreeeattt Sushi at great prices... What can I say? I mean everything here is fabulous... I am a big raw eater - so, that is where I spend my calories & it is FRESH!  To agree with others, Yes, it is $26 for all you can eat!  However, there are also some great sides... they have these lil potato croquettes... sooo yummy... also, they have some steak wrapped asparagus :)  It is so hard to name all of the yummy eats they have there... this is def my place...  I do not mind the drive from Henderson, takes me 15 - 20min & I am in sushi heaven :)

Yes, you must go there! Go there and enjoy! You will not be sorry...

one thing though, since it has become popular a reservation is recommended on the weekends...

LOVE the Iris roll!

happy eating!

your constant companion,

~deirdra
Ate here for my sons 15 birthday. I am not a fan of sushi. However, this place has a large variety of cooked sushi. My 10 year old also agreed that the food was delicious.

I have been here about 10 times, everytime except my last visit has been 5 stars ayce sushi with 3 star service.  The lasttime I went may be my last though.  When in the bathroom I saw a server use the toilet and NOT WASH HIS HANDS, I was beyond disgusted and just flat out left...  GROSS.  Sucks cause this was always my go to sushi spot in Vegas!  Just thought others should know what I saw.

This place has some specialty rolls that are way more unique than most sushi joints. Other places would get repetitive and would lack originality to they're recipe kinda makes me feel like a similar franchise concept such as McDonald's. definitely not this place though. You can go to this place and pretty much order anything and it will be good.
The costumer service always seems a tad up-tight; they never like to make conversation. Other than that, the food is Wonderful!
Excellent service we had Mono and Sia- all you can eat loved the skirt steak sizzling plate.

Updated 3/20/18 Once again Oyshi remains my number one AYCE sushi restaurant. Fresh, fast, fun and open late! They have buy one get one free Saki Monday's and Tuesday's. 


Oyshi sushi is our favorite place to come!! We drive from Henderson just to hang at the bar with our favorite sushi chef Ed! Martin y Ricardo also mucho divertido! He's a lot of fun, as is the rest of the sushi chefs. They also play good hip hop music and will make custom rolls if you ask nicely!

Excellent service as well as fresh high quality fish. I've read some reviews where people say the service was horrible and it took over 30 minutes to receive their food. Here's an idea... Enjoy the company and talk with the people around you instead of staring at your watch. I did not experience bad service. Everyone asked if we needed anything often enough to keep our glasses filled and our stomachs full. 

Now on to the amazing food! We had the ahi poke. Super fresh fish and delicious flavor. Ordered some hand rolls, yum yum and dragon. Once again the unagi and scallops were fresh and delicious. I have to say though that things only got better with the last two rolls. The double screaming roll and the Hawaiian roll made the meal! I used to be a huge sushi mon and wasabi fan but i think i found my new favorite. I was so impressed by the quality of food and the flavor I can't wait to go back.

I used to hate sushi but this place turned me into a sushi lover. Absolutely incredible food. Quality is impeccable, service is always great, there's usually a decent wait but it's because this place is incredible!! I refuse to get sushi anywhere but Oyshi! I've told all of my friends about it and they're all huge fans. Any one who's eaten here can attest to how fantastic this place is!! I wish I could remember our waiter/waitresses names but they're all awesome! Must try!!

Well I have raved about this place before but today I was sooooo disappointed  the food as always was great so keep it up chefs but as for the waitress we had well that's heads a totally different direction...

The place is always made by the environment around and today we definitely did not feel welcomed 

The hostess is greeted us and showed us to the table with a smile but that is where the courtesy ended...

We waited 15min to get asked for drinks, another 15 to order then even thought we were doing AYCE we waited 35 min to be able to add to our order at this point we felt ignored considering there were only 6 other tables occupied around us. We decided to cut it short and just go straight to dessert, we figured some ice cream could make us feel better, but upon ordering our desserts my hubby was given a creme brle when he told our waitress he wanted the berry parfait, it would have been fine had she just apologized when we brought it up to her but she says I pointed to the brle, ??? Well being that he ordered his own dessert we just looked away...at this point upset and confused we just paid our bill and left.... Sorry but no matter how great your food taste a staff with bad attitudes definitely brings your score down...

Sorry to say we won't be visiting this location anymore... Our best advice, perhaps order to go if you wanna try them out!

By far the best sushi on the SW/West side of town. Thankfully I don't live to far so I frequent often. But if I didn't this place would be worth the drive. You can't beat the AYCE. I hate when you go to an AYCE sushi restaurant and almost every roll tastes the same. If that's your thing don't come here because everything you try will be different, fresh and so good!

Came here tonight just to try it out.. not worth all you can eat sushi joint. I don't even know if you can call it Japanese food, not the authentic one. Sadly the food is not good! We wasted $90 for food that we couldn't eat. If you know sushi well this is not the place for you. Very disappointed. We will never come back.
 And to answer to your question. Yes, we did try a bunch of appetizers and my review will still be the same. From the sauces, to deep fried stuff, very disappointing. Sorry to say this but there's much better sushi joints out there.

A little more pricey than most other sushi bars, but the music and atmosphere is great! One of the more trendier sushi spots on the SW. Happy hour specials on fri and sat from 12 - 2am. Good spot to take a date!!

Oyshi sushi have the best sushi in this area .there is a big variety of sushi , sashimi and rolls . The restaurant looks very nice and  clean . The service is good ,too. I recommend this place to everyone . You will
Not regret .

Oyshi Sushi is the place to go when you have that sushi craving! The service and staff is always so nice and attentive our server Johnny was amazing and always made sure we were satisfied. The food is always fresh and the presentation is phenomenal Chef Ed is awesome, definitely recommend!!!!!

We love this place. We have gone to some other "must go" AYCE sushi and wondered why we ever strayed. The fish is extremely fresh...especially for being in a desert.The atmosphere is great. We recently had family from out of town and brought them here. They loved it. 

You will never feel rushed or timed here,  which is a huge plus in my book. The only reason I don't give it five stars is that sometimes the service can get a little slow. But if you love sushi, then this is the spot.

We had a table of around 20 people, so the table was split between two waiters. We all got the AYCE dinner. Our waitress really sucked. It took an hour or so for our rolls and sashimi to come out. We've complained numerous times to her and she kept saying, "It's coming. The sushi chefs are working on it." The other half of the table with the other waiter had all of their rolls and sashimi out already.... we all ordered the same stuff! They were already on round 3 and we were still on round 1!!! Wth. 

The Uni was not good... looked old and dark. Fresh uni is supposed to be light yellow/orange color but this was DARK orange/brown. It tasted as if it had been refrigerated for a long time. Overall bad service and the food was not good. The only good thing was the creme brulee and ice cream.

Everytime I come the Oyshi it is a pleasure..

Whether you want to do AYCE or Sashimi or just have a snack this a great place. There are not a ton of rolls to pick from but their menu is perfectly sized because the rolls they have...are all great. They also do not overload you with rice.

The customer service here is also top notch and what you shoud be used to in good establishments. This place does get very busy during peak hours so plan your trip wisely and enjoy.

This is a great place for AYCE sushi. Not only do they have a wide variety of rolls, I love their appetizers.
The service is ok, not great, but not bad.

I love the food at Oyshi but the service is incredibly slow. & of course it makes it worse when they have a full house too. Luckily both times here I had nice waiters though and when the food FINALLY came after what felt like over 30 minutes, it was delicious. The warm sake was also really good!
Did the AYCE and it was so worth it everything tasted great I will definitely be back again ! 4 stars because they don't offer sushi happy hour

Oyshi Sushi is a smart kid with ADHD.

We went with a good sized party and reservations. Got placed in a side room. The decor is solid but nothing spectacular. The party, with the exception of one tactically frugal individual all went All You Can Eat (AYCE).

Two things:
1) The sushi was great. Fresh, well put together, largelly plated well and highly satisfactory. Nothing mind blowing, but great stuff.

2) They brought it out seemingly at random. We'd not get rolls we ordered and get other rolls instead, no explanation. The waitress was reading our requests back and she appeared to be writing them down, but the correlation between food requested and food delivered was .71 tops.

Bizarre Food Fail: Surf and Turf was ordered. Turf and Turf was delivered. Apparently the shrimp staged a daring escape.

I will return here, but largelly because it's five minutes away and my friends have low standards.

We get into Vegas Friday evening, checked in, and began our weekend off with a night of debauchery.

Food porn at Oyshi. Yessiree, four hungry men and a AYCE Japanese food? This is gonna get ugly fast, real fast. We get there and it's packed. A nice waiter greeted us and told us it might be a while. 20 minutes. Shit, thats it? His reaction made it seem like an hour or 2. Dude! We'll wait. 

The restaurant is nicely designed with modern furnishings. Its set to look very relaxing like a lounge. Like Gerald S pointed out, it's not set up well if there's large groups. The good side is that it doesn't feel overcrowded. 

The AYCE is probably the best and only way to go here. There are so many items to choose from and the quality was not as bad as I thought it would be. They do limit the expensive stuff like uni, amaebi, and raw oysters, but it was well worth it. The sushi was very well made and fresh. Their sushi cuts are very generous. They hardly give any rice, so it was perfect. Everything was awesome, from the salmon, tempura, ribeye, and unlimited green tea or vanilla ice cream!!! 

Like hawks, we swooped down and attacked everything. Nothing was safe. We washed it all down with hot house sake ($7). For $25, I would do it over, and over, and over, and over, *deep breath*, and over again. The food came out slow, it was expected because they  had a full house. The service was simply awesome. If it's a Friday or Saturday, give them a call to make reservations. We left hurting and sat in our car like beached whales. 

You may have defeated us Oyshi, but we'll be back. Back with bigger and hungrier guys. *waives fist*

If I could give this place 0 stars I would!

The worst sushi I've ever had. It was falling apart, it had no flavor and very low quality. Even the hot green tea they brought us was burnt.

Our waitress ignored us and we were only able to order from her twice. We didn't even have water to drink until the end of the meal and we had to ask for it twice from two different waiters. 

I'm hate leaving bad reviews but this place seriously sucked, what a waste of money! NEVER AGAIN!
Great food, I'm very picky on sushi, and for an all you can eat place  this is pretty bomb!! You can pick any thing from sushi and appetizers and dessert

The ayce sushi doesn't taste bad, but I can't say the fish is really fresh. One of the uni we ordered smelt. Oysters tasteless and full of sands.
 
Very slow service. And somehow the waitress always seemed to want to be your enemy in anyway she could. It could be that she was having a bad day, but she seemed unwilling to separate that from work. 

Was very disappointed after reading so many great reviews.

I'm not too sure I agree with the bad service comment people have mentioned, but then again maybe they've stepped up their game since then....But I experienced great service and the sushi was the best I have had since moving here from SoCal. Plus the price was pretty decent for all you can eat. Make reservations on weekends though as there may be a long wait.

I don't know why I ate here, I guess I was in the area and craving sushi at 11pm.  I was excited when I saw that the menu was slightly different than the Oyshi on Sahara.  Unfortunately the food wasnt.  The oysters and muscles were bland. The fish all tasted the same.  
Let's put it this way...there was nothing I ate that made me even think "I want some more".  Instead I found myself trying to figure out where to hide the dry rice and fish  I couldn't stand eating.

Wide variety of food choices. Sushi was delicious and beautifully plated. Ver nice employees. FIRST TIME TRYING SOJU. Yes I got a little tipsy. I suggest the "White Peach" it's fruity and doesn't taste much like alcohol. Get a glass unless you're with a large group because it's a BIG glass 0.0 came here for lunch. Take advantage of the all you can eat. So get here with a big appetite.

They have fried veggies; yummy oysters!! And I recommend the Seaweed salad !! you'll love it ! Does not taste salty and gives the sushi that extra oomf :)

The only reason I didn't give this spot a 5... Blaring. House. And. Electronic. Music... Even on a weekday, during lunch time. I just don't get it?! I mean I can get down with some EDM, house, dub-step and whatever else they play, but it'd be nice if they can switch it up once in awhile.

On to the food. Double Screaming, Red Rock, High Roller... I mean I can keep going. So many yummy rolls. Definitely worth it to get AYCE. Just don't overdo it and look like half the people I see in there. Hunched over the table, sweating, trying to finish that last roll they regretted ordering in the first place! 

Wait, that was me last time. Hahaha
Fuck this place!  I can't believe I'm actually paying to eat here. If it wasn't for my kind hearted girlfriend this place would not be getting my money. We won't be back. Played shit music too.

It was my nephew's HS Graduation and it's our first time to eat here at Oyshi Sushi. We reserved one of the party room for 17 people. The sushi and rolls were the best. It was fresh and delicious, and most important the service was quick! We will definitely return to dine here again. 

FYI - Dinner all you can eat  (Sat) was $27 each. We had 3 kids (age 10 and below) and they ordered the chicken teriyaki ala carte and it was okay with the restaurant. Most All you can eat sushi restaurant won't let kids get the ala carte and instead would require to pay the full buffet price so I definitely recommend this Japanese restaurant for kids who are picky eaters

I went here with my Girlfriend last night, as she had wanted to revisit this place for some time, having visited herself once months ago.  I'll start off by saying I read a few reviews below and have to agree with something many have said and that is that you tend to have to wait a bit to get your orders in and then get served due to how busy the place is. My advice come early or come late ;) there open until 2 am Fridays and Saturdays.

We both got the AYCE deal; I think the bill came out to $64 for that and the two cokes. The sushi was fresh and very flavorful. The sauces were amazing. We had the simply shrimp roll (my favorite of the night), a deep fried spicy tuna roll and a few others. I tried something new for me and that was a tuna roll with scallions, which was a more fatty part of the tuna, more subtle and slightly fishier flavor that she did not enjoy, but I did. We finished off with a roll that had garlic sauce and wow that was seriously garlic flavored, so if you are not that into garlic, stay away from anything with garlic sauce. lol

The wait staff was nice, but again it was so busy they were all over the place and we tended to wait longer then I feel we or the other customers should have.

The place was ok and worth checking out if, you are in the area, but if you live across town like me it may not be worth the trip.
The price was decent.  Service was great.  Sushi was the best I've had for an all you can eat place.

Honestly the only reason why it's getting two instead of one is because the inside interior and vibe is very fun. The sushi, absolutely disgusting. I don't mean to be harsh but absolutely gross. And for how much they charge for all you can eat you'd expect good sushi. The crab is fake, when we asked the waiter if it's not real crab what is it then he was stuttering and you can tell he pulled the answer out of his ass by picking random fishes that are in the fake crab. So 28$ for all you can eat and you don't even get real crab what on earth. When I got home I had the biggest stomach ache ever I had to rock myself back and forth to fall asleep because I was not feeling well at all. I am disappointed will not be back and have been spreading the word how disappointed I am.
The AYCE sushi is one of the best I have had. A new favorite of mine

$28 for dinner all you can eat. Ordered 2 orders (2 pieces per order) of the following: fresh scallops, super white tuna, salmon belly and unagi. Took them 45-60min to get to me. Not a lot of people to have had me wait for the small ass order I placed! Fish was chewy and rice was bland and hard/overcooked. Never again will I come here.
EJ was an amazing server! On top of everything with a positive attitude. Service was great, as well as the food!

great environment, great music (if you like techno), great food, great menu (some real good and nice signature rolls) , i took my girlfriend out there today and bill was 20.54 so prices are great, lousy service is its only downfall =/

Love going here,  sushi is the best of all the AYCE places.  Really like how they will spice it up and add extra hot sauces when I request it.  The spicy stuff at most of the other sushi places isn't hot enough to do the trick.

Great, fresh sushi at reasonable prices. All you can eat dinner for $26, plus free dessert to complete the meal. Only downsides to the AYCE is that 1) it doesn't include sashimi, and 2) if you don't finish everything you pay the $26 plus a charge for any remaining rolls. However, if you have one or two you that just can't handle they'll usually cut you slack. Service is decent and friendly. Overall a great hidden gem everyone should try.

I love this place. I normally get the AYCE sushi and always get my $$ worth. My favs are the Ono, Fresh scallop, Salmon and Yellowtail....heck they're all good.  Service is the bomb and i'm not sure if he's the owner or the floor manager but he's the dude in a shirt and tie, but he's a total team player. He's greeting and helping clear tables including taking orders if the waiter/waitresses are busy multi tasking. The game is always on and the atmosphere is lively and they open late. If you're craving of sushi and have a huge appetite, give them a shot.

I usually love Oyshi, but I was disappointed when I reserved the large room for a birthday dinner. While the food was amazing, it took a while for us to receive it and the service was not as good as it normally is. We had to ask for water and out check in the main room because it seemed ole our server forgot about us. I only had a group of 9. The food was amazing, but I wouldn't recommend dining in the private dining room.

Ate here for a quick bite before doing my nails next door. Ate some sushi and some seaweed salad. I have had some amazing sushi so I have yet to taste something that compares. So it was good but not something to remember. However the seaweed salad was great! They were very polite and sat us quickly because we were in a rush. Prices were good. I saw that they have all you can eat sushi. Clean environment and food service overall.
Awesome sushi! Go see Chef Ed he's awesome and make you feel at home and welcome and creates some awesome off menu sushi creations

This place used to be great but it has completely gone down the drain over the last few years. I will never come again unless the  food quality starts to improve. The rolls are 80% rice and barely any pieces of good fish. The worst part is the smell. You leave there with your hair and clothes smelling like you just hung out next to a deep fryer for an hour. They really need to fix the ventilation problem. It's too bad because it used to be a great neighborhood option

Love this place! Tried many different sushi places and no other has come close to the perfection of this place. Can be a really long wait, but well worth it. Only complaints are that club/techno music is always playing and that your clothes tends to smell like smoke. Favorite rolls are the lobster fair, atomic bomb, Kami-kaze, coco, Japanese garlic lasagna, and the Nyi roll. To go ordering is a simply easier way to go to avoid the crowds. Like to end the meal with the ever tasty berry parfait. Customer service is always friendly with a smile.

Let me just start by saying I am incredibly disappointed this used to be one of our local favorite sushi spots until tonight. We made an entire night planned around meeting here after figuring out they were open until 10:30 PM we arrived at 9:35 PM and they told us they did last call for seating and would no longer seat anyone else a full hour before they closed I am highly disappointed in our experience and will not be back simply for the fact they wasted our time and night

My husband and I, as well as my daughter and her family used to love to eat at Oyshi. I don't know if it's gone thru a recent management change or what, but we had an absolutely HORRIBLE experience last week. First, when we came into the restaurant and sat down, I noticed that the music playing was not only RAP music, but uncensored RAP. I heard the 'F' word a couple of times. When I asked the server if he could change the station he said 'It's Pandora and it's censored."  I told him I heard the 'F' word several times and he continued to argue with me. I had my two grandchildren and was horrified. Then the sushi came and it was terrible. Not sure what happened to this place but we will never go back and will tell all of our friends and family not to go there. What a shame.
really good sushi restaurant for those who like to eat a lot. The sushi is fresh and really good. Its a bit pricey but worth it.

I love sushi and this was my first time here. All you can eat sushi? I said sign me up. I always, always try gyoza wherever I can and I wasn't disappointed here. The closest to my favorite restaurant.
But unfortunately, the sushi was not as good. The spider roll was absolutely amazing but my next two rolls dynamite and catercheese left a lot to be desired. So overall good place. Nice atmosphere and attentive waitstaff. (could also order half rolls which they failed to mention right away) and decent food. I'd go again for the spider roll and gyoza
Fresh sushi. Great setting. Highly recommend for sushi lovers.

Love coming to this place for my sushi fix.  The only complaint is the service.  Even on a slow day when there's only 4 tables filled the rest empty it takes them forever to get to you.. There's only ONE server that I actually like there.. She's fast and efficient.

I simply cannot believe in all the times I've come here I've never checked or written a review, that being said this is long overdue. We literally eat here nearly every week. Our 3 young sons have great taste & lobs family sushi night! Their Cajun albacore is fresh & has the perfect spice to it and we seriously can't get enough of it! My favorite are the Double Screaming O & Tiger rolls, but also enjoy the Love Affair, Oh My Heart & The Kamakzi! We used to always eat the Spicy Tuna Crunch but stopped only because we try to avoid eating deep fried food all together. It's worth a cheat though! Dynamite Roll is another! Quite honestly, there's not much here that we've tried that we haven't absolutely loved. The hot tea is the perfect end to your meal with the dessert options included with the AYCE! Crime brle (my only complaint is they keep downsizing it, it's become about 2 bite dessert...maybe it's a 100 calorie choice) the green tea tiramisu is my current favorite!! Whatever you do, get AYCE & start trying different rolls. You won't be disappointed.  And finally the chefs & wait staff...what can I say, they're phenomenal!

I tried Oyshi on 7/6/09 on the recommendation of a friend. Everything was great! I found my server to be very friendly. She was truly a delight and she was very helpful! I had the Hot Tamale, Love Affair, and Crazy Philly rolls. All were superb especially the Love Affair. While I had more, I won't bore with a complete list.

I will come back for the all you can eat again. It was every bit as good as I was told when the place was recommended.

This place is pretty great! It was about a 25 minute wait on a Friday night, so not tooooo bad. Once we were seated we were promptly attended to. The menu has a large selection, which is great but makes for difficult decisions. We will definitely be back again!

I've been going to the location on Sahara for a couple years now, but I have to be honest that the location on Rainbow IS THE BEST!!!!  Service was a amazing, food was great as always and the prices are unreal.   We recently moved to this side of town and will frequent this location often.  great job!!!!

I am SAD that I wasn't able to eat more because I went there after a night of drinking and was severely hung over. I love the prices and the fact that its all you can eat!! Tip: Remember not to leave any food or rolls left over because they make you pay for it. Also you cannot take food home so order carefully and arrive here on an empty stomach.
Just dine in with four people and they don't have oyster and uni, still charge for dinner price without those items. Very disappointed and never come back again.

Usually come here for a guaranteed good to amazing AYCE sushi experience but my most recent visit here today proved itself to be less than good let alone ok. 
In short: the food and quality of it is amazing, not sub par by any means. I highly suggest their nigiri as well as their Red Dragon and Crazy Philly roll. Their ahi poke is fresh and the bed of seaweed salad it's placed in is on point. 
However, the service (today at least) was below average. It's understandable if a waiter is slammed with tables, if errands for sushi bar needs to run, miscommunication with orders happen ---shit happens and waitressing is a tough job. But when you don't even bother to check your tables on the way of running food or when you're plain MIA for the duration of our longer than expected stay---It's simply no bueno. Our waiter Josh was sweet and was probably jam packed with errands but when it comes to an hr wait for the check let alone dessert orders...well hmm :/ 

Still love this place but maybe perhaps don't understaff?

Setting: 11:30 on a Saturday night. SW Vegas. Rumbly tummies. Not too busy sushi spot.

On a budget so I opt for a teriyaki beef bowl instead of sushi.
On the go so I grab the menu and let them know it will be take out.

After approximately 1 minute and 42 seconds of looking of the menu I am ready to order. I am very decisive, a trait I value in myself. I look around for the waiter who, just a minute prior, had served my friend and me some water. 

5 minutes go by.
Then 10.
15.
Hello?

My friend goes in search of a waiter. He says he'll be over in a moment.

Okay. He finally comes over and takes my order.
It's seriously another 15 or 20 minutes for some beef teryaki to be done AND it wasn't even that good. The meat was tough and not very flavorful. I dunno if it was on purpose or not, but whoever brought us our food didn't bring the check with it. Perhaps it was a mistake on their part or perhaps they brought it over as a silent apology for the terrible service. We just walked out before they could say anything. Does that make me a terrible person? It was 45 minutes for a to go order! I wish i was decisive about leaving and going somewhere else. I know I will never decide to go there again.
Great service and fresh sushi!!!!!!  Never fails that the freshness of the food is on point and the prices are reasonable. Family friendly. Quick service
one of the best AYCE sushi places...not only in vegas..but anywhere.  they don't overload you with rice on the rolls, they let the fresh fish and their creative presentations speak from themselves.

Star # 1 - All you can eat sushi!  I mean that is a star in itself

Star # 2 - $26.95 for All you can eat sushi dinner ;) Good price because I can eat that much in sushi ...EASY!

Star # 3 - I have been to other all you can sushi places in Vegas and this one has the most variety.  The side dish list is much longer than others and offers some good stuff

Star # 4 - Customer service here is great. They treat you with great courtesy and always come back to make sure you are OK.

Star # 5 - Restaurant setting.  I mean they play a little bit too much trance and should maybe mix in the some r&b, or commercial hip hop, but the ambiance is still cool.  They have modern decor, and TVs in visible areas to watch ESPN...perfect! haha!

Come here hungry and beware how much you order.   Here are some good things I like to order:

Side dishes:
-Surf n Turf
-Baked Mussels
-Shrimp tempura
-Edamame (warm and with some salt! lol)
-Green Tea Ice Cream
-Green Tea Mochi

Sushi rolls:
-Spicy Tuna Crunch
-Spider Roll

I have been going to this spot for a couple years now and the food and sushi chefs never disappoint. The last two times I have come in, the hostess has skipped my guest and I and has seated people who came in after us first. When it happen the first time I contributed it to it being busy. But when I came in Friday night, it was pretty slow. We gave our name to three different hosts that came to the podium. We even just asked to sit at the sushi bar. They needed to clean it and they would seat is is what they said. Well another couple that walked in ten min after we did came up to the podium and the girl sat them at the sushi bar first.  When we finally sat, I told the girl that this is the second time it is happen and she looked at me in disgust laughed and went back to the podium. Hungry and wanting to just hang out with my room mate, I let her finish her shift as I enjoyed yummy sushi and laughed with the chefs.

I had a horrible experience so I may have to revisit this at a later date.  

We sat at the north end of the restaurant with one long table.  There was about 16-20 of us doing all you can eat.  From looking around I didn't think the decor on our end of the restaurant was complete.

The dishes were good.  I'm in love with their oyster dish.  The only problem i had was that what ever we ordered, the food went to a random spot on the table.  We were forced to share.  I have no problems sharing but let me have my cut first especially since I don't like some sushi rolls with certain ingredients in it.  Hence, that's why I don't order the whole menu.  

Food is 4 stars, staff is 4 stars, service is 3 stars, price is 3 stars.  So for now, 3 stars until I revisit!
Having lunch here with my sister and it is so yummy. Baked rolls on point, and so happy they have something besides shellfish in them. Our waiter is amazing, and he is always checking in on us.

Went here for dinner, a birthday party, and a graduation lunch and it was yummy! The waitress was nice but she did forget my drink while i sat there for 30 min thirsty while everyone had their drink! but other than that the food is DELICIOUS!!

I have to say this is the best sushi place I have ever been to and this is coming from someone that's from California! Their all you can eat appetizers are so delicious and great price! And the rolls are perfect size, amazing flavor and the service is attentive and very polite. I need one of these in California!
Omg!!! Maggots on the sushi. Health department needs to inspect this place. Restrooms is so dirty even the curtains going to hallway is so nasty stained.

Non sushi lover but loves the food here, there's so much to eat non sushi and it's delicious, I had to do the all you can eat, I couldn't get enough of their teriyaki and steak. It's a nice yet fancy feel on the inside. I will be coming again and again when I have a craving for some oriental cuisine.

Oyshi is my favorite spot for sushi in Vegas. 
They are open until 2:00am to satisfy those late night sushi cravings. 
They have two VIP/ private rooms for parties. 
We always do the all you can eat. There are a lot of appetizer options that are included in the all you can eat. 
Just be aware that they WILL charge you if you over order and have a lot leftover. So pace yourself!
Each roll has a description including they ingredients used. So it is easy to avoid rolls with certain items you may not like.

Lets see All you can eat appetizers:

Might just go back to Vegas just for this: $21 dollars a person.

The appetizers comeout pretty fast.  The sushi is slower. 

List of normal stuff we got, Spider Roll, Rainbow Roll, Tempura, Chicken Yakitori, and Edamame.  They have a good list of Baked Sushi too. 

You can't get Sashimi but I got something just as good.  Ahi Poke.  

The Sushi is made to order.  We we're full and it was really worth it.  You do have to finish most of your rice with the Sushi.    

And to top it off 1 dessert.   We are definitely going to make this the go to place whenever we are in Vegas.

You know how there's good imitation crab meat and then there's bad imitation crab meat? Oyshi serves the latter. It was very disappointing. 

I suggest sticking to the nigiri rolls, or the traditional sushi rolls. None of that spicy tuna stuff, or anything with cheese in it. Traditional is the way to go. We ordered two rolls that were non-traditional, and we found that to be a very bad idea. On the other hand, tuna and salmon were not fresh the day we went (salmon was more fresh, but still...). It worried me. 

My favorite thing on the menu that night were the ama ebi (sweet raw shrimp). They were probably one of the freshest items on the menu. For this alone, they get another star because it was unique. I've never had this before at another restaurant.

Why did no one listen to me when I suggested Kyara for Japanese tapas instead?

Sweet! 2hr time limit for AYCE..  Too bad you'd probably need all 2 hrs of it as service here is inadequate.  

The restaurant was pretty much empty with maybe 5-6 other tables with about 5 or 6 front-of-the-house staff and 2 sushi chef.  The FOH would much rather have their backs toward us and mingle amongst themselves than to help the hungry (me). Kind of funny as It felt we were sat at the table with no server or porter assigned to it.  I ordered miso soup 3 times before it finally came out.  Our water and drinks were never refilled.  Sushi took too long and they just mediocre.  It was just one thing after another making it a very unpleasant dining experience.  

Only thing i have positive to say about this place is that eel sauce is extra sweet without the heaviness and they offer dessert you normally wont see at other AYCE: green tea tiramasu and creme brulee. 

My friends and I just finished eating sushi here since one of them recently reside in the area and he'd mention that we should have gone to Koji sushi just down the street instead.  I'd never been there, but i couldn't agree more.

Dawn C. and I decided to try a new place today for our sushi lunch, and decided on Oyshi based on the Yelp reviews and the fact that it was close enough to my work for me to get there eat and get back in around an hour. 

Oh, am I ever glad we decided to try a new place today! Oyshi is great, $21 AYCE lunch with a huge selection to choose from. We sat at the bar and had almost impeccable service. We did to request plates (they did not bring them out with the wasabi) but everyone that helped us was so pleasant and upbeat, and our drinks were refilled without us ever having to flag someone down. Our check was also brought out before we requested it, which I always appreciate when I am on my lunch break. 

We started out with some edamame, which is serves warm with a sprinkling of salt. We also tried the beef wrapped asparagus because a reviewer recommended it. It was ok, but I was there to eat fish not beef... so it was on to the rolls. We tried the Red Rock, a new roll called the Sexy something-or-other, Baked Philadelphia Roll and the Japanese Lasagna. All were very tasty. Some people may be turned off by the amount of sauce put on the rolls but I personally liked it. Rolls that come with sauces on top say so on the menu so if that's not your style, just ask the sushi chef to leave it off! 

For desert we had the green tea tiramisu and the berry parfait. The blueberries on the parfait were still crunchy from being frozen, and the tiramisu wasn't really as good as I had hoped. But I was so stuffed from the sushi it's probably better for my figure that the deserts weren't to die for! 

I will certainly be revisiting Oyshi on another lunch break in the near future.

Since Kai by my house closed, I have been trowling my neighborhood looking for a new sushi spot.  Ventured a little outside the neighborhood to come to this place, but the reviews were so good on Yelp, I had to go and see for myself.  

Very friendly staff.  Always a plus.  Really bumping on a Thursday night.  It looked like a lot of 30 somethings come here for date night.  Definitely a good atmosphere. We tried to order all of the rolls that sounded spicy because that's our thing. Everything we tried was really good, just not quite spicy enough for me.  My favorite roll was the Volcano roll.  Good value for the AYCE price of $26. Will definitely return and be sure to request extra spice.  Still haven't found anything better than Sin City for AYCE.

We went here for dinner last night. 4 adults and 2 kids, the service was good. 

For the value of what you pay, I think it was really good. We all got to try many things on the all you can eat. Everything was good. We ordered salmon and tuna sashimi off the regular menu also and it tasted fresh and really delicious. 

We got dessert too, our two friends ordered the green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brle, they both liked it, I got the ice cream which was also good. 

We would recommend it and would go again, I'm not sure why the bad reviews from others.

For sure a new favorite spot for AYCE! The fish quality was awesome!!! Great atmosphere, upbeat music playing, but not too loud. Stefan was a great server and very knowledgeable. Used to go to Goyemon, no more!

We were in Vegas a few months ago when a stranger told us about this place.  I remembered the name and we had time to try it out a few days ago.  We got there at about 8pm and on a weekday so it wasn't packed.  We had the best waiters though.  Service was excellent from the get go.  The people that work there are friendly and nice.  We ordered a few rolls and some appetizers to begin with.  We just took our time eating.  We weren't in a rush.  At times, we would take breaks and the waiter/waitress would check to see if we wanted to order anything.  All the rolls were fresh and tasty.  It's AYCE but they ask that you eat everything that you order.  Everything that we ordered was delicious.  We also ordered the seaweed salad and that was very nice.  The music is loud but it is also a place with a lot of energy.  I thought it was perfect.  We had a great experience and we will be back the next time we're in Vegas.

The BEST AYCE spot in town! Fish is incredibly fresh and such a great menu! Everything about this place is a plus. Even the other families and couples eating here are friendly. I think we made friends with 3 new couples in our last gisit

We used to be regulars here, but after the last 3 visits, we're finding a new spot. The food has declined and the customer service is even worse. The hostess, same one every time, literally rolls her eyes whenever someone enters and when approaching the podium, she doesn't even greet you with a welcome or anything, it's simply "how many?" And that's it. Then, after numerous of times coming here with our 1 and 2 year old, today, we are charged kids price for the all you can eat, when all the times before, each server did not even charge one cent for them since all they eat is the rice and miso soup (which tastes like salt water now.) The server we had was a woman today, Asian accent, long hair, and I don't even know her name since she never introduced herself and her name wasn't on the receipt. She was cold and couldn't even put a lid on a child's water cup right, which spilled everywhere when I picked it up. The food, although some were hits, majority were misses. The house salad tasted old, the cold tofu was room temp, the California roll was loose and not tightly rolled... Basically if you're ordering anything other than white rice and their ribeye sizzling plate, don't expect much! Overall, I am disappointed that this restaurant has declined over the 2 years we've been coming here, and no wonder for dinner on a Sunday night, there was more open tables than filled... And we still had to wait 15 mins to be seated!

The lunch specials are great deals and the food is good too.  I don't come here often as it can take a little longer than the average lunch break but it is well worth it on days when I can afford the extra time.

My go-to sushi place.

The rolls are everything. Nuclear bomb, Chung hua, and the tiger roll are my favorite. The AYCE menu is delicious and extensive. I've tried plenty of sushi places in Las Vegas and this one takes the cake. I would give it more stars if I could.

Finally got the chance to sample this southwestern sushi spot.

Restaurant design: very modern. Comfortable seats everywhere, very nice lounge with its own TV, huge counters at the bar. One of the largest interiors I've seen. The only weird thing is how low the armchairs in the lounge are. Luckily, we didn't have to deal with that since we didn't fill the table.

Service: consistent pacing throughout the night. Could be because we were the lounge table, but I'll take that versus sometimes being forgotten.

Picks:

Nigiri: everything was delicious through and through, even the tuna. The spicy tuna was a bit overwhelming for my sensitive palate. Smoked salmon special here is superior to Goyemon's special. Uni is the best quality other than when I tried Kaze's AYCE sashimi lunch. There were some issues with seaweed wrappers from different pieces sticking to each other though.
Oysters: no real off flavors and haven't gotten sick yet, so that's a win for me
Baked mussels: solid
Fried calamari: fine
Lasagna roll: didn't notice much difference with the inclusion of avocado, and good quality
Parfait: really, really good. Fruits and crunchy granola made me really happy. Glad I made this my limit-one-dessert-that-isn't-ice-cream-scoops choice.

Passable:

Dynamite: pretty good, but the sesame threw me off.
Surf n Turf sizzling plate: beef strips and shrimp on a bed of onions and cabbage. Not bad, but not great.
Hot sake: average, I suppose. Best part was that it was a Mon/Tues 2-for-1 special.

Pans:

Popcorn scallop: pretty useless.
Amaebi head: brain drained. I feel like they did this as a restaurant-wide strategy to appeal to a more mainstream palate (you can tell by how they let you order yum yum sauce on the side). Would've liked all off the flavors to be there.
Ice cream: while the green tea was pretty good, the vanilla was not that impressive and the texture of both had noticeable ice crystals

Overall, I enjoyed the meal with a few notable exceptions. It's worth the drive if you want a change from your normal sushi spot. I'd probably come back to explore the rolls since we didn't really plumb the depths of that extensive part of the menu.

This was my first trip to Oyshi Sushi. I had heard goid things about it, and the YELP reviews were mostly positive. The restaurant is far from upscale, and to my surprise the floor was quite dirty. 

The size of the restaurant is fairly big and they really pack in the customers. The customer service eas good, but not great. The fish was very good though, and the restaurant didn t smell like fish. I would visit Oyshi again, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Food was ok. Very poor service. Took a long time just for appetizers. Rather go to the new location on west Sahara.

Great food, great price and Nice cozy place. Love that it's all you can eat but made to order. Buffet sushi never appealed to me so this restaurant was a wonderful find. Will go anytime we are in Vegas!

This place has a great all you can eat sushi menu. Everything on the menu is included in the price except for sashimi. I've tried almost everything on the menu and i loved it. Even the hot item menus were delicious! One of my favorites since it's real close to my house. Make sure you either go early or later since dinner time can have a wait around 7ish.

This is our go to spot for sushi. The sushi selection is awesome, but if you're with people who don't particularly like eating fish, they have a ton of choices to choose from. Service is really hit or miss here. The restaurant itself is really clean with modern decor.

I think that Oyshi is one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  It is a bit of a far drive from the strip and from where I live, but it's worth it.  The AYCE prices are $21 for lunch and $26 for dinner.  The AYCE not only includes various sushi rolls, but also includes various items such as steaks, mussels, sweet shrimp, some nagiri choices, and dessert.
 
My Top Picks for AYCE:
-Ahi Poke
-Kamikaze Roll
-Tiger Roll
-Rainbow Roll
-Rib Eye Steak (comes out sizzling on a hot plate about 6-8 oz)
-Mussels (2 comes in every order)
-Vanilla Berry Parfait
 
Oyshi also has a normal non-sushi menu such as teriyaki chicken, egg rolls, and a beef bowl, if you ever have any non-sushi diners in your group.  The service there is decent, some servers are friendly some are not.  I've never had a problem with trying to get a table here.  My only qualms with Oyshi is that they tend to play rave/techno music there that does not match the ambiance.  And they also automatically add gratuity or parties of 6 or more, when it is usually customary to add gratuity for parties of 8-9 or more.

This is one of my favorite sushi places! The oysters are my fave aside from the unique rolls they have cause of the sauce they use. "All you can eat" is well worth it here & their customer service is great. Food takes a while to come out sometimes but it depends on what you order. So worth the wait though! One of the best rolls they have is the "love affair". You'll love it cause I do. :)

Food is good, comparable to other sushi places in Vegas. 

My friend came here once, and apparently the tip she left wasn't as generous as the waitress expected. We came back a few weeks later, and the same waitress had the nerve to send another girl over and ask us, "so-and-so over there wants to know why you tipped bad last time." Excuse us!? If your service sucks you're not getting a good tip. Extremely rude and unprofessional question to ask.
got the AYCE... overall is good... sashimi r not included in AYCE, and cant get half order of the rolls...

Horrible horrible horrible! Was there for my birthday today and my husband waited patiently for an hour still did not get his food. AYCE . My daughter ordered California rolls which they forgot and finally after 30 min we mentioned it. This was the worst I will never come here again. We usually go to the other location. I didn't even get my dessert because my husband was so livid, which he had every right to be, get it together Oyshi! They said the manager stepped out. How convenient... Should always have a manager at a restaurant especially with the crap service they are giving out. I always post positive on Yelp this is my second review for a bad bad place. Don't waste your time!
Always able to get a reservation when I need and food is absolutely delicious. Favorite ayce sushi restaurant by far!
Always have a great time here. Our favorite chef is Ed. (Hi, Ed! From Alyssa & Kyro) he's personable and good at what he does. The service here is always fast.

Best AYE sushi place in Vegas!!! Make sure to sit at the bar!!! You can do happy hour and half rolls. The server was great he ordered his favorites for us!!! Come with a big group so you can share....

This place was delicious! And with the all you can eat prices, it is a good deal for sushi. I went here Friday night with my boyfriend and another couple, and we all got the all you can eat deal for dinner ($26/person) and we were able to order over 10 rolls and some appetizers and sides as well. We definitely ate well over $26 worth of rolls.

Forget about the sushi restaurants on the Strip. Go here. Seriously.

Located in Enterprise, I was a little skeptical about this place because it's centered within a weird strip mall that had a veternarian's office, Dairy Queen, and a Korean nail salon nearby. Whatever. That don't mean SHIT when it comes to delicious sushi.

With a great all-you-can-eat dinner price and the craziest variety of rolls to choose from, I don't see how you would NOT enjoy your sushi-licious dinner here.

Even though we were only in Vegas for 5 days, we managed to eat here TWICE because we were like "EFF THE STRIP!" and wanted to eat to our stomachs' content without the glare of neon lights.

Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll? I dream about eating it every day for the rest of my life because that would be a DREAM COME TRUE, YOU GUYS.
Oyshi is a great place to hang out with friends and family during lunch to check out the fun atmosphere.  If you are a fan of sashimi, then this is the place to be.

This place is the bomb if you are a big eater! Which I am not but with three teenagers in the house they get their money's worth! The tempura rolls are my favourite and my wife likes the spicy tuna roll. Service is quick and the staff is friendly.
They do have rules that if you don't finish you will have to pay extra for any uneaten item. So, make sure you clean your plates! 
If you are a sushi fan I would recommend Oyshi be on your list of go to restaurants.
Had dinner there tonight and it was amazing!!! Though they were busy, food was amazing! My BF and I had popcorn scallops, dynamite sushi, and red dragon! They were delicious! Definitely recommended

I'm torn.

The sushi was outstanding and the All You Can Eat menu was expansive.

The service was terrible. There were many servers there on a Monday night and the place wasn't super busy. They kept forgetting about us and not once did anyone ask if everything was ok. We did the AYCE deal and after I finished a roll it would be like, 15 minutes before anyone asked for our next order. A few times we had to pester the bus boys to get our server because they were the only staff that was coming around. I saw the server at the table next to us check on them twice before anyone came to us even once. I understand if it's crazy busy and people are ordering sushi like it's going out of style, but I kept looking up at the servers standing around at the bar doing nothing but looking confused. Maybe they didn't know who had our table, I don't know. After we were done with our dessert we just sat there for another 10-15 minutes waiting for our check. Again, we had to literally get up out of our seats to find someone.

Any time I've done AYCE at other places, even busier places like Goyemon, the service has been fine. This was bad service to the point of being extreme.

Come on Oyshi, step it up! I really really like your sushi!

This is our new favorite AYCE spot for so many reasons. The selection is fantastic. The sparkling sale is homemade (green apple is amazing) the desserts are on point and there's more than mochi. Also, they're open until 2am (Rainbow location). Amazing rolls, fresh fish, great service, nice music, and amazing appetizers. An absolute must try!

Glad to say that Oyshi Sushi definitely gave me a good first impression! Although, the reason why I took a star off because my friend and I had to wait for a long time to get our sushi, we were a little irritated. Then again, it was definitely worth the wait. Best sushi I've tasted yet! Can't wait for my second time; highly recommend this place!

I went there tonight for a take out and it took them an hour to finish my order, plus it took another 15 minutes to be bagged.  I saw my order on the counter ready for bagging, but nobody was minding it.  If I did not asked about my order, it will be just sitting there.  They also forgot to put dressing on my sashimi salad.   Hence, the 2 stars.

Yummy yummy. Great service..prices are good...warning the calamari is gross. No flavor. I love calamari but i wont ever order thei calamari ever again. I had them take ut off my bill and sent it back and i never do that. So far everything else is good. I have been there about 4 times no other complaints so far.

Ed and James sushi chefs are the kings of sushi! They made us an Ahi Tuna with wasabi and special sauce on a bed of seaweed tempura in small bites as a compliment and it was something to come back for alone. These guys are here everyday besides tues/wed nights and they make up inspired dishes on the fly. The nuclear bomb is my personal fav! This place is a local must try!!

All you can eat Oyshi Sushi. 
It was good. Good quality. Anything on the menu goes.

But all the rules! One desert per person. Eat most of the rice. Limited raw oysters. Limited hand rolls, and all you can eat ..in two hours. 

All for around 25 dollar a person for dinner. 

I came for a bday dinner and we had a little room with dimmed lighting and trance music in the background. 
Good customer service too. 

It's just a little too strict to really enjoy yourself and to enjoy the company you're dining with.
I love this place. I've been coming here for a few years. The fresh wasabi is really good. My favorite is the Cajun albacore which most places don't have. Plus the deserts are more than just mochi.

I wasn't really impressed with this sushi joint. Typical AYCE format, however, the rolls didn't taste fresh. The calamari was just empty breaded rings with tentacles here and there. At the end of the night, I ended up having more gas than a Texaco station. If someone lit a match, the joint would be flammable!

I like this place not to busy when they open r 11:30am more people started coming in r 12:30pm when we were finally leaving. Great little place and sushi was so good and the service was good also. The green cold tea was OK I have had better. But all in all everything was really good. Going back again soon.

This is our favorite sushi restaurant near our house. We even take the slightly further drive just to come here. Ayce is on point, with great quality fish, awesome servers like Stefan, and a fun environment. Wish they had a punch card!!!

Love the food always taste amazing. Only complaint is that the service is sometimes really slow. I waited nearly 30 minutes to get a simply shrimp roll when the restaurant was not busy at all. All in all ill keep come here just for the food.

Love this place! In my own opinion, this is the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas! There are many options here, even if you do not like sushi. AYCE menu also included rib eye steak platters, and a variety of other item you can order in small portions. The AYCE menu also includes a dessert.
Amazing fresh sushi. I recommend the happy hour all you can eat sushi. It's worth it.

Best All you Can Eat Sushi in Vegas! Not only do they include oysters in the deal, but the toppings are A1. The baked mussels are also a must have. We were accommodated where we wanted to be seated immediately. Our server, Stefan was super attentive, friendly and informative. Totally recommend this place.

Oyshi will always have a special place in my heart. My husband and I used to eat here when we were just friends. We would come at least once a month and hang out at the bar with David. Fast forward about a year...we finally went back to the place that brought us together. 

We got here on a Saturday around 6 pm. Fairly busy but not packed. A lot of new faces, but David remembered us as well as the manager that runs the floor (not sure of his name). It felt pretty good to be remembered and it made the meal better! I cannot eat sushi right now, but everything looked fresh. My husband said it was good, but he didn't want to rub it in my face that I cannot eat raw sushi. Oyshi has always been on par with their fish and it definitely seemed that way on Saturday. 

I was able to order items from the kitchen luckily since they have a wide variety of cooked items. Calamari is good with their 2 different dipping sauces and as was their gyozas. I can't remember what else I ordered, but everything was fairly good. 

I will be back when I can get some real sushi into me again! Service has always been attentive and that hasn't changed. Oyshi is a winner!

I've gone a couple times with a large group of friends for a birthday and we got seated in the secluded area away from the restaurant. I felt like they also purposely forgot about us more than half the time for our orders. Or they would bring the forgotten orders that we put in 3 times as a reminder, and finally appear after 1.5 hours when we are 100% full, then try to charge us for the uneaten food.

The best items on their menu is the Lobster Love Affair and the Vegas Roll. Other than that, meh.

The service is the worst here. Good luck trying to just order for take out, they will look past you for 20 minutes until you ask them for help and even when they finally do, they will still ignore you because they have short attention spans. Mind you, I was sitting at the sushi bar with a menu in my hand and grabbed someone twice and still was not given the time of day. Never coming here again.
