BOOM!!!! Best damn sushi joint in LV, hands down! Don't argue either....this place gets a 10. Their AYCE is ALWAYS fresh, and I dont think Ive seen or heard a compliment in the 20 times I've been here. Awesome vibe, highly reccomend.

Usually "all you can eat sushi" should be translated into "you shouldn't eat any sushi"... Happily, this place is the exception to that rule. The sushi chefs here are knowledgable, fun and skilled. The service here is fast and friendly even when this place is packed.  The sushi here wouldn't pass at the very top tier sushi restaurants in town (like nobu, shibuya etc.) but it is as good as the best normally priced sushi spots in town. Bottom line, great quality sushi and for $25 you can stuff yourself silly... Updated my review to three stars as the quality here has notably gone downhill in the last year... It's not unusual to have sushi come out cut inconsistently and sloppy. Also, service here has suffered. Hopefully push I gets its act together, but until then I'll eat somewhere else.

Very disappointed ! I came and order assorted sashimi dish which is $25, I told them that I dont like tuna and I want anything else except tuna! They told me that the chef says he cant do it ! I don't see how hard it is to replace tuna with other fishes ! Never come back !

This is a great go-to sushi spot. Love the many choices of rolls, and that they offer half rolls. Wish they had real crab, but the items I have tried are fresh. We didn't do all you can eat because a few rolls already filled us up. It's an upbeat, young crowd, and we appreciated being able to watch the football game too! We'd definitely come back when we're craving sushi!

Had dinner here with my cousin and wife for my first time, my wife's second time. At first glance it was a nice atmosphere. The service was good. We got our drinks right away. The downfall was our sushi rolls took quite awhile to get. The table next to us was seated after us and they got their food before our table did which was odd. In my opinion, the sushi rolls were ok. Nothing extravagant or didn't give me a wow factor. It wasn't plated to give a wow factor or to make you excited to eat it. Which is a plus for me. The taste was a typical sushi roll taste. Nothing exciting. Our server did give us a free sake since we were still engaged in convo well after we paid our bill, and he came out with another sake on him. Which was nice and unexpected. 

Would I return? Eh I have had better sushi much closer to my house. Would I recommend? Sure. It's just another sushi place to add to the list.

I've been here a few times and the sushi was mediocre at best. The last time I was there maybe 2 years ago (and the last time I will be there) the service was just horrible. The waitress sat me in a booth with a stack of dirty dishes sitting right next to me in the booth next to me. I looked at her like she was crazy, waiting to see when she would move the soiled disgusting dishes. They stayed there my entire meal. I think I pretty much mentally tuned out after that, but my water glass was constantly empty. I drink a ton of water with my meals. Everything took forever to come and the bill, of course, took forever as well. There are too many sushi places in Vegas to come back to this one to be grossed out having to sit next to dirty dishes my ENTIRE meal.  Service is an F minus. If I were rating the food this place would get 3 stars.

I remember this being my favorite place when I was needing an after gym food sesh.  Back in high school.  It seems like it's gotten more unprofessional and not as yummy as. Before. Its a bit pricey and better looking than better tasting.  This isn't a terrible foodie place, but there are better priced and better tasting sushi joints in vegas

Ate here for the 2nd time yesterday. Service is quick and attentive. Rice to sushi ratio is a good balance. Nice variety of rolls. My favorite appetizer was hiya yakko: a cold soft tofu topped with green onions and sesame seeds in a light sauce. It was simple and refreshing. My favorite roll was the Monster: soft-shell crab, shrimp tempura, with crab mix, topped with eel and avocado. It was so big I could barely fit the whole roll in my mouth. Note, they don't add cucumber to many of their rolls. AYCE is $27 for dinner, with dessert included. Reasonable, in my opinion. Becoming my go-to spot for sushi in Southwest.

ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI and they have a wide variety for the AYCE not just strictly California Rolls like some other places. The menu contains things like sushi, beef, oysters, etc. When you order, it's appetizer/ tapas size so you're usually left ordering more, and more, and more. The food is great, pretty quality stuff. 

Atmosphere is nice, pretty modernized decor, nothing fancy but classy. I like that they have private rooms for those looking to have an event celebrated there. We went there for a friend's birthday and the room that we had fit about 8 people comfortably and even had a TV in there. We were able to watch a football game. I believe that there is another room that fits more people. 

Service was great, they took real good care of us and even gave the birthday boy ice cream with a candle and sang happy birthday. The times that we sit at the sushi bar, the sushi chefs chit chat with you. 

When we're craving sushi and know that we're bout to consume lots of it, we go here.
So the place is beautiful, the sushi is nice and all, but... My husband's rolls arrives after 40-50 LONG MINUTES! And he went for the "all you can eat" menu... What's that all about?!

When I went, I think they were only open for a few months. My friends really liked this joint and said I had to check it out. 

The food was decent. Although we ordered salmon and got lox. Which I guess if technically salmon. Just not very Japanesey. They also didn't have negi-toro or shiso leaves or white tuna. Shiso is a very basic requirement! 

Ergonomically mediocre. Like the counters are too deep ... for a sushi bar. The decor was still coming up. There was a ugly mural on the wall. Although, I did like the little pieces leading up to the bathroom, like little Basquiat post cards. 

The sushi chefs were also quarreling behind the sushi bar. Our servers weren't very warm, but got the job done. They were all boys. I think half of them were from Hawai'i. Not that you have to be Japanese to know how to slice a mean sushi ... but it didn't seem these kids had much formal training. Just sayin' ... 

* off the strip, non-casino

This restaurant is right in my neighborhood and very convenient. They are reasonably priced and quick with Togo and dine in orders. I often place to go orders and on one particular night as always, I ordered sushi to go and waited..... There were 4 servers standing around chit chatting behind a "wall" which was merely a beaded divider. They cussed and spoke rudely about guests in earshot of guests, like myself. I work service industry and understand that on occasions you get rude and sometime intolerable guests and need to vent but speaking poorly about a guest or anything else on your restaurant floor is immature, unprofessional and rude at best. 

You're open late, have great food and are quick with service..... I suggest your team be properly coached on the importance of guest relations and the impact one sentence may have on guests in the building.
I'be coming here to oyshi since there open back in 2009 best sushi  in Vegas hands down to chef ? Ed
Love this place!!aAll you can eat sushi and everything on the menu so delicious. Great pricing too

Considering just the food, I have to say that it's really great here. Really quality sushi here. The All You Can Eat menu also includes other dishes besides sushi, such as Calamari or Asian Skirt Steak. The food here is pretty darn great.

However.... the service here is horrible. I've been here about 6 times and it's a bad experience most of the time. I wait for up to 30 minutes for my food. One time my server forgot to put in anything that I ordered so I didn't get my food for a whole 45 minutes.

I also had to wait to be seated for 20 minutes when I could clearly see that there were about a dozen free tables.

Also, one time I went there and the server recognized me from a week before. She remembered that I didn't tip so generously the last time I was there, so when we sat down, she told us "I hope you tip more this time". I believe that was extremely rude. It ruined my appetite for the rest of the meal.

Fast service and good food, this is currently my go to Sushi place. They have a wide variety of rolls and will adjust the food in each roll as needed. I have only done the all you can eat option but with all the rolls and sashimi choices it is the best way to go.
Friend brought me here after a long wait for luggage at airport..and with the all you can eat menu hit the spot ....  nice service ..
Our good friends favorite place, half way across town and the service is horrible. .......
Good little sushi spot if you live in the neighborhood.

Food is always good. But the service has been very slow lately. Its the second time we came and it took 20-25 min for the food to come. They are usually consistent with the fast service. We decided to order just one more roll and that took almost half hour. At one point we were going to cancel the order but they eventually bought the food. I dont know if the chefs are short? But it wasnt busy at all. But we will try again since it is my favorite sushi place... The service has just been tremendously slow lately.

The absolute best all you can eat sushi restaurant I have ever been to!! 

I'm from Los Angeles but came here with my friends when we visited Vegas.  Loved it so much, that we went back the next trip after that. 

They are definitely not stingy with their sushi portions and you get a lot of bang for your buck.  It's about $25 and you for sure get your money's worth at Oyshi!  Not only are the sushi AYCE but the appetizers as well!  At the end of the meal, you get a free dessert too!  I had the creme brulee which was delicious! :) It would be my pleasure to come back here again!

Came in here for the first time on a Sunday 2pm, off peak lunch hour. There were about 4 other groups eating there with 5 sushi chefs working. Our initial order took quite a while - it did not all come out at once which is understandable, but I've definitely eaten at other places that don't have as many chefs that was much faster. 

Anyway, the first round was all nigiri - the first half came out great! Fish was fresh, rice portions under them were very reasonable. When the second half of the nigiri order came out.. The ENTIRE PLATE was drowned in ponzu sauce.. Gross. This is a big no-no, the rice was so drenched in this sauce that it couldn't even be picked up without the rice falling apart. For this I am docking a star.

I then decided to order some of their appetizer fresh oysters (to wash the disgusting ponzu sauce out of my mouth). They came out promptly and we're definitely fresh. They came out with a little bit of a pico de gallo type salsa on them and already had hot sauce on it.  The oysters were very clean and shucked properly - an observation I did have was that the oyster itself was almost tasteless - as in, no Oceany taste - perhaps they were farmed oysters if that's a thing.  (We paid dinner price to get in on these and the uni/sweet shrimp during lunch hour, definitely worth the extra $5pp if you eat these)

Also tried the lobster fair and spider roll - the spider roll was kind of bland and the lobster fair was a California roll with crab salad burnt on top - I would not order either one of those again. 

The wife got green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brle. I sampled both and they were quite delicious.

Service was ok, our waitress must have ended her shift while we were half way through eating but the other servers were all willing to help.

In summary, not a bad AYCE sushi joint - but make sure you tell them to hold that ponzu sauce if it's not your thing.  Also choose your rolls carefully if you order any - I won't order rolls from there anymore but would definitely eat there again.

I usually come here if I don't feel like waiting at goyemon. Their sushi is not as fresh here but I do love their sides and baked rolls. Agedashi tofu, grilled beef asparagus, and their skirt steak are some of my favorite sides. I like their Oyshi roll, love affair, and volcano roll (ask for them to make it with the garlic yum yum). It's a cute place and usually not much of a wait. And they have great desserts. The parfait and creme brle are very good. Although their parfait seems to be smaller in size lately.

The best sushi place in Vegas, and it's all-you-can eat.

It's been theorized by our mother that my brother and I have tapeworms with the amount of food we devour on a daily basis. With the amount of sushi we ate tonight, this could be true. Lunch is cheaper at $21 per person but I'm sure there are less things to order. We came for the all-you-can eat dinner ($26 per person) and ordered:

- yellowtail
- salmon
- tuna
- mackerel
- uni (sea urchin)
- oysters (limit 4 per person)
- red rock roll
- dynamite roll
- favorite roll
- and like, six other rolls.

The bottom line is that all the fish is fresh, the service is prompt and friendly, but the food can take a while to come out when they're busy (especially since it's an all you can eat place and there's a ton of things to make) so after your first order comes, order again immediately before you finish to insure it gets there on time. 

There is a 2 hour limit for the all you can eat option but I didn't have any issues with it. Most sushi places have this rule as a safety cushion for those rude customers who don't know any better and camp out in the restaurant for hours as if it were their last meal.

The decor is industrial Asian with exposed pipes, bricks, dim lighting, and colorful murals. It's a snazzy place in an unassuming location, but I'd totally take a date here.

With tip and tax, it came out to around $65 for two and that's including drinks and after devouring half the Pacific Ocean. We will be back with the whole family.
As a AYCE sushi veteran, I can honestly say that this is one of the best I've ever had. Food and service, top notch!

I'm going to be in the minority here and state I do not like this place. They have a vast selection of rolls, which is great for that type of sushi lover...I prefer a wider variety of nigiri sushi and other items.

Our most recent visit here was a group of 8 and it was terrible. Our server was slow in taking our orders, and also kept messing up. Our orders were either incorrect in terms of quantity and selection, or they didn't arrive at all. The quality of the sushi was average. They didn't have enough teapots (we ordered hot green tea) so we had to WAIT for one to become available. Really.

They added on the automatic group tip that is typical with parties of 8+. What was suprising was that it was for 20% of the bill. We were so anxious to be done with that place, we didn't even bother bringing it up. And just to put things in perspective, our bill listed we ordered 12 items for a group of 8.  So that should tell you we were in no way high maintenance. I cannot stress how terrible the service was. This should not be acceptable, especially in a town that has a ton of sushi restaurants.

I would never go back here again, especially in a large group situation. So disappointing.

My go-to for sushi! I've tried countless other sushi restaurants of similar caliber, waiting for one to surpass this place and after years, still haven't found one. They have so many delicious rolls to choose from and don't over-do it with certain components like some other restaurants have. Quality is consistent time after time and great service. Thanks Oyshi!

Food is normally good but last night I waited over 20 minutes for one roll. All my stuff came out before my girlfriends. It was ridiculous also the server didn't speak that great of English. It was extremely hard to understand her and she had an attitude whenever we ordered something. I don't understand how a place can have prices that high and not have good service. It's completely unacceptable. I expect to be contacted by management with this review. I'm not impressed and I'm not happy with the service. On a side note they were playing rap and music that should not be played in a restaurant.

Thanks Neal V-G for recommending this place!! Great place to eat before a bachelor party.

5 Star rating for sure, here's why:
Came here after a 3 hour trip from Los Angeles. Arrived around 4pm, with a group of 12. Was seated promptly in the back private room. Drinks were served quickly, left us with a large jug of ice water= awesome. Waiter was very polite and patient with our large group of guys. We all ordered different rolls and shared them. Each roll was delicious. Presentation, taste and size of content to each roll was perfect. I remember getting the Rattle snake, Heart attack, Lobster fare,  shrimp tempura, miso soup, fried scallops, warm saki and calamari. Absolutely no complaints of any item ordered.  Best, made to eat, all you can eat eat (AYCE) sushi joint ever. 

Caution: Do not over order!! Take your time and enjoy each item is my advice. After your first roll you will want to go berzerk and order everything on the menu, trust me just enjoy and order what you can finish. You may feel pressured by the two hour time limit, but don't worry you will have plenty of time and the food is served pretty quickly.

I pretty much had a good time the two times I went here. My favorite are their salmon dishes. Anything on their menu with salmon in it is a definite favorite. I don't know why we can only order ONE dessert out of the AYCE menu though...

The only thing that bothered me was the service. It was the slowest I've ever had, ever. (And I've been to a lot of places, not just in Vegas). If they fix their slow service, this place could definitely become my favorite place for AYCE sushi.

Great sushi, great service. Hostess accidentally gave our reservation away but when we pointed it out she apologized profusely and got us sat quickly. It's a great environment and great food. We have been coming here for many years and we will continue.

Had dinner with a party of three on a Sunday night in April. We were seated promptly and our drink order was taken soon after. We all had AYCE and it was
delicious. I had the Red Rock Signature Roll, Snow Mountain Signature Roll and Salmon Lovers Roll. They were all delicious. I would also recommend having a refreshing Berry Parfait with Green Tea Ice Cream!

Food quality was tasty, but the rolls have too many layers of rice! Service was disappointing, the waiter delivered my drink holding the rim of my cup - gross! The menu didn't have the correct pricing, so I was over charged, when I got my bill, I questioned it and I was challenged - I pointed out their error was told "it's already in the system, I can't change it" - Bad customer service.
Went halves with a friend. Rib eye steak teriyaki was alright, but the gyudon was really good. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.

This place is A-OK indeed. The all-you-can eat is very enticing the first 3 times you have it but after that, I can't even imagine putting myself through that again. All-you-can eat on the menu except sashimi means you will stuffing yourself with rice at the end of the night which is not very enjoyable.

The best  deal is the kid's Ninja Meal which is what I want to eat every time I go here but I can't...They're very strict on it. I brought my nephew here last time and he was sleeping so I thought I could order this Ninja meal and take it to go for him. Well NO! "Kid's sleeping can't do it. Only when he wakes up." 

Bottom line. Obviously I'd eat here. But I'm not proud of it. I feel like I'm in a bad relationship where my girlfriend is abusive and I still take it. Thank god there's plenty of fishes in the sea...

I frequent this place. Not for the sushi.  The sushi is fresh but not super creative. I love that the all you can eat includes the appetizers which I love! The shrimp yakitori and sizzling plates keep me coming back! The service is amazing also. Jane may be the best server I've ever had.
Great sushi...All u can eat... Redrock, tigerroll, popcorn scallops and Japanese ribeye awesome!!!
Very good neighborhood sushi spot. I got the AYCE. Customer service was friendly. I will come back again and ag

Great food and drinks. We didn't have the best service. They did run out of the plum wine which is my favorite but she did have recommendations for other types drinks. We ordered entree and several rolls everything tasted great.

Been going here for over a year now, after hearing that it was the LVRJ's editor's choice for Best of Las Vegas. Proximity to home was a big plus, of course!

It will likely remain my favorite, but I was incredibly embarrassed last night when bringing friends from the UK there for dinner after talking the place up so much. The service was WAY off, although the food was still excellent. They recently opened a new location on Sahara, so I'm hoping that this was just a matter of a bunch of trainees not knowing what they were doing (everyone looked new and got orders wrong, not providing place settings until after food was already served, not knowing which tables ordered what food, etc.).

Here's hoping that's all it was. I still suggest everyone give them a chance, as the actual food will not disappoint!

I have always been a fan of Oyshi Sushi as it took my sushi virginity! I wish the prices dropped to be more comparable to other sushi spots in the area but all one can do is hope. AYCE is the safest bet for a dinner out with a table for two or more. You ensure no one will need to wash dishes in the back if they get carried away with indulging. We all have those dinner friends who have the mindset of caviar budgets but the reality of dollar-value-menu wallets. 

Service is usually a hit or miss. I've gotten service that has made me not want to leave. On the other hand I've experienced servers at this establishment that made me want to request take-out. (which they do offer). 

The draw back for this place is they don't do half orders like other spots. It's also nowhere near the strip. Which is a catch-22. The wait can be timely depending on the day of the week. If it were closer to the strip it would be an endless wait.

Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and the Japanese Lasagna are my favorites!

Food is outstanding. Most of the time the service is good. Went one day after class and had to wait one hour for our food, but the quality of the sushi made up for it. Always go for the love affair roll. If you're going to get more than three rolls and you have a big stomach you might as well go for the all you can eat.
Spending Christmas Eve at Oyshi enjoy the amazing sushi and holiday spirit. This restaurant is always unmatched.

BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER. 
BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER. 
B_E_S_T  S_U_S_H_I B_U_F_F_E_T E_V_E_R!!!!!!

Okay, if this obnoxious review cannot convince you to try it out, then perhaps all the other positive ones will! 

Thanks to Yelp!, my friends took us here several months ago and the eight of us who went loved it! It seriously beat all the sushi-buffets I have ever been to. The sushi buffet menu is comprehensive! Every type of roll you can think of, Maki sushi, miso-soup, wakame salad(!!!), etc. etc. It even features menu items that even non-sushi lovers would enjoy -- tons of appetizers, surf and turf steak and shrimp, terayiki, tempura, etc. It comes with free tea, and a free dessert after your meal. And it's less expensive than a Vegas buffet! 

Totally worth it!! I went again a second time and introduced it to a new group and it did not disappoint. 

The only gripe I have is they have a rule that you have to eat most of the rice or there will be a surcharge. Only a slight bummer, but I cannot blame them. It is still a very fabulous place worth spending the $$$ you earned gambling!!!
I ate there on 4th of July and got food poisoning. I felt it was weird since the fish wasn't really cold. But now I'm spending my 4th of July on the toliet. I'm never coming back to this place.

I really like this place. $26.00 all you can eat sushi and hot entres for dinner...and not cafeteria style where everything is already made for the taking...the food is made to order. It annoyed me that the seemingly easy to make sushi, nigiri, took the longest to be served. The rolls came like clockwork but I had to remind the waitress several times that my sake, hamachi and unagi nigiri hadn't come yet. By the way the unagi was cold and didn't taste fresh.

Living in the Bay Area, this place was a pleasant surprise in terms of quality and price. I will try again before heading back...perhaps a second chance at 4 stars. I'm assuming that there are 5 star sushi places in Vegas, but I would probably pay double the price for less food.

It's all good, really....Me and my lady went on a Friday and had to wait 20-30mins but it was worth the wait. Got the all-you-can-eat YES!!! and everything I ordered was good.  Great place for a date...Cool music too.

Went here for my birthday. IT WAS AWSOME!!!
Food: 5 stars!
I used to not like sushi. But I decided to give it another try, see if I'll change my mind. After our visit, I discovered MY NEWFOUND LOVE!! Sushi!!!

Price: 5 stars!
Prices were reasonable. We went for their all-you-can-eat that costed about $26/person. I must say, we ate so much I think the store will go bankrupt! Jk. 

Service: 5 stars! 
Our server was also very nice. He always checked in on us to see if we're doing good. Very polite and quick. It seems like all of the servers there were.

Worth the time and money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!
One of my favorite all you can eat sushi spots in Vegas! I've only dined at the sushi bar. Chefs are amazing and will remember exactly what you order after you've gone a few times.  A++++

I almost wrote this place off for the unusual amount of time I spent waiting to be seated but patience paid off.  I ordered the AYCE (All You Can Eat) lunch & had an egg roll, a spicy tuna crunch roll & a rainbow roll.  I informed my server of my food sensitivities & she assured me that I can make omissions :-) (some sushi places are funny about that)  My eggroll was ok, nothing special, but I have to say that both my sushi rolls were very tasty & fresh.  Although not totally family friendly, its a relaxed enough atmosphere that you could totally bring the kiddos.  The bathroom although small was neat & clean.  My one note is in regards to service.  The staff wasn't especially friendly nor were they cold.  A smile here or there definitely would earn another star.  That being said, a must for sushi lovers especially with the wide variety of choices on the AYCE menu.  I would definitely eat here again.
Ask for Chef Ed!  He's the best!  He'll make the best off-menu treats if you ask him, but make sure to sit at the bar.

I'm not from Vegas but today marks my 3rd time coming here and I look forward to making it a tradition each time i'm in town. This place is awesome. It's a bit of a drive off the strip, about 10 minutes but well worth it.
It has a nice ambiance perfect for a date or a night out with the girls. There were quite a bit of families there also. 26 dollars ! All you can eat. I've been to many AYCE sushi places and they always give you fewer choices and just the basic appetizers and maybe a green tea ice cream for dessert. Not this place. They have a huge selection of rolls. They are so delicious. Ummm. They have so many appetizers to choose from. If your a meat eater you will appreciate it because they offer a lot of meat dishes. Last but not least if you have room the dessert is heavenly. They have creme brulee, green tea tiramisu, berry parfaits and one other that I cannot recall. 
All this for 26 bucks. It's unbelievable that you can get all this and still have great quality. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that on Friday and Saturday nights it gets busy so you may have to wait a while for them to come back and get your 2nd orders. This still doesn't deter me from giving them 5 stars because the servers are really helpful and cordial when they do come back.

We come here when we want all you can eat sushi. I love that they have so many different rolls to choose from. Everything tastes delicious every time. My 5 year old loves them too!
 The service on the other hand is a hit or miss. The last time we went in it wasn't very busy, but we had to wait forever for our food! It was like they were out catching the fish as we were waiting for it.

So what makes a great sushi restaurant?  Great Service, Nice entertaining sushi chefs and most of all yummy fresh cut fish!  Sadly Oyshi had NONE of these qualities.  First of all the hostess Kassidy was the rudest restaurant host I have ever encountered. We got there at 5:45 pm on Tuesday.  There were 12 open seats at the bar and many open tables.  She said there was a wait because there were not enough servers for any more guests and the next server comes at 6pm.  So we said we would wait till 6.  At the appointed time, she escorted us to the very end of the bar where there was no visibility of the fish cases or the chefs and there were 10 empty prime seats in the center of the bar.  Really?  When we questioned her, she rudely said, "I don't make the rules, the bar for servers is split in 2"   So the rules are  give the first guests to arrive for the evening the worst possible seat????  She reluctantly moved us and stomped away in a huff.  The server was only slightly more friendly.  Oh and guess what, you can't speak to the chefs.  You have to order through the server who only comes around rarely.  We decided to order a la cart instead of all you can eat because we prefer cut fish.   

Unfortunately the albacore fish was gross and mealy and we had to send it back.  My poor husband ate a couple of pieces of it and paid the price this morning.  The other fish plates were cut thick and not refined.  Most of the fish is pre-cut in the case making it dry out.  I ordered a grilled hamachi kamma, (cheek) and was told it would take 20 minutes.  Well no wonder it came out overcooked and dry because it probably only needs to broil 5 minutes.  They also covered it in masago eggs which i hate and I had ask to have them removed.  The rolls had the TINIEST cut piece of fish I've ever gotten in a roll.   I asked for seared tuna nigiri and got the wrong order.   I also ordered eel nigiri and it was grilled eel but COLD,  so they also grill that ahead of time and serve it cold,  YUCK.  Its the fresh warm juicy eel that makes it good.  The "rice" under the nigiri was I'm not sure what.  It was not whole kernels of rice but some kind of rice paste.  I could not find one kernel of rice in it.  It tasted fishy and gross like rice pulp, elmers glue and fish water mushed up.  It was not edible.  

At the end of our meal, the waiting area was full but there were 6 empty tables.  The hostess takes great pride in her little power of NOT SEATING guests.  I wanted to tell them RUN!  and save your money and your tummy.  Her bad attitude definitely sets off the experience to be bad. I have no idea how this place is popular when the only decent thing we ate was the edamame.  

We only went here because our favorite place had no seating from being so full on a tuesday night at 5:30 pm.  Next time we will make reservations at our normal place and spare ourselves from this bad treatment and bad food.  

I see other recent bad reviews so take note people....

Walking in, the decor is chic and modern.  The music is hip lounge style music - and I swear someone has stolen my Upbeat station on Pandora.  The staff is young, friendly, and fast paced.   

The food comes two ways - ALL YOU CAN EAT or ala carte. I opted for the more modest ala option as I am flying solo.  The food tastes fresh, the presentation lovely, and the delivery onto the plate quite speedy.  My only complaint about the food was that the rolls are packed very tightly...loose rolls aren't awesome.  I can understand how an AYCE would require trading speed for firmness but would rather have the firmness especially via ala carte ordering. 

All in all it was a pleasant experience and I will likely return. Four out of five stars for what it is.

I have gotten sushi from here in the past and it's been pretty good at reasonable prices. Recently went there again and was extremely disappointed with my order. I ordered off the Sushi menu which i have done before. My total came to $8.65 which seemed reasonable for two basic sushi rolls (salmon and spicy tuna) 
What I received was literally 4 bites (see photo)
So disappointed!
Went back in to ask the girl in front if there had been a mix up. She informed me that i ordered off the "nigiri menu" 
It was the menu she handed me and said sushi on the top -_-

That being said, the two stars are for the salmon "nigiri" which was a tasty two bites, and the ponzu sauce

Definitely will not be returning to this place unless they fix the menu and stop overcharging :/

$27 for all you can eat dinner was too much to pay for my group of 5 and it wasn't worth it. We should've just ordered 1 or 2 items each and it would've been cheaper at the end. Appetizers, salads and the scallops had very small proportions. Rolls were okay, only roll we liked was the Tiger roll. It's not worth coming back, spent too much money plus service was ehh barely checked on us, always had to wave him down.
Gotta love this place. Great Food and Great service and the staff is pro. Its my go to for sushi.

Been here enough times to state that the food is very good, service is great, AYCE is tops and the place has a nice ambiance. 
I highly recommend the Tiger roll, spicy tuna roll, poke salad, and the ribeye. Stay away from the cucumber salad. Too much dressing with a weird aftertaste. I think the chef just had a heavy hand that night with the dressing.
My friend loves their baked mussels. I'm not a fan of mussels so none for me. 
AYE includes a choice of dessert. Their berry parfait with your choice of vanilla or green tea ice cream is devine! They also have mochi and green tea tiramisu. Stay away from that green tea tiramisu...not good at all!! Other than that great place to tame a AYE sushi craving with fantastic hot dishes!

Great environment and good sushi. Definitely one of the better AYCE sushi restaurant in the Vegas area, however, there are some others with better quality fish.

My only "complaint?" They serve a high rice-to-fish ratio to fill you up faster. This is quite common with AYCE places, but there are a few places out there that load the fish and use an appropriate/smaller amount of rice. 

Other than that, it is a wonderful place to eat around the Enterprise/Blue Diamond areas!!

Everything is still about the same..missing food items..long wait times for a place that's not even busy. Food/Service is still hit or miss. Great music. Bussers on point.  Not sure what the problem is,this place can rock harder. Asked for condiments to be eaten with food,server talked for 15 minutes after food came out.  Had to ask for condiments again as good got cold. This place has the potential yet consistently lacks...WHY?? Ambience is there, Food quality is there. Repolish the rest and it could happen.

Just ordered trough Postmates.  Kinda disappointed.  Terrible screaming O sauce and blah rolls.  The Yakitori was super salty and blah as well.
Won't be ordering from here again.
sushi was good but the service was bad. we were seated over the sushi bar. the sushiman never asked us what we wanted to get. so we waited for a long time until our waitress came again to order.

Foods was amazing! They have a lot to offer on the "appetizers" section. I'm picky with my rolls and sushi places, but this place has plenty to select from. The Sizzling plates are a must try, especially the sweet & spicy pork. Also desert, chocolate crem brle is a fave!

Environment: a modern setting I would say. Music was a bit over taking. Also we sat in a booth and the tables were a bit close to each other, you can hear the whole conversation of the party next to you.

Service: ohhhh the service here is why I gave this place only 3 stars. The service is extra slow even on a easy pace night. Took about 15 min after we sat to just get our waters. Ordered our food and plates were taken off the table when we weren't even done.. I'm sure they could do better.

Other than that, wouldn't mind coming again!

This is my absolute favorite place to visit! Best sushi in town for a reasonable price. They have some creative rolls that are worth Atleast one try. My favorite is snow mountain and japanese lasagna! Only complaint is they had amazing music playing old school RnB and hip hop, but now theyve resorted to boring radio music. Kind of ruins the ambiance for me but food is good

So I have had my fair share in AYCE sushi, and I must say that the combination of the spacious restaurant, GREAT food, and good service this place is definitely one of my favorites. I went there for lunch and spent over 2 hours there and the service did not waiver, and the food was delish! This just became one of my favorite places to go for sushi! Good job OYSHI

The food was good and the price was right.

We ordered my nephew the Ninja meal which came with a house salad, miso soup, half california roll, teriyaki chicken.
For my niece we ordered the Cheesy Katsu meal and that came with a house salad, miso soup, and 3 sauces on the side of katsu sauce, honey mustard, and nacho cheese and a good size of katsu. The kids meals didn't come with rice so we ordered each a bowl on the side.
It was alot of food for just the kids, my boyfriend and I ended up eating the left overs and we were stuffed.. it was definetly worth $6 each for the kids meal excluding the bowls of rice.

My boyfriend had the unagi bowl which was perfect as we both shared 1 big bowl of rice unagi and grilled onions which was Delish, an order of a rainbow roll which was ok, as it didn't have avocado :(  but it still took care of my craving for sushi and a salmon handroll which was ok as I've gone to other resturaunts that pack it with salmon and the slices are big.  

I like oyshi.

I have tried this place a few times and have always enjoyed it The food i think is pretty good basically like any other place I do like the music they play in the restaurant  But unfortunately i tried to order togo and ordered a few roles and steak dinner when the food arrived I was super disappointed cause i there was no wasabi or ginger  I know that this is pretty minor thing But i dont know how you can forget both those items? Had to leave the house to go get some wasabi ? Which is a real let down cause my dinner was getting cold cause i had to leave the house

I was back in Vegas for a trade show. We didn't want to wait an hour for Texas De Brazil, so my boss and a guest asked me about "that sushi place you rave about" off we went to Oyshi! My boss AND our guest are sushi snobs and all the way there they voiced their concerns. As soon as the appetizers were done and our first rolls served, they were hooked and raved about the great rolls and how they will be back themselves! Thank You Oyshi Sushi for making me a hero!
I used to work next to this place, I like their staffs, friendly n quick service, food is decently fresh.

Most locals know where to go for sushi! It's the best for carb loading after a long run! Menu is extensive that offers variety of choices for most. My fav are hot stuff like Asian skirt steak! Come for lunch or just come and fill up!

I love AYCE (all you can eat) places that have a variety of items and not just sushi.

I've been coming to this location for years. Actually my first AYCE experience was here.

I've also taken many friends here to eat who didn't like sushi because their AYCE menu is filled with so many items. It gives people a chance to ease into sushi places if it's not their favorite thing to eat.

Two items that I highly recommend are Lobster fair and Love affair. Just so darn yummy. lobster fair is a California roll with baked lobster yumminess on top. Love affair is a STR with baked crab meat yumminess on top. Both just melt in your mouth.

Also love the different desserts they have. Anything from green tea ice cream to mochi to cream brle. Again, so many different options.

Service is not the fastest so be patient. It's AYCE anyway so sit back and enjoy the experience.

Also, don't come during peak dinner hours on Friday and Saturday. Your wait will be long.

I've eaten here twice now; both times were all-you-can-eat.  I absolutely loved it the first time.  The second time failed to live up to my inflated expectations.  To summarize the Oyshi experience: good sushi in a nice atmosphere with unpredictable service.  Some items come out after the appropriate amount of time while others take an inexplicably long time to arrive.

I ordered a la carte, and when I first looked at the menu, I thought to myself, "The pricing is on the in-expensive side". Then the food arrived. 

The cuts of fish were smaller than I am used to. So taking portion size into account, the a la carte pricing is fair. Which leads to this point: I think that part of the draw of this place is that they have an "AYCE" (All-You-Can-Eat) menu. The AYCE price is equivalent to what I paid for my a la carte meal (as described below).

As for my experience, I ordered: miso soup with clams; a California roll; tuna sushi, salmon sushi, Cajun tuna sushi, and halibut sushi. These are standard items, and I felt it would provide me with good gauge of the quality of their fish. The quality of the fish was very good.

Would I go again? Sure. But I would go for the AYCE.

BTW... the kitchen closes at 1:30am most nights (check the site for operating hours). Not bad for the suburbs.
There is absolutely nothing to dislike about this place. Everything is made with top quality ingredients, the prices are excellent and the service is fast.

First, I would like to say that I am not AYCE kinda gal.  I just don't eat that much (contrary to what my appearance may say) but in this case I think it was worth it.  We went for lunch so it was a $21 price.  But if you figure most of the rolls I liked cost about $10-$12 anyways, 2 rolls and you are there.  Plus it's your choice of different things from the menu, not just sushi.  But there are rules, and not EVERYTHING on the menu is part of the AYCE.

There is a bit of lag time on getting your food, so don't go running in thinking you are going to be out in 15 minutes.  But do go with the expectation of enjoying the company you went with.  Our server was great and the food was really good.

The service is okay, depends on which server you get. The first time eating here our server was great. Food came out fast & tasted good. Second time eating here our server was nice but very slow. It was a long wait for the food & by the time it came out our "crispy" rolls weren't so crispy. Eating here for the third time was just like the second. I would say the service & quality of food is inconsistent. The sushi's okay, had better else where.

I went to Oyshi for All you can eat last week. The all you can eat menu is huge!! there is so much to choose from and everything we ate was great! The atmosphere is great, the food is delicious and fresh, and the presentation if fantastic. They also play trance music - ha!

Dishes I liked:
Hamachi Trio Roll
Alaskan Roll
Dynamite (MMM)

There was a lot more but I can't remember anymore. The only one I wasn't so keen on was the cayenne albacore (this wasn't that great). 

for $26 per person for dinner, this is a great deal especially because you can easily eat more than that value!
Me and the wife love this place. The food is excellent. Service is slow at times, but the All you can eat price makes up for it.

Oyshi is the closest AYCE sushi to my house, so I've been here quite a lot. Not my favorite place, but it's a solid option. The decor is very modern and trendy. They also play EDM music and have sports showing on the flat screens near the bar. All postitives in my eyes. I always sit at the bar, so the service is good. Normally I can just order directly from the sushi chef without waiting for a waiter. That really speeds up the ordering process. I can't speak to the service when seated anywhere else in the restaurant.

One disappointing thing about Oyshi is that it doesn't offer seafood salad on the AYCE menu. That automatically prevents it from a five star review in my eyes. On the bright side, the amount of fish on the nigiri sushi is ample. Very high fish to rice ratio. I also like the variety of desserts offered. You're not limited to the usual mochi or ice cream. Oyshi also offers creme brulee and a berry parfait. The berry parfait is my usual and it's a must have.

You have to come and experience one of the best all you can eat sushi bars in Las Vegas . People I am telling you that this is quality sushi .. Not cheap crap. QUALITY .. The appetizer menu is also available for all you can eat . It's the best ! I go nowhere else when I am in Vegas for All you can eat sushi .

All you can eat sushi was great! As well as the desserts. Great customer service. Even though it was busy our server made sure that we were happy with the service provided. The music makes it fun as well. I will definitely be going back!

First time ever that I have had all you can eat sushi this style. Why doesn't New Orleans have this?? All you can eat on the menu for around $21! This deal more than filled my stomach. 

We started off with the grilled beef asparagus and baked green mussel. I love the beef that wraps around the asparagus which gives it a great taste to the asparagus. The sauce on the baked green mussel is also perfect. 

Overall i had  a great experience. We ordered most of the special rolls on the menu. I will definitely come back whenever I am back in town!

The food was not memorable but the service was, for all the wrong reasons: server forgot or "forgot" to put our order in, so half the table got food while the other half waited.  She did this repeatedly.  We were on a business meeting so our group didn't notice as much, but still, come on.

This was just as bad as the last time I went.  Probably will be the last time I ever go.  There are a lot of great sushi joints in this part of town.  Don't need to come back here again.  Good luck to you guys!

BS +++

I WANT SOME POKE!!!! (If you are Pinoy say it out loud lol).  Sushi for days! I can't rave about this place enough.  From the staff, to location, to the damn-bomb-food.  Legit sushi spot without the "fusion" stuff a lot of restaurants are trying to push.  If it's sushi make it sushi.  Stop changing it Vegas!! First, hats to the sushi masters for doing it right.  Amazing kitchen staff that keeps getting challenged and dishing food out.  I ordered a lot today (mainly the spicy tuna and salmon variety).  I was impress of the portion and consistency.  I will definitely come back here.  I challenge any big eater to come here.  $27 per person for dinner is a steal considering  some of these dishes will cost you $15 a roll.  The parking area is a bit packed and this place seems busy.  Come at night!

PROPS TO OUR WAITRESS!

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

I came here with some co-workers after a recommendation from a friend. 
The chefs are so funny and the atmosphere is really friendly. 
I tried the Red Dragon roll and the Caterpillar roll- so delicious. 
The best part: their dipping sauce. I have no idea what their sauce is made out of because it's sweet and it has sesame seeds in it. 
Although their AYCE was a little pricey, it's worth it. 
Savor every bite when you go!

The lunch specials here are amazing!! The staff is always friendly and while they're always busy it's never too long of a wait for a seat. There is not a full bar so I docked it a star, personal preference really(not a beer drinker).

First of all, I'm a sushi chef.  I had the all you can eat here. For the fish, which you should always have first, was poor quality.  I gave that a 2.   As for the rolls if you like deep fried and spicy sauce all the way I gave it a 3.5 but it gets tiring real fast.  Many of the rolls where they say soft shell crab mix, only means 95% imitation crab mixed with 5% soft shell crab.  Was horrible.  Anyway I'm pretty sure if your not a sushi advocate then this place will be just as good for you, but I'm use eating good, real good so I'll give it an average rating of 3. The server was on point though.  Had to end it off with something nice i suppose.

I've never been to a sushi buffet like this before.  Normally, places like Todai, Onami (now Tora in San Diego) have it set up where you walk up to the sushi bar and the rolls are there waiting for you to pick them up, at the same time they have a hot plate station, as well as desserts.

Oyshi is totally different due to the fact that you choose from the menu what you would like from the buffet section and it is made fresh for you to munch on.  Sushi is not the only thing part of the buffet menu, there are the small appetizer sushi's as well as tempura vegetables.  The best part are the specialty rolls, they are so freakin delicious.  I can't remember each of their names, but the cajun specialty roll, and the whatever screaming whatchamacalit are so damn good!

The ambience is pretty stylish and nice and I give them more props for playing house progressive music as we dine.  The staff is uber nice, especially since we went in a massive group that was pretty loud and would have drove most servers bonkers d bobcat.  Definitely gonna want to come here again next time I make a trip back out to visit the family in Vegas.

I love this restaurant! I've been coming here since it first opened. I've never gotten food poisoning here but if I did I wouldn't turn my back on it. Sushi is sushi. If you order sushi raw then you're taking a risk for food poisoning. It goes for any sushi restaurant because it's raw. Even if handled properly. There's always that small percent... But customer service just needs a little improvement. Overall the food is great!!!

It's not my absolute favorite sushi or AYCE sushi restaurant, but it's good and the location is wonderful. If there's an AYCE option at a sushi restaurant, I always order it because the price equals 2-3 specialty rolls. It just doesn't make sense any other way. Besides specialty rolls, I like hand rolls (tuna, salmon, yellowtail) and certain appetizers depending on my mood. I wasn't impressed with their hand rolls and although their specialty rolls are good, they're not amazing either (I've had better counterparts at other AYCE restaurants). I really like their DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL (without cream cheese) because the special sauce makes it unique. Their desserts are really good too. I like that they offer a PARFAIT that features ice cream, fresh assorted berries, and granola. Very good. On my most recent trip, I found out I could get Green Tea ice cream rather than Vanilla and it was even more amazing. The service is good and the food is usually quick. The only thing I really hate is the restaurant's lack of appropriate venting, so you end up leaving the place smelling like the inside of a fryer.
This is a decent place for AYCE. Price is reasonable. And the fish are mostly fresh. Not the best but I would go again.

Got HORRIBLE food poisoning here. 

So did the whole entire birthday party that I was with. Ate here on a Thursday late night, and started what felt like an exorcism that Saturday. I had to miss work on the weekend which is my money maker and it SUCKED so bad! I've never called into work or left early in 7 years and this did it for me. I've never thrown up so much throughout the whole entire night and next couple days like I did from this place. Holy crap, I will never eat sushi for as long as I live ever again. Thanks for completely ruining it for me. 

Please be careful here. They obviously screwed something up. But do they care? Probably not.
Mono was,awesome!!! He really made our experience great..he suggested a sake that was,exactly wat we were looking for. Loved it! We will b back! :)

This sushi place is both mine and my husbands #1 choice! We are both huge sushi lovers, and have tried many sushi places and this is by far the best one. We start of by getting an appetizer each and 5-6 rolls and a dessert for each and our bill always comes out to less than $60! Def worth every cent! Music is great, staff very friendly the whole atmosphere makes us keep going back! Makes it very hard to want to try a new place.
This is the best sushi ever! The sashimi, sushi or rolls are to die for! Great service and great food. This is the place to go!
So me and my friend asked for water THREE TIMES AND NO ONE WOULD GIVE US ANY.  We've been seated for about 20 minutes and literally everyone got their drinks but us.

i am a very picky person when it comes to food. everyone i come here i am pleased. every bing is made perfectly right. the all you can eat prices are very reasonable and the staff are exceptional. i will not go to any other sushi restaurant for sure. so if you're lothat's king for a great affordable all you can eat sushi restaurant, be sure to go here. :)

My family is a big fan of sushi. My daughter and I can live on sushi everyday!
Oyshi is a wonderful neighborhood sushi restaurant. It's not a very big place, so be prepared to wait for a table, especially at dinner time!

Oyshi is our favorite AYCE restaurant.
Lunch is $22, and dinner is $27 for ages 12 and over.  Lunch $16, dinner $19 for under 12.
Beverage is not included in the price.
Be aware that party of 6 or more an 18% gratuity will be automatically added to the bill.

I almost always order the Miso soup. It's very light on flavor but very comforting to eat.
The Fresh Oysters are very fresh, served with refreshing salsa! Only 2 pieces per person in the AYCE dinner only! At lunch they charge dinner price for them.
You can order unlimited items from the appetizers.
Love their Baked Oysters! Easy to pick from the shells because they are separated and halfway cut.
The Shrimp Tempura is lightly covered and not grease, served with dipping sauce.
My newest discovery is the Yakitori (2 skewers per order). I love the Shrimp and asparagus! Seriously, I can eat a whole plate of that!
My other favorite item is the Japanese Lasagna.
I make sure to order it all the time. I believe Oyshi makes them the best!
Everyone's favorite is the Monster! Spider roll with shrimp tempura, topped with baked eel and avocado, with eel sauce.
Bonsai: spicy tuna roll with Cajun albacore and avocado on top.
Sexy: yum-yum scallop, cream cheese and crunch flakes inside, topped with eel tempura, with wasabi mango and eel sauce.
My BF really likes the Crunch Scallop: Oyshi scallop, crab mix and avocado with popcorn scallops on top, with wasabi mango and eel sauce.

After eating all these food, I always wonder, how much more a person can eat? Well, we always get dessert, too! My absolute favorite is the Mango Mochi (ice cream wrapped in rice dough).
The Green Tiramisu is very tempting, too!
I really liked the green tea flavor in it! It's a house made tiramisu cake infused with green tea.
My daughter's favorite is the Vanilla or Green tea ice cream.

Service is always very attentive! Our iced tea is always refilled!

Happy to return anytime!

Me and Jessie B. wanted to try someplace new so we ended up here. And boy were we glad we did! The service was top notch and the rolls were huge and yummy!!
The price was great as well for lunch..I think it was 21 bucks!
They have a full bar but we came for the sushi.
And I am sure we will be back soon.

After driving by this sushi place many, many times I finally decided it was a good night for take out-i ordered a veggie roll and Alaskan roll.......very disappointed...the Alaskan roll was mainly all rice, hardly any salmon, a sliver of asparagus and a smidge of avocado.  Won't be going back

Food is always fantastic. However the floor management is very poor. It is frustrating to stand and wait at the door when only 2 seats are occupied at the bar and half the tables. Then to be sat at the bar 15 minutes later and all seats are still open. They either do not have enough servers or just poor table management. Whoever owns this restaurant needs to spend more time to see the flow of service and the dissatisfaction of the guests. Our server was very good by the way.
AYCE for the win! With some beer and good company, it'll be a great meal for any occasion.

OMG OH MY GOODNESS.... the best of the best Sushi. We have tried so many places be our best Sushi guy left us for Hawaii so we are trying to capture the same experience and let me tell you. Their Sushi is just the same the best. Made with love. Fresh as fresh can be. Atmosphere is amazing and you have to sit at the bar. The guys are great. So if you are looking for a damn good Sushi place you must try Oyshi!!! Hands Down. The only bad thing I can say as of right now they don't have Green Tea ice cream. But the food take the cake on that which I am okay on it. So be sure and try this amazing place you will love it!!!!

I loved this place. The food was excellent and the service was great. I went there with my wife and mother and 3 kids. It was the day after Mother's day since my dear wife had to work on Mother's day.

We loved pretty much every thing that we ordered. Now like all the all you can eat places in Vegas you can order sashimi but only as sushi and they make you eat everything.  Still at 25 dollars a person and 20 for kids it was well worth what we paid.

If there was one negative it was that at such a small place they still added 18% gratuity onto the bill. I would have tipped much more than that if they didn't add it.

We really loved the Lobster Fair and the Las Vegas Roll. Especially the Las Vegas since it didn't have any rice.

I do think that the staff needs better training. Although they were sweet and charming they did mess up a couple of times on the order. But we did order a lot and there were at least 3 people ordering. I guess I wouldn't have done as well as they did.

I wasn't sure what to expect and struggled with deciding to go with the all you can eat option as I'm a small girl. Well...it was a great decision! All of the rolls are amazing, particularly the Oyshi roll and then you can change it up with a sizzling plate of skirt steak or some veggie tempura. Yum!

My experience at Oyshi was pleasant. I thought the staff was courteous and got all of our orders right. 

We had all you can eat and I enjoyed pretty much everything I ate. We ate AYCE so we had to pace ourselves or else you will get charged for wasted food.  I would start with the salad and calamari (2 dipping sauces) Some things that I really enjoyed were the Surf and Turf (good steak and grilled shrimp) dynamite roll and monster roll. For dessert I always enjoy a classic creme brle. The berry parfait was a berry ice cream Sundae and that was nice too. Only thing I was ehhh about for dessert was the green tea tiramisu cause it tasted like a heavier creamed cake with a very buttery taste. 

Overall I thought it was a nice location with nice atmosphere. Service was fine and good was good. Would I say that is the best sushi place in town? Not quite but I am not disappointed and I would come back again.

Best place to go to pig out on fresh sushi....I don't get the negative reviews,,,,,been here several times always good, never got sick,,,rather go here than thanksgiving turkey We took a friend and he was amazed that there was so much variety...I guess he played it safe before with California rolls and never had "sushi" or sashimi.  Trust my Japanese relatives being an Aryan....Try the fish collar if you want an upgrade

All you can eat sushi! I'm in. Come hungry. Reasonable price. Nice staff. The baked mussels are divine. Loved the Japanese Lasagna roll. Oysters. Don't get me started. Yum. Just remember, if you can't finish it, you pay full price on it.
Amazing food and service! Some of us went for the AYCE and wow! Didn't have to wait long for the food to start coming even though the places was packed. A must bust in Vegas!
Great food, I always come for their all you can eat sushi. The rolls out of this world, my go to sushi place, it does get busy sometimes though.

I have visited this place a totally of 3 times and this last visit on Saturday March 11th around 7:00pm will be my last! First off I'm a manager at a retail store and customer service is a must!! So from the jump I should of know to leave and let me tell you why, it was a busy night for them obviously being a Saturday night which is totally understandable but after i proceed to put my name down,  I headed to the bathroom while in the bathroom i found myself having to listen to one of the front hostess in the bathroom on the phone cussing, crying, saying how she hates her job and the manager and so on and so on... sad part is after i came out the stall the young girl (she was the short dark hair fake lashes and could of been Mexican but look like she had some Asian in her)  just looked at me while continuing her rant. So feeling uncomfortable i went to the front to ask for the manager and just my luck she had walked up, i told her about the incident and she said she would go see the situation and figure out who the employee in the bathroom was. After that happen we were told 45min wait time which turned in to more than an hour wait again understand its busy just make sure you are telling customer the right wait times then. So as we waited to be seated the ball of sunshine aka the girl that hates her job was the one to seat us which again her attitude came out..... while she just turned from the desk and looked at me and said You can come this way with the rudest tone and attitude.. last time i checked most places call you by name or greet you by your name before taking you back to the table. But of course not her. Then as the food started coming out the quality was horrible, sushi taste old and fishy, not worth the price they are charging. So needless to say i will not be returning here anytime soon and i hope the owner or someone higher up see this because even after the manager knew the hostess had an attitude and everyone could tell she did, the manager should of pulled her aside and talked to her or sent her home especially being the first person your customers interact with, i wouldn't think that is the type of person you would want as a hostess.

Came for the 2nd time and it was even better than the first. Great food and the service today was the best I've had in a sushi restaurant. 
Will be back soon.
Chef ed Super sexy motherfucker... that can make a great chefs special. Great service and fresh sushi! Definitely  recommend to family and friends...

Went for AYCE lunch today.  $22/pp.  Was there with 6 others.  I gotta say that I have eaten AYCE in many places and in many states, and this by far is rated at the bottom of my list.  The only reason for 2 stars is good service from the waiter, and good green tea ice cream.  Sometimes the ice cream can be a turnoff too, but not here.  The fish was horribly fishy and tasted old.  I grew up on an island and know fish pretty well...this fish thumbs down.  I had tuna, salmon, octopus, albacore, and the treasure.  I had to choke it down.  Under normal circumstances, I would have 3-4 rolls, and about 10 orders of nigiri, with sides of apps.

When I arrived, I was not greeted by any staff, but was looked at by about 5 of them.  I was standing right by the "Wait to be seated" sign, and nothing.  Nothing from even the sushi chefs (who also looked right at me.)  I even had 2 staff walk in right pass me coming to work I guess.

I am told that they have another restaurant on Sahara/Tenaya.  Well sorry to say, I will not be going to either one.  If you are in the area and need sushi, go to 808 Sushi or SOHO.  Better food and better prices.
Went there for the AYCE and the food was really great. They even made something for my vegetarian girlfriend. Service was good too. Overall, had a great experience..

This little sushi treasure is not at all far from my home right down Rainbow. They have one of the largest sushi menus I have seen in Las Vegas and every roll on it is a winner in my book. It has been a while between when I went and when I am posting the review so I don't recall any specific roll names, I just know everything we ate, was excellent. The atmosphere is awesome and on the wknds they are open late. We love this place and are soon to be regulars.

Every time I come here, I leave feeling disappointed. Today was no different. 

I have been here on numerous occasions because this is where my friends want to go; ok, whatever.  We always come for AYCE dinner and the wait is always really long even with reservations. 

Once we are seated, it usually takes them a couple minutes to get our drinks and then a while long for our orders. We are so aware of their efficiency, or lack thereof, we would write down on a piece of paper of what we want and then just hand it to them. Kudos to us! 

The food would always take forever to arrive and the hot dishes are always what come out first. I never understand that since raw fish simply needs to be sliced and plated... Unless they wanna fill us up with the cheap stuff first...? Hmmmmmmm. 

And once the food arrives, they are always subpar or mediocre. Nothing ever wows my husband and I. 

Overall, service is extremely slow. This should be a french japanese fusion restaurant in the sense that it's gonna be a three hour meal eating japanese food. The food is mediocre. The price is not spectacular. I would never come back if I can help it. 

Oh, it's the same slowness at lunch, by the way. Most items on the menu is around $10-$12. The non sushi dishes came out first for my group today and halfway through their meal, my sushi bowl came out - mediocre yet again. 

That was my last straw; I am going somewhere else.

So we have been to Oyshi several times for different occasions. Great place to go when casual or if you want to get dressed up for date night. We love the all you can eat menu. 
Many options and the mochi is the best dessert.

AYCE Sushi for $26?  Ladies nights I think is Thurs after 10PM...for $21?  How do you beat that?  Well, with good sushi of course!  The amount of items you can pick off of the AYCE menu are aawesome...

You can get oysters, poke, and all of the sushi you want...of course, Sashimi doesn't count, but hey, get it all.  I like how you can pick a lot of the sides in the AYCE menu as well, particularly the seaweed salad, and the oysters...  

VERY good value, good quality food, fresh sushi, and a good atmosphere to boot.  Only thing is that service can get a little non-attentive, but they're serving everyone pretty much everything, so just make sure you check up on the many things you order.

compared to the sushi buffets in LA, ive gotta give oyshi 3 stars. the 2 things that trumps LA's sushi buffet is they serve seaweed salad and you get dessert at the end! main reason why it doesnt beat LA's sushi buffet: fish isnt as fresh and no sashimi!

what i recommend: seaweed salad, tempura, tofu appetizer, mango mochi icecream, green tea tiramisu, eel & avocado hand roll

the raw fish itself is alright, it's not that fresh...i would rate it 7/10

Went back to Oyshi last Monday and the place was packed. A Little surprised but expected knowing this place is pretty popular. Anyway, did the AYCE again, but I ordered the Kami Kaze and NYI rolls. Word of warning, these things were HUGE. I thought the AYCE portions suppose to be smaller than the regular order. If this is smaller order, I'm afraid to ask what their regular size would be. These two rolls came out near the end of our meals and we were kinda full by that time already, so trying to stuff those two rolls down was a challenge. Next time, I won't order this roll unless I have 2 or 3 people to split it with. Anyway, the reason I reduced one star on this trip is that the sushi wasn't as fresh as my previous trip there. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't exceptional fresh either. I heard from some review, not sure if it's for Oyshi or Kobe, that it might be due to the fact that fish delivery comes on Tue, Thu and Sat.

My boyfriend and I tried this place recently because we were getting tired of our regular spot and we loved it! the service was quick and friendly and their AYCE menu had lots of great options. We had a few rolls, as well as oysters, a seaweed salad and tons of nigiri sushi. It was all fresh and delicious and came out promptly. I think we've found our new favorite spot! As much as we love our old place it really is hard to find a good sushi place that also gives good service but this place has both!
Food is really good the only reason why I took off one star is because there service really really sucks at times! I get so surprised if they actually are doing well.

I can't give this place a 4 or 5 because the last time my friends and I went here the service was horrible...especially coming from a certain female server. She was slow with our orders and kind of stand-offish. I understand if you are having a bad night but don't ruin it for the customer.

Other than that, the food is great and I have never had any problems with it. The all-you-can-eat price is worth it especially if you know you are going to eat more than one roll including appetizers.

The ahi poke can use a little bit more pieces of tuna instead of being drowned in daikon and seaweed but it is still good.

Great sushi spot. My husband and I have been here a couple times. The food is great. I would recommend going during lunch before the dinner rush or you'll be waiting for 30-40 mins before being seated. 

Customer service from "some" servers need to be re-evaluated or re-trained being that "Las Vegas" is a number one place of customer service (personal opinion)

Other than that it's a great restaurant, definitely one in our books for a eating spot with friends.

(I'm a Chef) This place was recommended to me by two people whom i will never, ever take seriously again when it comes to food.    

Plus all the people that say this place is their favorite.. I feel like they are all clueless about food.. the service was ok but everything else was terrible..  

Mochi- tasted like it came straight from sams club.. its filled with sugary nasty goup instead of ice cream.

Ribeye-the beef is most definitely the worst cut of beef you can buy..  indistinguishable from wal mart beef no flavor.. no fat.. terrible thick cuts.. what the hell are they serving it for.. but beef that you would use with teriyaki or take it off the menu.. its not Ribeye!

all the crab is fake.. which is typical for sushi places but this imitation crab again tasted like sams club crap.. 

Tuna.. i don't know what is up with that tuna but I've had a lot of sushi and this tuna tasted like it had been frozen thawed, frozen, thawed, frozen and thawed.. thats the only way i can describe the taste and texture... plus the poke..

Poke isnt really poke.. there was 3 pieces of tuna in it.. rest was seaweed, and cucumber... don't call it poke.. i love poke.. i came here because i was told the poke is great... this was not poke.. and if it was it was the worst poke I've ever had.

Service was good.. Sushi chefs were great..  food is crap.

Found this place using the Yelp mobile app (so glad I did) - they have an all-you-can-eat menu, plenty of specialty rolls, and the tempura is awesome! 

Went with a big group of friends and everyone seemed to enjoy what they had. I got a spicy tuna handroll (yum) and one of the specialty tempura rolls which was also good. Service was a bit slow (hence the -1 star) but otherwise everything else was enjoyable!

been here several times. 1st time was for my 24th birthday. they dont take reservations, which was hard to plan out with 18+ people, but they were able to accommodate all of us, and the people who trickled in late. for the amount of people we had, the service was great! they even gave me a small bottle of hot sake on the house for waiting :]

the foods always been consistent every time i've come back. im not too big on the rolls (although there are a few i like). i get my fill on the hot items and appetizer items. they've added salad bowls and rice bowls as well.

favorites: poke, seaweed salad, oysters (dinner only), ribeye (its not a complete meal if i dont order at least 5 orders for myself), hamachi, salmon, and a few others. 

i only rated a 4 because service is never consistent. we sat at the bar one night, and had excellent service from our server (again, the name escapes me. i should really write these down!). another time, a group of maybe 9 or 10 of us went in for lunch, and if i remember right they were short handed at the sushi bar. hot food items came out before rolls did, and half of our groups didnt come out until the end of the meal (after asking servers several times about our food. the disappointing part was the table next to us got their food way before we did, and they sat well into half of our meal). 

this place is definitely a must try, if you've never been. but a regular spot? probably not. as a college student, its hard to pay $30 (including tip) for one meal as often as i'd like to. but when i do have some extra money, i will definitely be back!

Lousy service, mediocre food, dry saba, had to ask for tea 3x, no half rolls, "tip" already added into the final bill, too cold in the side room and no way to adjust. 

Why did I ever come here more than once?

I'd been here about 5 times and I love the amazing all you can eat sushi they have here!  The fish is always fresh. I love their variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.  The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get. There usually is a wait I never had to wait more than 30 minutes, and I learn to go earlier or later then the rush hour times. The waiters/waitresses aren't attentive like in other reviews.  But then again, some Asians don't tip well, so I guess you don't need to tip them as much as other restaurant you normally go to.

Love it here , the fish is so fresh (surprising ) considering its in Vegas surrounded by the dessert . My friend and I are regulars and wouldn't go to any other spot 

My favorite roll here is the sea urchin, ikara with quail egg and the spider roll

Price is very reasonable and well worth it for an all you can eat 

Ed and Ryan are awesome !!!

They have some of the best rolls I have ever tried, but their nigiris aren't the best. Their fish probably isn't as fresh as some other places but it's still decent. Some of my favorite rolls from Oyshi are the Snow Mountain Roll & the Kamikaze Roll. Not bad for lunch for $21

I really love this sushi place. I prefer this location over Sahara's usually, but when I came here for my 21st, I wasn't impressed with the service. Sitting at the bar, the only way they would do half rolls, some rolls I ordered didn't come and the service was slow. I will come back because it was probably an off day.

Oyshi was one of my favorite sushi restaurants until my most recent visit. When my family, and I arrived we waited six minutes to me seated there was no host so a waiter finally came to us and asked how many where in are group. It took the waiter over ten minutes to take are order. My wife and I order all you can eat sushi, we told the waiter which rolls we wanted to eat first that order took twenty minutes to arrive at my table. When we finished that order we had to ask a bus person to hunt down are waiters to place another order of sushi. We ended up spending over two hours eating sushi not because we ate so much but because it took for ever to place orders and to receive it. The sushi is not all good as I remember it being in the past I will not be going back.

Oyshi used to be one of my favorite binge eating locales, however the last time I went was an utter letdown. 

What differentiated Oyshi from other "All-you-can-eat" sushi spots was the quality of the fish. What used to be fresh, now looks and tastes old. Basically, all of the nigiri sushi was disgusting; uni being the worst. 

The cooked food is still good (hence two stars instead of one), but its "All-you-can-eat SUSHI", not "All-you-can-eat-tempura-edamame-teriyaki-skewers". 

Would I go back? Probably not. I'd rather spend $5 more and go to a real buffet like the M Resort. At least you know the sushi is going to be sub par there and gravitate towards the other entrees.

Hands down my favorite All You Can Eat sushi in Las Vegas. Always enjoy myself here with the friendly service and excellent rolls. The nuclear bomb roll is so delicious if you like your rolls more on the spicy side. I also love how I can finish off my meal with a Creme brle, which is included in the all you can eat.

ok i think i've mastered the art of the AYCE menu here now. lol

not sure why but the meal i had last night seemed to be better than my other visits. maybe because i didn't over order this time which i tend to do.

btw you may be wondering why i keep coming back here if i'm so unhappy with the service... it's because it's so close to where i stay.. and my friends like it and good company makes everything better.

so last night we started with some appetizers while we waited for a couple other friends to arrive. once they came we ordered rolls.. then continued with nigiri.. and finished off with dessert. a few appetizers were thrown in here and there.. and this strategy definitely worked.

stars of the night:

house salad: i really liked their dressing.. it was kinda a peanut ginger-y dressing. super refreshing and a decent size. it can definitely be shared

baked green mussels: not too fishy tasting and the sauce on top is super creamy and delicious

oysters: max order is 1 per person which comes with 4 oysters... tasty! 

sexy roll: i believe it has fried unagi on top with yum yum scallops inside and a creamy mango sauce on top... my favorite of the night.

agedashi tofu: their version is really tasty. the tofu itself stays crisp on the outside even after its been sitting there for a few minutes.. and the sauce is perfect.. not bland at all

premium spider roll: with avocado and cream cheese and possibly unagi on top. cant remember but it was deeeelicious!

service was ok in the beginning but really began to slow down as it got busy. we were seated in the area sectioned off to the side so it was easy to forget about us.. and we sure felt forgotten at times. 

as for dessert they were out of mochi the last time we were there.. this time they didnt have the strawberry. ooo my friends were super disappointed :(

tip: monday and tuesdays they have a 2 for 1 house sake special :)

Food was amazing but what really put the cherry on top was the service. Our server Stefan was great. Our drinks were never under half way, he checked on us every few minutes to see if we needed anything, and had a great attitude. For sure coming back.
