I went here for all you can eat sushi for dinner. It was really good. I got the lava roll and another spicy roll that I cannot remember the name of. Since I love spicy I loved both rolls! I went with my friend and he ordered a couple rolls which I tried and they were good too. I don't remember which ones because he ordered it. I also tried sriracha sauce which was reallyyy good as well. It was $35 for all you can eat which isn't too bad. I would love to come back and try more rolls. For dessert I got mango mochi-yum yum! 

I liked the location because it was right around the corner from my house-its always nice to have a sushi place nearby for when you have cravings. :)

Dinged one star because this place always seems unnecessarily busy... It's pretty annoying when you're waiting for a table when there's four or more empty tables in the joint. Food is always great--standard sushi fare. I believe it's $27 for All You Can Eat dinner, also pretty standard.

Usually me and my family come here for sushi (AYCE) and today March 22 me and my girlfriend and sister came here (which they are visiting from a different state) and the service was terrible we were here for fifteen minutes and we were not even acknowledged! Than a larger table was seated next to us and got their drinks and orders before us! We have got served different food orders that weren't ours 7 times over the course of one meal! We had 2 waiters Johnny and some other guy with Gage's who were careless servers and no one here had a good positive vibe. It took an hour for a miso soup a seaweed salad and 4 rolls to come out when it wasn't even busy. We complained than we got our check which said the drinks were voided which was nice but than she reprinted another which voided $6 instead of $3 big whoop...Don't go here I don't recommend it!

Just discovered this place thanks to a coworker. Great vibe, great food and decent prices. I have o admit I don't do all you can eat, however the deal was too good to pass up. Will definitely be back!

Overall always a good experience.  I'm always ok with coming out here every time someone suggests even though I don't live near by.  They have a good selection that is diverse.  Service is nothing to write about but I'm always satisfied that they get everything to me in a timely fashion.  If there is anything I can  say about this place is that I'm a fan and would always want to come out here if it is suggested.

This place is the perfect example of why I stopped going to AYCE sushi bars.  Lot's of our orders never showed up and the ones that did took forever. the Quality of the food  =   . I should have known better

Love this place!  All you can eat sushi for $20, but they also have lunch specials on things like rice bowls and delicious salads!  I love that everything I eat there tastes fresh and finishes clean!  

A high quality restuarant with a muted, classy feel to it :)

I've been to Oyshi a couple times and have never left satisfied! The fish quality was not all that great, the rice was too wet for my taste & the service was quite slow! Also the stools at the sushi bar were being really weird and kept sinking down for some reason.. Maybe I'll give them another try..  MAYBE ! Haha

I wish there were separate rating sections:
Rolls were not as tight as they should/could be- very sloppy though taste was still outstanding and fresh.
My waiter was great, attentive but not pushy nor lacking attention.
However!!!!!!
My biggest complaint is with the "supervisor" whom was conducting the business like the Soup Nazi from that Seinfeld episode.  Firstly, it wasn't busy at all, I have issues from the military and a long career working with criminals so I asked for a corner with a wall to my back.
She immediately said "can I put you at the table in the middle".........wow!!!!!!!! Pull the sushi out of your ears and think about what I asked for.
Then she proceeded to tell me once I was seated "it's ok THIs TIME since we aren't that busy, normally it wouldn't be"-  I told her frankly- "well I'm a veteran with PTSD so thank you for the exception"........
Waiter was great again btw!!!   I asked him if she was always that angry after she came in between me finishing my first round and waiting for round 2---- she asks "are you ok? You don't have food"........... now, I can see you might say she was just checking- but the way she did it, body language, tone of voice and previous interaction made me feel like I either had to have a constant stream of food coming, eating or I had to get out-  
VERY UNENJOYABLE thanks to this lady!!!!!!

I always come to this location when in town, but now- I think I'll go to the one on Saraha-  much more relaxed atmosphere and don't have to feel rushed or like I can't relax and enjoy my

If you are a fan of the AYCE and westernized style sushi, you will really like this place. 

1.  Service - 5 Stars - This place rocks with service. This is a key at the AYCE places as I think that they will automatically "pace" you with the limited staff and service. However, here, we had numerous people helping, providing us food, taking orders for additions and even the manager or owner (didn't get his name) came out to help.  Very, very nice.

2.  Ambiance - 5 Stars - I was kinda irritated as to why my pals were asking to meet way out here in the middle of where, and it was not a disappointment at all. The table set up is great, nice waiting area, very comfortable flow.  I felt very, very relaxed here and not rushed at all.....

3.  Food Quality - We ordered some real sushi like Amai Ebi with the fried shrimp heads and they were tasty. The Uni or sea Urchin was very flavorful and the texture was spot on.  Then, we had a bunch of westernized sushi that my pals ordered and while I cannot tell you what was in them and the conglomeration of sauces that hid the fish taste, I can tell you that as a food group, this stuff was pretty darn good. I wouldn't call it sushi, I would call it "chop suey sushi".  I give the food quality 4 stars.

4.  Pricing - For AYCE, the price is not bad 21 / 26 per person depending on lunch or dinner.  Many of my favorites don't qualify for AYCE, so I will be going back to clarify this as I did not pay this bill, and so I am not 100% positive. However, in reading the bill, the more traditional and higher quality stuff was not included.  I will check this as I may be wrong.  For now, I give this 4 star.

GK says, check it out!

Very disappointed with my last few to go orders here. This used to be my go to neighborhood sushi spot but sadly I won't be visiting any more. The service is decent but the sushi is just not as delicious as it used to be. My last to go order, the rolls were very heavily overloaded with rice, over cooked rice, so much that both rolls were falling apart as soon as I opened the to go box. I'm a sushi addict and I know that some places that offer AYCE overload the rolls with rice to fill you up but it's very disappointing when you are paying al a carte prices at $30 for 2 rolls and you have to pull so much rice off it and still can't enjoy it. I order to go from other places like Sawa, Ojah, Goyemon and Kyara and have never had this problem with them. Also, the shrimp tempura was mushy, the tuna didn't taste fresh... I could go on and on. Sadly wouldn't recommend Oyshi, plenty of other places to eat at.

The sushi is good for an all you can eat. The atmosphere is surprisingly comfortable. Originally I was going to give this place 4 stars, but the extras like rib eye and green tea tiramisu bumped me up to 5. The sushi is not the best, but it's pretty good, all you can eat, and only $26... Excellent value

I've been here many times and today the service was not so great! I had to remind our waiter that I had ordered something.

Food was good but ended being here for a little over 2 hours because  he always took long. Everyone else was great it was just our waiter. FYI I was upset because it wasn't that busy

Came for a quick dinner & was craving sushi. Got seated at the bar right away. Sushi Chefs & entire staff are very friendly. I noticed they have A LOT of Chefs & restaurant staff, which is very good. We ordered some wine & raspberry sake. I liked my raspberry sake. Very fruity. We ordered the Lobster Affair (very yummy & had crunch topping), Heart Attack (spicy & decadent) & Oh my heart rolls (tasty). We truly enjoyed our food so much. We were very happy! The food came out fairly quick (than most places). The dcor was really nice & modern. Overall food was great & staff were A++. This place never disappoints.

This was meh. Nothing great about it. The rolls were so small and the fish wasn't that fresh. Service was okay.. The server was getting annoyed because I said I didn't like eel sauce..which was difficult because almost every roll they have is smothered in eel sauce. Not going back

Great sushi. Never let's me down. Great service

Amazing sushi chefs

Looking forward to trying the Sahara location with my friend. 

20% off lunch during happy hour 330-530pm

Horrible customer service, the sushi is frozen and not fresh, I asked kindly to replace the bad tuna for something else and they said I would have to pay for it, can't believe a place like this is still in business.

Love the all you can eat with a variety of options!! The staff is friendly, it's very comfortable, and I enjoy the atmosphere. The only flaw is I feel it took a long time for things to come out - but that meant I had time to digest in between rolls.. I really enjoyed the experience overall!!

This place is pretty cool! This is my second time and pretty impressed! The sushi was really good and creative and the sizzling meat dishes are off the hook! Nice vibe and for lunch the $10 special is way too much good stuff to eat!!
Very good sushi! Very fast & friendly service. Good price for all you can eat. IMHO, too many rolls with cream cheese. However, I will return! :-)

Bland tastebuds and strong stomachs: WELCOME. 
I haven't had this place since the last time I got food poisoning. 
But, after a good number of years, here I am. Again. With a stomach full of pain and a pocket less of money. 
Waste of my time. 
The service is ok. 
But if the food was superb, I'd be ok with that. 
The calamari tasted like batter and oil. 
The sushi broke each time I picked it up. 
The meat was subpar. 
And everything in my insides hurt. 
My girlfriend got instant diarrhea. 
I'm holding myself together till I get home. 
But I'm still waiting on our server to get back and pick up my check. It's been over 10 minutes. 
Dislike!!!! 
This place was a million times better when it first opened. Sad it's turned to this.

Yeah, the Husband and I are sushi snobs - at least we're upfront about it.  But when you're living in Vegas, the only way to go is to do AYCE, right?  After getting tons of recommendations for this place, we finally got around to seeing what the hype is all about.

All-you-can-eat dinner is $26/pp.  It was pretty busy on a Sunday night with a steady stream of customers (and large groups) coming in all night long.

Like Ned M. mentioned, the sushi rice is only okay...it could be better.  Perhaps that's what put us off already...we had to eat the rice and we weren't digging it.

We ordered lots of nigiri and found the fish to be okay too, some of it was mushy though.  As one friend mentioned, she wished the fish was a bit 'colder'.  Maybe we came on a bad night - but everyone is raving about the fish.  I'm also not too fond of 'sauce' added to my nigiri, and they added 'sauce' to a lot of my nigiri choices.  

They do offer a wider selection of side items like Asian style skirt steak, ribeye steak teriyaki, etc.  And for this reason, one friend prefers coming here over other AYCE places.  I do like their version of agadashi tofu though.

Limitations on their menu include:
* one order of uni and amaebi per person
* limit one order of oysters on the half shell (4 pieces) per person
* limit one order on desserts of creme brulee, mochi ice cream, berry parfait or green tea tiramisu (regular ice cream is AYCE though - plum, green tea, vanilla, and coffee)

Sitting at the sushi bar, service was pretty good.  The manager seemed like he was our main waiter and he was quite attentive.  We thought we were supposed to order our sushi from the sushi chef, but he asked the manager to take our sushi order instead.  He continued to take our orders throughout the night and refilled our beverages too.  There was a gap at one point where our tempura order was forgotten, had to be reordered again, and then had to be followed up on again before we got it.

I can see why this place is popular - there's definitely a mixed crowd and separate rooms for private parties.  The staff are busy and attentive and they definitely recognize the regulars.  They have a lot of rolls to choose from, something that we usually avoid.  Overall, we found Oyshi Sushi to be an average place for AYCE sushi.
Cheap under cooked rice, bad oysters, terrible service... This isnt sushi... So disappointed. Tried 3 times just bc i live so close but the food and service gets worse and worse.
Oh yeah! My new & ONLY Sushi spot! Bomb rolls and Sashimi, excellent and friendly Chefs! I will say the waits are crazy and if you better organize that part

The sushi here was great! Really fresh. I do have another favorite sushi spot, so I do not treat myself to Oyshi as much as I'd like too, but the few times I do get over there, I definitely enjoy the rolls as well as the appetizers that are included in AYCE. I will say, that, like many AYCE sushi places, service is not the quickest. When ordering a roll, you may not get it for a while later. But it's understandable, as the place is busy. '
Overall, the sushi is pretty delicious.

LETS START OFF WITH ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR TWO HOURS!!!

Yes two hours for one of the cheapest all you can eat sushi I've seen in Las Vegas myself. Some will say that service of the sushi is a tad slow but hey you get two hours. Who likes to be rushed when eating anyways? I enjoy food so I would like to enjoy it at a nice pace thank you.
If your with great company that gives some extra time for some intellectual exchange of words (conversation). Plus the two hours give enough time to let the rice settle a bit and enough time to try a good portion of the menu.

The service might be a tad slow but the workers are always pleasant. I actually feel like I'm wanted there.. not like that other Asian restaurants..
They also are very knowledgeable with the menu which leads to great sushi suggestions.

The sushi at Oyshi I say is the best I've had in Las Vegas! 
I would like to suggest the RED ROCK ROLL due to the fact that it contains "Orgasm Sauce."  The sauce is rightfully named this because it will climax your taste buds into ecstasy!

Conclusion.. YES!

We thought we'd try this place instead of going to our usually sushi spot, what a mistake that was! The service is terrible, we had a server that was just wondering around like a lost puppy. Our waters were empty on several occasions and I had to ask twice how much longer it would be until we got our sushi and then was given the confused "let me go check" look. Also, we were told they only did half rolls at the bar, which makes no sense! The sushi was mediocre at best. In a town full of great places to eat, skip this one and go somewhere else.

Came here for a bday dinner..and they sat us in our own private area on the side, which was perfect.  $25 for all you can eat and that pretty much included everything on the menu besides sashimi... They had many rolls to choose from and they also had yakitori dishes(bacon wrapped asparagus, steak, chicken, shrimp, scallops), poke salads(delicious), poke bowls, oysters, mussels.. There was a great selection.  Since we had a big party, our order took some time and some got missed but the servers were more than helpful and they made sure we got everything we wanted.  After our meals they also had parfait, mochi, and tiramisu for dessert..I would definitely be coming back..Only downer is that it is pretty far from the strip if you don't have a car, its about a $30 cab ride, but if you split it, its not so bad.  After 2 hours of stuffing our faces and many bottles of sake, we left stuffed and satisfied and it only came out to $40 a person! We were expecting way more!

Snow Mountain roll is incredible! Service usually good though the wait for rolls can get long during dinner. Only complaint is the god awful music. Hip hop and EDM are all you hear. Nothing against Ludacris but he isn't really sushi music. This kills the atmosphere. Would come more often if they set a better music program.
Chirashi is good, but prettty limited on the quantity of fish,,,a few fillers.  Service at the bar was great, the guys are lively and keep a fun atmosphere.
Amazing place and amazing food me and my husband were treated like it was our anniversary.  Chef Ed is super sweet.

Love this spot. In terms of availability of diverse food items for AYCE sushi places this place is pretty great. Sitting at the bar the chefs are friendly, and the waitstaff has always been wonderful. Been going here for years and besides them not having a punch card for AYcE, the place is great and open late!

This place is so yummy!

My friends and I came here one day for lunch while on a trip to Vegas for our friend's birthday.  We heard from our party planner about this place that has all you can eat sushi and we were there.

There were 9 of us and the service was quick and friendly, and we definitely stayed a few hours to milk the all you can eat deal for what it was worth! Sooooo good! Definitely go! Tons and tons of choices on the menu as well!
Food is awesome here, always long waits to get in. My favorite sushi place in Vegas
This place is better then what I expected. The service was good. The sushi is good with a lot of options to choose from. The red bean moochi is soo delicious!!!

Great AYCE sushi :) 

Pros: Fresh, good portions, large selection. Good dessert.  

Cons: How far in on Rainbow it's located. Can be long waits-make RESERVATION! Lobster fair was not that great.  Fish without rice not option under AYCE.

Random nights with good friends are always a blast!  I've always said it.  Spontaneity really makes the activity better!  So when I was invited last minute for a sushi dinner, I knew it was going to be fun.  We settled on a place one of us raved about.  I've been to Soyo restaurant many times but never Oyshi.  Time to Yelp!

The only down side of this place is the location.  I live across town from here.  Oyshi is in a really cool strip mall in my opinion.  First, you have one of my favorite Korean joints.  Now you have my favorite fried rice joint, Rice Trax.  This location, although far, will be frequented a lot.  Although the wait was super long, the restaurant is pretty cool.  Love the concrete floors, the wood accents in the front and the half table chairs, half booth options for seating.  Our service was pretty good.  Multiple servers came by our table at most times.  It was enjoyable. 

For dinner at a sushi joint in Vegas, the ONLY way to go is to get the AYCE special (All You Can Eat).  This place charges a $26 price tag.  The one thing that threw me for a loop were the rules involved.  I've never seen a place have all their rules listed on their menu.  With this dinner, you can literally order anything off the menu.  Granted, there are a few items that limit one per person, but you have access to everything.  My recommendations to get the most out of your AYCE is to stick to non-rice dishes.  I know, I know, it's a sushi joint, but trust me.  You can eat so much more if you stick to the protein.  For dinner, here's what I got, grouped in categories:

Things I loved: Seaweed Salad (with sesame seeds), Fresh Oysters (with ponzu sauce, green onions and hot sauce), Baked Mussels (topped with yum yum sauce and ponzu), Miso Soup (always a hit), Shrimp Tempura (lightly breaded), chicken yakitori (2 skewers with dark meat chicken and yakitori sauce), 

Things I liked but kind of disappointed with: Ahi Poke - Bowl filled with seaweed salad, shredded cucumbers and onions on the top, was small chunks of tuna with a little sesame seeds.  Kind of a disappointment.  I understand that tuna is expensive, but the dish was 75% salad and 25% tuna, which should have been the star of the show. 

Things that were questionable:  Yellowtail or hamachi nigiri - If there's any rice dish I get, it's nigiri because of the small portions. The yellowtail is usually my favorite fish, however, this specific yellowtail was a little discolored and questionable to me.  I took a bite and ended up finishing the dish but it didn't taste like what I'm used to.  Make sure it's fresh!

All in all, this place is actually good.  I'm definitely coming back for another AYCE session.  The place is still convenient and the staff is nice.  If you're looking for a good sushi joint on the SW side of Vegas, for sure check them out!

The service is absolutely terrible and the wait time is reallllllly inconvenient because the staff are so unorganized. I literally walked in and waited at the podium for 15 minutes, and servers were just staring at me and I was like HELLO WILL ANYONE HELP ME? There was also tons of tables like 10+ and they still made me wait 30 minutes... for what?! The staff were just chatting, hiding behind the podium right by the kitchen. They also don't take reservations at the weirdest times. The hostesses are sooooo rude here and will ignore you unless you ask them for an update.

The staff spent more time cleaning the tables while there. There were probably 30 people waiting outside, because when I was seated there was 5 empty tables around me! The rolls are just okay, but their fish/sashimi was good, even though the servers DIDN'T KNOW WHAT THEY WERE???? How do you confuse a white fish with octopus ?! Their prices for AYCE are pretty standard, not too cheap or expensive. The quality of the food is pretty good.

The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous of course and very roomy. They also have an incredible sake selection ranging from hot-cold, fruity-to house.
Chef Ed was so sexy and funny! He made sure my service was prefect! Chef Ed provided us with amazing recommendations! He was definitely fun to talk with.

The wait was a little long when it appeared that there was many open tables. The service was friendly and fast. 

The sushi was amazing, and the all you can eat was such s value!!  I highly recommend this place, and I'll be back.

One of my favorite AYCE sushi hot spots in town. The food is affordable and delicious. I recommend starting off your meal with the surf&turf, tempura shrimp and the special albacore toro with truffle sauce. For rolls my favorites are the heart attack, Japanese lasagna and the rainbow roll.

I have always enjoyed Oyshi, ever since it opened years ago, I've been a huge fan! It was the first AYCE sushi place I had ever been to. And after all this time, they still serve up pretty yummy eats!

AMBIANCE: 3 - The space is intimate, but at the same time, still pretty well lit. Usually has a good amount of people inside, I recommend calling in advance, especially with a big party.

SERVICE: 4 - Service is okay, especially when you call in a big party reservation; everything came out fast and hot for our bday party celebration! It's also pretty fast seated at the bar.

when you're not at the "party tables", regular service is a bit slow! I really hope they get better, but it's been that way for a while. Also, they charged full price for a kid under 10! Say whaa?! 

FOOD: 4 - I have a like/love relationship with the food. So I'll just tell you my absolute favorite dishes to order: Love Affair, Fresh Oysters, Baked Mussels, Japanese Lasagna Roll, Vegas Roll, Garlic Tuna nigiri, Oyshi Roll, Strawberry Mochi, Green Tea Ice Cream, and the Ahi Poke :) All delish and some of the best sushi around. Though, not a huge fan of all of the nigiri that they serve.

Oyshi is always a fun time for me, so I hope that everyone that has a big reservation or sits at the bar feels the same way as well!
Not a sushi eater but love love the chicken teriyaki the service and atmosphere is just right, server was on top of her game for a gathering of 11 people awesome service.

Went here for the AYCE Sushi, and it was simply BOMB.COM. 
End of story. 

Ok, I'll tell you more. They have more than just sushi on the menu - great steak, delicious fresh oysters, and best of all GREAT SERVICE!! They didn't rush us, the sushi came out in a timely manner, but not all at once so we didn't get overwhelmed.

Did I mention the amazing service?? Cause it really was! I swear with all of the AYCE sushi places around Vegas, the menu doesn't vary too much, so the service really will determine if I come back to a place or not. 

And I will be BACK!! Thanks for a great experience, and obviously a full tummy :)

I found this place perusing Yelp sometime back in 2010. AYCE lunch $21, dinner $26 which is comparable to similar places. Ive come here about 2-3 times a month for the past 2yrs plus. Always do AYCE. The main thing that got me as a repeat customer is their service(at least in my experiences) is considerably better than most sushi places Ive visited. I counted and cant even believe Ive tried 12 different AYCE sushi spots in Vegas to date. Im not a big fan of the traditional sushi, more into the creative and many rolls that these places sell. I like to say Im more into the 'americanized' type of sushi and have been able to convince friends who dont even eat raw fish to try it with me and most liked it. So you can take what you want from my review based on that. This place does get very busy at dinner with sometimes long waits to be seated so I try to frequent at lunch. Service can take longer at times. I typically like to sit at the bar when I sushi. I have experienced faster service that way usually, so now I lean towards sitting at the bar. The ambiance, decor and music targets the more younger demographic.
Some items I favor are the seared salmon nigiri, cajun albacore nigiri, tiger roll, double screaming orgasm, heart attack, ian special, chung hua, kamikaze & surf n turf roll. At every AYCE I go for green tea ice cream and hamachi kama(not on AYCE here) if its available. They do also have brulees, mochi ice cream and parfaits for dessert. All desserts are limited to 1 per cept for ice cream. Dinner AYCE limits are 1 uni, 1 ama ebi and 2 raw oysters which is similar to most AYCEs. Theres a list of appetizers which I will order from ocassionally but I concentrate more on the sushi and green tea ice cream. :)
Is it the freshest and highest quality seafood? No. Its decent. It does say theres a time limit of, 90min I believe? Dont remember exactly atm since its never come into play. Ive never been rushed even tho I know I have passed the time limit before, or things like being reminded repeatedly on leftover charges. I realize this may not be everybodys cup of tea but for food and service Ive gotten here, I think you definitely get your moneys worth.
Always come here for the lunch specials. Staff is always friendly and attentive.  Will be back here again soon I'm sure lol

Before you step into this restaurant, think again. There is a great five star restaurant next to it call soyo, you sure you wanna eat here?? Granted its a different type of restaurant but still, its money well spent if you spend $ 50 for two in soyo than here.

The reason why I am so harsh on this place. Well, sushi are just amazingly stupid. There is no artform whatsoever, sushi are art, even though you are an ayce restaurant. Its a reflection of the sushi chef how the presentation of the sushi went. 

This restaurant make all sushi look like california roll and to boot if you look at all the rolls it full of slimy crabmeat with mayonaisse combination to make you full right away. 

Sure, they do have other appetisers on the menu or dessert included, but there are lots of other japanese ayce around las vegas that offer the same things. 

All this yelper that commented how great this restaurant is must never really eat in a proper japanese restaurant. Service are ok but honestly this one is a one and done for me.

You can try and then pm me afterward, I will probably just say "see I told you so"

Wow! The service and wait time is extremely slow tonight. So slow that I'm on my phone more than ever at a sit-down dinner. It's so slow that I have the time to check-in here on yelp and write this long review. As I'm writing this it has been 10 since my last order came out.  In between orders we've had our coke refilled like 3 times. I'm waiting for the last order to come out. I'm not even full... At this point I just want to leave.

Consistently consistent!  I have been coming here for at least 3 years now and still continue to bring out of town guests here.  We have had wonderful service whether we were dining for two or a table of 14.  Some of my local friends, who moved out of town still request Oyshi for their sushi cravings.  

Now onto the food.  For $26 (dinner) AYCE, you get beyond your money's worth.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert. (Of course, sashimi is NOT included).  Some of my favorites include:
Appetizers: oysters, mussels, rib eye, surf & turf, dynamite
Rolls: Ian special, double screaming & love affair
Nigiri: SUPER WHITE TUNA!, hamachi (yellowtail) & salmon
Dessert: creme brule & green tea ice cream parfait.

The overall restaurant has a great vibe, good energy/music, and attentive staff.  The last time we went here was a table of 14 and all of orders came out correct and in a timely manner.  Our server's name was Pink and she took wonderful care of us!
Oyshi has been my favorite since I first went ! Love it's AYCE and sit at the bar with Chef Ed!! He is the best ! (:

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 35/100***

I have been to this location about 4 times total, service was never really extraordinary but it wasn't quite as disorganized as it was last Saturday. They had us sit in a private area because we were a party of 15, and I don't know if it was due to that fact but the total experience was dampen by their lack of organization when it came to ordering and getting our food. 

We all got the AYCE, so that right there was already less of a headache or so I thought. We even helped out by writing our orders on the napkins. That part was a cinch but when it came to actually receiving our orders, it was a mess. First, the dishes came out one at a time and then later on we were told that they were putting orders together in one plate: the tempura for example, which had we known, wouldn't have been a problem and could've just passed it around. Instead, people were waiting for their orders to arrive only to find out it was already given to the end of the table. We didn't want to keep ordering as we weren't aware if they were just backed up or totally forgotten. We were finally told towards the middle of the meal what they were doing, when half of the party was agitated already. Don't mess with hungry Filipinos LOL.   

The food is just OK, quality is nowhere as good as some of our preferred sushi places, it's AYCE I know, but I've been to other AYCE places where their nigiri's taste so much better and fresher. Now their green tea crme brulee is in a league of its own, I could eat about 5 of those suckers lol, it might be the only reason for me to come back hahaha oh and the unlimited ice cream.
Wonderful Sushi!!! Did not expect to find this in the desert!! All the fish was fresh and oh so good!!!! Wish I took pics of all the food!! I had my sushi craving filled!!!!
Simply the BEST!!...there fast & customer service rocks!!...would recommend to anyone!

Its not Nobu. Its not Yellowtail.  It does not compare to the top quality sushi I get back in Hawaii BUT you can have an entire meal for the price of just two pieces of sushi at the other places.  

$21 for lunch.  $26 for dinner.  All you can eat (with some exclusions).

The food is good and well seasoned.  Fish is reasonably fresh.  Rolls are creative and good eats.  Excellent interpretation of classic sushi dishes.

The ambiance is a little weird (nightclub meets strip mall Japanese sushi joint) but who cares.  The food and service are good and the price is right.

Competition in the Las Vegas AYCE (All You Can Eat) scene is fierce, one of the most recent causalities is Sushi On Rainbow on the Westside of Chinatown.  It's somewhat hard to standout in such a crowded field.  Generally, I like to categorize them in which part of town they are in.

One of my "must go" places have been added in the Southwest section in Las Vegas.

Oyshi Sushi won't have the premium quality sushi, expect the fish to be previously frozen but still is not bad, the rice to fish ratio is more fish than rice, the rolls are not too over sauced, the salmon roe and flying fish eggs to be plentiful.

Customer service is excellent and attentive, they will stop by frequently to check if you want more orders.  Several notes:

They charge for green tea, so don't be surprised to tacked on a few more dollars for this.  The prices are in line with other AYCE restaurants, just a few dollars above $20 for lunch and around $26 for dinner.  Pass on the green tea creme brulee and green tea ice cream, barely any hints of green tea at all.

Another AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.  I swear there are one in every two blocks.  Bigger than most, this place is usually busy at night but very chill during earlier hours like  most places.  But when it's busy, it's really busy which leads to service sucking!  But overall the atmosphere inside is pretty good and seats up large group of people which is good for birthday dinners or just a bunch of friends coming from out of town.

All you can eat I believe was $25 for dinner.  I'm just gonna point out what I like and usually order. Baked mussels, dynamite roll, volcano roll, nigiri is not as tasty here, oysters are the best I've had in Vegas but unfortunately only 4 per person so get your friends to order it as well even if they don't eat it so you can have it, surf and turf (highly recommended), and for dessert the fruit parfait. 

This is not a quiet place for dinner so bad idea for a date if you plan on having a meal with a quiet conversation.  People come here often with their kids and big groups of people, which shouldn't surprise you are very loud.  This place is a hit or miss but fortunately I'm patient when it comes to bad service when it's excusable because of how busy this place can be at times.

Been here a few times and I must say, I like it here. We usually get the AYCE. The menu has a good variety and includes dessert. The sushi is decent to good. There's a board with specials as well so don't forget to check that out. 

Oyshi offers the usual Japanese fare from sushi to specialty rolls, appetizers and other small plates. Some of the sushi have options of preparing. ie. you can have your albacore regular, seared, seared with garlic, etc. Same goes for the salmon and yellowtail and a few other fish on the menu. 

I really like the yakitori, baked mussels, sushi options and desserts. 

This location is way off the strip. It's worth a try if you like AYCE. They also accept reservations.

What can I say? All-you-can-eat sushi is always awesome! The plus is its all-you-can-eat sushi PLUS all-you-can-eat appetizers like kobe beef, tempura, oysters, mussels, etc.  Also you can have a choice of 1 out of 4 mini desserts.  After an all-you-can-eat fest one night here at Oyshi, my friends and I left full and very happy. :D

I brought my mom to eat sushi, since we both love it. We did our usual order of all you can eat. They start you off with an appetizer then your rolls. After 30 minutes of waiting, only 1 of the 2 appetizers and 3 of the 4 rolls we ordered arrived. We ate everything quickly since we were hungry and wanted to order more rolls. For the second order, we asked for 4 more rolls and again, only 3 of the 4 came to the table. We kept asking, when are the other rolls and appetizer coming? All they said was "well let them know". Finally, dessert time came and they were all out of everything green tea, so we settled for a strawberry mochi instead. We left without getting our appetizer and 2 of our rolls. I still paid $28 each. Wouldn't come here again.
This place has been solid in the past- since all the new managers have come in the service is not as good- food still remains above average.

Went to dinner there tonight with another couple. Sushi was mediocre. Service was horrible! Server accidentally spilled water on the table ended up in my lap and my husbands. The server was in no rush to clean it up. Water was everywhere. He uttered an "sorry about that" then ignored our table after that. Never came back to check on us. Brought the check to us- Sat it on the table and then said "do u want dessert?" I would think that after knocking water all over the table, which resulted in water all over my husbands pants. He would of been sincere about his apology. Maybe even offered a free mochi? 
Prior to that, I had to ask THREE times for napkins while we were eating.
Previous expierence there has been great! The four of us, Will never return.
Best Sushi in Vegas! $21 All you can eat lunch, $26 dinner. Clean restaurant with cordial staff.  They offer more rolls that any spot I've been and the quality of fish is top notch.

I absolutely loved my experience here! 
I was reading the other reviews that had bad ratings and most of it came from bad service and about waiting too long. Well first of all, you gotta come early! You can't just be walkin in like you own the place. If it's busy don't expect to be waited on hand a foot. C'mon give these guys a break! They do their best to accommodate the guest they have. I mean, would you be able to handle 6-8 parties yourself? (Unless you're and server than ok. Haha) But nonetheless, they continuously checked up on us and I think that's all we can ask for. 

I'm gonna keep this short and sweet. Besides the outstanding service, if you love sushi, Just come here. It's sooo good and During lunch too cause it's cheaper! Hahah Enjoy!

4 words: All you can eat. That's the way to go. Being that I'm not from here, I was surprised at how fresh the sushi was. But it was! We ordered way too much but somehow found a way to finish it all. I would definitely come back.

Went here last night. The food was pretty good, and the atmosphere was great. I do wish they would update the menu because there are things listed that they no longer serve. Only other complaint would be for them to be a little more attentive. My friend didn't get the rolls that she ordered while everyone else had food so we had to ask for them again and then it took forever for our checks to be picked up and cleared out.

I used to HATE this place!  Many visits a couple years ago...all with slow service, room temperature nigiri, etc.  This was actually one of the only places that I told people NOT to go to for sushi....and never understood why others liked it so much.

A VERY reluctant lunch stop proved to be a much better experience this time around!

A few highlights :

Sea Scallops were awesome! Super fresh, buttery texture...melt in your mouth! 

Sake was very fresh today! Beautiful cuts of salmon....the Sake in Yuzu was very good as well, and not overpowering like yuzu can be sometimes.

The Ika with Mint. I really enjoyed this combination...and it was noticeably less chewy than most. 

Ahi. Fresh, but another odd cut...the darker area was a bit tougher...should have been removed by the chef.  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oyshi-sushi-las-vegas?select=UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ#UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ

Unagi. Nice crispy edges...good flavor! 

Ahi Poke. Tuna was fresh, and the seaweed salad was good too!

Sunomono. I liked their version here...thin cuts versus the larger circular cuts most use. The ginger sauce was good too.

Green Tea Creme Brulee. Delicious! Lots of tea flavor here 

Service was fairly quick, considering their tables were mostly full.

I would come back again now if I was already on this side of town :P
Tried the AYCE for lunch. Hated that they put so much imitation krab mix in almost every roll. Gross.
I love this place! Our food was so good and the service was great!!! Will definitely continue to dine here!

Sigh. We were *really* looking forward to this after all the stellar reviews. I've been to Vegas many times and always thought the best sushi would be at some swank place on The Strip, but Yelp claimed otherwise.

The good: The food was, overall, fine. We didn't do All You Can Eat because my wife wanted two orders of sashimi (salmon and hamachi). Both were excellent. Nice large meaty pieces, well trimmed, nicely presented. We had two rolls each, which were fine but nothing special. I also had two orders of nigiri.

The bad: We arrived around 2pm on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant was MAYBE half full. It more than half hour before our first piece of food came out. It was 40 minutes before I saw any of my order. The (nice) server came by at 30 minutes and offered us free miso soup to help pass the time. Meanwhile we watched every other table in the place get multiple orders of sushi delivered. Completely unimpressed, and cost them several stars.

Other issues: I asked if they had aji bones they could deep fry, and the server went off to find out but never came back to tell me yes or no. My aji nigiri had the tiniest pieces of aji I've ever eaten on top. It tasted fine, but they amounted to table scraps, not at all like the beautiful pieces of sashimi my wife got.

Who ever was my sushi chef tonight didn't really do a great job on my shrimp tempura roll.  It was soggy and the crunch wasn't there.  I ordered two in case maybe there was a mistake on how it was made the first time.  The second was as soggy, if not, more.  The flavor was there, just the texture was not correct.

I normally come here with my cousins when we feel like sushi and in the past the sushi has always been top notch.  But tonight, I think the chef was probably in a bad mood, hence the mediocre sushi. 

I also ordered a sashimi salad.  It's also not so great here.  I've had it better in other restaurants.  Oh well, maybe next time I try it might be better.  As long as the sushi chef I had tonight isn't the same as the next time.

Why three stars? Here's why.... First let me say that for a not so busy Saturday afternoon it took fifteen minutes for me and my boyfriend to be seated. It took another fifteen minutes on top of that for the waitress to take our order and another twenty minutes for us to get our sushi. I have heard of oyshi being one of the best sushi places in town, and while the sushi is good and tasty, in order for a restaurant (in my opinion) to have five worthy deserving stars the service needs to be as good as the food. That's minus star number one.

 And!.... You would think for an 'all you can eat' everything in the all you can eat section is all you can eat, right? Including the dessert? Well, I think not (not here at oyshi at least.) The dessert here is one per person only. Which technically isn't all you can eat. So it's basically all you can eat sushi, but not dessert. Haha. That would minus star number two. 

Now, on to the three yummy stars! When the sushi finally came, it was yum-O! With a capital last letter screaming O! The cajun albacore (thanks to a friend who recommended it at another sushi place) has become one of my favorites next to unagi. It's really full of flavor and I love how the center of attention goes to the fish, not the rice at the bottom. That gives plus one star.

The atmosphere in this restaurant is laid back. Both my boyfriend and I are laid back so the mood of the place set the mood for a relaxing time which is always much needed after a long busy week. Even their cutesy plate mats had designs of cutesy fonts and cutesy flowers. Haha. Guess what? Yes! You guessed it, another star for oyshi.

Freshness in sushi is another thing I look for. And boy oh boy does oyshi serve it fresh. As fresh as the prince of bel-air. We had the 'love affair' which everyone kept yelping about. It's the kind of affair that makes you feel guilty because you think you are cheating on your significant other. Oh yea, it's that's good! Total of three stars for this modern looking sushi spot.

I don't know if I'd come back though partly because of the service and partly because of my ever so longing for eating a lot of desserts. Well, I wouldn't say I don't know but maybe. Maybe the service is better than what we experienced in a different time or day. Maybe. A-ok review by me, but read other peoples reviews of this place. You may have a change of heart unlike me. =P

When pressed for their favorite AYCE sushi place, most Vegas locals can name at least one. Oyshi on Rainbow is mine. 

I've been here for lunch and dinner, by myself and on dates. Most often, my roommates and I just roll up after one of us so much as mentions sushi.

The food is delicious and extremely fresh. I'm from New York where all-you-can-eat sushi is unheard of--and would be pretty suss if you did hear of it. Less than $30 for seafood? What, was it fished out of Hudson River?

Sashimi platters are the only thing on the menu that isn't AYCE. Dessert, however, is. I highly recommend their chocolate creme brle! For apps, you must try their Ahi Poke.

I'm partial to their Shrimp Tempura hand rolls, which I can, and have, eaten 3-4 of in one sitting. Other favorites include: Kami-Kaze, Oh My Heart, and Lobster Fair. If you like nigiri, you should check the chalkboard when you come in for the daily specials. 

Pro Tip: If you sit at the bar, you can order half-rolls! It's a great way to try more rolls if you're like me and have limited tummy space, but eyes bigger than your stomach.

Came here for the first time last night for a Bday.  We had a big group but we were very well accommodated.   The restaurant was very busy but the service was able to handle it.  Our drinks and food are coming out without us having to wait and it was very enjoyable.  I really enjoyed a couple of the rolls and the Uni.  The uni is very well priced at $6 for two pieces which is a little low compared to other sushi bars.   I recommend this place to all sushi lovers...


sorry no pics, I didn't think about it til the food was gone.

Pretty amazing. I was a little nervous going to a place that does all you can eat sushi, but wow it was great!  You could order anything you wanted except sashimi. Big rolls and cuts of fresh fish. Yes I stuffed myself to the gills with some of the best creative rolls I've ever seen, and walked out of that place with a $52 bill for 2 people. When income back to Vegas I will run to this place!!

Ordered 6 plates and enjoyed everything. Ordered 3 more and was thoroughly satisfied. The "sexy" is very delicious. The "heart attack" is good if you love spicy. Japanese lasagna is always a tasty selection. If you want tangy mustard go for the  "high roller". The service was quick at first then slowed down mid way. Gave us time to chat with the party and food to settle.

27 an adult for AYCE at the time we went. Excellent place.

This place isn't my favorite sushi establishment.  The food isn't presented well, and my server is never around. I've been to the location on Sahara, and also this one on Rainbow. Didn't like the sushi quality or how the rolls were made. Table was sticky, which I didn't like. It made my dining experience uncomfortable.

Pros: AYCE is decently priced
Short wait time to be seated
Parking is easy to find
Dessert was delicious
Half order rolls, and hand cut options available

Cons: Tables are small
Tables are sticky
Service takes a long time after placing orders
Seafood quality is below good
Imitation crab is used
Charged for extra for leftovers
Music is outdated
No wifi

Overall: I not fond of this sushi spot. The food is decent although the service lacked and so did the cleanliness of the establish at both locations. Bang for your buck isn't too satisfying. The dessert was good! Best part of the meal. 2/5 stars on my rating scale.

Sounded good, looked good, good to know there's an all-you-can-eat sushi option nearby. Went in and sat down, then noticed they're playing some pretty inappropriate music complete with explicit lyrics... not trying to sit through that while I eat. Sorry, had to get up and leave. Thanks anyway!

I came here with 3 of my friends and we all got the AYCE sushi. 
This was my first time trying sushi and I really enjoyed it. 
The atmosphere was great, decent background music. 
My friends had been there numerous time before so the did all the ordering.
Our waiter was very friendly and the service was prompt. 
I loved the " Love Affair" it was delicious. 
I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu.
Nice all you can eat menu...watch out for the Oysters not so good at room temp!!

We absolutely love Oyshi sushi! We would come here every meal of every day if we had the money to spend. They have amazing appetizers from calamari to scallops to fresh oysters. My favorite roll is the lobster fair! And everything is such high quality. All the nigiri is amazing especially the Cajun and garlic albacore. The fish isn't fishy and the rice doesn't taste like vinegar like some lower quality places! The music is always so good it's usually like a mix between 90s and current R and B and hip hop music. All the staff is so great as well, we've never had a bad experience. Definitely our favorite place in town.

Went again yesterday with a group of 7. It seems as if the service gets worse, which is a shame because the food is still great. After we placed our first orders, it took almost 25 minutes for the first items to come out. Again, this waiter forgot a handful of our items and we had to remind him multiple times. One of my friends was really upset because he ordered 5 things from the menu in the beginning and it took 45 minutes for them to bring out just one! Like I said, the food was still great but having to wait what seems forever for your plates ruins the whole experience. They state you have a 2 hour limit, but what's the point if you are waiting for your food for more than half that time?

On a plus side, they did add new items to their AYCE menu; more rolls, salads, and rice bowls. I tried most of the new rolls and they were fantastic!

This isn't a go-to place for me  anymore but it will be if the services quality catches up to the food on my next couple of visits.

Love this place! It's so close to my house too which is a plus. I always get shrimp tempura rolls at sushi restaurants, and here they have a whole shrimp tempura roll section on the menu, with different toppings, sauces, meats, etc. Thumbs up!

My fianc and I love Oyshi. The fish taste fresh and they have a great menu! Good service, just don't expect to get a table without a reservation most nights of the week. It will be about an hour wait.

Didn't get a chance to eat here but felt like I would add a similar review I read.  

Tried to come on Saturday night at 12:50, place says it closes at 2am.  Walk in and they have already done last call and are closing.  I understand it's slow, but I'm not the first this has happened to...change your posted hours to 1am.  Then no harm done.

I would rate them 5 star if this prob didn't happen. But at the end going on dessert you are only allowed to order one (as in just one piece) dessert. I'm a dessert person, so if you are too, I don't recommend this place. Too much rule when it comes to eating all you can eat. Where can you see all you can eat but only allow you to eat one piece of dessert per person from the entire dessert menu?? They taking time on serving your food too and leave you one napkin and you have to ask for extra. This is my first and will be the last time eating here.

OMG I was blown away at how delicious this all you can eat sushi was I ate so much food I'm glad I wore stretchy pants. I can't wait to visit Vegas again so I can come back to this spot. Totally worth the wait.
The food is great, the service is great. Always a good experience when we go. They definitely know our faces and are always welcoming us back. We only get the AYCE and it's always a great experience.

Went to a nice lunch with a vendor.  My favorite foods were the garlic tuna, salmon belly and yellowtail trio.

Other than that, service was slower though the staff did their best.  Not my favorite, but good enough.  Since it is close to where my job is, there might be future plans to have lunch there....lol.

I've been wanting to try some other sushi spots for a while now, and when some friends from out of town flew in this week, another friend organized a dinner outing here.

Really, the food was "meh."  
They have a lot of options for all you can eat, and there were three dishes that were absolutely awesome: The fresh scallop, the amaebi (with the heads!), and the gyoza.  
Everything else that we ordered was just ok.  A little bland where there should have been more flavor.

The worst part about the evening though, was the service.  
While it was super polite and friendly, it was SO slow!  We were there for 2 hours, no joke.  
My fiance and I always order in rounds, so we'll do a few orders of several different nigiri options, and by the time we're done with the first one, we'll order more. 

We didn't receive several items, and had to go find a server to come back for our second round of orders.  

I had thought, briefly, that I'd be willing to come back to give it another go, but realistically...even the slow service at Sumo was better than this place.  

I might go back again, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way for it, especially when the spots I frequent have better fish.

Talk about #yummy sushi this place is really good. We dropped in on a Friday afternoon for lunch...all you can eat of course.

It was actually pretty busy for 2PM. Still the sushi was fresh and the service was impeccable!  We never waited more than 7 mins for our next round of sushi orders. We sat at the bar and I think our chef was listening to our discussions over which rolls to get lol by the time we put in our order he was sliding 2 rolls to us!!

Our favorites were the: Snow Mountain, Love Affair, Lobster Affair, Chung Hua and Sibuya. We tried maybe 11 different rolls, poke and nigri.

Awesome place! !!

A little disappointed considering all the great reviews. I will have to give them another try sometime on someone else's dime. 

It's your typical AYCE pricing & rules (literally had a rule menu!!) 

First off, came here with 5 people for bday dinner with an expected group of 10, they wouldn't let us sit at our table (which was already reserved and waiting patiently for us) until our entire group arrived. 

Finally!!! Were seated. No sever. No water, no edamame. Just a bunch of hungry thirsty bums still waiting. 

It took forever to get water and edamame. The menu was extensive but boring. Most of the combo rolls seemed similar to other combo rolls minus or add one insignificant ingredient. I did very much enjoy the pork belly. 

Even my Sapporo beer experience was ruined but my non-chilled glass. Did I mention I thought I was at a club with the music blasting techno? Geezus. Overall, it sucked.

If you have a  Sushi craving stop here and squash it.  Its like $26 for all you can eat.  You have to finish everything you order, but man we eat so much Sushi I will not need to see Sushi for the rest of the year... Well maybe in a month or 2 I could enjoy some Sushi again.  Eveything tasted great and we all enjoyed it.  A party of 15 and everyone liked the place so I will be back :)

Oyshi is my go to ayce, they are always consistent with quality, taste and service.  I always get Monster roll, tiger roll, NYI roll, sibuya, Love affair, surf&turf app, beef asparagus app, gyoza, uni, ikura, unagi, and usually try some specials, The green tea creme brulee and tiramisu are very good, and I'm not usually a dessert person.  These guys are always on point! I love Oyshi Sushi!

I enjoy coming to Oyshi on a regular basis. The food here is good and pricing is fair for their AYCE. Sometimes I do catch them on an "off" day and their salmon is not as fresh tasting as I would like it. But what I'll do is order their yumyum overload rolls (any of the big ones). As for their desserts, I think they're ok. Nothing too spectacular. I'd recommend coming here for the consistently good AYCE. Be sure to come with an appetite!

The All you can eat sushi here is the best in town.
Although they have no sashimi, they make up  by giving the freshest fish with small rice. And the sushi rice here is very good.

I've been here dozens of times. I was disheartened to read some of the more recent reviews saying that things had gone downhill. Hoping they were wrong, I came here for lunch and was not disappointed in the least. Service was great, food was brought out quickly and everything was delicious. Oyshi is still on my list of sushi restaurants to frequent.

I love their all you can eat sushi here... I wish they would put one in southern cali because this is THE restaurant to go to.  No matter what you order it is delicious and you can eat as much as you can of it!

Okay so I just left this place about 20 minutes ago. Its okay. The fish was fresh and the service was excellent. The place is nice a bit Japo and a trendy feel to it as well. I could do without the techno music. The one thing i did not really care for was some of the pieces were pretty bland. Although fresh it could of use some kind of sauce on them to bring out flavors. If I go again I will be sure to re-post :)

Our Favorite all u can eat sushi spot for lunch 20$ dinner 25$ I mean that's a good deal when u consider 2 rolls would be about 26$ alone. They always have a big selection of sushi rolls and appetizers. Including yellowtail and surf and turf grilled rib eye and shrimp!  

For fresh sushi hit this spot
My boyfriend and I come here once a week. Best sushi ever!!! And of course can't forget the great service, Odi is our favorite!
I haven't been here in a while , but i just came back when i was visiting las vegas and the service was great and the food was great still , imo its one of my favorite ayce places

My favorite sushi place!! The all you can eat has so many options, and is the best in town for cooked/fried/baked rolls in my opinion! The AYCE also has great options like surf and turf and tempura for those who are not too crazy about the rolls. Food is always fresh, staff is always friendly. Been going here for years, and it's still my favorite in town!

It's good for AYCE sushi. You won't be disappointed. Plenty of room, nice decor, and wide menu. My disappointment is no half orders on sushi like other places. Limited to certain order amounts on certain items. Rib eye was a overlooked and tough. Order it rare to medium rare. They didn't ask so I guess that's my fault. Extra charge for tea. Worth a try but I probably won't be back. Our server Toni was great.

On a Wednesday evening, we had 2 AYCE dinners for ~60. 

- Accommodative. They changed the channel for the olympics for us :)
- Get the oysters. small but packed with flavor. beware! rocks with the oysters? too fresh :/. LOL
- Calamari was a bit too oily. no flavor
- Get the baked green mussels. they even cut it in half for you :)
- big pieces of yellow tail and salmon for the nigiri :)
- The monster roll is deceiving. it's not all soft shell crab. sad that they only use the legs. Ends are shrimp tempura.  
- LOVED the salmon skin roll. more skin than salmon means more crunchy :)
- the NYI roll barely has soft shell crab. even smaller legs!!! :(
- Nuclear roll had a bit too much cream cheese. :/
- Yellow tail trio was a bit too tangy. small pieces of yellow tail
- you only get ONE DESSERT! FAIL...
- Mango mochi was average. they put a toothpick in it with the plastic on. LOL
- Parfait was delicious. but needs more granola. i think the berries and strawberry pieces are frozen.
- Although it may sound picky, overall it was pretty delicious or OISHI :)

Had dinner here tonight around 6:15. There was quite a line of people but we got seated within 20 minutes, which was great.

First of all, walking inside the restaurant, there was a strong scent of frying oil. I assume the ventilation inside is not strong enough. I've been to KFC and Popeyes without smelling that much oil frying.

We told the hostess our party had 4 people, when she walked us to the table, she took away a setting and set the table for 3, I didn't understand why she did that. So we asked a server to get us another setting, I'm not sure if he didn't hear us or if he was confused because we had to point out what a "table setting" was before he went to get it.

We didn't do the AYCE, just a few menu items:
Unagi & Avocado Roll:
The sushi roll was made badly, the rice was falling apart and there was a lot of avocado, barely any eel and smothered in way too much sauce.
Donburi:
Donburi is a combo of thin sliced beef (that is NOT all lean meat), egg, onions over rice with sauce in it. The one we got was dry, barely any sauce until you hit way bottom. The beef used was all lean and definitely not thinly sliced.
Kids Popcorn Chicken & Teriyaki Chicken meals:
The popcorn chicken was overcooked. They definitely fried it for too long. It was dry and some pieces had a burnt taste. My son ate a few pieces and said he didn't like it. The Teriyaki chicken was also overcooked. The chicken was hard to chew.

Service:
We saw a lot of servers walking around, but it didn't look like they were doing anything productive. Only the manager (we assume, he was well dressed not in server type uniform) came by multiple times to see if our table was doing OK. Otherwise, the server would come by drop off food and disappear before we can even ask for anything.

Maybe, we'll give it another try in the future, but for now, it was not the dinner we expected to have.
My favorite Sushi place! The food is delicious and the service is friendly. Its always busy which gives it an upbeat feel. NYI Roll is the Best!

This was one of my first times having AYCE sushi on the west coast! Oyshi was perfect! The wait on a Sunday night wasn't too long. We had waited about 10 mins and we were seated at a table right away. The menu here is vast and close to endless. Definitely many options for the different types of eaters in your party!

Some of my favorites were the oysters, the steak, the veggie and shrimp tempura, and most of the sushis we ordered. It was all you can eat so we had many on our table. 

Sad you can only have 1 dessert per person but I enjoyed my berry parfait. Great deal for all you can eat here!
Very good all you can eat sushi options. The monthly specials were exceptional all be it the salmon belt was average at best.  I would recommend this place and will come back again

My husband and I have been going to the Oyshi Sushi restaurant off of Sahara for YEARS, but it's such a far drive for us and the service at that one is often TERRIBLE. A friend recently told us there was an Oyshi off of Rainbow Blvd just 15 minutes from our house so we knew we had to go ASAP. When we walked in there was a line at the host stand and the hostess had all of us sat within 5 minutes. We chose to sit at the bar and do AYCE. Our server was Mono and he was the BEST service we've ever had at an Oyshi restaurant! I cannot speak highly enough of his attention to detail. Thank you Mono! We will be back to this location and request you if you're working.

Wonderful restaurant!!! My new favorite sushi place in Vegas. Not only is it in "my neck of the woods"--SW Las Vegas, but it serves wonderful sushi and hot meals, has incredible service and inviting, fun atmosphere. Oyshi does not disappoint, and I have been to most sushi places in town. The fish is always incredibly fresh and delicisous and hot foods and rolls are creative and very tasty. The presentation is top notch too, especially for the price. That's right, the price is on the low side for "all you can eat" sushi as compared to other neighborhood sushi places in town; Big flat screen televisions, always running mini fountains and modern decor add to the wonderful, fun, yet inviting atmosphere. Servers all speak English and are knoweledgeable about all of the dishes and make great recommendations!!! I love this sushi restaurant and have frequented it about twice a month, if not more often. Oyshi in Japanese means "delicious" and this restaurant surely lives up to its name in every sense of the word. Highly recommended.

THIS BUFFET IS HEAVEN!

Everytime I visit Vegas I will have to visit Oyshi. I live in Chicago and basically Oyshi's sushi buffet kicks all the other sushi buffet's butts in Chicago. Oyshi has a very contempory & modern decor to it, with a cool geisha painting on one of the huge walls. 

My dinner at Oyshi was so fast, I couldn't even comprehend the food I ate. For starters - the mussels are a MUST and so is the ahi poke which is very fresh tuna. 

Their sushi selection on the menu is so vast you don't even know what to order. If I had to pick only one sushi roll from the menu it would have to be the volcano roll.

The price is definitely worth this buffet which is around $26.

I'm a fan and a regular but sometimes the service is hit or miss. Sitting at the bar is fine, but a couple of times finding your waiter\waitress when you're sitting at a table is ridiculous.

With that said, AYCE sushi is not as amazing as "regular" sushi places (i.e. Sushi Fever, I love Sushi, Sushi Loca, etc) but Oyshi is always consistent when it comes to quality and quantity. Definitely worth a trip if you're looking for good AYCE sushi.

This place was great.  Great food.  Great Staff.  The thing that impressed me most was how they treated my family.  I went with a friend and their kids so we had a lot of kids, some very small.  They treated them extremely well, explained the parts of sushi ordering culture we weren't familiar with, and were super attentive and patient.  This is how a restaurant should be.
Oyshi is the spot! Good ambiance and great service. Stefan was friendly and informative, & made it more fun. The energy here is great. Definitely a must try!

I brought a friend of mine to this, my favorite sushi restaurant, and I could not have asked for a better experience. Although we had to wait 30+ min to be seated, everything was great once we got to our table. Here is a recap:

Service: Awesome! Our waitress was friendly and checked back with us often. Our food arrived quickly at our table (even faster than the times when they were less busy and I sat at the bar), and we were made to feel comfortable by the staff.

Food: Better than ever. All of our rolls were presented with delicacy and tasted great. Even though the place was packed, I felt like the chefs really took the time to prepare the best rolls for us, and yet did not take forever to make our orders.

Quick tip: Do yourself a favor and try the heart attack and the amigo roll. They are out of this world!

We made reservations for a party of 15 we didn't have to wait.  That part was great, as far as ordering and getting the food timely and accurately that is a different story.  I think it was because we had too many orders or something.  We had a group of people that loved to eat.  We order things that went to the table next to us they were a big party as well.  I heard our our screaming went to them because they didn't know what was ordered and they said okay we'll take it.  The food was okay not as good as I remember and I like another place that we go to better. . After to night experience it confirms that I wouldn't go there.  
The following I found 1 star:
Oysters (they taste really bad not fresh' and needed lemon)
Adegashi tofu (they give you one and it is now sweet or yummy. 

The decent but small pieces:
Fresh scallop
Eel
Fried scallops  the fried scallops was small size but tasted yummy.  Why not isn't everything fried best? 
The rib eye steak was ok but some of it was just too well done so it was tough.  
The surf and turf is better with the rib eye and two shrimps. It comes in a sizzling platter, 
Poke was like two little bites.  Photos of this was way generous then 

The favs for the night:
Garlic tuna
Albacore
Salmon belly
Octopus
Uni was low grade
Sweet shrimp eh.
We got a bunch of other rolls but really it is the atmosphere here that attract people imo.
The nigiri sushi was the best. 

The ice cream was out of mochi, the cream brle was in a small little ramekin.  They only allow one dessert order why is that so small?  The parfait on the other hand is like a shake glass and large.

Discovered a few more favorites:
-NYI roll
-banzai roll
-uni nigiri (be warned, some of the pieces were darker so I'm guessing they have a mixture between premium and select ca grades)

I guess I'll update this place with 5 stars because it seems to already have secured its spot in our vegas regimen. We even sit at the same table every time too (the big semiprivate one that's behind noren on the right side of the restaurant with the cool mural). As always, we ate til our hearts content. Food comes out reasonably timed and prompt for the most part and service is never lacking.

Okay, went there for lunch with few of my co-workers, we flew in from los angeles for the all you can eat sushi work for the airlines so this is easy.

The sushi was a hit and miss, some of the rolls were good and some were not. The nigiri sushi was also a hit and miss.

Most of the fish seemed fresh, some seemed like it just came from the freezer and thawed.  

The selection was great you had  a lot of choices in terms of rolls and appetizers

1. when we got there the place was empty except a few couples, but why did the sushi take so long to get, no lie it took like 20 minutes for our first order which didnt make any sense to me.

2. the side orders (appetizers came out really quick. i really believe you can make a meal out of the sides alone. they were really good. like the Asian skirt steak.

3. would i go back and try again , ya i would give it one more try.

An extensive AYCE menu at a low price. Especially for this area. Lunch for two with a bottle of sake came to a little over $60 before tip. 

Oyshi is one of the only places that uses lobster in their dishes. I wish it was a little more distinguishable though. Mixed in with the diced crab stick, it is difficult to taste the natural sweetness of the lobster. I am not a huge mayo fan either, but did not dislike any of the dishes because of it. The fact that it was not mixed with half a jar made it bearable.

The rice is the most important part of the sushi. Even though we were there early, the rice was cooked off early enough to let it properly cool. There is nothing worse than warm fish and rice that falls apart when picked up. 

The nigiri list is smaller than some of the other sushi joints, but the items we got were all fresh.

This is my all time favorite all you can eat sushi place in Las Vegas. I've been coming here since right after I moved here when they were pretty new, in early 2008. I am pretty much obsessed with some of their rolls, my favorites are Full Moon, Lava Flow, Nyi, Red Rock, and Treasure, but I honestly haven't tried anything I don't like. The nigiri it's always delicious, and I also definitely recommend the Vanilla Berry Parfait for dessert. I am disappointed that they stopped carrying "white tuna" aka Escolar, but that seems to be city-wide. The private rooms are great for larger groups, I'd suggest making a reservation ahead of time for those. They have plenty of beer, wine, and sake, and the best part is that Oyshi is open until 3am! Best AYCE sushi in Vegas!

Oyshi is our go-to spot for AYCE sushi.  Everyone that works here is super cool and most nights the service is quick, unless they're slammed.  The variety of rolls is good  and they are generous with their sauces, which makes it for me.  They don't offer sashimi on the AYCE menu, but not many places do.  All of their hot dishes are yummy too!  They have specials that are written on the dry erase board on the wall behind the sushi bar.  We like to start with the Salmon Lover's Roll and I like to end on the sweet & cheesy Japanese Lasagna.

It's so close to my house I could walk there, but there's no way that I would be able to walk home!

Their service kinda sucks, but the food is excellent.  I always do the AYCE and usually got for the Bonsai Roll, ahi poke, gyoza, miso soup, grilled beef asparagus and some sushi (garlic tuna, cajun albacore)  YUM!!

Being a Vegas local, I hear the buzz about Oyshi ALOT. It's been a successful sushi business for a few years now. My first visit was a couple of years ago but it wasn't that memorable to me, but two Thursdays ago, it was VERY  memorable.

But not in a good way.

I understand that a restaurant doesn't really decide when it's busy or not. But when I went two weeks ago on a Thursday for dinner, I really didn't expect the amount of neglect that my party of three received. We all ordered off of the AYCE menu and some dishes from the kitchen. 

In the duration of 30 minutes, we got nothing from the kitchen except miso soup. When we asked our server, he just nonchalantly shrugged and said it was a busy night. Barely saw him after that and just felt like he was avoiding our table. 

When we did get our nigiri and rolls, I really did wish it could've been SO MUCH BETTER to redeem the time that we wasted. There was so much rice in our sushi that it might've been better to just serve a bowl of rice. I understand that you're not supposed to discard the rice but I'm not paying for the rice, I'm under the impression that I'm paying for the sushi.

That night, we ordered dessert but we didn't have energy to waste another 20 minutes. We just left.

I really wanted to like this place after my very first encounter years ago wasn't that impressive. But seems like this restaurant has proved that first impressions always last.

Hands down, the food is amazing!   That's why we come here, but you have to come at odd hours because the servers suck whether you sit at the bar or in the restaurant.   If you come when they are busy, the service is a D at best.  They act like their head is in the clouds.  

But for food, love the atomic bomb, love affair,  dynamite roll, etc.  I could keep going and love the all you can eat.  They just need help with how to be a good food server.

I love this place ! I am a Sushi fanatic, and quite picky about my Sushi, when my son and I went to Oyshi, we were quite impressed with the friendly staff, the fast service, and the fresh Sushi ! This place is 5 stars to me and I will continue to recommend them to all my friends ! They are really busy so be prepared to wait a bit, but well worth it !
Kellyann

01.07.12

Preface: This review had been shortened & edited from an 8-page thesis which I will someday publish as "Can Fresh Sushi be Found in the Middle of the Desert?"

POSITIVE: 
* My 18 y.o. niece (Las Vegas native) recommended this sushi restaurant. "Uncle, this place is the BOMB!"
* Off the L.V. Strip

NEGATIVE:
* Host not attentive to the waiting guests (first time I've ever seen a restaurant host partake in drinking with guests during a work shift).
* Waitress/Server never there when we needed her - asking if we needed anything every 90 seconds the last 15 minutes of our stay.
* Food seemed like it sat too long before reaching the table. 
* Beer not chilled enough. (maybe it sat out too long before being served as well).
* Water glasses were never serviced nor were we asked if we wanted anything else to drink.
* The time waiting to be seated succeeded the time spent eating at the table
* Overpriced less than average fare for an over-rated joint.

Will I return? Sure...if I sit at the sushi bar & someone else pays.

Truth! deez out.

Loved this place!!! I ventured here, because it is quite a distance from my abode. I was not disappointed in the least and plan on making the trek regularly in the future. The combination of rolls and appetizers on their AYCE menu is vast. They have the cooked rolls with mayo and crab and crunch that my sister loves and they also have the poke and Cajun albacore that I adore. Service was impeccable and the lunch price at $21 is totally worth it. My nephew ate for $14 AYCE. This is definitely one of my fave AYCE places in town!

I've been coming here for years for the all you can eat and I think it's one of the best... I like that you can order half rolls at the bar so you can try more rolls . They always have good music and a great ambiance!

This is my 3rd visit to Oishi Sushi here in Vegas over last 5 years or so. One of the high-fluting sushi places in 5 star hotels I have stayed come close to the friendly service (EJ is an excellent server!) and variety of excellent dishes! I will return here for sure in my future trips to Vegas!
Food was good except for the EGG roll it had a funky taste. But our server EJ gave as excellent service we are happy customers .

3.5 stars for this joint. I go here frequently. Every time I open the menu I search for a new roll to try and I end up confused and indifferent to my selection. I'm not a huge fan of cream cheese or eel in my rolls. Oddly, these two items (but mainly the cream cheese) makes it hard for me to find one that sound appealing without modification. It's a large menu but I can never seem to find a roll that sounds 'amazing' as written. 

They offer all you can eat which is great for big eaters. We typically order a couple rolls, some baked mussels, a few hot sakes, and mochi. Each time the server has comped off one or more of the smaller items because we were paying the regular prices so it always comes out to about the same cost as if we had done all you can eat. 
Service can be spotty but if you're not in a rush it's a nice spot to grub on some sushi basics.
My favorite sushi in Vegas! Here with Sidney Eileen
They take too long to bring out food for AYCE and the rice seems like its old. They didn't take our order for a long time. I didn't get my last order. Dessert took forever to come out also.

Will not return. All you can eat at its WORST!! stay away. they have no idea about cleaning in this place. Check out they're recent health inspections no wonder we got sick!!!
http://www.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/restaurants/inspections.php

Had to give my two cents given all the overblown reviews this place has. Don't get me wrong the sushi was not bad - the albacore was tasty even though it was warm. Two of the rolls were ok, not delicious, but good. What this place needs to step up in is on service. Staff friendly but not as attentive as they could've been. I never received my Sapporo and was billed for it (I didn't pay for it).I imagine the trick is ordering the AYCE. The table next to us had it and received regular service, in fact, their water glasses were filled while ours were left empty. Place is not worth the lengthy drive from the strip.

the service egain one sushi chef for the whoole restaurant, extra slow service,in other words bad service, we never went back, n not to organise, the sushi guy dress in adidas shirt n terrible hat, not drss properly to his job, thanks

Omfg!   Everything from the wasabi to the rolls was FANTASTIC.   The sizes are cut appropriately small so you can thoroughly enjoy an AYCE experience.   Definitely will come here again on date nite with my wife.
