We had an 8:30 reservation. We were seated about 9. Our waiter was ridiculously rude. My husband isn't a sushi person and this annoyed the waiter to no end. Service was very slow. Sushi was just OK. I wouldn't eat here again free. We went with two young men. They could have eaten more but the service was so slow we gave up and left. Also, the music is way too loud for the inadequate sound system they have.

My family went here last night...as we go pretty often at least 2-3 times a month.  Hunby and I were so sick after eating here last night.  We were told that the chefs were behind, we waited 20 min for a seat, not even half the seats were filled.  The food tasted off...but since you have to pay for what you don't eat, my husband ate his knowing it wasn't quite right.  My son and I don't eat sushi, but the only thing my husband and I had that my son did not have was rice.  We were both so sick upon arriving home.  My husband said the kamakazi (spelling??) and tuna tasted funny but he ate it anyway.  Not sure we would eat here again.

Very good as far as ayce goes. They really have some quality rolls. I think I've had some better starters/appetizers at other ayce sushi spots but as far as rolls they are solid. My only drawback is the last few times I have been in this restaurant there have been lots of flies buzzing around for some reason. The food still tastes good but flies ruined our last few experiences landing on our table and even our sushi. We haven't been back since.

Always hard for me to comment on how the quality of AYCE sushi is to another, considering this would only be my second one. I've never been a fan of raw anything, so I usually stay away from places where sushi is the main dish.

I'm trying though! 

I've graduated and have been eating sushi (cooked of course) here and there. 

Back to my review! Wait time on a Saturday was little to none, which was absolutely amaze balls. A group of 6 of us came to eat, and we're immediately seated. Our server Game, was so sweet. He was quick to respond and had are orders coming out. He was apologetic at the end when some desserts were not available.

Great time, good corner table and constant refills on point. 

We ordered:
Rock and roll 
Veggie tempura 
Quail egg
Caterpillar roll 
Coco
Monster 
Ahi poke
Dynamite roll 
App dynamite 
Calamari 
Red dragon 
Hawaiian 
Crazy Cali 
Tiger roll
Green tea = wtf
Parfait 
Choco creme brule

Consistently good food and consistently bad service.. what can I say I am torn.  They have a great menu of rolls, decent ayce prices, their ahi poke is on point, but on the other hand I have had too many bad service experiences from them to count.. For that I would say there is better in Vegas and its worth looking for.

Waste of $45. Was just flavorless and proper sauces were not given.  SMITHS market woulda been better, fresher and cold!  The fish was room temp and then on my one fried roll the outside was so gummy.  I just followed my gut intuition and go to the SMITHS market next time!  :(

I've been to this sushi place 3 times.. My first two experiences here were alright.. The all you can eat is at a reasonable price and the rolls were ok. But the third time I came in was this last week.. I was very disappointed.. First it took them forever to seat us and there wasn't a lot of people.. There was no one in line and they only had a few people in the restaurant. Then all around our service was bad. Our waitress took a long time to take our orders and once we were done with a dish multiple waiters and bussers would walk by and they still wouldn't take away our dirty plates.. Eventually the dishes just piled up. Even when they brought new rolls out they wouldn't take our plates away.. Then to top off a bad experience the sushi was subpar if that. We could tell the fish was previously frozen so it took away the flavor of the fish. I was very disappointed.. The whole experience was bad.

(4.5 stars)

My trip to Vegas would not be complete without a visit to Oyshi Sushi. Though it's off strip, I'm lucky my best friend lives close enough so we can make a trip every time I'm there. 

My last visit was the first time I've done their All You Can Eat deal, and for $26, it was WELL WORTH IT! The only things it DOESN'T include are the Chef's Special Sashimi, so all your appetizers, salads, specialty rolls and desserts are included. My friends and I went all out and ordered several to share of every course. Oysters were delicious and baked mussels (while too much mayo sauce) was to die for. Tempura dishes are nice and crispy and not too soggy or heavy. My favorite salad is their ahi poke on top of seaweed salad - YUM! We shared 6 specialty rolls that were all delicious in their own ways. Again their specialty "yum yum" sauce is "yum yum", but in small amounts. The mochi ice cream is like the type you buy at the store, but again, it's all part of the deal so might as well indulge! We also got a bottle of lychee flavored cold sake that was decently priced and balanced the sweet:alcohol ratio perfectly.

Service is good: unless its super busy, the wait staff always comes up to check on your group, make sure your water is filled, etc. As with any sushi place, baked rolls will take longer, so be patient! They did forget one of our orders at one point, but since we were eating so much, it gave us time to digest.

If you can make the trip out with a group who enjoys sharing specialty rolls and can throw down in eating, Oyshi is the place to go!

So yesterday for a late lunch/early dinner my friends wanted to try a new sushi place. He was going to drive so I said sure wherever you want to go. He and our other friend heard good things about this place. We arrive and it turns out our other friend has been here once but forgot (haha hope this isn't bad news). 

Turns out it was really good. I like the decor of the place and the music playing makes it feel kind of clubby haah. Our waitress was nice to let us switch from the table to the bar so we could get our orders in faster. We all stuffed our faces full of sushi. Large selection of sushi to choose from so you should find something you like. Since the day I had some cream cheese in sushi I am a fan so when I saw it on the menu I had to try everyone that had cream cheese haha. For dessert which I gave to my friend I had the strawberry mochi. He had the green tea ice cream.

I give it 3 stars. I love the sushi and the guys were friendly making the sushi and the waitress was friendly too. It's far for me but if in the area it is the place I would stop at.
Excellent quick Service to my party of 15, everything was great from food to customer service, Thanks to my Server Mono!
Eveytime I go here it is excellent. I never had anything bad here. Got to go early cause this place gets packed.

Been going here many, many years since it opened. Still one of the best AYCE places in SW Las Vegas. Clean establish, fast & friendly service. Good quality. I just wished they didn't give so much rice with their sushi pieces.

I'm no sushi expert by any means, but I know what's good to me. Baked rolls are great as are the spicy rolls. Seems like a younger crowd that hangs out here and they play great music. Definitely do the all you can eat so you can sample the different styles of rolls. Worth the $20 every time. Always take friends and family here when they are visiting. This place can get busy and service can be slow at times, but it is always worth it!

I do love sushi and Oyshi's is good, but the AYCE service leaves something to be desired. Service is very slow, and orders come when the chef decides to prepare them, not when you ordered it.  Orders have been forgotten and errors made repeatedly. Because its all-you-can-eat maybe there's a sense that mistakes don't matter if you accept the dish, since it's all the same price.  

Those complaints aside, the food is done well and isn't oversized and sloppy like some AYCE places. You can tell the chefs care about presentation. I can't think of any food of poor quality there.  

My tips for this place would be to:
1) come with a list
2) order a variety of items at once. When they arrive, order the next batch. 
3) make sure everyone at the table agrees to order in batches, otherwise everyone  will be sitting around waiting for ages until your next lonely order arrives- and that second order could take 30 minutes or more!
4) save room for the tiny dessert. It comes with the AYCE.
Owner shows up late and place couldn't open for lunch, just lost a sushi fan due to lack of business ownership!

Were I come from, all you can eat sushi means buffet, which also means stay away. So when Khatherine T. and I made a sushi date and she suggested AYCE, I about died. Thankfully, Oyshi Sushi has opened my eyes to the other side of AYCE.

Even though this was my first real experience with AYCE, I still ordered off the menu, LOL! Should have and would have tried it, but the BF begged me to bring him left overs, the AYCE rules require you to finish eating everything you order. Nuts! Next time the BF can get his own sushi, I'm going big or going home!

Our server was so nice! He made several recommendations of really good rolls, I like mine spicy and he knew which were hot and which were too hot. He even told me one roll to stay away from. He was attentive and made sure we always had food in front of us and our water glasses stayed full. Khatherine was a pro at this, she didn't even have to look at the menu, she knew everything she wanted and ordered each time he came back to the table. She knew how to keep the sushi coming, and everything that came to the table looked delicious!

The sushi was good, not amazing, but good. I tried the Monster Roll (it was so big I had a hard time fitting it in my mouth!), the Rainbow Roll (by BF's request), and the Red Dragon. The Red Dragon was by far my favorite!! My order actually ended up being more expensive than the AYCE, but at least I could bring leftovers home. Now I need to plan date night with the Beau so that we can come back and try the AYCE together.

So V. and I headed to this spot on our way out of Las Vegas to L.A. and i am adding this place to my favorites whenever in Vegas...

Service is Decent,The food is great and they have plasmas where i got to see the Lakers take on the Rockets! So that was awesome,Sushi and watching the game...How cooler can you get...jk

So this was what V and I had/tried:

Philly Roll
Rainbow Roll
Tiger Roll
Dynamite Roll
Ginza Roll
Spyder Roll
2 orders of Yellowtail
2 orders of Albacore
5 orders of Tuna
5 orders of Salmon
Vanilla Creme Brulee
Strawberry Mochi Ice Cream

Everything was really good and fresh(on a sunday!) 

yea,i have experienced some places on sunday,and the fish never tasted this fresh.

So the deal is this,Only 2 hours to eat and no Sashimi,that works for me,regardless!

Thanks for reading,hit this one spot when in Vegas!
Great service and wonderful food. All-you-can-eat is a must if you're going in a group. Check out their special menu located behind the bar.

Great sushi! 

I walked in and had to wait about 5 minutes which is not a big deal at all. I would wait much longer to eat here again. Waiter was very friendly and made suggestions. The menu is very big and definitely worth it if you are going to eat at least 3 rolls. Plus, you get the option of ordering appetizers and other sides. The only down side to Oyshi is the time it takes to bring out your food. Other sushi places in town are very quick to get orders to the table. I went a second time hoping it was just an off night in the kitchen but the service was still incredibly slow. We were at our table for 10 minutes before anyone came to greet us, which is annoying but the food here is worth the wait I suppose.

This is our absolute favorite place to eat sushi! Great atmosphere, friendly staff and a great variety. You absolutely can't beat they're all you can eat price. The bonsai is my favorite. The only downside that I see is the wait is sometimes long but with food this good, it's worth it

Used to be my go-to place for sushi but I've had so many bad experiences, especially at dinner that I just cant' stand it anymore.  I always gave them a pass because they were so close to my house.

Here's my list of gripes:

-Sushi is not the freshest in town in comparison to other AYCE.  I had some  Spanish mackerel that literally I had to spit out.
-Service is horrendous, especially for dinner when they are swamped with customers.
-Most of the non-fish dishes are greasy and badly cooked.

I suppose they are good because they are so huge they have a lot of variety.  But who cares when it doesn't taste good.
Perfect. So friendly and great for our 4 year old son. Love the menu options. We will be back.

TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS: Best and freshest sushi place in town!  If you can splurge for all you can eat It Is definitely the way to go!  Super selection-The yellowtail and garlic tuna are amazing!  Fresh everytime  and melts in your mouth.  Top 5  favorite rolls - I think what makes these so good is the eel sauce (slightly sweet):

1) Atomic bomb (kind of a sad name for a japanese roll but I digress) - spicy jalapeno on top and siracha
2) Monster roll - huge but has all the goodies 
3) Simply shrimp- light and sweet
4) Red dragon- spicy tuna roll sweet and spicy yum!
5) Tiger roll - similar to red dragon buy with shrimp tempura added

Just tried their hand roll last night - They have a killer shrimp and avocado one. Not on the menu but they'll make it for you. 

Appetizers:
Seaweed salad
Excellent tempura-always fresh and hot never oily
Surf and turf-steak and shrimp appetizer. One order enough for two people to share

Desserts (all you can eat is one dessert per person)
Mochi of course!!
Yogurt parfait is big, especially after a large meal, but very tasty

Some negatives:

Oyshi can get really busy.  They do take reservations and have two private rooms available.  Also, not a big fan of the "baked sushi" although the california crunchy roll is pretty good if you like baked.

All in all, this is my favorite sushi place in town and really hard to beat.  This place is a "must" for any yelper!
Love love love! This place is the best, large assortment of rolls and so many options so other menu items that are included in the all you can eat.

I'm a huge fan of Oyshi as it is just minutes from my house. There is definitely something to be said about convenience! That said, the sushi is pretty damn good here as well. Much better than other AYCE (all-you-can-eat) places in town. Though I do argue with my friend about what's better between Oyshi and Sushi-mon so I'd call it a coin flip.

The only reason I didn't give Oyshi 5 starts is because of the service. Every once in a while you'll find yourself wanting to order sushi for 10 minutes or more because you haven't seen your server. Simple solution for this is to sit at the sushi bar. Nothing I would knock it down to 3 stars for because overall is still great sushi and a good experience!

I have to say that this all-you-can-eat sushi buffet wasn't too bad. The service and ambiance was definitely better than Sushimon, but when it comes down to quality, taste, and presentation....Sushimon wins the competition!

If you don't mind driving a bit off the strip, then come to this sushi place. It was only $22 for lunch when my friends and I went here on a Saturday.

Sorry, peeps...Sushimon is still better for me...

AYCE this place is awesome and everything tastes great wish I could have more than one premium dessert but I guess I could just have another sush roll instead? Don't do one offs just go AYCE so worth it!
All you can eat... Check. Great quality fish... Check. Open for lunch... Bonus! We'll be coming back!
OMG!! Haven't been here in over 3 years and it's still over the top delish!!  Kudos!! Thank u Odi excellent service and recommendations!!

Not worth it. Portions are tiny, have to order twice, most of their rolls have 'Cajun' rub, not many choices for the price they offer. 
Our server was okay but alittle off. I first ordered gyoza and after getting everything we ordered I told him I never got my gyoza his response was, "I never heard u say that" clearly my girl friend I came with heard me and so I said ok can I get an order he walks away. Then we ask to order more, we put an order in for two more rolls, waited 10 mins he comes back and asks if we wanna order dessert so we order that and he brings them over so me and my friend look at each other confused bc we ordered two more rolls and he clearly didn't put that order in so we just paid and left. Totally by wort it and I recommend trying to ignore that server never even got his name! 
Yama on flamingo and Maryland is the best ayce sushi too bad they don't stay open late or we would of gone there!

I'm always looking for new late night spots to try in Vegas because I usually eat dinner here around 11 or 12, so I decided to give this one a shot. I especially love a good late night happy hour, but here it's only with the sake, not the food. 
Great service, the chefs were really friendly and always checking to make sure if we needed anything. But the food (in terms of good sushi and authentic Japanese) was mediocre. It's one of those Americanized places where spicy tuna, fried California roll, and yum yum sauce are dominant on the menu and where most of the cut rolls taste the same because its all different variations of the same ingredients. I ordered their white tuna sushi and sunomono salad as well. White tuna was decent and sunomono was something errr else...cucumber was shredded thin, not sliced thin and they put a sesame peanut sauce on it instead of the usual rice vinegar. Let's just say I didn't finish it and I'm one not to waste food unless it's truly unappetizing.
Fat pieces of fish on the nigiri, the ratio and freshness beats all of the other sushi joints I've tried out here.
My boyfriend and I received FOOD POISONING from them. I recommended no one pays a visit here because the next day will not be pleasant.

Oyshiii! It means yummy or tasty in Japanese. This place does makes some pretty good food that makes me say that though. I live about 5 minutes away so I'm always glad to support my neighborhood businesses. But this place is really worth my time and money. I really like their ayce menu as they always have specials. I love the salmon toro for example and sometimes they do a yellowtail special as well which is worth trying. 

They also have a number of great apps, like baked mussels or surf and turf skillet, that are ayce, and my mom loves them. 

I also like that, unlike some of the other popular ayce sushi places in the area, the wait here is never crazy. If you come here on a regular weekend night, it shouldn't be anything more than 10-15 min wait. 

Lastly, if you have a small party, sit at the bar as you can order half rolls to try out more things on the menu.

This place is poppin on a Saturday night!

We won out last game for the day and wanted to celebrate as a team. 

I'll be hella honest, I wanted to hit that plant based fast food spot around the way. But being the team player (haha get it?) that I am I went along with the plan.

We ate in one of the back rooms that we actually had to customize the tables/set up ourselves because there were a grip of Samoans in a small room haha

My table did not pick the AYCE option but I got a few veggie rolls and the yakisoba which I did not care for but the rolls were really tasty and fresh!

The service was on point. They were bringing rolls out left and right. There were about 4 folks serving us and they were super chill.

One even participated in our mannequin challenge haha

Today was my second time visiting this sushi place. First time I was there, I wasn't too impressed. But I came back again today, and oh boy.. I completely changed my mind about this place.

My family and I had shrimp tempura, baked mussels, heart attack roll, salmon roll, california roll, oyshi roll, lasagna roll, yellowtail nigiri, salmon nigiri, white tuna nigiri, and the vegas roll. Everything that we ordered was completely delicious. I really appreciated that the sashimi slices for their nigiri were generously thick. The fish to rice ratio of the nigiri was perfect. Not too much rice.

Only reason why I gave it a 4 is because the service was kind of eh. And I really didn't like how my 3-year-old was $16 for AYCE. My daughter doesn't even eat much sushi at all. I like sushi places that have children 5 & under free. So those two would be my only reasons as to why they don't receive 5 stars. 

Minus the cons, I think this place is a very decent place to eat sushi. I would go back. Not often, but if I'm ever in this side of town & craving some sushi.. I'll definitely stop by.

$26/per person for all-you-can-eat dinner sushi. Excellent service. Great tuna poke, seaweed salad and the Tiger Roll here is the best I've had yet. I also recommend the Pink Lady. I never had tried this before, but it was ahi tuna, cooked shrimp wrapped in pink soy paper. Delicious! The only complaint my friend made is that desert is limited to one item only. Boo!

Oyshi was my first AYCE experience here in Vegas.  At first I thought it was one of the better AYCE sushi places in Vegas but lately it has gone down hill. Case in point my last visit.

We had a party of 6, waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  I've been here when it has been busy and tonight it wasn't that BUSY. We made our first round of orders and waited, waited some more and waited.  It was a good 25 minutes before we got our first round.  We didn't receive our complete order, I just said eh never mind. We ordered some more, and I ordered some Uni and oysters for our group. Again we waited, and waited again. We got the rest of our FIRST order and got some of the second but no uni or oysters. So I ordered some nigiri to hold me over until the uni and oysters came. My nigiri came but not the other items, finally the oysters came but no uni, i asked our server where is the uni and i she tells me 'oh, we ran out'. I was like WTF! Shouldn't you know that information before I ordered it or at least kept me updated. At this point some of my party was clearly upset and just ordered dessert but guess what? They were OUT of some the dessert items too! 

This last visit was VERY bad, I hope they improve cause I like this place a lot because they offer different items from other AYCE.

FYI: The table next to us, got up and left and never paid, I think it was due to the poor service they got.

I'll be back, MAYBE

This place was initially introduced and highly recommended to us by a friendly bartender from the Silverton Casino.  He informed us that this place was a spin-off of Sushi Factory (in Las Vegas).  It's a bit out of the way from "The Strip", but if you have the time it's well worth it.  Anyway, after a horrible experience at Sushi Factory (see my review) several months ago, my buddies and I decided to give Oyshi a go.  We couldn't have been any happier with our visit to Oyshi.  Our server (Justin) was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  As for the food, the sashimi was fresh, the rolls were tasty, the ambiance was comfortable, simple and modern.  By the way, the Ama ebi (sweet shrimp) and Uni (sea urchin) were both very fresh and delicious.  However, I was bummed that each customer was limited to one order of Ama ebi and Uni per customer.  But being that both are very expensive items, one can understand.  If you're looking for a great, affordable sushi dinner in the Las Vegas area, look no further than Oyshi.  I hope they keep up the good service, and not falter like that of Sushi Factory.

Oyshi has a delicious and extensive ayce menu, there is no doubt about that. Many of the items are interesting and full of flavor. Some of my favorite items are the Love Affair and Japanese Lasagna rolls as well as the beef wrapped asparagus and sizzling ribeye. The quality and creativity of their menu items deserves praise. For example, the cucumber salad isn't the typical you would get at another sushi spot, they have a peanuty sauce laid on top that really individualizes it from the standard version of the dish. All that being said, I still would not say that dinner there should be several dollars higher than other ayce sushi places. 

First of all, the service at Oyshi stinks, to put it plainly. Don't get me wrong, the staff is pleasant and at times can even be friendly. However, the food just comes out way too slowly. Other sushi restaurants really leave Oyshi crying in the dust when it comes to this. On top of that, they definitely pull the "always filling up your drink" technique to get us full. This just doesn't give your party a lot of room to appreciate all of the items they offer simply because your appetite duration can only hold out for so long.

Secondly, the dessert choices are outstanding, BUT you are limited to one special dessert! Their desserts are the best I've seen so far at a sushi place, but oh my goodness, for $26 dinners, I personally think we should be allowed to try them all one time each, at the very least! I am in love with the green tea tiramisu and the green tea crme brle. The fruit parfait is also very tasty, anything but disappointing.

For these reasons, I award Oyshi three stars. Their food makes them a great establishment, but I strongly feel they need cater better to the customers.

UPDATE: 5-28-08: Went back 4 times since review every time was awesome. We even had the AYCE at a table instead of the sushi bar and the service was great. Before our rolls were done our server got our next order. This place impresses me every time.

Food was delicious!! If you love AYCE this is definitely the spot to indulge in different types of sushi! HUGE shoutout to Stefan for the great service and his recommendations on what to choose. We truly enjoyed our experience and plan to come back soon!

-Ced

Super disappointed. On my previous trip to Oyshi, I thought it was decent sushi and service. However today's trip to Oyshi was a super disappointment. The hostess was no where to be seen, so we had to wait 20 minutes before someone even noticed we were there. We finally got seated, got out drinks, and ordered our first selection for the all you can eat sushi. However, we had to wait 35 minutes until even just our appettizer of the small surf and turf came out. After that it seemed like we were invisible to the waiters before we even got one to awknowledge that they were having staffing problems and that we should wait another 15 minutes for our sushi to come out. When we finally got the sushi it was horribly made and cold (we ordered a baked sushi). I happened to order calamari for my 2nd selection after finishing the 1st. That never came. After being ignored for a few more minutes another waitress came by to see if we would like anything, I was already super pissed by that time so I just ordered a dessert and asked for the check. The $26 for a dinner all you can eat sushi was not worth it. So sad that this place did not meet up to my expectations

Everything from the service to the quality and presentation I was very satisfied ,  will be returning 

Price for ayce  was 27 for dinner  23 for lunch

I love the AYCE here the variety is great. Dynamite is good...lobster fair...the sizzling appetizers, like surf and turf. The sake is reasonably priced and does its job ha ha and who doesn't love dessert? I had a berry parfait and creme brle and they were delicious!! On top of it all, it was an amazing value

great deal for all you can eat!!! 21 bucks for adults and 15 for kids. i treated myself and my cousins to a lunch before taking the red eye back to nyc.

i wasn't sure if we were going to be able to eat a lot but we sure ate more than we paid for! everything in the menu was included except for sashimi (easy fix: order it sushi style and don't eat the rice), uni and ebi.

we had gyoza, edamame, seaweed salad,  seven rolls (from regular spicy tuna and alaska rolls to specialty ones including a spider, baked rolls, and a deep fried philly), two hand rolls, two orders of tako nigiri, two orders of hamachi nigiri, an order of tamago, and green tea ice cream for dessert.

i'd say we did a but of damage at this joint! what i also liked was that our waitress was recommending specialties to get and told us that appetizers and dessert were included. she was also helpful when my cousin wanted green tea ice cream and parfait by combining the two together. it was pretty much the green tea ice cream instead of vanilla yogurt with fruit and whipped cream on top. what a way to end a great meal!

Well I just ate at Oyshi an hour ago and this is my experience with them. First off I should have known better to eat there when I realized me and my friend were the only Asians in the restaraunt. If you are a Expert Sushi eater you would do well to stay away from Oyshi. The Sushi Rice was horrid. It was not cooked all the way and they pack the rice way too tight. I never got three things I ordered by the time I left which was such a turn off.  Some of the Nigiri was decent however some of it tasted not so fresh. The back of my throat was itching from their fish as I am very sensitive to bad fish. The server was super sweet however she was not attentive what so ever. 

    My child ordered the Teryaki kids meal and the first thing she said when I asked her how is it was my chicken is dry with no flavor so I had them take it back. 

   They do not understand how to make rolls there. I ordered the spicy tuna which was the worse spicy tuna. They had no cucumber in any rolls which that texture was missing from every roll. I do not think they understand the proper way to make sushi. 

  Discouraged from the sushi I tried to order some apps to get my moneys worth.... Bad idea the salad ...bad! The Calamri was the same frozen tiny dried over cooked calamari served at other pizza bistros. The sizzling rib eye was over cooked and dry and flavorless. The mussels had a garlic soy mayo sauce which was super salty and made the mussels super rich. 

   This place seems to be more for those who really do not know what good sushi is. If you were raised eating sushi then I would stay far away from Oyshi.  They seem concerned when they notice a customer is unhappy yet management or the servers do nothing to ammend the situation. 

  I ordered Sea Urchin, sunrise roll, white tuna, salmon, garlic tuna and a few other rolls and Nigiri. The only thing I liked or enjoyed was my water with lemon. 

  Now all I am thinking about is the money I wasted there. I have never been so displeased ergo why I tweeted to my 16 Thousand Followers that they should never eat at Oyshi .. HORRIBLE
What can I say...ALL YOU CAN EAT Sushi...its great!  Great kitchen items too.  Service was good, and the California and California-based rolls were out of the world delicious!

Amazing! My mother in law, sister in law & I stayed in the area cause we had rented an air bnb for Memorial Day weekend and we were beyond happy we found this place. We were more sad we couldn't bring them back with us to California. The attention and the food were seriously spectacular! And the all you can eat had such a big variety that I didn't know what to do with my life. I seriously cannot wait to be back. Much love from California!

First time visiting this place and I was very pleasantly surprised.  We did have to wait a minute for a table during lunch but it was worth it. The amount of food for the price was great.  I got the teriyaki sizzling chicken platter and it was more than enough.  I would definitely return.

Wide variety of rolls and appetizers. Pretty good, BUT...some of slowest service I've ever received at a sushi joint. I heard so many good things about this place and with the service alone...I wouldn't come back.
All you can eat style dining but what makes this place nice is the decor and friendly staff. Worth the wait for a table at 6:30 pm Sunday September 1st, 2013. $26 AYCE.

This is my favorite sushi place in town! I love the array of delicious rolls they offer and the rib eye. Not to mention the appetizing green tea berry parfait. I highly recommend, and be sure to do AYCE.

This place has gone downhill in a major way. It used to be good. I wonder if it's under new management or ownership.  The salmon nigiri was fresh, but everything else was just downright nasty. How do you mess up rolls that contain imitation crab? Which, by the way, a majority of the rolls contain. The imitation crab was mushy and sweet. The rolls were 7 day-old grocery store quality. I'm talking about Albertson's quality. The rolls at Whole Foods are way better than Oyshi's. Also, the rolls were loaded with way too much rice. I know that ayce places love to fill you up with rice, but this was ridiculous. Why have rolls called the yum yum scallop that contains one tiny sliver of scallop, or a lobster fair roll that has no lobster in it?  This was a waste of $72 for two people.

This is my favorite sushi place in town. We eat here (and order to go) very frequently. They have really fresh fish and some interesting combinations. My favorite roll is the screaming roll, with shrimp tempura, cajun albacore, avocado and ponzu sauce. Yum! Their dinners are great, like the sukiyaki, rib-eye teriyaki and asian style skirt steak. Also love their appetizers, like popcorn scallops and calamari tempura.

The sushi was great the service was lacking. The two star is for the service not the sushi. I ordered several rolls with ayce and didn't ever receive a couple of the ordered rolls. Not sure what is going on here I used to think this place was great.

The service has been decent,  food has been decent as well.  I just wish they offered 1/2 order options for sushi /rolls.  Also, the happy hour time and offers could definitely be better and more expansive as far as time offered and selections are concerned.
i like here so much . good service and good food. very fresh. sever is very nice. i like here's dessert too.

It's pretty decent, not that I had high expectations for it. It's my first time just now because I had heard bad things about it a long time ago (quality of fish mostly). 

There's nothing special, in my opinion, but my friend wanted to come to try one of their desserts (IKR?). 

They only allow you to pick one dessert item (not including unlimited ice cream, though). Another friend stated when they came before they didn't have this restriction. Well, looks like it was just mochi ice cream for me then, which comes only in strawberry, by the way. 

They have some daily specials so check out that list on the way to your table. Fish wasn't as shabby as anticipated so that was a plus. I love salmon nigiri but theirs wasn't too good, actually. So I definitely ate less than usual in that department. 

In terms of hot tea, they charge you $2.50 for the pot at the table so I'm thankful it wasn't $2.50 per person :). 

Overall, it's pretty much a just as expected / average place for me. In this area, it's not my to-go place for ayce sushi but hey, this visit just means I won't say no if another friend wants to eat here. :0)

Went here last Friday to celebrate "Treat yo Self" day (if you watch parks and Rec you know what I'm talking about) & it was pretty good. They're all you can eat dinner was just about $30. I believe it was $28 something. It wasn't bad. The service was pretty prompt and the restaurant was clean and very "organized". I liked it. It was small, but had a very modern and cozy feel. The menu wasn't that expansive per say when it came to the variety of rolls. Maybe it's just me. I look for certain key "trigger" words and nothin jumped it at me. I did order the snow mountain and the Japanese garlic lasagna roll which were pretty good. Also ordered the baked mussels which are MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE THING. The thing I didn't like was they have limits on certain apps like the oysters and the mussels. Kind of a buzzkill. Overall I can't complain too much, but the place just didn't wow me. If I had the option to go out for sushi again. I'd go to the nearby "Sushi House Goyemon" instead. No limit on mussels, lots of roll variety, and tempura ice cream !

We've been going to this restaurant for nearly 6 years now and since the end of last year (2017), it seems to be going down hill fast. It used to be the place that all of our out of town guests were excited to eat at when they visited and that my wife and I had date nights at (literally hundreds of times). Not anymore. It seems as if there was a change in ownership or management because the service has been slow at best most recently and down right unacceptable the rest of the times with 45-55 minutes before some of our party's food even arrived. We've been 3 times in the past month trying to give it one more chance way too many times and out of those 3 times, my wife and I got sick the last two (not making the connection that it was the sushi that got us sick the time previous). This is it for us. No more chances when our health is in question.

If anyone has any recommendations for a good AYCE sushi restaurant on the southwest side of town, please share it with me! We're trying to figure out where we'll go for sushi from now on.

Yummy! Love this place but you can not get in for dinner without waiting. This place needs to expand or get a bigger space because a wait on a Tuesday night is not cool! Their food is really good and their portion sizes are good. Prices are fair, staff is nice, and restaurant has a nice contemporary atmosphere. The best time to go is lunch and they have some great lunch specials and menu. I love living close and being able to grab some food to go.

I am actually quite shocked as to how low the yelp review for this place was.   My boyfriend suggested it to me as one of his friends had taken him there the day before.   I completely forgot to check in on yelp so after we ordered I looked and got pretty scared of the low rating. 

Well it's off that's for sure.   I actually really liked this place.   A lot.  

The menu has a good variety of items.   The specials were interesting (and written on the wall very nicely.)  Out of all the items we ordered (believe me there are more than what is pictured here.   Lol!), the only ones I actually did not care for were the sunamono (there seemed to be some weird peanut butter or sesame paste thing on top) and the green tea tiramisu (was oily and flavorless to me.)

The other amazing thing about this place was Judy.   Probably the best server I've had in a long time (including any fine dining this past year.)  She was super attentive and seemed to really care about her job. 

Definitely might make this place my new sushi joint...
This is the best AYCE sushi in Vegas! We always come here for a great time and good eats!! The sushi chefs are amazing!!

Hands down my favorite sushi. My wife prefers baked rolls and they have a great selection for her. I like it all and the all you can eat rocks!  Plus there are private rooms for parties. We have held a few larger birthday dinners there with great success!

Atlas my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas!

Unfortunately I'm unable to rate them a full 5 star due to their slowness on delivering plates. My group definitely has to order a lot of sushi at once to compensate for the wait time in between orders.

The environment is amazing. It's definitely the most up to date sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. I'm judging by the actual wall decor to the house music played.

My favorite dish would have to be A Lobster Affair. If you don't have a shellfish allergy give this dish a try.

By far the worst service I have received in a while. Literally waited an hour for an appetizer. Basically wasted time and money . Whenever we made an order we would wait FORVER for it to make our table. Not to mention half of our orders didn't make it to our table! We ended up asking for our check and what was funny is that the manager brought out the rest of our food. Seriously??? Yea total waste of $70!

Horrible service... They make guests wait while they have open tables. This is the third time I have come here and it's the same story every time. Rude hostess, no customer service. I will never come back to this oyshi. If I could rate them a zero I would.

I get why they have four stars, it's a hip place with electronica music playing in the background, and that seems to be a Vegas standard now.  However, I can't say ill be making my way back.

They have a variety to choose from for AYCE, with the whole inside menu strictly rolls.  When I do AYCE, I only go for nigiri.  As I've posted before, I'm not really into rolls because its usually covered in sauce, with very little filling.  I guess it's what Americans love though... Sauce on everything.  I'm guilty as well, just not on my sushi.

Anyway, the fish was really poor quality.  After my initial order, I couldn't bring myself to order any more.  I love my fish to taste like fish (if that even makes sense).  The fish here had no taste whatsoever.  All I could taste was the vinegar from the rice.

I thought it was cool they served oysters, but it was pretty blah.  There was no flavor at all.  It tasted like water.  It did not have that "taste like the sea" quality.  I don't know.  It just didn't taste like anything.  The baked mussels were not very good. Overcooked. No flavor.  Too chewy.

Tofu was ok, but too much sauce, and it was overly sweet.  Desserts were boring.  No green tea ice cream. Creme brle was ok.  Ice cream parfait was ok.

Seriously, this place is lacking all types of flavors.

I like the fact that they serve "fresh" scallops, other places usually have the baby scallops drenched in yum yum sauce.  

Server was friendly.  

I'd pass on this place and go for Goymen, Sushi Komo, or even Kaya.

Introduced by a friend was very impressed. Came back a second time this time I bought friends we ate in VIP room it was dirty. But food still great. At the end I ordered 2 rolls to go for my friend who intro me to this spot cause he couldn't make it. I brought them to his store after dinner and left he texted me to ask what they were cause it was not what he ordered. We called oyshi manager Kevin and he told us he would take care of us next time. So a few days later (visit 3 in less then 10 days) we went again. This time my friend who intro the place made it. When we were done we asked for Kevin again the five of us ate ayces. My two boys both under 3 did not eat. Again we were in VIP room.  Kevin came up and we reminded him of our wrong roll order and the 22 buck credit we had. He said what rolls would you like to take home? We said none the guy we ordered them for is here and we ate enough fish tonight. He said well I'm not taking off check next time you do want rolls to go I will take care of you. Then the check came 18% gratuity for 5 people....... We paid it cause it was 24 dollars but the server actually screwed himself out of a bigger tip.  The service also sucked.. Hour for our first round of rolls to show to the table. It's fresh it's good. It will be closed soon if their attitudes don't change.
Chef Ed was our sushi chef tonite! He made our experience amazing! We will come back just to see him!

Oyshi, well what can I say. It is an all you can eat sushi place that is run by Koreans. The decor is very modern and there are several water sculptures that is placed around the restaurant. They also have private rooms and large Plasma tvs that will show a basketball game or two. I was introduced to this sushi place by a friend of mines and went for the first time a couple of months ago. I have to say their appetizer menu is, by far, superior to all AYCE sushi places. Their surf and turf has this sweet and tangy sauce, it is served over a bed of shredded greens with steak and shrimp on a hot plate that is sizzling as it arrives. Their oysters are fairly good served with a bit of chili sauce and you can have max of 4. I have gone back to Oyshi about 3 times and this review is a collective of all the times I dined there. The first time I dined I ordered some salmon, tuna, yellowtail, nigiri. I was very very impressed with the quality and ratio of rice to fish. I asked the waiter what he would recommend as it was my first time dining there and he immediately chirped "love affair" you must have it. It was very very good. I do have to say it took them over 20 minutes to bring out my order of nigiri and even longer for the love affair roll. There were probably 10 people dining there. I was kind of confused as a couple that came after us got their roll first. I am normally a service junkie and if I don't get it I usually don't ever step back into the restaurant. This restaurant seemed like a place that deserved a second chance. I went another time with a group of 9 and were sat in a semi private area where the wall had a huge mural that seemed hand painted. We were seated and they took our orders. The wait wasn't as painful this time as they brought out the food fairly quickly. Once again, the love affair roll and my classic salmon, tuna and yellowtail nigiri were wonderful. The third time I went was pretty similar to the first time I dined here. The service was subpar and their food seemed to lack flavor. I have to say if their service was at par with how their decor is I would probably have given a higher rating, but without good service the clients will never return. Maybe they deserve another chance? I have to wait and see.

My first time experience here wasn't the best, don't get me wrong the sushi was good. Just had bad service. But the waiter was disappointing, the food came to us late, all I know is that I felt like the hospitality wasn't there. Left knowing I didn't wanna come here again. First & last timer for sure.

I have been coming here for years...unfortunately a good place is not so good anymore. Went to dinner had the all you can eat. The Gyoza n shrimp tempura were good bc you can't mess up fried stuff. The ribeye app was tasteless n not even sizzling when it came out. The sushi was sooo disappointing. Not fresh at all.....The sushi rice was obviously pre-made (main inside rolls w/ the crab n sushi rice that comes under the fish) meaning that they mass produce the main parts of the sushi- refrigerate it and then just added the fish and toppings after the fact. The rice was sooo cold that when you were eating it, it felt like you were eating ice cream with warm sushi toppings. I know this place is busy but when a place moves in that direction to get people in n out not good;( 
Very sad that this restaurant is cutting corners like that, especially with sushi. I rather go to an a la carte place and get my sushi made and rolled fresh.

This place is a delicious all you can eat sushi joint. The variety is good, the quality is good, the service is good, and the price is relative to any other all you can eat sushi place. I have come here multiple times, and I will continue to.

All you can eat sushi... Who's idea was this? 

I came, I all-you-can-eated, I left in a near coma! 

Good sushi, I think it was like $26 for the all you can eat, comes with sushi, or hot food items (ie gyoza and such), you order from the server, they make it, bring it out, rinse repeat! 

Standard dinning room, sushi bar, or they have a couple of side rooms if you want to roll out here with a group of people or have a party and such here!

For people looking for variety, not so much into the raw fish part of sushi, this place has a lot of variety and their offerings are pretty good. 

But for the sushi purist and sushi snob it's a no go. The fish is not at its freshest/finest compared to other places, most of their rolls are stuffed full of imitation crab, and the rice is pretty inconsistent across chefs, getting bigger with the more you order. 

Their deserts are more unique than other places and pretty good. The parfait was the best out of the brulees and tiramisu that we tried among their offerings. 

No complaints about the service this day.

I come to this restaurant at least two time a week in the past and since my last encounter I will no longer be going back nor recommend it to anyone. I called in for a pick up order and after realizing I made a mistake I called back. When the guy on the phone answered he put me on hold and decided at least 10 minutes of my time deserves to be wasted. I hung up and called again he answered and when I asked if he fixed my order so they don't make extra he said he was "very busy" and hung up on me. I called yet again this time to cancel my order where I was hung up on AGAIN. By this time I'm clearly upset I called and this time a woman answered she said no manager was on duty and that she was going to give my number to the manager. NO ONE reached out or called. I will not do business where it is not appreciated. The management obviously doesn't care how their staff take care of regulars and the staff has no manners. I've put up with mistakes here and there and never complained but the level of disrespect this last time will not be forgiven. 

Any other location will be better if you enjoy this place.

Sushi is good but the service is terrible. Especially when you have a personal training without a trainer. Ordered all you can eat and had a few questions about items on the menu and our waitress had no idea what I was talking about. Then I ordered a few items that never came out or sides like jalapeos that showed up after we're done eating. We were a party of 2 and we ordered 4 rolls and 3 orders of sushi our quick dinner turned in to a 2 hour total ordeal.

Mmmm yummy Oyshi sushi oh how we adore our monthly AYCE visits! My sweet cheeks and I really enjoy coming here as part as our dining out rotation as it is always a real treat.

We always sit at the bar in the back corner as it is cozy and has a great view of the flat screen TV on the wall that always has the latest sports game playing. 

We have our favorite rolls and this time we enjoyed a new appetizer that was really good. The popcorn scallops was a yummy appetizer we tried which came with a honey mustard and a spicy ranch dipping sauce. 

What we really like about Oyshi is the consistency in service and food quality. We have never really been disappointed with a visit, it is an easy and happy relationship we have with Oyshi.

I really enjoy the flavors of the Oyshi roll and the Lobster Affair which both melt in my mouth. My lover boy likes the spicy rolls such as the nuclear bomb and the atomic roll. He loves anything that is spicy and that has jalapeno in it  When I want a satisfying mouth orgasm this is where I go to get it over and over and over again.

I like mouth orgasms caused by Amazing flavors exploding in my mouth!

I'm from San Diego and when I heard "ALL YOU CAN EAT" sushi -- I had to try this out. My family and I had lunch here and It blew me away. The decor was gorgeous and modern and for $21 dollars for all you can eat sushi plus sweets! 

Went here on the weekend and there was a good amount of people dining. The sushi was good and I even tasted some sushi that I wouldn't normally try back home. Because of the "all you can eat deal", I took advantage of that. As we ordered it took a bout a couple of minutes for our food to come out. 

I gave this place 3 stars because our waitress Vivian had forgotten some of our food.
The food was good and I wanted to try as much as I could, I got too excited.. but when you forget an order, it bums customers out. She did apologize. 

I would like to come back again and try more of the food here, just hopefully they wont forget our order :)

Super disappointing... We come here often and while I understand it's Valentine's and everyone is busy but I don't get the the roll orders. I've seen plenty of tables get 10+ rolled while all we got was our drinks in 50 min... we placed a second order 30 min in since it was busy and somehow got that roll before our main order.

Figure out your order process... when the hostess comes back to me and tells me the chef says the order is out and we have nothing our table.. that is not service.


***updated from 1 star to 4

After our waitress Toni was super nice and explained what issue was I can't blame her. But I do feel like the kitchen chefs ruined our Valentine's Day with the disorder and chaos.

I'm just waiting for someone to post pictures of their sick mural so I can go get a life sized tatoo of their samurai looking warrior on my back. 

Their private rooms are comfortable and my party of 5 was diggin it Yakuza style watchin the Celtic's/Cav's game while listenin to some Alice DJ in the background. 

They have this Korean mouthwash dispenser in the bathroom that probably serves shots of sake/soju or something because that mutha was empty when I tried to hit it up for some mouth smell good. 

$21for all you can eat bomb ass sushi rolls! The rolls weren't janky all lopsided and crooked either. The fish was fresh and I know if they had one of these in the bay area that it would be soo popular.

Oyshi means YUMMY in Japanese! The sushi & rolls are delicious. Their fishes are so fresh that you can't even taste the fishiness! BUT! The service has decline over the years. They were great when they first open, now they are slow with everything. It takes at least 20 mins. to get your food. You'll even have to wait for a waiter to come around again just to pay your bill. Definitely give them a try but don't expect anything fast!
My favorite sushi place in vegas, all you can eat or not.  Great staff, great food, great atmosphere.

We decided to have a surprise birthday party for a friend, and she loves Oyshi!  So we arranged to have dinner in the private room, there was probably about 15 people with our party.  We enjoyed beer and sake, we then ate soooooo much amazing food! Everything was great! The staff was attentive and we all had a great celebration!

Finally made it to Vegas to try Oyshi sushi. I learned about this place from a website called Sushinomads. It had good reviews so I had to plan to go the next time I was in Vegas. We went during lunch AYCE sushi which is not much different from dinners AYCE. I must say that the quality of the food deserves five stars. They offer a lot of interesting styles of rolls and also offer specials of the day that are included in AYCE. My test for all sushi restaurants I go to is the Salmon Skin Handroll. Oyshi passed with flying colors. The salmon skin was crispy. The seaweed was crunchy and not soggy from getting drenched with eel sauce to add flavor. Salmon skin roll is a simple roll but can easily be ruined if not done correctly. Since that turned out well, I was really looking forward to trying the wide selections of rolls that they offered on the menu. You pretty much have the whole menu to choose from including appetizers, salads and desserts for the AYCE. So if it's not just sushi you're craving, the AYCE is still an excellent choice. We will definitely go back to try the many different sushi & rolls we were to full to try.

Alright this is all you need to know: it's a Japanese AYCE restaurant that's not Japanese. 

We came here for lunch and did the AYCE menu. For $25ish, its a steal of a deal just based on the cost basis of California style sushi at any other restaurant. 
And that my friends, is all we came here for.  If you have read any of my other Japanese restaurant reviews, you know that this is not my cup of tea so please don't unfollow me; the lady wanted to eat Cali style sushi so what the lady wants, the lady gets. 

Here is the fat skinny on this place: if you stick to just the sushi rolls, you will be satisfied. Lets do the math: the average price for a Cali style roll at any given sushi joint will run you about $10 so assuming you eat at least 2 rolls, then you will eat your money's worth. 
The rolls were decent but nothing spectacular. As mentioned previously I prefer the purist motherland style sushi. 

Notable misses for this place:
1. They charge extra for sashimi
2. Most of the cooked food is not very good. The steak did not taste good and the sizzling platter was loaded with onions as fluff. 


The gf was happy she got her Japanese lasagna and spider rolls so all in all an -ok dining experience I guess...

Oyshi Sushi is a pretty good AYCE sushi restaurant located in the SW.  After hearing my coworker praising it, I finally hit up the place with a few Meetup folks from Las Vegas and SoCal.  It is the sister restaurant to Soyo Barestaurant in the same plaza, so yes, this is another Korean owned sushi restaurant with some items that has a more Korean flare/flavor.

The restaurant itself is well-lit and trendily decorated, and attracts a diverse crowd of patrons looking for good AYCE sushi at a reasonable price.

The AYCE menu is practically the entire menu (mostly nigiri and rolls), except the sashimi and if I remembered correctly some salads.  They also have expanded their menu, and the new items are printed on the paper place mats, so don't forget to check those out too.  Plus the numerous options available in the appetizer section is more than adequate to round out the sushi dining experience.  There are three special items (uni, ama ebi and raw oysters) that is limited to one order/pp with AYCE, and the restaurant reserves the right to charge you for the food you don't finish to minimize unnecessary waste (standard rules of the AYCE realm).

I Enjoyed:
Sibuya No Rice Roll
New Moon Roll
Vegas No Rice Roll
YumYum Scallop
Ama Ebi and the fried shrimp heads
Surf n Turf
Popcorn Scallops

I Didn't Care For:
Japanese Lasagna (topped with way too much mayo that it overwhelmed and masked the flavor profile of the rolls underneath)
Asian Style Flank Steak (basically a not so good version of the traditional Korean Bulgogi served on a sizzling plate)
Green Tea Tiramisu

Service was good, especially considering that Ted, was our only waiter, and he was looking after our party of 7 plus his other tables.

We were seated in one of the side rooms with really comfortable seats, so it was extra relaxing.

Ambiance: 5/5  Great vibes.
Service: 4/5  For a busy night, our service was still great.
Food: 4/5  Overall, I think it is pretty good for AYCE.
Price: 4.5/5  Very reasonable.
Parking: 5/5  Never been a problem finding a parking space when I come to this plaza.

4 Stars!

One of my favorite sushi spots in town. Their fish is superb and is always fresh. I also like it that they are open late! This is where we go for our sushi fix, it's also not to far from our house.

The service is not that good. So far most servers we've had we're a bit rude. This place gets packed especially by 8pm.

I go to this place due to its near by location.  It's an all you AYCE Sushi place.  Now you would expect low quality from somewhere like this, but it is actually pretty decent in some respects.  However, it is also lacking in areas.

Pros: The price was the norm for this type of establishment.  The food is good.  I'm not a big time roll eater as I'd rather eat nigiri over some American take on sushi.  The nigiri was of decent quality, not outstanding, but hey, it is the desert after all. The appetizers are great!  Yes you can make a meal out of the appetizers.  The sauce on the surf and turf was outstanding.  The tempura dipping sauce was also great.

Cons:  First of all, this place has gotten very busy.  I used to be able to walk right in, now it can be up to a 45 minute wait.  Once you get in you get the feel that this place is understaffed.  (Update!!!  Staff seems to have increased, speed of orders has improved....some.  Still a packed house.)  The servers come around, yet your order does not.  I came with a group of 7 big time eaters and we put in big orders at a time.  Not only did our orders take forever to come out, but it felt like the manager was watching us to see if we were really eating all that food.  It got to a point that they stopped taking our order.  It says all you can eat on the door buddy.  (Update:  Management does not do that to us anymore, are they reading this?  Great job if they are!)  They didn't even bring out our oysters and claimed that they did and we could not have any more.  I had to explain to the manager that we are not asking for more, we never got any to begin with.  They figured out that our oysters were taken to the wrong table.  Lucky them.  We ended up paying the bill and leaving having not received everything we ordered. They couldn't even take the time to fill a drink.

UPDATE:  The last few times we went we got better service, the rotation of fish is fast, so the flavor has improved.  Still not the fastest, and still a wait to get in, but it's a slamming busy place now.  I have found one big dislike that is totally not the restaurant's fault.  Every time I go there now, there always seems to be the loudest, most obnoxious, cussing, group of trendy punks sitting right next to me.  It's like man, if you've got all this money that you seem to need to yell about so everyone can hear you, why are you at an AYCE sushi place.  Go eat at some rich place where everyone else is yelling about their car and their money.  I don't want to hear you, I want to hear the person sitting next to me.

My boyfriend & I had a late lunch here today. The food was great, the service was wonderful & we really enjoyed the fun music. Being new to Las Vegas we've been trying out a lot of different restaurants but I think we found our new regular sushi spot! Thanks for the great experience!

Been here couple times when visiting Vegas. $22 lunch special for all you can eat sushi?! Worth it. Market price on sushi can add up so this all you can eat deal is the best deal you can get so I would suggest not getting ala carte if you're a big eater on sushi. Two rolls will already set you above the all you can eat price so you might as well get the AYCE deal! I've tried several of their signature rolls such as Oh my heart, Pink lady roll, Dynamite roll and Rock & Roll. All good! Be sure you don't order with you eyes because there's a policy that you have to eat everything. Always best when shared with others, don't all order the same thing. Try a little bit of everything. I always make my money's worth it with orders of shrimp tempura. It's a must whenever I come here. You also get a free dessert with your meal as well. I love the creme brulee, soooo delish! I always leave here with a feeling like a I gained 10 pounds.

Been here once, really enjoyed the place. The sushi was delicious, the sushi chefs were all nice, the ambiance was a great medium-energy. There was moderate level music, primarily hip-hop and secondarily pop. I enjoyed the music and thought it was the right volume. We got our food super fast each time. I believe the price is $27 for all-you-can-eat. I can't comment if that's good or bad, because I don't have a lot to compare it to, but I had a super-fun time here. Place was pretty busy, even on Monday (presidents day) from 730-930.

We went here on my birthday! The food and the service are awesome. I highly recommended this place.  It was an awesome experience especially with my family was with me... Actually I told everyone at work to try it here. I even want to go just by myself...Their appetizers are the best... LOve it to the Maxxxxx!!!!!

Ok so I'm on a weird post baby diet-no sugars and low to no carbs. I did not really understand this AYCE culture, in Europe we had carousel sushi and sashimi and we had eat in Tepenyaki/ Sushi restaurants (I think in USA the equivalent would be a high class of that old restaurant Benihana?). So I was DYING for sushi but know I really crave the wasabi (it clears me out and my sinuses are awful living here in the Anus Mundi). 

I walked in and my waitress, whose name escapes me and I am so sorry as she was super sweet to me, I hope management can answer with her name, well she and a guy named Stefan were literally really interested in helping me indulge. Of course I could not get the AYCE (and with all that rice I would find it pretty disgusting even not on a diet-and honestly watching some people in America eat actually scares me)-but suffice to say I had hot sake (oddly no sugar and almost no carbs-1.4carbs per serving and NO sugars due to how it is fermented and I love it) so I indulged in both of my desires, luckily Sake does not really affect me for some reason, a glass of wine would make me drunk and red in the face but sake does very little I just love the taste.

I was eating sashimi made by Mexicans and a Filipino--being waited on by a Bulgarian and a girl who had Asian and Mexican in her (the waitress whose name escapes me) and I was all by myself just eating and I swear I gave most Americans a run for their money with the way I ate. It was the best "splurge" (food and money) I made in a long time. I really loved this place and any review that says the waitstaff are not attentive, well maybe you are not receptive as when you are open and you let people know what you want, you generally get what you want and the service here was superb.

AYCE sushi. 

I enjoy this place. It doesn't have the best sushi in town, so I usually just stick with the specialty rolls and hot dishes, which is a nice change of pace from time to time. If you are trying to satiate a serious nigiri craving, go somewhere else. 

The potato croquettes, dynamite, buttery shrimp and scallop, yakitori, surf and turf, seared tuna and salmon skin are some of the regular menu items I order. I'm a fan of the amigo, red dragon and hawaiian rolls. 

I wish they had a better happy hour deal, like Kobe and I'd probably visit this place a little more often.
Thank you Vince for being our server... Excellent service and I'm so stuffed; all you can eat sushi....

This is the closest sushi spot to me and I'm glad it's actually a decent place.  I go here with my little brother and so far it's been great.  The servers there are very friendly and usually have a smile on their face.  Our last server there when we went for ayce was pretty cute as well (always a plus).

As far as the sushi is concerned, I got my money's worth.  The fish was pretty fresh, not the freshest, but still good.  I prefer sushi that isn't drenched in sauce and the rolls that I had were good.  I got away with an extra dessert when you can only order one, thanks to our cute waitress.  The best rolls were the Hawaiian and the Yellowtail Trio.

They also have a great selection of entrees and apps to choose from.  I have had the teriyaki beef and that was really good.  They have something for everyone interested in Asian cuisine.

Whenever I feel like treating myself or my friends and family, this will definitely be the spot.

Cool menu cover and placemats designs.
I've sat at the bar in one of the cute booths, and tables service was great every time. 

They're sushi was delicious; fresh fish, good sauce variety, spicy rolls and nice cuts of fish. Not sure if they have many riceless options, but it would be a great addition.

If I lived closer I would probably frequent more.

This is by far one of the best sushi restsurants in town. The ACE is the best way to go and you definitely won't be disappointed. All the fish are fresh and for me, perfectly sliced. Sushi at other places are too bug for a mouthfull, but here its perfect. The eel is by far my favorite and the tuna and yellowfin are also top notch. The restaurant is charming and the staff are attentive. Pricing here us pretty standard so no suprises there. You can easily go here on a date or with your family. This place is my number one on my list of sushi restaurants.

They don't put the server name on the check, other wise I would be bragging about how great his service was.  Seated quick and served quicker, although he did not think we got our food fast enough and took care of the first round of drinks.  Great experience, especially after our first stop.
Ploi was a great waitress. She took good care of us. Nice place and great service. I will be coming back soon

This place has changed a lot since I first went there. 
Uni- I know not to expect too much from ayce uni, but the uni came out grey and slimy. 
Oysters- the oysters were nice and big. They tasted fresh, and not overpowered with sauce. Probably the best dish. 
Surf & turf - bland and flavorless. The shrimp was super rubbery due to being over cooked.
AGEDASHI TOFU- fried to a crisp, so when you cut into it.. the entire batter falls off. It should be light and easy to swallow.
NIGIRI- fish quality was decent, but filled with a lot of rice. The amaebi tasted ok, but there is a part of the shrimp head that they don't clean off and discard. This makes it very difficult to enjoy, and sharp on the gums. 
Asparagus Beef- asparagus wasn't shaved down enough at roots, so you get the bad stringy part stuck in your teeth if it's possible to even bite off. 
Beef and asparagus, shrimp skewers - very dry, overcooked, flavorless. ( a waste of stomach space )

Overall, really nothing special anymore. They don't allow half rolls which is unusual at an ayce spot. They seem to have cut the ayce app menu down a bit too. The service was good, and attentive. However, I would rather stick to umiya for ayce. They have a larger selection with much better quality.

Food was great it took a while to come out but it was good, they bring everything out at ones which sucks because we couldn't enjoy the appetizers before the food. Service was slow after the first set of food came out. After they give you the bill they come more often. Great place for kids. Prices are great as well, we did all you eat for kids and an adult. Place is clean. Overall good place :)

Oyshi is me and my husband's go to AYCE sushi spot because we live so close by. The price isn't bad and I love the dcor inside especially. It's usually busy on the weekend but the service is great and I just recently learned that you can order half rolls! Which for me is so much better so I can try different things. I was brave this time and tried the Oh my heart roll and surprisingly I liked it. Me and my husband's go to is the ngiri which is fresh and we love the salmon belly. Overall, I have recommended and even brought different family members and friends to this location and will continue going here since if is convenient and food that I love.
